Of the cattle are some for burden and some for meat.  Eat what\n\t\t\tAllah hath provided for you and follow not the footsteps of\n\t\t\tSatan: for he is to you an avowed enemy. <sup class='fn'>967</sup>

(Take) eight (head of cattle) in (four) pairs: of sheep a pair
			and of goats a pair; say hath He forbidden the two males or the
			two females or (the young) which the wombs of the two females
			enclose? Tell me with knowledge if ye are truthful. <sup class='fn'>968</sup>

Of camels a pair and of oxen a pair; say hath He forbidden the
			two males or the two females or the (the young) which the wombs
			of the two females enclose?  Were ye present when Allah ordered
			you such a thing?  But who doth more wrong than one who invents a
			lie against Allah to lead astray men without knowledge? For Allah
			guideth not people who do wrong.

Say: "I find not in the Message received by me by inspiration any
			(meat) forbidden to be eaten by one who wishes to eat it unless
			it be dead meat or blood poured forth or the flesh of swine for
			it is an abomination or what is impious (meat) on which a name
			has been invoked other than Allah's."  But (even so) if a person
			is forced by necessity without wilful disobedience nor
			transgressing due limits thy Lord is Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful.
			<sup class='fn'>969</sup>

For those who followed the Jewish Law We forbade every (animal)
			with undivided hoof and We forbade them the fat of the ox and the
			sheep except what adheres to their backs or their entrails or is
			mixed up with a bone: this in recompense for their wilful
			disobedience: for We are True (in Our ordinances). <sup class='fn'>970</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>971</sup>
If they accuse thee of falsehood say: "Your Lord is full of Mercy\n\t\t\tAll-embracing; but from people in guilt never will His wrath be\n\t\t\tturned back.

Those who give partners to Allah will say "If Allah had wished we
			should not have given partners to Him nor would our father; nor
			should we have had any taboos."  So did their ancestors argue
			falsely until they tasted of Our wrath.  Say: "Have ye any
			(certain) Knowledge?  If so produce it before us.  Ye follow
			nothing but conjecture: Ye do nothing but lie." <sup class='fn'>972</sup>
Say: "With Allah is the argument that reaches home: if it had\n\t\t\tbeen his will he could indeed have guided you all." <sup class='fn'>973</sup>

Say: "Bring forward your witnesses to prove that Allah did forbid
			so and so."  If they bring such witnesses be not thou amongst
			them: nor follow thou the vain desires of such as treat Our Signs
			as falsehoods and such as believe not in the Hereafter: for they
			hold others as equal with their Guardian-Lord. <sup class='fn'>974</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>975</sup>

Say: "Come I will rehearse what Allah hath (really) prohibited
			you from": join not anything as equal with Him; be good to your
			parents: kill not your children on a plea of want;  We provide
			sustenance for you and for them;  come not nigh to shameful deeds
			whether open or secret; take not life which Allah hath made
			sacred except by way of justice and law: thus doth He command you
			that ye may learn wisdom. <sup class='fn'>976</sup> <sup class='fn'>977</sup>

And come not nigh to the orphan's property except to improve it
			until he attain the age of full strength; give measure and weight
			with (full) justice; no burden do We place on any soul but that
			which it can bear; whenever ye speak speak justly even if a near
			relative is concerned; and fulfil the Covenant of Allah: thus
			doth He command you that ye may remember. <sup class='fn'>978</sup>

Verily this is My Way leading straight: follow it: follow not\n\t\t\t(other) paths: they will scatter you about from His (great) path:\n\t\t\tthus doth He command you that ye may be righteous. <sup class='fn'>979</sup>

Moreover We gave Moses the Book completing (Our favor) to those
			who would do right and explaining all things in detail and a
			guide and a mercy that they might believe in the meeting with
			their Lord. <sup class='fn'>980</sup>
And this is a Book which We have revealed as a blessing: so\n\t\t\tfollow it and be righteous that ye may receive mercy:
Lest ye should say: "The Book was sent down to two peoples before\n\t\t\tus and for our part we remained unacquainted with all that they\n\t\t\tlearned by assiduous study." <sup class='fn'>981</sup>

Or lest ye should say: "If the Book had only been sent down to us
			we should have followed its guidance better than they."  Now then
			hath come unto you a Clear (sign) from your Lord and a guide and
			a mercy: then who could do more wrong than one who rejecteth
			Allah's signs and turneth away therefrom?  In good time shall We
			requite those who turn away from Our Signs with a dreadful
			penalty for their turning away. <sup class='fn'>982</sup>

Are they waiting to see if the angels come to them or thy Lord
			(Himself) or certain of the signs of thy Lord! the day that
			certain of the signs of thy Lord do come no good will it do to a
			soul to believe in them then if it believed not before nor earned
			righteousness through its Faith.  Say: "Wait ye: we too are
			waiting." <sup class='fn'>983</sup> <sup class='fn'>984</sup>

As for those who divide their religion and break up into sects
			thou hast no part in them in the least: their affair is with
			Allah: He will in the end tell them the truth of all that they
			did. <sup class='fn'>985</sup>

He that doeth good shall have ten times as much to his credit: he\n\t\t\tthat doeth evil shall only be recompensed according to his evil. \n\t\t\tNo wrong shall be done unto (any of) them. <sup class='fn'>986</sup>
Say: "Verily my Lord hath guided me to a way that is straight a\n\t\t\treligion of right the path (trod) by Abraham the true in faith\n\t\t\tand he (certainly) joined not gods with Allah."
Say: "Truly my prayer and my service of sacrifice my life and my\n\t\t\tdeath are (all) for Allah the Cherisher of the Worlds:
No partner hath He: this am I commanded and I am the first of\n\t\t\tthose who bow to His Will.

Say: "Shall I seek for (my) Cherisher other than Allah when He is
			the Cherisher of all things (that exist)?" Every soul draws the
			meed of its acts on none but itself: no bearer of burdens can
			bear the burden of another.  Your goal in the end is toward
			Allah: He will tell you the truth of the things wherein ye
			disputed. <sup class='fn'>987</sup>

It is He who hath made you (His) agents inheritors of the earth:
			He hath raised you in ranks some above others: that he may try
			you in the gifts He hath given you: for thy Lord is quick in
			punishment: yet He is indeed Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful.
			<sup class='fn'>988</sup>
Alif Lam Mim Sad. <sup class='fn'>989</sup>

A Book revealed unto thee so let thy heart be oppressed no more\n\t\t\tby any difficulty on that account that with it thou mightest warn\n\t\t\t(the erring) and teach the believers. <sup class='fn'>990</sup>
Follow (O men!) the revelation given unto you from your Lord and\n\t\t\tfollow not as friends or protectors other than Him.  Little it is\n\t\t\tye remember of admonition. <sup class='fn'>991</sup>
How many towns have We destroyed (for their sins)?  Our\n\t\t\tpunishment took them on a sudden by night or while they slept for\n\t\t\ttheir afternoon rest.
When (thus) our punishment took them no cry did they utter but\n\t\t\tthis "indeed we did wrong." <sup class='fn'>992</sup>
Then shall We question those to whom Our message was sent and\n\t\t\tthose by whom We sent it. <sup class='fn'>993</sup>
And verily We shall recount their whole story with knowledge for\n\t\t\tWe were never absent (at any time or place). <sup class='fn'>994</sup>
The balance that day will be true (to a nicety): those whose\n\t\t\tscale (of good) will be heavy will prosper.
Those whose scale will be light will find their souls in\n\t\t\tperdition for that they wrongfully treated our signs.
It is We who have placed you with authority on earth and provided\n\t\t\tyou therein with means for the fulfillment of your life: small\n\t\t\tare the thanks that ye give! <sup class='fn'>995</sup>

It is We who created you and gave you shape; then We bade the\n\t\t\tangels bow down to Adam and they bowed down; not so Iblis; he\n\t\t\trefused to be of those who bow down. <sup class='fn'>996</sup> <sup class='fn'>997</sup>
(Allah) said: "what prevented thee from bowing down when I\n\t\t\tcommanded thee?"  He said: "I am better than he: thou didst\n\t\t\tcreate me from fire and him from clay." <sup class='fn'>998</sup>
(Allah) said: "Get thee down from this: it is not for thee to be\n\t\t\tarrogant here: get out for thou art of the meanest (of\n\t\t\tcreatures)." <sup class='fn'>999</sup>
He said: "give me respite till the day they are raised up."
(Allah) said: "be thou among those who have respite."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1000</sup>
He said: "because Thou hast thrown me out of the way lo! I will\n\t\t\tlie in wait for them on Thy straight way. <sup class='fn'>1001</sup>
"Then will I assault them from before them and behind them from\n\t\t\ttheir right and their left: nor wilt Thou find in most of them\n\t\t\tgratitude (for Thy mercies). <sup class='fn'>1002</sup>
(Allah) said: "Get out from this disgraced and expelled.  If any\n\t\t\tof them follow thee hell will I fill with you all.

O Adam! dwell thou and thy wife in the garden and enjoy (its good\n\t\t\tthings) as ye wish: but approach not this tree or ye run into\n\t\t\tharm and transgression." <sup class='fn'>1003</sup> <sup class='fn'>1004</sup>

Then began satan to whisper suggestions to them bringing openly
			before their minds all their shame that was hidden from them
			(before): he said "Your Lord only forbade you this tree lest ye
			should become angels or such beings as live for ever."
			<sup class='fn'>1005</sup> <sup class='fn'>1006</sup>
And he swore to them both that he was their sincere adviser.

So by deceit he brought about their fall: when they tasted of the
			tree their shame became manifest to them and they began to sew
			together the leaves of the garden over their bodies.  And their
			Lord called unto them: "Did I not forbid you that tree and tell
			you that satan was an avowed enemy unto you?"
They said: "our Lord! we have wronged our own souls: if Thou\n\t\t\tforgive us not and bestow not upon us Thy mercy we shall\n\t\t\tcertainly be lost."
(Allah) said: "Get ye down with enmity between yourselves.  On\n\t\t\tearth will be your dwelling-place and your means of livelihood\n\t\t\tfor a time."
He said: "therein shall ye live and therein shall ye die; but\n\t\t\tfrom it shall ye be taken out (at last)." <sup class='fn'>1007</sup>

O ye children of Adam! We have bestowed raiment upon you to cover
			your shame as well as to be an adornment to you but the raiment
			of righteousness that is the best.  Such are among the signs of
			Allah that they may receive admonition! <sup class='fn'>1008</sup>

O ye children of Adam! let not satan seduce you in the same
			manner as he got your parents out of the garden stripping them of
			their raiment to expose their shame: for he and his tribe watch
			you from a position where ye cannot see them: We made the evil
			ones friends (only) to those without faith. <sup class='fn'>1009</sup>

When they do aught that is shameful they say: "We found our
			fathers doing so"; and "Allah commanded us thus": say: "Nay Allah
			never commands what is shameful: do ye say of Allah what ye know
			not?"

Say: "My Lord hath commanded justice; and that ye set your whole
			selves (to him) at every time and place of prayer and call upon
			him making your devotion sincere as in his sight: such as he
			created you in the beginning so shall ye return." <sup class='fn'>1010</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1011</sup>

Some He hath guided: others have (by their choice) deserved the
			loss of their way: in that they took the evil ones in preference
			to Allah for their friends and protectors and think that they
			receive guidance. <sup class='fn'>1012</sup>
O children of Adam! wear your beautiful apparel at every time and\n\t\t\tplace of prayer: eat and drink: but waste not by excess for Allah\n\t\t\tloveth not the wasters. <sup class='fn'>1013</sup>

Say: Who hath forbidden the beautiful (gifts) of Allah which He
			hath produced for his servants and the things clean and pure
			(which He hath provided) for sustenance?  Say: they are in the
			life of this world for those who believe (and) purely for them on
			the Day of Judgment.  Thus do We explain the signs in detail for
			those who understand. <sup class='fn'>1014</sup> <sup class='fn'>1015</sup>

Say: The things that my Lord hath indeed forbidden are: shameful
			deeds whether open or secret; sins and trespasses against truth
			or reason; assigning of partners to Allah for which he hath given
			no authority; and saying things about Allah of which ye have no
			knowledge. <sup class='fn'>1016</sup>
To every people is a term appointed: when their term is reached\n\t\t\tnot an hour can they cause delay nor (an hour) can they advance\n\t\t\t(it in anticipation). <sup class='fn'>1017</sup>

O ye children of Adam! whenever there come to you apostles from
			amongst you rehearsing my signs unto you those who are righteous
			and mend (their lives) on them shall be no fear nor shall they
			grieve.
But those who reject our signs and treat them with arrogance they\n\t\t\tare companions of the fire to dwell therein (for ever).

Who is more unjust than one who invents a lie against Allah or
			rejects his signs?  For such their portion appointed must reach
			them from the Book (of decrees); until when Our messengers (of
			death) arrive and take their souls they say: "where are the
			things that ye used to invoke besides Allah?"  They will reply
			"they have left us in the lurch" and they will bear witness
			against themselves that they had rejected Allah. <sup class='fn'>1018</sup>

He will say: "enter ye in the company of the peoples who passed
			away before you men and Jinns into the fire.  Every time a new
			people enters it curses its sister-people (that went before)
			until they follow each other all into the fire.  Saith the last
			about the first: "Our Lord! it is these that misled us: so give
			them a double penalty in the fire."  He will say: "doubled for
			all": but this Ye do not understand. <sup class='fn'>1019</sup>
Then the first will say to the last: "see then! no advantage have\n\t\t\tye over us; so taste ye of the penalty for all that ye did!"\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1020</sup>

To those who reject Our signs and treat them with arrogance no
			opening will there be of the gates of heaven nor will they enter
			the garden until the camel can pass through the eye of the
			needle: such is Our reward for those in sin.
For them there is hell as a couch (below) and folds and folds of\n\t\t\tcovering above: such is Our requital of those who do wrong.
But those who believe and work righteousness no burden do We\n\t\t\tplace on any soul but that which it can bear they will be\n\t\t\tcompanions of the garden therein to dwell (for ever).

And We shall remove from their hearts any lurking sense of
			injury; beneath them will be rivers flowing; and they shall say:
			"Praise be to Allah Who hath guided us to this (felicity): never
			could we have found guidance had it not been for the guidance of
			Allah: indeed it was the truth that the apostles of our Lord
			brought unto us."  And they Shall hear the cry: "Behold! the
			garden before you! Ye have been made its inheritors for your
			deeds (of righteousness)." <sup class='fn'>1021</sup> <sup class='fn'>1022</sup>

The companions of the garden will call out to the companions of
			the fire: "We have indeed found the promises of our Lord to us
			true: have you also found your Lord's promises true?"  They shall
			say "yes"; but a crier shall proclaim between them: "the curse of
			Allah is on the wrong- doers; <sup class='fn'>1023</sup>
"Those who would hinder (men) from the path of Allah and would\n\t\t\tseek in it something crooked: they were those who Denied the\n\t\t\tHereafter." <sup class='fn'>1024</sup>

Between them shall be a veil and on the heights will be men who
			would know everyone by his marks: they will call out to the
			companions of the garden "peace on you" they will not have
			entered but they will have an assurance (thereof.) <sup class='fn'>1025</sup>
When their eyes shall be turned towards the companions of the\n\t\t\tfire they will say: "Our Lord! send us not to the company of the\n\t\t\twrong- doers." <sup class='fn'>1026</sup>
The men on the heights will call to certain men whom they will\n\t\t\tknow from their marks saying: "Of what profit to you were you\n\t\t\thoards and your arrogant ways? <sup class='fn'>1027</sup>
"Behold! are these not the men whom you swore that Allah with his\n\t\t\tmercy would never bless?  Enter ye the garden: no fear shall be\n\t\t\ton you nor shall ye grieve."

The companions of the fire will call to the companions of the
			garden; "pour down to us water or anything that Allah doth
			provide for your sustenance."  They will say: "Both these things
			hath Allah forbidden to those who rejected Him. <sup class='fn'>1028</sup>

"Such as took their religion to be mere amusement and play and
			were deceived by the life of the world."  That day shall We
			forget them as they forgot the meeting of this day of theirs and
			as they were wont to reject Our signs. <sup class='fn'>1029</sup>
For We had certainly sent unto them a Book based on knowledge\n\t\t\twhich We explained in detail a guide and a mercy to all who\n\t\t\tbelieve.

Do they just wait for the final fulfillment of the event?  On the
			day the event is finally fulfilled those who disregarded it
			before will say: "the apostles of our Lord did indeed bring true
			(tidings).  Have we no intercessors now to intercede on our
			behalf?  Or could we be sent back?  Then should we behave
			differently from our behavior in the past."  In fact they will
			have lost their souls and the things they invented will leave
			them in the lurch. <sup class='fn'>1030</sup>

Your guardian-Lord is Allah Who created the heavens and the earth
			in six days and is firmly established on the throne (of
			authority): He draweth the night as a veil O'er the day each
			seeking the other in rapid succession: He created the sun the
			moon and the stars (all) governed by laws under His command.  Is
			it not His to create and to govern?  Blessed be Allah the
			cherisher and sustainer of the worlds! <sup class='fn'>1031</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1032</sup>
Call on your Lord with humility and in private: for Allah loveth\n\t\t\tnot those who trespass beyond bounds. <sup class='fn'>1033</sup>

Do no mischief on the earth after it hath been set in order but
			call on Him with fear and longing (in your hearts): for the mercy
			of Allah is (always) near to those who do good. <sup class='fn'>1034</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1035</sup>

It is He who sendeth the winds like heralds of glad tidings going
			before His mercy: when they have carried the heavy-laden clouds
			We drive them to a land that is dead make rain to descend thereon
			and produce every kind of harvest therewith: thus shall We raise
			up the dead: perchance ye may remember. <sup class='fn'>1036</sup>

From the land that is clean and good by the will of its cherisher
			springs up produce (rich) after its kind: but from the land that
			is bad spring up nothing but that which is niggardly: thus do We
			explain the signs by various (symbols) to those who are grateful.
			<sup class='fn'>1037</sup> <sup class='fn'>1038</sup>
We sent Noah to his people.  He said: "O my people! worship\n\t\t\tAllah! ye have no other god but Him.  I fear for you the\n\t\t\tpunishment of a dreadful day! <sup class='fn'>1039</sup>
The leaders of his people said: "Ah! we see thee evidently\n\t\t\twandering (in mind)."
He said: "O my people! no wandering is there in my (mind): on the\n\t\t\tcontrary I am an apostle from the Lord and Cherisher of the\n\t\t\tworlds!
"I but fulfil towards you the duties of my Lord's mission:\n\t\t\tsincere is my advice to you and I know from Allah something that\n\t\t\tye know not.
"Do ye wonder that there hath come to you a message from your\n\t\t\tLord through a man of your own people to warn you so that ye may\n\t\t\tfear Allah and haply receive his mercy?"
But they rejected him and We delivered him and those with him in\n\t\t\tthe ark: But We overwhelmed in the flood those who rejected our\n\t\t\tsigns. They were indeed a blind people!
To the Ad people (We sent) Hud one of their (own) brethren: He\n\t\t\tsaid: "O my people! worship Allah! ye have no other god but Him. \n\t\t\tWill yet not fear (Allah)?" <sup class='fn'>1040</sup>
The leaders of the unbelievers among his people said: "Ah! we see\n\t\t\tthou art an imbecile!" and "we think thou art a liar!"
He said: "O my people! I am not imbecile but (I am) an apostle\n\t\t\tfrom the Lord and Cherisher of the worlds!
"I but fulfil towards your the duties of my Lord's mission: I am\n\t\t\tto you a sincere and trustworthy adviser.

"Do ye wonder that there hath come to you a message from your
			Lord through a man of your own people to warn you? call in
			remembrance that he made you inheritors after the people of Noah
			and gave you a stature tall among the nations.	Call in
			remembrance the benefits (ye have received) from Allah: that so
			Ye may prosper."
They said: "Comest thou to us that we may worship Allah alone and\n\t\t\tgive up the cult of our fathers?  Bring us what thou threatenest\n\t\t\tus with if so be that thou tellest the truth!"

He said: "punishment and wrath have already come upon you from
			your Lord: dispute ye with me over names which ye have devised ye
			and your fathers without authority from Allah?	Then wait: I am
			amongst you also waiting." <sup class='fn'>1041</sup> <sup class='fn'>1042</sup>
We saved him and those who adhered to him by our mercy and We cut\n\t\t\toff the roots of those who rejected our signs and did not\n\t\t\tbelieve.

To the Thamud people (We sent) Saleh one of their own brethren:
			he said: "O my people! worship Allah; ye have no other god but
			Him.  Now hath come unto you a clear (sign) from your Lord!  This
			she-camel of Allah is a sign unto you: so leave her to graze in
			Allah's earth and let her come to no harm or ye shall be seized
			with a grievous punishment. <sup class='fn'>1043</sup> <sup class='fn'>1044</sup>

"And remember how He made you inheritors after the Ad people and
			gave you habitations in the land: ye build for yourselves palaces
			and castles in (open) plains and carve out homes in the
			mountains; so bring to remembrance the benefits (ye have
			received) from Allah and refrain from evil and mischief on the
			earth."

The leaders of the arrogant party among his people said to those
			who were reckoned powerless those among them who believe: "know
			ye indeed that Saleh is an apostle from his Lord?"  They said:
			"We do indeed believe in the revelation which hath been sent
			through him." <sup class='fn'>1045</sup> <sup class='fn'>1046</sup>
The arrogant party said: "for our part we reject what ye believe\n\t\t\tin."
Then they ham-strung the she-camel and insolently defied the\n\t\t\torder of their Lord saying: "O Saleh! bring about thy threats if\n\t\t\tthou art an apostle (of Allah)!"
So the earthquake took them unawares and they lay prostrate in\n\t\t\ttheir homes in the morning! <sup class='fn'>1047</sup>

So Saleh left them saying: "O my people! I did indeed convey to\n\t\t\tyou the message for which I was sent by my Lord: I gave you good\n\t\t\tcounsel but ye love not good counsellors!" <sup class='fn'>1048</sup>
We also (sent) Lut: he said to his people: "Do ye commit lewdness\n\t\t\tsuch as no people in creation (ever) committed before you?\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1049</sup>
"For ye practice your lusts on men in preference to women: ye are\n\t\t\tindeed a people transgressing beyond bounds."
And his people gave no answer but this: they said "drive them out\n\t\t\tof your city: these are indeed men who want to be clean and\n\t\t\tpure!" <sup class='fn'>1050</sup>
But We saved him and his family except his wife: she was of those\n\t\t\twho lagged behind. <sup class='fn'>1051</sup>
And We rained down on them a shower (of brimstone): then see what\n\t\t\twas the end of those who indulged in sin and crime! <sup class='fn'>1052</sup>

To the Madyan people We sent Shu`aib one of their own brethren:
			he said: "O my people! worship Allah; Ye have no other god but
			Him.  Now hath come unto you a clear (sign) from your Lord!  Give
			just measure and weight nor withhold from the people the things
			that are their due; and do no mischief on the earth after it has
			been set in order: that will be best for you if ye have faith.
			<sup class='fn'>1053</sup> <sup class='fn'>1054</sup>

"And squat not on every road breathing threats hindering from the
			path of Allah those who believe in Him and seeking in it
			something crooked; but remember how ye were little and He gave
			you increase. And hold in your mind's eye what was the end of
			those who did mischief. <sup class='fn'>1055</sup>

"And if there is a party among you who believes in the message
			with which I have been sent and a party which does not believe
			hold yourselves in patience until Allah doth decide between us:
			for He is the best to decide." <sup class='fn'>1056</sup> <sup class='fn'>1057</sup>

The leaders the arrogant party among his people said: "O Shu`aib!
			we shall certainly drive thee out of our city (thee) and those
			who believe with thee: or else ye (thou and they) shall have to
			return to our ways and religion."  He said: "what! even though we
			do detest (them)? <sup class='fn'>1058</sup>

"We should indeed invent a lie against Allah if we returned to
			your ways after Allah hath rescued us therefrom: nor could we by
			any manner of means return thereto unless it be as in the Will
			and plan of Allah Our Lord.  Our Lord can reach out to the utmost
			recesses of things by His knowledge.  In Allah is our trust.  Our
			Lord! decide thou between us and our people in truth for thou art
			the best to decide." <sup class='fn'>1059</sup> <sup class='fn'>1060</sup> <sup class='fn'>1061</sup>
The leaders the unbelievers among his people said "if ye follow\n\t\t\tShu`aib be sure then ye are ruined!" <sup class='fn'>1062</sup>
But the earthquake took them unawares and they lay prostrate in\n\t\t\ttheir homes before the morning! <sup class='fn'>1063</sup>
The men who rejected Shu`aib became as if they had never been in\n\t\t\tthe homes where they had flourished: the men who rejected Shu`aib\n\t\t\tit was they who were ruined!

So Shu`aib left them saying: "O my people! I did indeed convey to
			you the messages for which I was sent by my Lord: I gave you good
			counsel but how shall I lament over a people who refuse to
			believe! <sup class='fn'>1064</sup>
Whenever We sent a prophet to a town We took up its people in\n\t\t\tsuffering and adversity in order that they might learn humility.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1065</sup>

Then We changed their suffering into prosperity until they grew
			and multiplied and began to say: "Our fathers (too) were touched
			by suffering and affluence."...Behold!	We called them to account
			of a sudden while they realized not (their peril). <sup class='fn'>1066</sup>

If the people of the towns had but believed and feared Allah We
			should indeed have opened out to them (all kinds of) blessings
			from heaven and earth; but they rejected (the truth) and We
			brought them to book for their misdeeds.
Did the people of the towns feel secure against the coming of our\n\t\t\twrath by night while they were asleep? <sup class='fn'>1067</sup>
Or else did they feel secure against its coming in broad daylight\n\t\t\twhile they played about (care-free)?
Did they then fell secure against the plan of Allah?  But no one\n\t\t\tcan feel secure from the plan of Allah except those (doomed) to\n\t\t\truin! <sup class='fn'>1068</sup>

To those who inherit the earth in succession to its (previous)
			possessors is it not a guiding (lesson) that if We so willed We
			could punish them (too) for their sins and seal up their hearts
			so that they could not hear? <sup class='fn'>1069</sup>

Such were the towns whose story We (thus) relate unto thee: there
			came indeed to them their apostles with clear (signs): but they
			would not believe what they had rejected before.  Thus doth Allah
			seal up the heart of those who reject faith. <sup class='fn'>1070</sup>
Most of them We found not men (true) to their covenant: but most\n\t\t\tof them We found rebellious and disobedient.
Then after them We sent Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his\n\t\t\tchiefs but they wrongfully rejected them: so see what was the end\n\t\t\tof those who made mischief.
Moses said: "O Pharaoh! I am an apostle from the Lord of the\n\t\t\tworlds. <sup class='fn'>1071</sup> <sup class='fn'>1072</sup>

"One for whom it is right to say nothing but truth about Allah. 
			Now have I come unto you (people) from your Lord with a clear
			(sign): so let the children of Israel depart along with me."
			<sup class='fn'>1073</sup>
(Pharaoh) said: "If indeed thou hast come with a sign show it\n\t\t\tforth if thou tellest the truth." <sup class='fn'>1074</sup>
Then (Moses) threw his rod and behold! it was a serpent plain\n\t\t\t(for all to see)! <sup class='fn'>1075</sup>
And he drew out his hand and behold! it was white to all\n\t\t\tbeholders! <sup class='fn'>1076</sup>
Said the Chiefs of the people of Pharaoh: "This is indeed a\n\t\t\tsorcerer well-versed.
"His plan is to get you out of your land then what is it ye\n\t\t\tcounsel?" <sup class='fn'>1077</sup>
They said: "Keep him and his brother in suspense (for a while);\n\t\t\tand send to the cities men to collect
and bring up to thee all (our) sorcerers well-versed."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1078</sup>
So there came the sorcerers to Pharaoh: they said "Of course we\n\t\t\tshall have a (suitable) reward if we win!" <sup class='fn'>1079</sup>
He said: "Yea (and more) for ye shall in that case be (raised to\n\t\t\tposts) nearest (to my person)."
They said: "O Moses! wilt thou throw (first) or shall we have the\n\t\t\t(first) throw?"

Said Moses: "Throw ye (first)."  So when they threw they\n\t\t\tbewitched the eyes of the people and struck terror into them: for\n\t\t\tthey showed a great (feat of) magic. <sup class='fn'>1080</sup>
We put it into Moses's mind by inspiration: "throw (now) thy\n\t\t\trod": and behold! it swallows up straightway all the falsehoods\n\t\t\twhich they fake!
Thus truth was confirmed and all that they did was made of no\n\t\t\teffect.
So the (great ones) were vanquished there and then and were made\n\t\t\tto look small. <sup class='fn'>1081</sup>
But the sorcerers fell down prostrate in adoration.
Saying: "we believe in the Lord of the worlds.
"The Lord of Moses and Aaron."

Said Pharaoh: "believe ye in him before I give you permission? 
			Surely this is a trick which ye have planned in the city to drive
			out its people: but soon shall ye know (the consequences).
			<sup class='fn'>1082</sup>
"Be sure I will cut off your hands and your feet on opposite\n\t\t\tsides and I will cause you all to die on the cross."
They said: "for us we are but sent back unto our Lord.

"But thou dost wreak thy vengeance on us simply because we
			believed in the signs of our Lord when they reached us!  Our
			Lord! pour out on us patience and constancy and take our souls
			unto thee as Muslims (who bow to thy will)"! <sup class='fn'>1083</sup>

Said the chiefs of Pharaoh's people: "wilt thou leave Moses and
			his people to spread mischief in the land and to abandon thee and
			thy gods?"  He said: "Their male children will we slay; (only)
			their females will we save alive; and we have over them (power)
			irresistible." <sup class='fn'>1084</sup>

Said Moses to his people: "Pray for help from Allah and (wait) in
			patience and constancy: for the earth is Allah's to give as a
			heritage to such of his servants as He pleaseth; and the end is
			(best) for the righteous. <sup class='fn'>1085</sup>

They said: "We have had (nothing but) trouble both before and
			after thou comest to us."  He said: "It may be that your Lord
			will destroy your enemy and make you inheritors in the earth;
			that so He may try you by your deeds." <sup class='fn'>1086</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1087</sup>
We punished the people of Pharaoh with years (of drought) and\n\t\t\tshortness of crops; that they might receive admonition.

But when good (times) came they said "this is due to us"; when
			gripped by calamity they ascribed it to evil omens connected with
			Moses and those with him!  Behold! in truth the omens of evil are
			theirs in Allah's sight but most of them do not understand!
			<sup class='fn'>1088</sup>
They said (to Moses): "whatever be the signs thou bringest to\n\t\t\twork therewith the sorcery on us we shall never believe in thee."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1089</sup>

So We sent (plagues) on them wholesale death Locusts Lice Frogs\n\t\t\tand Blood: signs openly Self-explained; but they were steeped in\n\t\t\tarrogance a people given to sin. <sup class='fn'>1090</sup> <sup class='fn'>1091</sup>

Every time the penalty fell on them they said: "O Moses! on our
			behalf call on thy Lord in virtue of his promise to thee: if thou
			wilt remove the penalty from us we shall truly believe in thee
			and we shall send away the children of Israel with thee."
			<sup class='fn'>1092</sup>
But every time We removed the penalty from them according to a\n\t\t\tfixed term which they had to fulfil Behold! they broke their\n\t\t\tword! <sup class='fn'>1093</sup>

So We exacted retribution from them: We drowned them in the sea\n\t\t\tbecause they rejected Our signs and failed to take warning from\n\t\t\tthem. <sup class='fn'>1094</sup> <sup class='fn'>1095</sup>

And We made a people considered weak (and of no account)
			inheritors of lands in both east and west lands whereon We sent
			down our blessings.  The fair promise of the Lord was fulfilled
			for the children of Israel because they had patience and
			constancy and We levelled to the ground the great works and fine
			buildings which Pharaoh and his people erected (with such pride).
			<sup class='fn'>1096</sup>

We took the children of Israel (with safety) across the sea. 
			They came upon a people devoted entirely to some idols they had. 
			They said: "O Moses! fashion for us a god like unto the gods they
			have." He said: "surely ye are a people without knowledge.
			<sup class='fn'>1097</sup>
"As to these folk the cult they are in is (but) a fragment of a\n\t\t\truin and vain is the (worship) which they practice."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1098</sup>
He said: "Shall I seek for you a god other than the (true) Allah\n\t\t\twhen it is Allah who hath endowed you with gifts above the\n\t\t\tnations?"

And remember We rescued you from Pharaoh's people who afflicted
			you with the worst of penalties who slew your male children and
			saved alive your females: in that was a momentous trial from your
			Lord. <sup class='fn'>1099</sup>

We appointed for Moses thirty nights and completed (the period)
			with ten (more): thus was completed the term (of communion) with
			his Lord forty nights.	And Moses had charged his brother Aaron
			(before he went up): "Act for me amongst my people: do right and
			follow not the way of those who do mischief." <sup class='fn'>1100</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1101</sup>

When Moses came to the place appointed by Us and his Lord
			addressed him He said: "O my Lord! show (Thyself) to me that I
			may look upon thee."  Allah said: "by no means canst thou see Me
			(direct); but look upon the mount; if it abide in its place then
			shalt thou see Me." When his Lord manifested his glory on the
			mount He made it as dust and Moses fell down in a swoon.  When he
			recovered his senses he said: "Glory be to Thee! to thee I turn
			in repentance and I am the first to believe."  (Allah) said: "O
			Moses! I have chosen thee above (other) men by the mission I
			(have given thee) and the words I (have spoken to thee): take
			then the (revelation) which I give thee and be of those who give
			thanks." <sup class='fn'>1102</sup> <sup class='fn'>1103</sup> <sup class='fn'>1104</sup>

(Allah) said: "O Moses! I have chosen thee Above (other) men By
			the mission I (have Given thee) and the words I (have spoken to
			thee): Take then the (revelation) Which I give thee And be of
			those Who give thanks." <sup class='fn'>1105</sup> <sup class='fn'>1106</sup>

And We ordained laws for him in the tablets in all matters both
			commanding and explaining all things (and said): "take and hold
			these with firmness and enjoin thy people to hold fast by the
			best in the precepts: soon shall I show you the homes of the
			wicked (how they lie desolate)." <sup class='fn'>1107</sup> <sup class='fn'>1108</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1109</sup>

Those who behave arrogantly on the earth in defiance of right
			them will I turn away from My signs they will not believe in
			them; and if they see the way of right conduct they will not
			adopt it as the way; but if they see the way of error that is the
			way they will adopt; for they rejected Our signs and failed to
			take warning from them. <sup class='fn'>1110</sup> <sup class='fn'>1111</sup>
Those who reject Our signs and the meeting in the hereafter vain\n\t\t\tare their deeds: can they expect to be rewarded except as they\n\t\t\thave wrought?

The people of Moses made in his absence out of their ornaments
			the image of a calf (for worship): it seemed to low: did they not
			see that it could neither speak to them nor show them the way? 
			They took it for worship and they did wrong. <sup class='fn'>1112</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1113</sup> <sup class='fn'>1114</sup>
When they repented and saw that they had erred they said: "If our\n\t\t\tLord have not mercy upon us and forgive us we shall indeed be of\n\t\t\tthose who perish."

When Moses came back to his people angry and grieved he said:
			"evil it is that ye have done in my place in my absence: did ye
			make haste to bring on the judgment of your Lord?"  He put down
			the tablets seized his brother by (the hair of) his head and
			dragged him to him. Aaron said: "son of my mother! the people did
			indeed reckon me as naught and went near to slaying me! make not
			the enemies rejoice over my misfortune nor count thou me amongst
			the people of sin." <sup class='fn'>1115</sup> <sup class='fn'>1116</sup> <sup class='fn'>1117</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1118</sup>
Moses prayed: "O my Lord! forgive me and my brother! admit us to\n\t\t\tThy mercy! for Thou art the Most Merciful of those who sow\n\t\t\tmercy!" <sup class='fn'>1119</sup>

Those who took the calf (for worship) will indeed be overwhelmed\n\t\t\twith wrath from their Lord and with shame in this life: thus do\n\t\t\tWe recompense those who invent (falsehoods). <sup class='fn'>1120</sup>
But those who do wrong but repent thereafter and (truly) believe\n\t\t\tverily Thy Lord is thereafter Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful.
When the anger of Moses was appeased he took up the tablets: in\n\t\t\tthe writing thereon was guidance and mercy for such as fear their\n\t\t\tLord.

And Moses chose seventy of his people for Our place of meeting:
			when they were seized with violent quaking he prayed: "O my Lord!
			if it had been Thy will Thou couldst have destroyed long before
			both them and me: wouldst Thou destroy us for the deeds of the
			foolish one among us?  This is no more than Thy trial: by it Thou
			causest whom Thou wilt to stray and Thou leadest whom Thou wilt
			into the right path.  Thou art our protector: so forgive us and
			give us Thy mercy; for Thou art the best of those who forgive.
			<sup class='fn'>1121</sup> <sup class='fn'>1122</sup> <sup class='fn'>1123</sup> <sup class='fn'>1124</sup>

"And ordain for us that which is good in this life and in the
			hereafter: for we have turned unto Thee."  He said: "with My
			punishment I visit whom I will; but My mercy extendeth to all
			things. That (Mercy) I shall ordain for those who do right and
			practice regular charity and those who believe in Our signs;
			<sup class='fn'>1125</sup> <sup class='fn'>1126</sup>

"Those who follow the apostle the unlettered prophet whom they
			find mentioned in their own (Scriptures); in the law and the
			Gospel; for he commands them what is just and forbids them what
			is evil: he allows them as lawful what is good (and pure) and
			prohibits them from what is bad (and impure); He releases them
			from their heavy burdens and from the yokes that are upon them. 
			So it is those who believe in him honor him help him and follow
			the light which is sent down with him it is they who will
			prosper." <sup class='fn'>1127</sup> <sup class='fn'>1128</sup> <sup class='fn'>1129</sup> <sup class='fn'>1130</sup>

Say: "O men! I am sent unto you all as the apostle of Allah to
			Whom belongeth the dominion of the heavens and the earth: there
			is no god but He: it is He that giveth both life and death.  So
			believe in Allah and His apostle the unlettered Prophet who
			believed in Allah and His words: follow him that (so) ye may be
			guided." <sup class='fn'>1131</sup> <sup class='fn'>1132</sup>
Of the people of Moses there is a section who guide and do\n\t\t\tjustice in the light of truth.

We divided them into twelve tribes or nations.	We directed Moses
			by inspiration when his (thirsty) people asked him for water:
			"Strike the rock with thy staff": out of it there gushed forth
			twelve springs: each group knew its own place for water.  We gave
			them the shade of clouds and sent down to them manna and quails
			(saying): "Eat of the good things We have provided for you": (but
			they rebelled): to Us they did no harm but they harmed their own
			souls. <sup class='fn'>1133</sup> <sup class='fn'>1134</sup>

And remember it was said to them: "Dwell in this town and eat
			therein as ye wish but say the word of humility and enter the
			gate in a posture of humility; We shall forgive you your faults;
			We shall increase (the portion of) those who do good."
			<sup class='fn'>1135</sup>

But the transgressors among them changed the word from that which\n\t\t\thad been given them; so We sent on them a plague from heaven for\n\t\t\tthat they repeatedly transgressed. <sup class='fn'>1136</sup>

Ask them concerning the town standing close by the sea.  Behold!
			they transgressed in the matter of the Sabbath.  For on the day
			of their Sabbath their fish did come to them openly holding up
			their heads but on the day they had no Sabbath they came not:
			thus did We make a trial of them for they were given to
			transgression. <sup class='fn'>1137</sup>

When some of them said: "why do ye preach to a people whom Allah
			will destroy or visit with a terrible punishment?"  Said the
			preachers: "to discharge our duty to your Lord and perchance they
			may fear him." <sup class='fn'>1138</sup>

When they disregarded the warnings that had been given them We
			rescued those who forbade evil; but We visited the wrong-doers
			with a grievous punishment because they were given to
			transgression.
When in their insolence they transgressed (all) prohibition We\n\t\t\tsaid to them: "Be ye apes despised and rejected." <sup class='fn'>1139</sup>

Behold! thy Lord did declare that He would send against them to
			the Day of Judgment those who would afflict them with grievous
			penalty. Thy Lord is quick in retribution but he is also
			Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful. <sup class='fn'>1140</sup>

We broke them up into sections on this earth.  There are among
			them some that are the righteous and some that are the opposite. 
			We have tried them with both prosperity and adversity: in order
			that they might turn (to us). <sup class='fn'>1141</sup>

After them succeeded an (evil) generation: they inherited the
			Book but they chose (for themselves) the vanities of this world
			saying (for excuse): "(everything) will be forgiven us."  (Even
			so) if similar vanities came their way they would (again) seize
			them.  Was not the covenant of the Book taken from them that they
			would not ascribe to Allah anything but the truth?  And they
			study what is in the Book.  But best for the righteous is the
			home in the hereafter: will ye not understand? <sup class='fn'>1142</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1143</sup>
As to those who hold fast by the Book and establish regular\n\t\t\tprayer; never shall We suffer the reward of the righteous to\n\t\t\tperish.

When We shook the mount over them as if it had been a canopy and
			they thought it was going to fall on them (We said): "Hold firmly
			to what We have given you and bring (even) to remembrance what is
			therein; perchance ye may fear Allah." <sup class='fn'>1144</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1145</sup>

When thy Lord drew forth from the children of Adam from their
			loins their descendants and made them testify concerning
			themselves (saying): "Am I not your Lord (who cherishes and
			sustains you)?"  They said: "Yea! we do testify!"  (This) lest ye
			should say on the Day of Judgment: "of this we were never
			mindful." <sup class='fn'>1146</sup> <sup class='fn'>1147</sup>

Or lest ye should say: "Our fathers before us may have taken
			false gods but we are (their) descendants after them: wilt thou
			then destroy us because of the deeds of men who were futile?"
			<sup class='fn'>1148</sup>
Thus do We explain the signs in detail! and perchance they may\n\t\t\tturn (unto Us).
Relate to them the story of the man to whom We sent our signs but\n\t\t\the passed them by: so satan followed him up and he went astray.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1149</sup>

If it had been Our will We should have elevated him with our
			signs; but he inclined to the earth and followed his own vain
			desires.  His similitude is that of a dog: if you attack him he
			lolls out his tongue or if you leave him alone he (still) lolls
			out his tongue. That is the similitude of those who reject our
			signs; so relate the story; perchance they may reflect.
			<sup class='fn'>1150</sup> <sup class='fn'>1151</sup>
Evil as an example are people who reject Our signs and wrong\n\t\t\ttheir own souls.
Whom Allah doth guide he is on the right path: whom He rejects\n\t\t\tfrom His guidance such are the persons who perish. <sup class='fn'>1152</sup>

Many are the Jinns and men We have made for Hell: They have
			hearts wherewith they understand not eyes wherewith they see not
			and ears wherewith they hear not.  They are like cattle nay more
			misguided: for they are heedless (of warning). <sup class='fn'>1153</sup>

The most beautiful names belong to Allah: so call on Him by them;\n\t\t\tbut shun such men as use profanity in His names: for what they do\n\t\t\tthey will soon be requited. <sup class='fn'>1154</sup>
Of those We have created are people who direct (others) with\n\t\t\ttruth and dispense justice therewith.
Those who reject Our signs We shall gradually visit with\n\t\t\tpunishment in ways they perceive not.
Respite will I grant unto them: for My scheme is strong (and\n\t\t\tunfailing).
Do they not reflect?  Their companion is not seized with madness:\n\t\t\the is but a perspicuous warner. <sup class='fn'>1155</sup> <sup class='fn'>1156</sup>

Do they see nothing in the government of the heavens and the
			earth and all that Allah hath created?	(Do they not see) that it
			may well be that their term is nigh drawing to an end?	In what
			message after this will they then believe? <sup class='fn'>1157</sup>
To such as Allah rejects from His guidance there can be no guide;\n\t\t\tHe will leave them in their trespasses wandering in distraction.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1158</sup>

They ask thee about the (final) hour when will be its appointed
			time? Say: "The knowledge thereof is with my Lord (alone): none
			but He can reveal as to when it will occur.  Heavy were its
			burden through the heavens and the earth.  Only all of a sudden
			will it come to you. They ask thee as if thou wert eager in
			search thereof: Say: "The knowledge thereof is with Allah (alone)
			but most men know not." <sup class='fn'>1159</sup> <sup class='fn'>1160</sup>

Say: "I have no power over any good or harm to myself except as
			Allah willeth.	If I had knowledge of the unseen I should have
			multiplied all good and no evil should have touched me I am but a
			warner and a bringer of glad tidings to those who have faith."
			<sup class='fn'>1161</sup>

It is He who created you from a single person and made his mate
			of like nature in order that he might dwell with her (in love). 
			When they are united she bears a light burden and carries it
			about (unnoticed).  When she grows heavy they both pray to Allah
			their Lord (saying): "if Thou givest us a goodly child we vow we
			shall (ever) be grateful." <sup class='fn'>1162</sup> <sup class='fn'>1163</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1164</sup>

But when He giveth them a goodly child they ascribe to others a\n\t\t\tshare in the gift they have received: but Allah is exalted high\n\t\t\tabove the partners they ascribe to Him. <sup class='fn'>1165</sup>
Do they indeed ascribe to Him as partners things that can create\n\t\t\tnothing but are themselves created?
No aid can they give them nor can they aid themselves!
If ye call them to guidance they will not obey: for you it is the\n\t\t\tsame whether ye call them or ye hold your peace! <sup class='fn'>1166</sup>
Verily those whom ye call upon besides Allah are servants like\n\t\t\tunto you: call upon them and let them listen to your prayer if ye\n\t\t\tare (indeed) truthful! <sup class='fn'>1167</sup>

Have they feet to walk with? or hands to lay hold with? or eyes
			to see with? or ears to hear with?  Say: "Call your god-partners
			scheme (your worst) against me and give me no respite!
			<sup class='fn'>1168</sup>
"For my protector is Allah Who revealed the Book (from time to\n\t\t\ttime) and He will choose and befriend the righteous.
"But those ye call upon besides Him are unable to help you and\n\t\t\tindeed to help themselves."
If thou callest them to guidance they hear not.  Thou wilt see\n\t\t\tthem looking at thee but they see not. <sup class='fn'>1169</sup>
Hold to forgiveness; command what is right; but turn away from\n\t\t\tthe ignorant. <sup class='fn'>1170</sup>
If a suggestion from satan assail thy (mind) seek refuge with\n\t\t\tAllah; for He heareth and knoweth (all things). <sup class='fn'>1171</sup>
Those who fear Allah when a thought of evil from satan assaults\n\t\t\tthem bring Allah to remembrance when lo! they see (aright)!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1172</sup>
But their brethren (the evil ones) plunge them deeper into error\n\t\t\tand never relax (their efforts). <sup class='fn'>1173</sup>

If thou bring them not a revelation they say: "Why hast thou not
			got it together?"  Say: "I but follow what is revealed to me from
			my Lord: This is (nothing but) lights from your Lord and guidance
			and mercy for any who have faith." <sup class='fn'>1174</sup> <sup class='fn'>1175</sup>
When the Qur'an is read listen to it with attention and hold your\n\t\t\tpeace: that ye may receive Mercy.

And do thou (O reader!) bring thy Lord to remembrance in thy
			(very) soul with humility and in reverence without loudness in
			words in the mornings and evenings; and be not thou of those who
			are unheedful.
Those who are near to thy Lord disdain not to do Him worship:\n\t\t\tThey celebrate His praises and bow down before Him. <sup class='fn'>1176</sup>\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1177</sup>

They ask thee concerning (things taken as) spoils of war.  Say:
			"(Such) spoils are at the disposal of Allah and the apostle: so
			fear Allah and keep straight the relations between yourselves:
			obey Allah and His apostle if ye do believe." <sup class='fn'>1178</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1179</sup>

For believers are those who when Allah is mentioned feel a tremor\n\t\t\tin their hearts and when they hear His signs rehearsed find their\n\t\t\tfaith strengthened and put (all) their trust in their Lord.
Who establish regular prayers and spend (freely) out of the gifts\n\t\t\tWe have given them for sustenance: <sup class='fn'>1180</sup>
Such in truth are the believers: they have grades of dignity with\n\t\t\ttheir Lord and forgiveness and generous sustenance.
Just as thy Lord ordered thee out of thy house in truth even\n\t\t\tthough a party among the believers disliked it. <sup class='fn'>1181</sup>
Disputing with thee concerning the truth after it was made\n\t\t\tmanifest as if they were being driven to death and they\n\t\t\t(actually) saw it. <sup class='fn'>1182</sup>

Behold! Allah promised you one of the two (enemy) parties that it
			should be yours: ye wished that the one unarmed should be yours
			but Allah willed to justify the truth according to His words and
			to cut off the roots of the unbelievers. <sup class='fn'>1183</sup>
That He might justify and prove falsehood false distasteful\n\t\t\tthough it be to those in guilt.
Remember ye implored the assistance of your Lord and He answered\n\t\t\tyou: "I will assist you with a thousand of the angels ranks on\n\t\t\tranks." <sup class='fn'>1184</sup>
Allah made it but a message of hope and an assurance to your\n\t\t\theart: (in any case) there is no help except from Allah: and\n\t\t\tAllah is exalted in power wise. <sup class='fn'>1185</sup>

Remember He covered you with a sort of drowsiness to give you
			calm as from Himself and He caused rain to descend on you from
			heaven to clean you therewith to remove from you the stain of
			satan to strengthen your hearts and to plant your feet firmly
			therewith. <sup class='fn'>1186</sup> <sup class='fn'>1187</sup> <sup class='fn'>1188</sup>

Remember thy Lord inspired the angels (with the message): "I am
			with you: give firmness to the believers: I will instil terror
			into the hearts of the unbelievers: smite ye above their necks
			and smite all their finger-tips off them." <sup class='fn'>1189</sup>
This because they contended against Allah and His apostle: if any\n\t\t\tcontend against Allah and His apostle Allah is strict in\n\t\t\tpunishment.
Thus (will it be said): "Taste ye then of the (punishment): for\n\t\t\tthose who resist Allah is the penalty of the fire."
O ye who believe! when ye meet the unbelievers in hostile array\n\t\t\tnever turn your backs to them. <sup class='fn'>1190</sup>

If any do turn his back to them on such a day unless it be in a
			stratagem of war or to retreat to a troop (of his own) He draws
			on himself the wrath of Allah and his abode is Hell and evil
			refuge (indeed)!

It is not ye who slew them; it was Allah: when thou threwest (a
			handful of dust) it was not thy act but Allah's: in order that He
			might test the believers by a gracious trial from Himself: for
			Allah is He who heareth and knoweth (all things). <sup class='fn'>1191</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1192</sup>
That and also because Allah is He who makes feeble the plans and\n\t\t\tstratagems of the unbelievers.

(O unbelievers!) if ye prayed for victory and judgment now hath
			the judgment come to you: if ye desist (from wrong) it will be
			best for you: if ye return (to the attack) so shall We.  Not the
			least good will your forces be to you even if they were
			multiplied: for verily Allah is with those who believe.
			<sup class='fn'>1193</sup>
O ye who believe! obey Allah and his apostle and turn not away\n\t\t\tfrom him when ye hear (him speak).
Nor be like those who say "we hear" but listen not: <sup class='fn'>1194</sup>
For the worst of beasts in the sight of Allah are the deaf and\n\t\t\tthe dumb those who understand not. <sup class='fn'>1195</sup>
If Allah had found in them any good He would indeed have made\n\t\t\tthem listen; (as it is) if He had made them listen they would but\n\t\t\thave turned back and declined (faith).

O ye who believe! give your response to Allah and His apostle
			when He calleth you to that which will give you life; and know
			that Allah cometh in between a man and his heart and that it is
			He to whom Ye shall (all) be gathered. <sup class='fn'>1196</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1197</sup>
And fear tumult or oppression which affecteth not in particular\n\t\t\t(only) those of you who do wrong and know that Allah is strict in\n\t\t\tpunishment. <sup class='fn'>1198</sup>

Call to mind when ye were a small (band) despised through the
			land and afraid that men might despoil and kidnap you; but He
			provided a safe asylum for you strengthened you with his aid and
			gave you good things for sustenance: that ye might be grateful.
			<sup class='fn'>1199</sup>
O ye that believe! betray not the trust of Allah and the apostle\n\t\t\tnor misappropriate knowingly things entrusted to you.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1200</sup>
And know ye that your possessions and your progeny are but a\n\t\t\ttrial; and that it is Allah with whom lies your highest reward.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1201</sup>

O ye who believe! if ye fear Allah He will grant you a criterion
			(to judge between right and wrong) remove from you (all) evil
			(that may afflict) you and forgive you: for Allah is the Lord of
			grace unbounded. <sup class='fn'>1202</sup>

Remember how the unbelievers plotted against thee to keep thee in
			bonds or slay thee or get thee out (of thy home).  They plot and
			plan and Allah too plans but the best of planners is Allah.
			<sup class='fn'>1203</sup>

When Our signs are rehearsed to them they say: "we have heard\n\t\t\tthis (before): if we wished we could say (words) like these:\n\t\t\tthese are nothing but tales of the ancients." <sup class='fn'>1204</sup>
Remember how they said: "O Allah! if this is indeed the truth\n\t\t\tfrom Thee rain down on us a shower of stones from the sky or send\n\t\t\tus a grievous penalty." <sup class='fn'>1205</sup>
But Allah was not going to send them a penalty whilst thou wast\n\t\t\tamongst them; nor was He going to send it whilst they could ask\n\t\t\tfor pardon.

But what plea have they that Allah should not punish them when
			they keep out (men) from the sacred Mosque and they are not its
			guardians?  No men can be its guardians except the righteous; but
			most of them do not understand.
Their prayer at the house (of Allah) is nothing but whistling and\n\t\t\tclapping of hands: (its only answer can be) "taste ye the penalty\n\t\t\tbecause ye blasphemed."

The unbelievers spend their wealth to hinder (men) from the path
			of Allah and so will they continue to spend; but in the end they
			will have (only) regrets and sighs; at length they will be
			overcome: and the unbelievers will be gathered together to Hell.

In order that Allah may separate the impure from the pure put the\n\t\t\timpure one on another heap them together and cast them into hell.\n\t\t\tThey will be the ones to have lost. <sup class='fn'>1206</sup>

Say to the unbelievers if (now) they desist (from unbelief) their\n\t\t\tpast would be forgiven them; but if they persist the punishment\n\t\t\tof those before them is already (a matter of warning for them).

And fight them on until there is no more tumult or oppression and
			there prevail justice and faith in Allah altogether and
			everywhere; but if they cease verily Allah doth see all that they
			do. <sup class='fn'>1207</sup> <sup class='fn'>1208</sup>
If they refuse be sure that Allah is your protector the best to\n\t\t\tprotect and the best to help.

And know that out of all the booty that ye may acquire (in war) a
			fifth share is assigned to Allah and to the apostle and to near
			relatives orphans the needy and the wayfarer if ye do believe in
			Allah and in the revelation We sent down to Our servant on the
			day of testing the day of the meeting of the two forces.  For
			Allah hath power over all things. <sup class='fn'>1209</sup> <sup class='fn'>1210</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1211</sup>

Remember ye were on the hither side of the valley and they on the
			farther side and the caravan on lower ground than ye.  Even if ye
			had made a mutual appointment to meet ye would certainly have
			failed in the appointment: but (thus ye met) that Allah might
			accomplish a matter already enacted; that those who died might
			die after a clear sign (had been given) and those who lived might
			live after a clear sign (had been given).  And verily Allah is He
			Who heareth and knoweth (all things). <sup class='fn'>1212</sup> <sup class='fn'>1213</sup>

Remember in thy dream Allah showed them to thee as few: if He had
			shown them to thee as many ye would surely have been discouraged
			and ye would surely have disputed in (your) decision: but Allah
			saved (you): for He knoweth well the (secrets) of (all) hearts.

And remember when ye met He showed them to you as few in your
			eyes and He made you appear as contemptible in their eyes: That
			Allah might accomplish a matter already enacted: for to Allah do
			all questions go back (for decision). <sup class='fn'>1214</sup>
O ye who believe! when ye meet a force be firm and call Allah in\n\t\t\tremembrance much (and often); that ye may prosper.

And obey Allah and His apostle; and fall into no disputes lest ye\n\t\t\tlose heart and your power depart; and be patient and persevering:\n\t\t\tfor Allah is with those who patiently persevere. <sup class='fn'>1215</sup>

And be not like those who started from their homes insolently and\n\t\t\tto be seen of men and to hinder (men) from the path of Allah: for\n\t\t\tAllah compasseth round about all that they do. <sup class='fn'>1216</sup>

Remember satan made their (sinful) acts seem alluring to them and
			said: "No one among men can overcome you this day while I am near
			to you": but when the two forces came in sight of each other he
			turned on his heels and said: "Lo! I am clear of you; lo! I see
			what ye see not; lo! I fear Allah; for Allah is strict in
			punishment. <sup class='fn'>1217</sup>

Lo! the hypocrites say and those in whose hearts is a disease:\n\t\t\t"these people--their religion has misled them."  But if any trust\n\t\t\tin Allah behold! Allah is Exalted in might Wise. <sup class='fn'>1218</sup>

If thou couldst see when the angels take the souls of the
			unbelievers (at death) (how) they smite their faces and their
			backs (saying): "Taste the penalty of the blazing fire.
			<sup class='fn'>1219</sup>
"Because of (the deeds) which your (own) hands sent forth: for\n\t\t\tAllah is never unjust to His servants: <sup class='fn'>1220</sup>

"(Deeds) after the manner of the people of Pharaoh and of those
			before them: they rejected the signs of Allah and Allah punished
			them for their crimes: for Allah is strong and strict in
			punishment:

"Because Allah will never change the grace which He hath bestowed
			on a people until they change what is in their (own) souls: and
			verily Allah is He Who heareth and knoweth (all things)."
			<sup class='fn'>1221</sup>

"(Deeds) after the manner of the people of Pharaoh and those
			before them": they treated as false the signs of their Lord; so
			We destroyed them for their crimes and We drowned the people of
			Pharaoh: for they were all oppressors and wrong-doers.
			<sup class='fn'>1222</sup>
For the worst of beasts in the sight of Allah are those who\n\t\t\treject Him: They will not believe. <sup class='fn'>1223</sup>
They are those with whom thou didst make a covenant but they\n\t\t\tbreak their covenant every time and they have not the fear (of\n\t\t\tAllah). <sup class='fn'>1224</sup>
If ye gain the mastery over them in war disperse with them those\n\t\t\twho follow them that they may remember.
If thou fearest treachery from any group throw back (their\n\t\t\tcovenant) to them (so as to be) on equal terms: for Allah loveth\n\t\t\tnot the treacherous.
Let not the unbelievers think that they can get the better (of\n\t\t\tAllah): they will never frustrate (them).

Against them make ready your strength to the utmost of your power
			including steeds of war to strike terror into (the hearts of) the
			enemies of Allah and your enemies and others besides whom ye may
			not know but whom Allah doth know.  Whatever ye shall spend in
			the cause of Allah shall be repaid unto you and ye shall not be
			treated unjustly. <sup class='fn'>1225</sup> <sup class='fn'>1226</sup> <sup class='fn'>1227</sup>
But if the enemy incline towards peace do thou (also) incline\n\t\t\ttowards peace and trust in Allah: for He is the one that heareth\n\t\t\tand knoweth (all things). <sup class='fn'>1228</sup>
Should they intend to deceive thee verily Allah sufficeth thee:\n\t\t\tHe it is that hath strengthened thee with his aid and with (the\n\t\t\tcompany of) the believers: <sup class='fn'>1229</sup>

And (moreover) He hath put affection between their hearts: not if
			thou hadst spent all that is in the earth couldst thou have
			produced that affection but Allah hath done it: for He is Exalted
			in might Wise. <sup class='fn'>1230</sup>
O Apostle! sufficient unto thee is Allah (unto thee) and unto\n\t\t\tthose who follow thee among the believers. <sup class='fn'>1231</sup>

O apostle! rouse the believers to the fight.  If there are twenty
			amongst you patient and persevering they will vanquish two
			hundred: if a hundred they will vanquish a thousand of the
			unbelievers: for these are a people without understanding.
			<sup class='fn'>1232</sup>

For the present Allah hath lightened your (task) for He knoweth
			that there is a weak spot in you: but (even so) if there are a
			hundred of you patient and persevering they will vanquish two
			hundred and if a thousand they will vanquish two thousand with
			the leave of Allah: for Allah is with those who patiently
			persevere. <sup class='fn'>1233</sup>

It is not fitting for an apostle that he should have prisoners of
			war until he hath thoroughly subdued the land.	Ye look for the
			temporal goods of this world; but Allah looketh to the hereafter;
			and Allah is Exalted in might Wise. <sup class='fn'>1234</sup>
Had it not been for a previous ordainment from Allah a severe\n\t\t\tpenalty would have reached you for the (ransom) that ye took.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1235</sup>
But (now) enjoy what ye took in war lawful and good: but fear\n\t\t\tAllah: for Allah is Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful. <sup class='fn'>1236</sup>

O apostle! say to those who are captives in your hands: "If Allah
			findeth any good in your hearts He will give you something better
			than what has been taken from you and He will forgive you: for
			Allah is Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful." <sup class='fn'>1237</sup>

But if they have treacherous designs against thee (o apostle!)
			they have already been in treason against Allah and so hath He
			given (thee) power over them and Allah is He who hath (full)
			knowledge and wisdom. <sup class='fn'>1238</sup>

Those who believed and adopted exile and fought for the faith
			with their property and their persons in the cause of Allah as
			well as those who gave (them) asylum and aid these are (all)
			friends and protectors one of another.	As to those who believed
			but came not into exile ye owe no duty of protection to them
			until they seek your aid in religion it is your duty to help them
			except against a people with whom ye have a treaty of mutual
			alliance: and (remember) Allah seeth all that ye do.
			<sup class='fn'>1239</sup> <sup class='fn'>1240</sup> <sup class='fn'>1241</sup>
The unbelievers are protectors one of another: unless ye do this\n\t\t\t(protect each other) there would be tumult and oppression on\n\t\t\tearth and great mischief. <sup class='fn'>1242</sup>

Those who believe and adopt exile and fight for the faith in the
			cause of Allah as well as those who give (them) asylum and aid
			these are (all) in very truth the believers: for them is the
			forgiveness of sins and a provision most generous. <sup class='fn'>1243</sup>

And those who accept faith subsequently and adopt exile and fight
			for the faith in your company they are of you.	But kindred by
			blood have prior rights against each other in the Book of Allah. 
			Verily Allah is well acquainted with all things. <sup class='fn'>1244</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1245</sup>
A (declaration) of immunity from Allah and His apostle to those\n\t\t\tof the pagans with whom ye have contracted mutual alliances.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1246</sup>

Go ye then for four months backwards and forwards (as ye will)
			throughout the land but know ye that ye cannot frustrate Allah
			(by your falsehood) but that Allah will cover with shame those
			who reject him. <sup class='fn'>1247</sup>

And an announcement from Allah and His apostle to the people
			(assembled) on the day of the Great Pilgrimage that Allah and His
			apostle dissolve (treaty) obligations with the pagans.	If then
			ye repent it were best for you; but if ye turn away know ye that
			ye cannot frustrate Allah.  And proclaim a grievous penalty to
			those who reject faith. <sup class='fn'>1248</sup>

(But the treaties are) not dissolved with those pagans with whom
			Ye have entered into alliance and who have not subsequently
			failed you in aught nor aided anyone against you.  So fulfil your
			engagements with them to the end of their term: for Allah loveth
			the righteous. <sup class='fn'>1249</sup>

But when the forbidden months are past then fight and slay the
			pagans wherever ye find them and seize them beleaguer them and
			lie in wait for them in every stratagem (of war); but if they
			repent and establish regular prayers and practice regular charity
			then open the way for them: for Allah is Oft-Forgiving Most
			Merciful. <sup class='fn'>1250</sup> <sup class='fn'>1251</sup> <sup class='fn'>1252</sup>

If one amongst the pagans ask thee for asylum grant it to him so
			that he may hear the word of Allah and then escort him to where
			he can be secure: that is because they are men without knowledge.
			<sup class='fn'>1253</sup> <sup class='fn'>1254</sup>

How can there be a league before Allah and His apostle with the
			pagans except those with whom ye made a treaty near the sacred
			mosque?  As long as these stand true to you stand ye true to
			them: For Allah doth love the righteous. <sup class='fn'>1255</sup>

How (can there be such a league) seeing that if they get an
			advantage over you they respect not in you the ties either of
			kinship or of covenant?  With (fair words from) their mouths they
			entice you but their hearts are averse from you; and most of them
			are rebellious and wicked. <sup class='fn'>1256</sup> <sup class='fn'>1257</sup>
The signs of Allah have they sold for a miserable price and\n\t\t\t(many) have they hindered from His way: evil indeed are the deeds\n\t\t\tthey have done.
In a believer they respect not the ties either of kinship or of\n\t\t\tcovenant!  It is they who have transgressed all bounds.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1258</sup>

But (even so) if they repent establish regular prayers and
			practice regular charity they are your brethren in faith: (thus)
			do We explain signs in detail for those who understand.
			<sup class='fn'>1259</sup>

But if they violate their oaths after their covenant and taunt
			you for your faith fight ye the chiefs of unfaith: for their
			oaths are nothing to them: that thus they may be restrained.
			<sup class='fn'>1260</sup>

Will ye not fight people who violated their oaths plotted to
			expel the apostle and took the aggressive by being the first (to
			assault) you?  Do ye fear them?  Nay it is Allah whom ye should
			more justly fear if ye believe! <sup class='fn'>1261</sup>
Fight them and Allah will punish them by your hands cover them\n\t\t\twith shame help you (to victory) over them heal the breasts of\n\t\t\tbelievers. <sup class='fn'>1262</sup>
And still the indignation of their hearts. For Allah will turn\n\t\t\t(in mercy) To whom He will; and Allah is All-Knowing All-Wise.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1263</sup> <sup class='fn'>1264</sup>

Or think ye that ye Shall be abandoned as though Allah did not
			know those among you who strive with might and main and take none
			for friends and protectors except Allah His apostle and the
			(community of) believers?  But Allah is well-acquainted with
			(all) that ye do. <sup class='fn'>1265</sup>

It is not for such as join gods with Allah to visit or maintain
			the mosques of Allah while they witness against their own souls
			to infidelity.	The works of such bear no fruit: in fire shall
			they dwell. <sup class='fn'>1266</sup>

The mosques of Allah shall be visited and maintained by such as
			believe in Allah and the Last Day establish regular prayers and
			practice regular charity and fear none (at all) except Allah.  It
			is they who are expected to be on true guidance. <sup class='fn'>1267</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1268</sup>

Do ye make the giving of drink to pilgrims or the maintenance of
			the Sacred Mosque equal to (the pious service of) those who
			believe in Allah and the Last Day and strive with might and main
			in the cause of Allah?	They are not comparable in the sight of
			Allah: and Allah guides not those who do wrong. <sup class='fn'>1269</sup>

Those who believe and suffer exile and strive with might and main
			in Allah's cause with their goods and their persons have the
			highest rank in the sight of Allah: They are the people who will
			achieve (salvation). <sup class='fn'>1270</sup>
Their Lord doth give them Glad tidings of a Mercy from Himself of\n\t\t\tHis good pleasure and of gardens for them wherein are delights\n\t\t\tthat endure.
They will dwell therein forever.  Verily in Allah's presence is a\n\t\t\treward the greatest (of all). <sup class='fn'>1271</sup>
O ye who believe! take not for protectors your fathers and your\n\t\t\tbrothers if they love infidelity above faith: if any of you do so\n\t\t\tthey do wrong.

Say: If it be that your fathers your sons your brothers your
			mates or your kindred; the wealth that ye have gained; the
			commerce in which ye fear a decline; or the dwellings in which ye
			delight are dearer to you than Allah or His apostle or the
			striving in his cause; then wait until Allah brings about His
			decision: and Allah guides not the rebellious. <sup class='fn'>1272</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1273</sup>

Assuredly Allah did help you in many battle-fields and on the day
			of Hunain: Behold! your great numbers elated you but they availed
			you naught: the land for all that it is wide did constrain you
			and ye turned back in retreat. <sup class='fn'>1274</sup> <sup class='fn'>1275</sup>

But Allah did pour His calm on the apostle and on the believers
			and sent down forces which ye saw not: He punished the
			unbelievers: thus doth He reward those without faith.
			<sup class='fn'>1276</sup>
Again will Allah after this turn (in mercy) to whom He will: for\n\t\t\tAllah is Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful. <sup class='fn'>1277</sup>

O ye who believe! truly the pagans are unclean; so let them not
			after this year of theirs approach the Sacred Mosque.  And if ye
			fear poverty soon will Allah enrich you if He wills out of his
			bounty for Allah is All-Knowing All-Wise. <sup class='fn'>1278</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1279</sup> <sup class='fn'>1280</sup>

Fight those who believe not in Allah nor the Last Day nor hold
			that forbidden which hath been forbidden by Allah and His apostle
			nor acknowledge the religion of truth (even if they are) of the
			People of the Book until they pay the Jizya with willing
			submission and feel themselves subdued. <sup class='fn'>1281</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1282</sup>

The Jews call Uzair a son of Allah and the Christians call Christ
			the son of Allah.  That is a saying from their mouths; (in this)
			they but imitate what the unbelievers of old used to say. 
			Allah's curse be on them: how they are deluded away from the
			truth! <sup class='fn'>1283</sup> <sup class='fn'>1284</sup> <sup class='fn'>1285</sup>

They take their priests and their anchorites to be their lords in
			derogation of Allah and (they take as their Lord) Christ the son
			of Mary; Yet they were commanded to worship but one Allah: there
			is no god but He.  Praise and glory to him: (far is He) from
			having the parents they associate (with him). <sup class='fn'>1286</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1287</sup> <sup class='fn'>1288</sup>

Fain would they extinguish Allah's light with their mouths but\n\t\t\tAllah will not allow but that His light should be perfected even\n\t\t\tthough the unbelievers may detest (it). <sup class='fn'>1289</sup>
It is He who hath sent His apostle with guidance and religion of\n\t\t\ttruth to proclaim it over all religions even though the pagans\n\t\t\tmay detest (it). <sup class='fn'>1290</sup>

O ye who believe! there are indeed many among the priests and
			anchorites who in falsehood devour the substance of men and
			hinder (them) from the way of Allah.  And there are those who
			bury gold and silver and spend it not in the way of Allah:
			announce unto them a most grievous penalty. <sup class='fn'>1291</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1292</sup>

On the day when heat will be produced out of that (wealth) in the
			fire of hell and with it will be branded their foreheads their
			flanks and their backs "this is the (treasure) which ye buried
			for yourselves: taste ye then the (treasures) ye buried!"
			<sup class='fn'>1293</sup> <sup class='fn'>1294</sup>

The number of months in the sight of Allah is twelve (in a year)
			so ordained by Him the day He created the heavens and the earth;
			of them four are sacred; that is the straight usage.  So wrong
			not yourselves therein and fight the pagans all together as they
			fight you all together.  But know that Allah is with those who
			restrain themselves. <sup class='fn'>1295</sup> <sup class='fn'>1296</sup>

Verily the transposing (of a prohibited month) is an addition to
			unbelief: the unbelievers are led to wrong thereby: for they make
			it lawful one year and forbidden another year in order to adjust
			the number of months forbidden by Allah and make such forbidden
			ones lawful. The evil of their course seems pleasing to them. 
			But Allah guideth not those who reject faith. <sup class='fn'>1297</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1298</sup>

O ye who believe! what is the matter with you then when ye are
			asked to go forth in the cause of Allah ye cling heavily to the
			earth?	Do ye prefer the life of this world to the hereafter? 
			But little is the comfort of this life as compared with the
			hereafter. <sup class='fn'>1299</sup> <sup class='fn'>1300</sup>

Unless ye go forth He will punish you with a grievous penalty and\n\t\t\tput others in your place; but Him ye would not harm in the least.\n\t\t\t For Allah hath power over all things. <sup class='fn'>1301</sup>

If ye help not (your Leader) (it is no matter): for Allah did
			indeed help him: when the unbelievers drove him out: he had no
			more than one companion: they two were in the cave and he said to
			his companion "have no fear for Allah is with us": then Allah
			sent down his peace upon him and strengthened him with forces
			which ye saw not and humbled to the depths the word of the
