			unbelievers.  But the word of Allah is exalted to the heights:
			for Allah is Exalted in might Wise. <sup class='fn'>1302</sup> <sup class='fn'>1303</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1304</sup> <sup class='fn'>1305</sup>

Go ye forth (whether equipped) lightly or heavily and strive and\n\t\t\tstruggle with your goods and your persons in the cause of Allah. \n\t\t\tThat is best for you if ye (but) knew. <sup class='fn'>1306</sup>

If there had been immediate gain (in sight) and the journey easy
			they would (all) without doubt have followed thee but the
			distance was long (and weighed) on them.  They would indeed swear
			by Allah "If we only could we should certainly have come out with
			you" they would destroy their own souls; for Allah doth know that
			they are certainly lying. <sup class='fn'>1307</sup>
Allah give thee grace!\tWhy didst thou grant them exemption until\n\t\t\tthose who told the truth were seen by thee in a clear light and\n\t\t\tthou hadst proved the liars? <sup class='fn'>1308</sup>
Those who believe in Allah and the last day ask thee for no\n\t\t\texemption from fighting with their goods and persons.  And Allah\n\t\t\tknoweth well those who do their duty.
Only those ask thee for exemption who believe not in Allah and\n\t\t\tthe Last Day and whose hearts are in doubt so that they are\n\t\t\ttossed in their doubts to and fro. <sup class='fn'>1309</sup>

If they had intended to come out they would certainly have made
			some preparation therefor; but Allah was averse to their being
			sent forth; so He made them lag behind and they were told "sit ye
			among those who sit (inactive)."

If they had come out with you they would not have added to your
			(strength) but only (made for) disorder hurrying to and fro in
			your midst and sowing sedition among you and there would have
			been some among you who would have listened to them.  But Allah
			knoweth well those who do wrong. <sup class='fn'>1310</sup>
Indeed they had plotted sedition before and upset matters for\n\t\t\tthee until The Truth arrived and the Decree of Allah became\n\t\t\tmanifest much to their disgust. <sup class='fn'>1311</sup>

Among them is (many) a man who says: "Grant me exemption and draw
			me not into trial."  Have they not fallen into trial already? 
			And indeed hell surrounds the unbelievers (on all sides).
			<sup class='fn'>1312</sup>
If good befalls thee it grieves them; but if a misfortune befalls\n\t\t\tthee they say "we took indeed our precautions beforehand" and\n\t\t\tthey turn away rejoicing.
Say: "Nothing will happen to us except what Allah has decreed for\n\t\t\tus: He is our protector": and on Allah let the believers put\n\t\t\ttheir trust.

Say: "Can you expect for us (any fate) other than one of two
			glorious things (martyrdom or victory)?  But we can expect for
			you either that Allah will send His punishment from Himself or by
			our hands.  So wait (expectant); we too will wait with you."
			<sup class='fn'>1313</sup>
Say: "Spend (for the cause) willingly or unwillingly: not from\n\t\t\tyou will it be accepted: for ye are indeed a people rebellious\n\t\t\tand wicked." <sup class='fn'>1314</sup>

The only reasons why their contributions are not accepted are:
			that they reject Allah and His apostle; that they come to prayer
			without earnestness; and that they offer contributions
			unwillingly.

Let not their wealth nor their (following in) sons dazzle thee:
			in reality Allah's plan is to punish them with these things in
			this life and that their souls may perish in their (very) denial
			of Allah. <sup class='fn'>1315</sup> <sup class='fn'>1316</sup>
They swear by Allah that they are indeed of you; but they are not\n\t\t\tof you; yet they are afraid (to appear in their true colors).
If they could find a place to flee to or caves or a place of\n\t\t\tconcealment they would turn straightway thereto with an obstinate\n\t\t\trush. <sup class='fn'>1317</sup>

And among them are men who slander thee in the matter of (the\n\t\t\tdistribution of) the alms.  If they are given part thereof they\n\t\t\tare pleased but if not behold! they are indignant! <sup class='fn'>1318</sup>

If only they had been content with what Allah and His apostle
			gave them and had said "sufficient unto us is Allah! Allah and
			His apostle will soon give us of his bounty: to Allah do we turn
			our hopes!" (that would have been the right course).
			<sup class='fn'>1319</sup>

Alms are for the poor and the needy and those employed to
			administer the (funds); for those whose hearts have been
			(recently) reconciled (to truth); for those in bondage and in
			debt; in the cause of Allah; and for the wayfarer: (thus is it)
			ordained by Allah and Allah is full of knowledge and wisdom.
			<sup class='fn'>1320</sup>

Among them are men who molest the Prophet and say "he is (all)
			ear." Say "he listens to what is best for you; he believes in
			Allah has faith in the believers and is a Mercy to those of you
			who believe": but those who molest the apostle will have a
			grievous penalty. <sup class='fn'>1321</sup>
To you they swear by Allah.  In order to please you: but it is\n\t\t\tmore fitting that they should please Allah and His apostle if\n\t\t\tthey are believers.
Know they not that for those who oppose Allah and His apostle is\n\t\t\tthe fire of Hell?  wherein they shall dwell.  That is the supreme\n\t\t\tdisgrace.

The Hypocrites are afraid lest a Surah should be sent down about
			them showing them what is (really passing) in their hearts.  Say:
			"Mock ye! but verily Allah will bring to light all that ye fear
			(should be revealed)." <sup class='fn'>1322</sup>
If thou dost question them they declare (with emphasis): "we were\n\t\t\tonly talking idly and in play."  Say: "was it at Allah and His\n\t\t\tsigns and His apostle that ye were mocking?"
Make ye no excuses: ye have rejected faith after ye had accepted\n\t\t\tit. If We pardon some of you We will punish others amongst you\n\t\t\tfor that they are in sin. <sup class='fn'>1323</sup>

The Hypocrites men and women (have an understanding) with each
			other: they enjoin evil and forbid what in just and are close
			with their hands.  They have forgotten Allah; so He hath
			forgotten them. Verily the Hypocrites are rebellious and
			perverse. <sup class='fn'>1324</sup> <sup class='fn'>1325</sup> <sup class='fn'>1326</sup>

Allah hath promised the Hypocrites men and women and the
			rejecters of faith the fire of hell: therein shall they dwell:
			sufficient is it for them: for them is the curse of Allah and an
			enduring punishment <sup class='fn'>1327</sup>

As in the case of those before you: they were mightier than you
			in power and more flourishing in wealth and children.  They had
			their enjoyment of their portion: and ye have of yours as did
			those before you; and ye indulge in idle talk as they did.  They!
			their works are fruitless in this world and in the hereafter and
			they will lose (all spiritual good).

Hath not the story reached them of those before them?  The people
			of Noah and Ad and Thamud; the people of Abraham the men of
			Madyan and the cities overthrown.  To them came their apostles
			with clear signs.  It is not Allah who wrongs them but they wrong
			their own souls. <sup class='fn'>1328</sup> <sup class='fn'>1329</sup> <sup class='fn'>1330</sup>

The believers men and women are protectors one of another: they
			enjoin what is just and forbid what is evil: they observe regular
			prayers practice regular charity and obey Allah and His apostle. 
			On them will Allah pour His mercy: for Allah is Exalted in power
			Wise.

Allah hath promised to believers men and women gardens under
			which rivers flow to dwell therein and beautiful mansions in
			gardens of everlasting bliss.  But the greatest bliss in the Good
			Pleasure of Allah: that is the supreme felicity.
O Prophet! strive hard against the unbelievers and the Hypocrites\n\t\t\tand be firm against them.  Their abode is hell an evil refuge\n\t\t\tindeed.

They swear by Allah that they said nothing (evil) but indeed they
			uttered blasphemy and they did it after accepting Islam; and they
			meditated a plot which they were unable to carry out: this
			revenge of theirs was (their) only return for the bounty with
			which Allah and His apostle had enriched them!	If they repent it
			will be best for them; but if they turn back (to their evil ways)
			Allah will punish them with a grievous penalty in this life and
			in the hereafter: they shall have none on earth to protect or
			help them. <sup class='fn'>1331</sup>
Amongst them are men who made a covenant with Allah that if He\n\t\t\tbestowed on them of His bounty they would give (largely) in\n\t\t\tcharity and be truly amongst those who are righteous.
But when He did bestow of His bounty they became covetous and\n\t\t\tturned back (from their covenant) averse (from its fulfillment).

So He hath put as a consequence hypocrisy into their hearts (to
			last) till the day whereon they shall meet Him: because they
			broke their covenant with Allah and because they lied (again and
			again). <sup class='fn'>1332</sup>
Know they not that Allah doth know their secret (thoughts) and\n\t\t\ttheir secret counsels and that Allah knoweth well all things\n\t\t\tunseen?

Those who slander such of the believers as give themselves freely
			to (deeds of) charity as well as such as can find nothing to give
			except the fruits of their labor and throw ridicule on them Allah
			will throw back their ridicule on them: and they shall have a
			grievous penalty. <sup class='fn'>1333</sup>

Whether thou ask for their forgiveness or not (their sin is
			unforgivable): if thou ask seventy times for their forgiveness
			Allah will not forgive them: because they have rejected Allah and
			His apostle; and Allah guideth not those who are perversely
			rebellious. <sup class='fn'>1334</sup>

Those who were left behind (in the Tabuk expedition) rejoiced in
			their inaction behind the back of the apostle of Allah: they
			hated to strive and fight with their goods and their persons in
			the cause of Allah: they said "Go not forth in the heat.  Say
			"The fire of Hell is fiercer in heat."	If only they could
			understand! <sup class='fn'>1335</sup>
Let them laugh a little: much will they weep: a recompense for\n\t\t\tthe (evil) that they do. <sup class='fn'>1336</sup>

If then Allah bring thee back to any of them and they ask thy
			permission to come out (with thee) say: "Never shall ye come out
			with me nor fight an enemy with me: for ye preferred to sit
			inactive on the first occasion: then sit ye (now) with those who
			lag behind."
Nor do thou ever pray for any of them that dies nor stand at his\n\t\t\tgrave: for they rejected Allah and His apostle and died in a\n\t\t\tstate of perverse rebellion. <sup class='fn'>1337</sup>

Nor let their wealth nor their (following in) sons Dazzle thee:
			Allah's plan is to punish them with these things in this world
			and that their souls may perish in their (very) denial of Allah.
			<sup class='fn'>1338</sup>

When a Surah comes down enjoining them to believe in Allah and to
			strive and fight along with his apostle those with wealth and
			influence among them ask thee for exemption and say: "Leave us
			(behind): we would be with those who sit (at home)."
They prefer to be with (the women) who remain behind (at home):\n\t\t\ttheir hearts are sealed and so they understand not. <sup class='fn'>1339</sup>

But the apostle and those who believe with him strive and fight\n\t\t\twith their wealth and their persons: for them are (all) good\n\t\t\tthings: and it is they who will prosper. <sup class='fn'>1340</sup>
Allah hath prepared for them gardens under which rivers flow to\n\t\t\tdwell therein: that is the supreme felicity. <sup class='fn'>1341</sup>

And there were among the desert Arabs (also) Men who made excuses
			and came to claim exemption; and those who were false to Allah
			and His apostle (Merely) sat inactive.	Soon will a grievous
			penalty seize the unbelievers among them. <sup class='fn'>1342</sup>

There is no blame on those who are infirm or ill or who find no
			resources to spend (on the cause) if they are sincere (in duty)
			to Allah and His apostle: no ground (of complaint) can there be
			against such as do right: and Allah is Oft-Forgiving Most
			Merciful. <sup class='fn'>1343</sup>

Nor (is there blame) on those who came to thee to be provided
			with mount and when thou saidst "I can find no mounts for you"
			they turned back their eyes streaming with tears of grief that
			they had no resources wherewith to provide the expenses.
			<sup class='fn'>1344</sup>

The ground (of complaint) is against such as claim exemption
			while they are rich.  They prefer to stay with the (women) who
			remain behind: Allah hath sealed their hearts; so they know not
			(what they miss). <sup class='fn'>1345</sup>

They will present their excuses to you when ye return to them. 
			Say thou: "Present no excuses: we shall not believe you: Allah
			hath already informed us of the true state of matters concerning
			you: it is your actions that Allah and His apostle will observe:
			in the end will ye be brought back to Him who knoweth what is
			hidden and what is open: then will He show you the truth of all
			that ye did.

They will swear to you by Allah when ye return to them that ye
			may leave them alone.  So leave them alone: For they are an
			abomination and Hell is their dwelling place a fitting recompense
			for the (evil) that they did.
They will swear unto you that ye may be pleased with them but if\n\t\t\tye are pleased with them Allah is not pleased with those who\n\t\t\tdisobey.

The Arabs of the desert are the worst in unbelief and hypocrisy\n\t\t\tand most fitted to be in ignorance of the command which Allah\n\t\t\thath sent down to his apostle: but Allah is All-Knowing All-Wise.

Some of the desert Arabs Look upon their payments as a fine and\n\t\t\twatch for disasters for you: on them be the disaster of evil: for\n\t\t\tAllah is He that heareth and knoweth (all things). <sup class='fn'>1346</sup>

But some of the desert Arabs believe in Allah and The Last Day
			and look on their payments as pious gifts bringing them nearer to
			Allah and obtaining the prayers of the apostle.  Aye indeed they
			bring them nearer (to Him): soon will Allah admit them to His
			Mercy: for Allah is Oft- Forgiving Most Merciful. <sup class='fn'>1347</sup>

The vanguard (of Islam) the first of those who forsook (their
			homes) and of those who gave them aid and (also) those who follow
			them in (all) good deeds well pleased is Allah with them as are
			they with him: for them hath He prepared gardens under which
			rivers flow to dwell therein for ever: that is the supreme
			felicity. <sup class='fn'>1348</sup> <sup class='fn'>1349</sup>

Certain of the desert Arabs round about you are hypocrites as
			well as (desert Arabs) among the Medina folk: they are obstinate
			in hypocrisy: thou knowest them not: We know them: twice shall We
			punish them and in addition shall they be sent to a grievous
			penalty. <sup class='fn'>1350</sup> <sup class='fn'>1351</sup>

Others (there are who) have acknowledged their wrong-doings: they
			have mixed an act that was good with another that was evil. 
			Perhaps Allah will turn unto them (in mercy): for Allah is
			Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful. <sup class='fn'>1352</sup>

Of their goods take alms that so thou mightest purify and
			sanctify them; and pray on their behalf.  Verily thy prayers are
			a source of security for them: and Allah is one who heareth and
			knoweth.
Know they not that Allah doth accept repentance from His votaries\n\t\t\tand receives their gifts of charity and that Allah is verily He\n\t\t\tthe Oft-Returning Most-Merciful?

And say: "Work (righteousness): soon will Allah observe your work
			and His apostle and the believers: soon will ye be brought back
			to the knower of what is hidden and what is open: then will He
			show you the truth of all that ye did." <sup class='fn'>1353</sup>
There are (yet) others held in suspense for the command of Allah\n\t\t\twhether He will punish them or turn in mercy to them: and Allah\n\t\t\tis All-Knowing Wise. <sup class='fn'>1354</sup>

And there are those who put up a mosque by way of mischief and
			infidelity to disunite the believers and in preparation for one
			who warred against Allah and His apostle aforetime.  They will
			indeed swear that their intention is nothing but good; but Allah
			doth declare that they are certainly liars. <sup class='fn'>1355</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1356</sup>

Never stand thou forth therein.  There is a mosque whose
			foundation was laid from the first day on piety; it is more
			worthy of thy standing forth (for prayer) therein.  In it are men
			who love to be purified; and Allah loveth those who make
			themselves pure. <sup class='fn'>1357</sup> <sup class='fn'>1358</sup>

Which then is best?  he that layeth his foundation on piety to
			Allah and His good pleasure?  or he that layeth his foundation on
			an undermined sand-cliff ready to crumble to pieces?  And it doth
			crumble to pieces with him into the fire of Hell.  And Allah
			guideth not people that do wrong. <sup class='fn'>1359</sup>

The foundation of those who so build is never free from suspicion\n\t\t\tand shakiness in their hearts until their hearts are cut to\n\t\t\tpieces.  And Allah is All-Knowing Wise. <sup class='fn'>1360</sup>

Allah hath purchased of the believers their persons and their
			good; for theirs (in return) is the garden (of Paradise): they
			fight in His cause and slay and are slain: a promise binding on
			Him in truth through the Law the Gospel and the Qur'an: and who
			is more faithful to his covenant than Allah?  Then rejoice in the
			bargain which ye have concluded: that is the achievement supreme.
			<sup class='fn'>1361</sup> <sup class='fn'>1362</sup>

Those that turn (to Allah) in repentance: that serve Him and
			praise Him; that wander in devotion to the Cause of Allah; that
			bow down and prostrate themselves in prayer; that enjoin good and
			forbid evil; and observe the limits set by Allah; (these do
			rejoice).  So proclaim the glad tidings to the Believers.
			<sup class='fn'>1363</sup>

It is not fitting for the prophet and those who believe that they
			should pray for forgiveness for pagans even though they be of kin
			after it is clear to them that they are companions of the Fire.
			<sup class='fn'>1364</sup>

And Abraham prayed for his father's forgiveness only because of a
			promise he had made to him.  But when it became clear to him that
			he was an enemy to Allah he dissociated himself from him: for
			Abraham was most tender-hearted forbearing. <sup class='fn'>1365</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1366</sup>

And Allah will not mislead a people after He hath Guided them in\n\t\t\torder that He may make clear to them what to fear (and avoid) for\n\t\t\tAllah hath knowledge of all things. <sup class='fn'>1367</sup>
Unto Allah belongeth the dominion of the heavens and the earth. \n\t\t\tHe giveth life and He taketh it.  Except for Him ye have no\n\t\t\tprotector nor helper.

Allah turned with favor to the prophet the Muhajirs and the Ansar
			who followed Him in a time of distress after that the hearts of a
			part of them had nearly swerved (from duty); but He turned to
			them (also): for He is unto them Most Kind Most Merciful.
			<sup class='fn'>1368</sup> <sup class='fn'>1369</sup>

(He turned in mercy also) to the three who were left Behind:
			(they felt guilty) to such a degree that the earth seemed
			constrained to them for all its speciousness and their (very)
			souls seemed straitened to them and they perceived that there is
			no fleeing from Allah and no refuge but to Himself.  Then He
			turned to them that they might repent: for Allah is Oft-Returning
			Most Merciful. <sup class='fn'>1370</sup>
O ye who believe! fear Allah and be with those who are true (in\n\t\t\tword and deed).

It was not fitting for the people of Medina and the bedouin Arabs
			of the neighborhood to refuse to follow Allah's Apostle nor to
			prefer their own lives to his: because nothing could they suffer
			or do but was reckoned to their credit as a deed of righteousness
			whether they suffered thirst or fatigue or hunger in the cause of
			Allah or trod paths to raise the ire of the unbelievers or
			received any injury whatever from an enemy: for Allah suffereth
			not the reward to be lost of those who do good; <sup class='fn'>1371</sup>

Nor could they spend anything (for the cause) small or great nor
			cut across a valley but the deed is inscribed to their credit;
			that Allah might requite their deed with the best (possible
			reward). <sup class='fn'>1372</sup>

Nor should the believers all go forth together: if a contingent
			from every expedition remained behind they could devote
			themselves to studies in religion and admonish the people when
			they return to them that thus they (may learn) to guard
			themselves (against evil). <sup class='fn'>1373</sup>
O ye who believe! fight the unbelievers who gird you about and\n\t\t\tlet them find firmness in you; and know that Allah is with those\n\t\t\twho fear him. <sup class='fn'>1374</sup>

Whenever there cometh down a Surah some of them say: "which of\n\t\t\tyou has had his faith increased by it?\tYea those who believe\n\t\t\ttheir faith is increased and they do rejoice. <sup class='fn'>1375</sup>
But those in whose hearts is a disease it will add doubt to their\n\t\t\tdoubt and they will die in a state of unbelief. <sup class='fn'>1376</sup>
See they not that they are tried every year once or twice?  Yet\n\t\t\tthey turn not in repentance and they take no heed. <sup class='fn'>1377</sup>

Whenever there cometh down a Surah they look at each other
			(saying) "doth anyone see you?"  Then they turn aside: Allah hath
			turned their hearts (from the light); for they are a people that
			understand not. <sup class='fn'>1378</sup>

Now hath come unto you an apostle from amongst yourselves: it\n\t\t\tgrieves him that ye should perish: ardently anxious is he over\n\t\t\tyou: to the believers is he most kind and merciful. <sup class='fn'>1379</sup>
But if they turn away Say : "Allah sufficeth me: There is not god\n\t\t\tbut He: On Him is my trust - He the Lord of the Throne (Of Glory)\n\t\t\tSupreme! <sup class='fn'>1380</sup>
Alif Lam Ra. These are the Ayats of the Book of Wisdom.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1381</sup> <sup class='fn'>1382</sup>

It is a matter of wonderment to men that We have sent Our
			inspiration to a man from among themselves? That he should warn
			mankind (of their danger) and give the good news to the Believers
			that they have before their Lord the lofty rank of Truth (but)
			say the Unbelievers: "This is indeed an evident sorcerer!"
			<sup class='fn'>1383</sup> <sup class='fn'>1384</sup>

Verily your Lord is Allah Who created the heavens and the earth
			in six Days and is firmly established on the Throne (of
			authority) regulating and governing all things.  No intercessor
			(can plead with Him) except after His leave (hath been obtained).
			 This is Allah your Lord; Him therefore serve ye: will ye not
			celebrate His praises? <sup class='fn'>1385</sup> <sup class='fn'>1386</sup> <sup class='fn'>1387</sup>

To Him will be your return of all of you.  The promise of Allah
			is true and sure.  It is He Who beginneth the process of Creation
			and repeateth it that He may reward with justice those who
			believe and work righteousness but those who reject Him will have
			nothing but draughts of boiling fluids and a Penalty grievous:
			because they did reject Him. <sup class='fn'>1388</sup> <sup class='fn'>1389</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1390</sup>

It is He Who made the sun to be a shining glory and the moon to
			be a light (of beauty) and measured out stages for her: that ye
			might know the number of years and the count (of time).  Nowise
			did Allah create this but in truth and righteousness.  (Thus)
			doth He explain his Signs in detail for those who understand.
			<sup class='fn'>1391</sup> <sup class='fn'>1392</sup> <sup class='fn'>1393</sup>
Verily in the alternation of the Night and the Day and in all\n\t\t\tthat Allah hath created in the heavens and the earth are Signs\n\t\t\tfor those who fear Him. <sup class='fn'>1394</sup>
Those who rest not their hope on their meeting with Us but are\n\t\t\tpleased and satisfied with the life of the present and those who\n\t\t\theed not Our Signs <sup class='fn'>1395</sup>
Their abode is the Fire because of the (evil) they earned.
Those who believe and work righteousness their Lord will guide\n\t\t\tthem because of their faith: beneath them will flow rivers in\n\t\t\tGardens of Bliss. <sup class='fn'>1396</sup>

(This will be) their cry therein: "Glory to Thee O Allah!" and
			"Peace" will be their greeting therein! And the close of their
			cry will be: "Praise be to Allah the Cherisher and Sustainer of
			the Worlds!" <sup class='fn'>1397</sup>

If Allah were to hasten for men the ill (they have earned) as
			they would fain hasten on the good then would their respite be
			settled at once. But We leave those who rest not their hope of
			their meeting with Us in their trespasses wandering in
			distraction to and fro. <sup class='fn'>1398</sup>

When trouble toucheth a man he crieth unto Us (in all postures)
			lying down on his side or sitting or standing.	But when We have
			solved his trouble he passeth on his way as if he had never cried
			to Us for a trouble that touched him! Thus do the deeds of
			transgressors seem fair in their eyes! <sup class='fn'>1399</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1400</sup>
Generations before you We destroyed when they did wrong: their\n\t\t\tApostles came to them with Clear Signs but they would not\n\t\t\tbelieve! Thus do We requite those who sin!
Then We made you heirs in the land after them to see how ye would\n\t\t\tbehave! <sup class='fn'>1401</sup>

But when Our Clear Signs are rehearsed unto them those who rest
			not their hope on their meeting with Us say: "Bring us a Reading
			other than this or change this." Say: "It is not for me of my own
			accord to change it: I follow naught but what is revealed unto
			me: if I were to disobey my Lord I should myself fear the Penalty
			of a Great Day (to come)." <sup class='fn'>1402</sup>

Say: "If Allah had so willed I should not have rehearsed it to
			you nor would He have made it known to you.  A whole lifetime
			before this have I tarried amongst you: will ye not then
			understand?" <sup class='fn'>1403</sup> <sup class='fn'>1404</sup>
Who doth more wrong than such as forge a lie against Allah or\n\t\t\tdeny His Signs? But never will prosper those who sin.

They serve besides Allah things that hurt them not nor profit
			them and they say: "These are our intercessors with Allah." Say:
			"Do ye indeed inform Allah of something He knows not in the
			heavens or on earth?  Glory to Him! and far is He above the
			partners they ascribe (to Him)!" <sup class='fn'>1405</sup>

Mankind was but one nation but differed (later).  Had it not been\n\t\t\tfor a word that went forth before from thy Lord their differences\n\t\t\twould have been settled between them. <sup class='fn'>1406</sup> <sup class='fn'>1407</sup>
They say: "Why is not a Sign sent down to him from his Lord?"\n\t\t\tSay: "The Unseen is only for Allah (to know).  Then wait ye: I\n\t\t\ttoo will wait with you." <sup class='fn'>1408</sup>

When We make mankind taste of some mercy after adversity hath
			touched them Behold! they take to plotting against our Signs!
			Say: "Swifter to plan is Allah!"  Verily Our messengers record
			all the plots that ye make! <sup class='fn'>1409</sup>

He it is Who enableth you to traverse through land and sea; so
			that ye even board ships they sail with them with a favorable
			wind and they rejoice thereat; then comes a stormy wind and the
			waves come to them from all sides and they think they are being
			overwhelmed: they cry unto Allah sincerely offering (their) duty
			unto Him saying "If Thou dost deliver us from this we shall truly
			show our gratitude!" <sup class='fn'>1410</sup>

But when He delivereth them Behold! they transgress insolently
			through the earth in defiance of right! O mankind! your insolence
			is against your own souls an enjoyment of the life of the
			Present: in the end to Us is your return and We shall show you
			the truth of all that ye did. <sup class='fn'>1411</sup>

The likeness of the life of the present is as the rain which We
			send down from the skies: by its mingling arises the produce of
			the earth  which provides food for men and animals: (it grows)
			till the earth is clad with its golden ornaments and is decked
			out (in beauty): the people to whom it belongs think they have
			all powers of disposal over it: there reaches it Our command by
			night or by day and We make it like a harvest clean-mown as if it
			had not flourished only the day before! Thus do We explain the
			Signs in detail for those who reflect. <sup class='fn'>1412</sup>
But Allah doth call to the Home of Peace: He doth guide whom He\n\t\t\tpleaseth to a way that is straight. <sup class='fn'>1413</sup>

To those who do right is a goodly (reward) yea more (than in
			measure)! No darkness nor shame shall cover their faces! They are
			Companions of the Garden; they will abide therein (for aye)!
			<sup class='fn'>1414</sup> <sup class='fn'>1415</sup>

But those who have earned evil will have a reward of like evil:
			ignominy will cover their (faces): no defender will they have
			from (the wrath of) Allah: their faces will be covered as it were
			with pieces from the depth of the darkness of Night: they are
			Companions of the Fire: they will abide therein (for aye)!
			<sup class='fn'>1416</sup> <sup class='fn'>1417</sup>

One Day shall We gather them all together.  Then shall We say to
			those who joined gods (with Us): "To your place! ye and those ye
			joined as `partners.'"	We shall separate them and their
			"partners" shall say: "It was not us that ye worshipped!"
			<sup class='fn'>1418</sup>
"Enough is Allah for a witness between us and you: we certainly\n\t\t\tknew nothing of your worship of us! <sup class='fn'>1419</sup>

There will every soul prove (the fruits of) the deeds it sent
			before: they will be brought back to Allah their rightful Lord
			and their invented falsehoods will leave them in the lurch.
			<sup class='fn'>1420</sup> <sup class='fn'>1421</sup>

Say: "Who is it that sustains you (in life) from the sky and from
			the earth? Or who is it that has power over hearing and sight?
			And who is it that brings out the living from the dead and the
			dead from the living? And who is it that rules and regulates all
			affairs?" They will soon say "Allah." Say "Will ye not then show
			piety (to Him)?" <sup class='fn'>1422</sup> <sup class='fn'>1423</sup> <sup class='fn'>1424</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1425</sup>
Such is Allah your real Cherisher and Sustainer: apart from Truth\n\t\t\twhat (remains) but error? How then are ye turned away?\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1426</sup>
Thus is the Word of thy Lord proved true against those who rebel:\n\t\t\tverily they will not believe. <sup class='fn'>1427</sup>

Say: "Of your `partners' can any originate creation and repeat\n\t\t\tit?" Say: "It is Allah Who originates Creation and repeats it:\n\t\t\tthen how are ye deluded away (from the truth)?" <sup class='fn'>1428</sup>

Say: "Of your `partners' is there any that can give any guidance
			towards Truth?" Say: "It is Allah Who gives guidance towards
			Truth.	Is then He Who gives guidance to Truth more worthy to be
			followed or he who finds not guidance (himself) unless he is
			guided? What then is the matter with you? How judge ye?"
But most of them follow nothing but fancy: truly fancy can be of\n\t\t\tno avail against Truth.  Verily Allah is well aware of all that\n\t\t\tthey do.

This Qur'an is not such as can be produced by other than Allah;
			on the contrary it is a confirmation of (revelations) that went
			before it and a fuller explanation of the Book wherein there is
			no doubt from the Lord of the Worlds. <sup class='fn'>1429</sup>
Or do they say "He forged it"? Say: "Bring then a Surah like unto\n\t\t\tit and call (to your aid) anyone you can besides Allah if it be\n\t\t\tye speak the truth!" <sup class='fn'>1430</sup>

Nay they charge with falsehood that whose knowledge they cannot
			compass even before the elucidation thereof hath reached them:
			thus did those before them make charges of falsehood: but see
			what was the end of those who did wrong! <sup class='fn'>1431</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1432</sup>
Of them there are some who believe therein and some who do not:\n\t\t\tand thy Lord knoweth best those who are out for mischief.
If they charge thee with falsehood say: "My work to me and yours\n\t\t\tto you! Ye are free from responsibility for what I do and I for\n\t\t\twhat ye do!" <sup class='fn'>1433</sup>
Among them are some who (pretend to) listen to thee: but canst\n\t\t\tthou make the deaf to hear even though they are without\n\t\t\tunderstanding? <sup class='fn'>1434</sup>
And among them are some who look at thee: but canst thou guide\n\t\t\tthe blind even though they will not see?
Verily Allah will not deal unjustly with man in aught: it is man\n\t\t\tthat wrongs his own soul. <sup class='fn'>1435</sup>

One day He will gather them together: (it will be) as if they had
			tarried but an hour of a day: they will recognize each other:
			assuredly those will be lost who denied the meeting with Allah
			and refused to receive true guidance. <sup class='fn'>1436</sup> <sup class='fn'>1437</sup>

Whether We show thee (realized in thy lifetime) some part of what
			We promise them or We take thy soul (to Our Mercy) (before that)
			in any case to Us is their return: ultimately Allah is witness to
			all that they do. <sup class='fn'>1438</sup>

To every people (was sent) an Apostle: when their Apostle comes\n\t\t\t(before them) the matter will be judged between them with justice\n\t\t\tand they will not be wronged. <sup class='fn'>1439</sup>
They say: "When will this promise come to pass if ye speak the\n\t\t\ttruth?"

Say: "I have no power over any harm or profit to myself except as
			Allah willeth.	To every People is a term appointed: when their
			term is reached not an hour can they cause delay nor (an hour)
			can they advance (it in anticipation). <sup class='fn'>1440</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1441</sup>
Say: "Do ye see if his punishment should come to you by night or\n\t\t\tby day what portion of it would the Sinners wish to hasten?\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1442</sup>
"Would ye then believe in it at last when it actually cometh to\n\t\t\tpass? (It will then be said): `Ah! now? And ye wanted (aforetime)\n\t\t\tto hasten it on!"
"At length will be said to the wrongdoers: "Taste ye the enduring\n\t\t\tpunishment! Ye get but the recompense of what ye earned!' "\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1443</sup>
They seek to be informed by thee: "Is that true?" Say: "Aye! by\n\t\t\tmy Lord! It is the very truth! and ye cannot frustrate it!"

Every soul that hath sinned if it possessed all that is on earth
			would fain give it in ransom: they would declare (their)
			repentance when they see the Penalty: but the judgment between
			them will be with justice and no wrong will be done unto them.
			<sup class='fn'>1444</sup> <sup class='fn'>1445</sup>
Is it not (the case) that to Allah belongeth whatever is in the\n\t\t\theavens and on earth? Is it not (the case ) that Allah's promise\n\t\t\tis assuredly true? Yet most of them understand not.
Is it He Who giveth life and who taketh it and to Him shall ye\n\t\t\tall be brought back.
O mankind! there hath come to you a direction from your Lord and\n\t\t\ta healing for the (diseases) in your hearts and for those who\n\t\t\tbelieve a Guidance and a Mercy. <sup class='fn'>1446</sup>
Say: "In the Bounty of Allah and in His Mercy in that let them\n\t\t\trejoice": that is better than the (wealth) they hoard.

Say: "See ye what things Allah hath sent down to you for
			sustenance? Yet ye hold forbidden some things thereof and (some
			things) lawful." Say: "Hath Allah indeed permitted you or do ye
			invent (things) to attribute to Allah?" <sup class='fn'>1447</sup>

And what think those who invent lies against Allah of the Day of\n\t\t\tJudgment? Verily Allah is full of Bounty to mankind but most of\n\t\t\tthem are ungrateful. <sup class='fn'>1448</sup> <sup class='fn'>1449</sup>

In whatever business thou mayest be and whatever portion thou
			mayest be reciting from the Qur'an and whatever deed ye (mankind)
			may be doing We are Witnesses thereof when ye are deeply
			engrossed therein. Nor is hidden from thy Lord (so much as) the
			weight of an atom on the earth or in heaven.  And not the least
			and not the greatest of these things but are recorded in a clear
			Record. <sup class='fn'>1450</sup>
Behold! verily on the friends of Allah there is no fear nor shall\n\t\t\tthey grieve; <sup class='fn'>1451</sup>
Those who believe and (constantly) guard against evil
For them are Glad Tidings in the life of the Present and in the\n\t\t\tHereafter: no change can there be in the Words of Allah.  This is\n\t\t\tindeed the supreme Felicity.
Let not their speech grieve thee: for all power and honor belong\n\t\t\tto Allah: it is He Who heareth and knoweth (all things).\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1452</sup>

Behold! verily to Allah belong all creatures in the heavens and
			on earth.  What do they follow who worship as His "partners"
			other than Allah? They follow nothing but fancy and they do
			nothing but lie. <sup class='fn'>1453</sup>

He it is that hath made you the night that ye may rest therein\n\t\t\tand the Day to make things visible (to you).  Verily in this are\n\t\t\tSigns for those who listen (to His Message). <sup class='fn'>1454</sup>

They say "Allah hath begotten a son!" Glory be to Him! He is\n\t\t\tself-sufficient! His are all things in the heavens and on earth!\n\t\t\tNo warrant have ye for this! Say ye about Allah what ye know not?
Say: "Those who invent a lie against Allah will never prosper."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1455</sup>
A little enjoyment in this world! and then to Us will be their\n\t\t\treturn.  Then shall We make them taste the severest Penalty for\n\t\t\ttheir blasphemies.

Relate to them the story of Noah.  Behold! he said to his People:
			"O my People! if it be hard on your (mind) that I should stay
			(with you) and commemorate the Signs of Allah yet I put my trust
			in Allah.  Get ye then an agreement about your plan and among
			your Partners so your plan be not to you dark and dubious.  Then
			pass your sentence on me and give me no respite. <sup class='fn'>1456</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1457</sup>

"But if ye turn back (consider): no reward have I asked of you:\n\t\t\tmy reward is only due from Allah and I have been commanded to be\n\t\t\tof those who submit to Allah's Will (in Islam)." <sup class='fn'>1458</sup>

They rejected him but We delivered him and those with him in the
			Ark and We made them inherit (the earth) while We overwhelmed in
			the Flood those who rejected Our Signs.  Then see what was the
			end of those who were warned (but heeded not)! <sup class='fn'>1459</sup>

Then after him We sent (many) apostles to their Peoples: they
			brought them Clear Signs but they would not believe what they had
			already rejected beforehand.  Thus do We seal the hearts of the
			transgressors. <sup class='fn'>1460</sup>
Then after them sent We Moses and Aaron to Pharaoh and his chiefs\n\t\t\twith Our Signs.  But they were arrogant: they were a people in\n\t\t\tsin. <sup class='fn'>1461</sup>
When the Truth did come to them from Us they said: "This is\n\t\t\tindeed evident sorcery!"
Said Moses: "Say ye (this) about the Truth when it hath\n\t\t\t(actually) reached you? In sorcery (like) this? But sorcerers\n\t\t\twill not prosper." <sup class='fn'>1462</sup>

They said: "Hast thou come to us to turn us a way from the ways
			We found our fathers following in order that thou and thy brother
			may have greatness in the land? But not we shall believe in you!"
			<sup class='fn'>1463</sup>
Said Pharaoh: "Bring me every sorcerer well-versed."
When the sorcerers came Moses said to them: "Throw ye what ye\n\t\t\t(wish) to throw!"

When they had their throw Moses said: "What ye have brought is\n\t\t\tsorcery: Allah will surely make it of no effect: for Allah\n\t\t\tprospereth not the work of those who make mischief. <sup class='fn'>1464</sup>
"And Allah by His Words doth prove and establish his truth\n\t\t\thowever much the Sinners may hate it!" <sup class='fn'>1465</sup>

But none believed in Moses except some children of his People
			because of the fear of Pharaoh and his chiefs lest they should
			persecute them; and certainly Pharaoh was mighty on the earth and
			one who transgressed all bounds. <sup class='fn'>1466</sup>
Moses said: "O my People! if ye do (really) believe in Allah then\n\t\t\tin Him put your trust if ye submit (your will to His)."
They said: "In Allah do we put our trust.  Our Lord! make us not\n\t\t\ta trial for those who practice oppression; <sup class='fn'>1467</sup>
"And deliver us by Thy Mercy from those who reject (Thee)."

We inspired Moses and his brother with this message: "Provide
			dwellings for your People in Egypt make your dwellings into
			places of worship and establish regular prayers: and give Glad
			Tidings to those who believe!" <sup class='fn'>1468</sup>

Moses prayed: "Our Lord! Thou hast indeed bestowed on Pharaoh and
			his Chiefs splendor and wealth in the life of the Present and so
			our Lord they mislead (men) from Thy Path.  Deface our Lord the
			features of their wealth and send hardness to their hearts so
			they will not believe until they see the grievous Penalty."
			<sup class='fn'>1469</sup> <sup class='fn'>1470</sup>
Allah said: "Accepted is your prayer (O Moses and Aaron)! So\n\t\t\tstand ye straight and follow not the path of those who know not."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1471</sup>

We took the Children of Israel across the sea: Pharaoh and his
			hosts followed them in insolence and spite.  At length when
			overwhelmed with the flood he said: "I believe that there is no
			god except Him Whom the Children of Israel believe in: I am of
			those who submit (to Allah in Islam)." <sup class='fn'>1472</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1473</sup>
(It was said to him): "Ah now! but a little while before wast\n\t\t\tthou in rebellion! and thou didst mischief (and violence)!
"This day shall We save thee in thy body that thou mayest be a\n\t\t\tSign to those who come after thee! But verily many among mankind\n\t\t\tare heedless of Our Signs!"

We settled the Children of Israel in a beautiful dwelling-place
			and provided for them sustenance of the best: it was after
			knowledge had been granted to them that they fell into schisms. 
			Verily Allah will judge between them as to the schisms amongst
			them on the Day of Judgment. <sup class='fn'>1474</sup>

If thou wert in doubt as to what We have revealed unto thee then
			ask those who have been reading the Book from before thee: the
			Truth hath indeed come to thee from thy Lord: so be in nowise of
			those in doubt. <sup class='fn'>1475</sup> <sup class='fn'>1476</sup>
Nor be of those who reject the Signs of Allah or thou shalt be of\n\t\t\tthose who perish.
Those against whom the Word of thy Lord hath been verified would\n\t\t\tnot believe <sup class='fn'>1477</sup>
Even if every Sign was brought unto them until they see (for\n\t\t\tthemselves) the Penalty Grievous.

Why was there not a single township (among those We warned) which
			believed so its Faith should have profited it except the people
			of Jonah? When they believed We removed from them the Penalty of
			Ignominy in the life of the Present and permitted them to enjoy
			(their life) for a while. <sup class='fn'>1478</sup> <sup class='fn'>1479</sup>
If it had been the Lord's Will they would all have believed all\n\t\t\twho are on earth! Wilt thou then compel mankind against their\n\t\t\twill to believe! <sup class='fn'>1480</sup>
No soul can believe except by the Will of Allah and He will place\n\t\t\tDoubt (or obscurity) on those who will not understand.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1481</sup> <sup class='fn'>1482</sup>
Say: "Behold all that is in the heavens and on earth"; but\n\t\t\tneither Signs nor Warners profit those who believe not.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1483</sup>
Do they then expect (anything) but (what happened in) the days of\n\t\t\tthe men who passed away before them? Say: "Wait ye then: for I\n\t\t\ttoo will wait with you." <sup class='fn'>1484</sup>
In the end We deliver Our apostles and those who believe: thus is\n\t\t\tit fitting on Our part that We should deliver those who believe!

Say: "O ye men! if ye are in doubt as to my religion (behold!) I
			worship not what ye worship other than Allah  But I worship Allah
			Who will take your souls (at death): I am commanded to be (in the
			ranks) of the Believers. <sup class='fn'>1485</sup> <sup class='fn'>1486</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1487</sup> <sup class='fn'>1488</sup>
"And further (thus): `Set thy face towards Religion with true\n\t\t\tpiety and never in anywise be of the Unbelievers;
"Nor call on any other than Allah such will neither profit thee\n\t\t\tnor hurt thee: if thou dost Behold! thou shalt certainly be of\n\t\t\tthose who do wrong."

If Allah do touch thee with hurt there is none can remove it but
			He: if He do design some benefit for thee there is none can keep
			back His favor: He causeth it to reach whomsoever of His servants
			He pleaseth. And He is the Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful.
			<sup class='fn'>1489</sup>

Say: "O ye men! now Truth hath reached you from your Lord! Those
			who receive guidance do so for the good of their own souls; those
			who stray do so to their own loss: and I am not (set) over you to
			arrange your affairs." <sup class='fn'>1490</sup>
Follow thou the inspiration sent unto thee and be patient and\n\t\t\tconstant till Allah doth decide: for He is the Best to decide.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1491</sup>

Alif Lam Ra. (This is) a Book with verses basic or fundamental
			(of established meaning) further explained in detail from One Who
			is Wise and Well-Acquainted (with all things): <sup class='fn'>1492</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1493</sup>
(It teacheth) that ye should worship none but Allah.  (Say:)\n\t\t\t"Verily I am (sent) unto you from Him to warn and to bring glad\n\t\t\ttidings: <sup class='fn'>1494</sup>

("And to preach thus) `Seek ye the forgiveness of your Lord and
			turn to Him in repentance; that He may grant you enjoyment good
			(and true) for a term appointed and bestow His abounding grace on
			all who abound in merit! But if ye turn away then I fear for you
			the Penalty of a Great Day: <sup class='fn'>1495</sup>
"`To Allah is your return and He hath power over all things.'"

Behold! they fold up their hearts that they may lie hid from Him!
			Ah! even when they cover themselves with their garments He
			knoweth what they conceal and what they reveal: for He knoweth
			well the (inmost secrets) of the hearts. <sup class='fn'>1496</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1497</sup>

There is no moving creature on earth but its sustenance dependeth
			on Allah: He knoweth the time and place of its temporary deposit:
			all is in a clear Record. <sup class='fn'>1498</sup> <sup class='fn'>1499</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1500</sup>

He it is Who created the heavens and the earth in six Days and
			His Throne was over the Waters that He might try you which of you
			is best in conduct.  But if thou wert to say to them "Ye shall
			indeed be raised up after death" the Unbelievers would be sure to
			say "This is nothing but obvious sorcery!" <sup class='fn'>1501</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1502</sup> <sup class='fn'>1503</sup> <sup class='fn'>1504</sup>

If We delay the Penalty for them for a definite term they are
			sure to say "What keeps it back?" Ah! on the day it (actually)
			reaches them nothing will turn it away from them and they will be
			completely encircled by that which they used to mock at!
			<sup class='fn'>1505</sup>
If We give man a taste of mercy from Ourselves and then withdraw\n\t\t\tit from him behold! he is in despair and (falls into) blasphemy.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1506</sup>

But if We give him a taste of (Our) favors after adversity hath\n\t\t\ttouched him He is sure to say "All evil has departed from me;"\n\t\t\tBehold! he falls into exultation and pride. <sup class='fn'>1507</sup>
Not so do those who show patience and constancy and work\n\t\t\trighteousness; for them is forgiveness (of sins) and a great\n\t\t\treward. <sup class='fn'>1508</sup>

Perchance thou mayest (feel the inclination) to give up a part of
			what is revealed unto thee and thy heart feeleth straitened lest
			they say "Why is not a treasure sent down unto him or why does
			not an angel come down with him? But thou art there only to warn!
			It is Allah that arrangeth all affairs! <sup class='fn'>1509</sup>

Or they may say "He forged it." Say "Bring ye then ten Surahs\n\t\t\tforged like unto it and call (to your aid) whomsoever ye can\n\t\t\tother than Allah! if ye speak the truth! <sup class='fn'>1510</sup>

"If then they (your false gods) answer not your (call) know ye
			that this Revelation is sent down (replete) with the knowledge of
			Allah and that there is no god but He! Will ye even then submit
			(to Islam)?"
Those who desire the life of the Present and its glitter to them\n\t\t\tWe shall pay (the price of) their deeds therein without\n\t\t\tdiminution. <sup class='fn'>1511</sup>
They are those for whom there is nothing in the Hereafter but the\n\t\t\tFire: vain are the designs they frame therein and of no effect\n\t\t\tare the deeds that they do!

Can they be (like) those who accept a Clear (Sign) from their
			Lord and whom a witness from Himself doth teach as did the Book
			of Moses before it a guide and a mercy? They believe therein; but
			those of the Sects that reject it the Fire will be their promised
			meeting place. Be not then in doubt thereon: for it is the Truth
			from thy Lord: yet many among men do not believe! <sup class='fn'>1512</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1513</sup>

Who doth more wrong than those who invent a lie against Allah?
			They will be turned back to the presence of their Lord and the
			witnesses will say "These are the ones who lied against their
			Lord! Behold! the Curse of Allah is on those who do wrong!
"Those who would hinder (men) from the path of Allah and would\n\t\t\tseek in it something crooked: these were they who denied the\n\t\t\tHereafter! <sup class='fn'>1514</sup>

They will in nowise frustrate (His design) on earth nor have they\n\t\t\tprotectors besides Allah! Their Penalty will be doubled! They\n\t\t\tlost the power to hear and they did not see! <sup class='fn'>1515</sup>
They are the ones who have lost their own souls: and the\n\t\t\t(fancies) they invented have left them in the lurch!
Without a doubt these are the very ones who will lose most in the\n\t\t\tHereafter!
But those who believe and work righteousness and humble\n\t\t\tthemselves before their Lord they will be Companions of the\n\t\t\tGarden to dwell therein for aye! <sup class='fn'>1516</sup>
These two kinds (of men) may be compared to the blind and deaf\n\t\t\tand those who can see and hear well.  Are they equal when\n\t\t\tcompared? Will ye not then take heed?
We sent Noah to his people (with a mission): "I have come to you\n\t\t\twith a Clear Warning:
"That ye serve none but Allah: verily I do fear for you the\n\t\t\tPenalty of a Grievous Day." <sup class='fn'>1517</sup>

But the Chiefs of the Unbelievers among his people said: "We see
			(in) thee nothing but a man like ourselves: nor do we see that
			any follow thee but the meanest among us in judgment immature:
			nor do we see in you (all) any merit above us: in fact we think
			ye are liars! <sup class='fn'>1518</sup>

He said: "O my people! see ye if (it be that) I have a Clear Sign
			from my Lord and that He hath sent Mercy unto me from His own
			Presence but that the Mercy hath been obscured from your sight?
			Shall we compel you to accept it when ye are averse to it?
			<sup class='fn'>1519</sup>

"And O my People! I ask you for no wealth in return: my reward is
			from none but Allah: but I will not drive away (in contempt)
			those who believe: for verily they are to meet their Lord and ye
			I see are the ignorant ones! <sup class='fn'>1520</sup>
"And O my People! who would help me against Allah if I drove them\n\t\t\taway? Will ye not then take heed? <sup class='fn'>1521</sup>

"I tell you not that with me are the Treasures of Allah nor do I
			know what is hidden nor claim I to be an angel.  Nor yet do I say
			of those whom your eyes do despise that Allah will not grant them
			(all) that is good: Allah knoweth best what is in their souls: I
			should if I did indeed be a wrongdoer." <sup class='fn'>1522</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1523</sup> <sup class='fn'>1524</sup>

They said: "O Noah! thou hast disputed with us and (much) hast\n\t\t\tthou prolonged the dispute with us: now bring upon us what thou\n\t\t\tthreatenest us with if thou speakest the truth!" <sup class='fn'>1525</sup>
He said: "Truly Allah will bring it on you if He wills and then\n\t\t\tye will not be able to frustrate it! <sup class='fn'>1526</sup>

"Of no profit will be my counsel to you much as I desire to give
			you (good) counsel if it be that Allah willeth to leave you
			astray: He is your Lord! and to Him will ye return!"
			<sup class='fn'>1527</sup>
Or do they say "He has forged it?" Say: "If I had forged it on me\n\t\t\twere my sin! And I am free of the sins of which ye are guilty!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1528</sup>
It was revealed to Noah: "None of thy people will believe except\n\t\t\tthose who have believed already! So grieve no longer over their\n\t\t\t(evil) deeds. <sup class='fn'>1529</sup>

"But construct an Ark under Our eyes and Our inspiration and\n\t\t\taddress Me no (further) on behalf of those who are in sin: for\n\t\t\tthey are about to be overwhelmed (in the Flood)." <sup class='fn'>1530</sup>

Forthwith he starts constructing the Ark: every time that the
			Chiefs of his People passed by him they threw ridicule on him. 
			They threw ridicule on him.  He said: "If ye ridicule us now we
			(in our turn) can look down on you with ridicule likewise!
			<sup class='fn'>1531</sup> <sup class='fn'>1532</sup>
"But soon will ye know who it is on whom will descend a Penalty\n\t\t\tthat will cover them with shame will be unloosed a Penalty\n\t\t\tlasting."

At length behold! there came Our Command and the fountains of the
			earth gushed forth! We said: "Embark therein of each kind two
			male and female and your family except those against whom the
			Word has already gone forth and the Believers." But only a few
			believed with him. <sup class='fn'>1533</sup> <sup class='fn'>1534</sup> <sup class='fn'>1535</sup>
So he said: "Embark ye on the Ark in the name of Allah whether it\n\t\t\tmove or be at rest! For my Lord is be sure Oft-Forgiving Most\n\t\t\tMerciful!"

So the Ark floated with them on the waves (towering) like
			mountains and Noah called out to his son who had separated
			himself (from the rest): "O my son! embark with us and be not
			with the Unbelievers!" <sup class='fn'>1536</sup>

The son replied: "I will be take myself to some mountain: it will
			save me from the water." Noah said: "This day nothing can save
			from the Command of Allah any but those on whom He hath mercy!"
			and the waves came between them and the son was among those
			overwhelmed in the Flood. <sup class='fn'>1537</sup>

When the word went forth: "O earth! swallow up thy water and O
			sky! withhold (thy rain)!" and the water abated and the matter
			was ended. The Ark rested on Mount Judi and the word went forth:
			"Away with those who do wrong!" <sup class='fn'>1538</sup> <sup class='fn'>1539</sup>
And Noah called upon his Lord and said: "O my Lord! surely my son\n\t\t\tis of my family! and Thy promise is true and Thou art the Justest\n\t\t\tof Judges!"

He said: "O Noah! he is not of thy family: for his conduct is
			unrighteous.  So ask not of Me that of which thou hast no
			knowledge! I give thee counsel lest thou act like the ignorant!"
			<sup class='fn'>1540</sup>

Noah said: "O my Lord! I do seek refuge with Thee lest I ask Thee\n\t\t\tfor that of which I have no knowledge.\tAnd unless Thou forgive\n\t\t\tme and have Mercy on me I should indeed be lost!" <sup class='fn'>1541</sup>

The word came: "O Noah! come down (from the Ark) with Peace from
			Us and Blessings on thee and on some of the Peoples (who will
			spring) from those with thee: but (there will be other) Peoples
			to whom We shall grant their pleasures (for a time) but in the
			end will a grievous Penalty reach them from Us." <sup class='fn'>1542</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1543</sup>

Such are some of the stories of the Unseen which We have revealed
			unto thee: before this neither thou nor thy People knew them.  So
			persevere patiently: for the End is for those who are righteous.
			<sup class='fn'>1544</sup>

To the `Ad People (We sent) Hud one of their own brethren.  He\n\t\t\tsaid: "O my people! worship Allah! ye have no other god but Him. \n\t\t\t(Your other gods) ye do nothing but invent! <sup class='fn'>1545</sup>
"O my people! I ask of you no reward for this (Message).  My\n\t\t\treward is from none but Him Who created me: will ye not then\n\t\t\tunderstand?

"And O my people! ask forgiveness of your Lord and turn to Him
			(in repentance): He will send you the skies pouring abundant rain
			and add strength to your strength: so turn ye not back in sin!"
			<sup class='fn'>1546</sup> <sup class='fn'>1547</sup>
They said: "O Hud! no Clear (Sign) hast thou brought us and we\n\t\t\tare not the ones to desert our gods on thy word! Nor do we\n\t\t\tbelieve in thee! <sup class='fn'>1548</sup>

"We say nothing but that (perhaps) some of our gods may have
			seized thee with imbecility." He said: "I call Allah to witness
			and do ye bear witness that I am free from the sin of ascribing
			to Him <sup class='fn'>1549</sup>
"Other gods as partners! So scheme (your worst) against me all of\n\t\t\tyou and give me no respite. <sup class='fn'>1550</sup>

"I put my trust in Allah my Lord and your Lord! There is not a\n\t\t\tmoving creature but He hath grasp of its forelock.  Verily it is\n\t\t\tmy Lord that is on a Straight Path. <sup class='fn'>1551</sup> <sup class='fn'>1552</sup>

"If ye turn away I (at least) have conveyed the Message with
			which I was sent to you.  My Lord will make another People to
			succeed you and you will not harm Him in the least.  For my Lord
			hath care and watch over all things." <sup class='fn'>1553</sup>
So when Our decree issued We saved Hud and those who believed\n\t\t\twith him by (special) Grace from Ourselves: We saved them from a\n\t\t\tsevere Penalty. <sup class='fn'>1554</sup>

Such were the `Ad people: they rejected the Signs of their Lord\n\t\t\tand Cherisher; disobeyed His Apostles; and followed the command\n\t\t\tof every powerful obstinate transgressor. <sup class='fn'>1555</sup>

And they were pursued by a Curse in this Life and on the Day of
			Judgment.  Ah! behold! for the `Ad rejected their Lord and
			Cherisher! Ah! behold! removed (from sight) were `Ad the people
			of Hud!

To the Thamud People (We sent) Salih one of their own brethren. 
			He said: "O my people! worship Allah: ye have no other god but
			Him.  It is He Who hath produced you from the earth and settled
			you therein: then ask forgiveness of Him and turn to Him (in
			repentance): for my Lord in (always) near ready to answer."
			<sup class='fn'>1556</sup> <sup class='fn'>1557</sup>

They said: "O Salih! thou hast been of us! a center of our hopes
			hitherto! Dost thou (now) forbid us the worship of what our
			fathers worshipped? But we are really in suspicious (disquieting)
			doubt as to that to which thou invitest us." <sup class='fn'>1558</sup>

He said: "O my people! Do ye see? if I have a Clear (Sign) from
			my Lord and He hath sent Mercy unto me from Himself who then can
			help me against Allah if I were to disobey Him? What then would
			ye add to my (portion) but perdition? <sup class='fn'>1559</sup>

"And O my people! this she-camel of Allah is a symbol to you:\n\t\t\tleave her to feed on Allah's (free) earth and inflict no harm on\n\t\t\ther or a swift Penalty will seize you! <sup class='fn'>1560</sup>
But they did hamstring her.  So he said: "Enjoy yourselves in\n\t\t\tyour homes for three days: (then will be your ruin): there is a\n\t\t\tpromise not to be belied!" <sup class='fn'>1561</sup>

When Our Decree issued We saved Saleh and those who believed with
			him by (special) Grace from Ourselves and from the Ignominy of
			that Day.  For thy Lord He is the Strong One and Able to enforce
			His Will. <sup class='fn'>1562</sup>
The (mighty) Blast overtook the wrongdoers and they lay prostrate\n\t\t\tin their homes before the morning <sup class='fn'>1563</sup>

As if they had never dwelt and flourished there.  Ah! behold! for\n\t\t\tthe Thamud rejected their Lord and Cherisher! Ah! behold! removed\n\t\t\t(from sight) were the Thamud! <sup class='fn'>1564</sup>
There came Our Messengers to Abraham with glad tidings.  They\n\t\t\tsaid "Peace!" He answered "Peace!" and hastened to entertain them\n\t\t\twith a roasted calf. <sup class='fn'>1565</sup>

But when he saw their hands went not towards the (meal) he felt
			some mistrust of them and conceived a fear of them.  They said:
			"Fear not: we have been sent against the people of Lut."
			<sup class='fn'>1566</sup>
And his wife was standing (there) and she laughed: but We gave\n\t\t\ther glad tidings of Isaac and after him of Jacob. <sup class='fn'>1567</sup>
She said: "Alas for me! Shall I bear a child seeing I am an old\n\t\t\twoman and my husband here is an old man? That would indeed be a\n\t\t\twonderful thing!" <sup class='fn'>1568</sup>

They said: "Dost thou wonder at Allah's decree? The grace of
			Allah and His blessings on you O ye people of the house! for He
			is indeed worthy of all praise full of all glory!" <sup class='fn'>1569</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1570</sup>
When fear had passed from (the mind of) Abraham and the glad\n\t\t\ttidings had reached him he began to plead with Us for Lut's\n\t\t\tpeople. <sup class='fn'>1571</sup>
For Abraham was without doubt forbearing (of faults)\n\t\t\tcompassionate and given to look to Allah. <sup class='fn'>1572</sup>
O Abraham! seek not this. The decree of thy Lord hath gone forth:\n\t\t\tfor them there cometh a Penalty that cannot be turned back!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1573</sup>
When Our Messengers came to Lut he was grieved on their account\n\t\t\tand felt himself powerless (to protect) them.  He said: "This is\n\t\t\ta distressful day." <sup class='fn'>1574</sup>

And his people came rushing towards him and they had been long in
			the habit of practicing abominations.  He said: "O my people!
			here are my daughters: they are purer for you (if ye marry)! Now
			fear Allah and cover me not with shame about my guests! Is there
			not among you a single right-minded man?" <sup class='fn'>1575</sup>
They said: "Well dost thou know we have no need of thy daughters:\n\t\t\tindeed thou knowest quite well what we want!"
He said: "Would that I had power to suppress you or that I could\n\t\t\tbetake myself to some powerful support." <sup class='fn'>1576</sup>

(The Messengers) said "O Lut! we are Messengers from thy Lord! By
			no means shall they reach thee! Now travel with thy family while
			yet a part of the night remains and let not any of you look back:
			but thy wife (will remain behind): to her will happen what
			happens to the people.	Morning is their time appointed: is not
			the morning nigh?" <sup class='fn'>1577</sup>

When Our decree issued We turned (the cities) upside down and\n\t\t\trained down on them brimstones hard as baked clay spread layer on\n\t\t\tlayer <sup class='fn'>1578</sup> <sup class='fn'>1579</sup>
Marked as from thy Lord: nor are they ever far from those who do\n\t\t\twrong! <sup class='fn'>1580</sup> <sup class='fn'>1581</sup>

To the Madyan people (We sent) Shuaib one of their own brethren:
			he said: "O my people! worship Allah: ye have no other god but
			Him.  And give not short measure or weight: I see you in
			prosperity but I fear for you the Penalty of a Day that will
			compass (you) all round. <sup class='fn'>1582</sup> <sup class='fn'>1583</sup>

"And O my people! give just measure and weight nor withhold from\n\t\t\tthe people the things that are their due: commit not evil in the\n\t\t\tland with intent to do mischief. <sup class='fn'>1584</sup>
"That which is left you by Allah is best for you if ye (but)\n\t\t\tbelieved! But I am not set over you to keep watch!" <sup class='fn'>1585</sup>

They said: "Oh Shuaib! does thy (religion of) prayer command thee
			that we leave off the worship which our fathers practiced or that
			we leave off doing what we like with our property? Truly thou art
			the one that forbeareth with faults and is right-minded!"
			<sup class='fn'>1586</sup> <sup class='fn'>1587</sup>

He said: "O my people! see ye whether I have a Clear (Sign) from
			my Lord and He hath given me sustenance (pure and) good as from
			Himself? I wish not in opposition to you to do that which I
			forbid you to do. I only desire (your) betterment to the best of
			my power; and my success (in my task) can only come from Allah:
			in Him I trust and unto Him I look. <sup class='fn'>1588</sup>

"And O my people! let not my dissent (from you) cause you to sin
			lest ye suffer a fate similar to that of the people of Noah or of
			Hud or of Salih nor are the people of Lut far off from you!
			<sup class='fn'>1589</sup> <sup class='fn'>1590</sup>
"But ask forgiveness of you Lord and turn unto Him (in\n\t\t\trepentance): for my Lord is indeed Full of mercy and\n\t\t\tloving-kindness."

They said: "O Shuaib! much of what thou sayest we do not
			understand! In fact among us we see that thou hast no strength!
			Were it not for thy family we should certainly have stoned thee!
			For thou hast among us no great position!" <sup class='fn'>1591</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1592</sup>

He said: "O my people! is then my family of more consideration
			with you than Allah? For ye cast Him away behind your backs (with
			contempt). But verily my Lord encompasseth on all sides all that
			ye do! <sup class='fn'>1593</sup>

"And O my people! do whatever ye can: I will do (my part): soon
			will ye know who it is on whom descends the Penalty of ignominy
			and who is a liar! And watch ye! for I too am watching with you!"
			<sup class='fn'>1594</sup> <sup class='fn'>1595</sup>

When Our decree issued We saved Shuaib and those who believed
			with him by (special) Mercy from Ourselves: but the (mighty)
			Blast did seize the wrongdoers and they lay prostrate in their
			homes by the morning <sup class='fn'>1596</sup>
As if they had never dwelt and flourished there! Ah! behold! how\n\t\t\tthe Madyan were removed (from sight) as were removed the Thamud!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1597</sup>
And We sent Moses with Our Clear (Signs) and an authority\n\t\t\tmanifest <sup class='fn'>1598</sup>
Unto Pharaoh and his Chiefs: but they followed the command of\n\t\t\tPharaoh and the command of Pharaoh was no right (guide).\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1599</sup>

He will go before his people on the Day of Judgment and lead them\n\t\t\tinto the Fire (as cattle are led to water): but woeful indeed\n\t\t\twill be this leading (and) the place led to! <sup class='fn'>1600</sup>
And they are followed by a curse in this (life) and on the Day of\n\t\t\tJudgment: and woeful is the gift which shall be given (unto\n\t\t\tthem)!

These are some of the stories of communities which We relate unto\n\t\t\tthee: of them some are standing and some have been mown down (by\n\t\t\tthe sickle of time). <sup class='fn'>1601</sup> <sup class='fn'>1602</sup>

It was not We that wronged them: they wronged their own souls:
			the deities other than Allah whom they invoked profited them no
			whit when there issued the decree of thy Lord: nor did they add
			aught (to their lot) but perdition! <sup class='fn'>1603</sup>
Such is the chastisement of thy Lord when He chastises\n\t\t\tcommunities in the midst of their wrong: grievous indeed and\n\t\t\tsevere is His chastisement.
In that is a Sign for those who fear the Penalty of the\n\t\t\tHereafter: that is a Day for which mankind will be gathered\n\t\t\ttogether: that will be a Day of Testimony. <sup class='fn'>1604</sup>
Nor shall We delay it but for a term appointed.
The day it arrives no soul shall speak except by His leave: of\n\t\t\tthose (gathered) some will be wretched and some will be blessed.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1605</sup> <sup class='fn'>1606</sup>
Those who are wretched shall be in the Fire: there will be for\n\t\t\tthem therein (nothing but) the heaving of sighs and sobs:\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1607</sup>

They will dwell therein for all the time that the heavens and the\n\t\t\tearth endure except as thy Lord willeth: for thy Lord is the\n\t\t\t(sure) Accomplisher of what He planneth. <sup class='fn'>1608</sup>

And those who are blessed shall be in the Garden: they will dwell
			therein for all the time that the heavens and the earth endure
			except as thy Lord willeth: a gift without break. <sup class='fn'>1609</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1610</sup>

Be not then in doubt as to what these men worship.  They worship
			nothing but what their fathers worshipped before (them): but
			verily We shall pay them back (in full) their portion without
			(the least) abatement. <sup class='fn'>1611</sup> <sup class='fn'>1612</sup>

We certainly gave the Book to Moses but differences arose
			therein: had it not been that a Word had gone forth before from
			thy Lord the matter would have been decided between them: but
			they are in suspicious doubt concerning it. <sup class='fn'>1613</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1614</sup>
And of a surety to all will your Lord pay back (in full the\n\t\t\trecompense) of their deeds: for He knoweth well all that they do.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1615</sup>
Therefore stand firm (in the straight path) as thou art commanded\n\t\t\t thou and those who with thee turn (unto Allah); and transgress\n\t\t\tnot (from the Path): for He seeth well all that ye do.
And incline not to those who do wrong or the Fire will seize you;\n\t\t\tand ye have no protectors other than Allah nor shall ye be\n\t\t\thelped.

And establish regular prayers at the two ends of the day and at
			the approaches of the night: for those things that are good
			remove those that are evil: be that the word of remembrance to
			those who remember (their Lord): <sup class='fn'>1616</sup> <sup class='fn'>1617</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1618</sup>
And be steadfast in patience; for verily Allah will not suffer\n\t\t\tthe reward of the righteous to perish.

Why were there not among the generations before you persons
			possessed of balanced good sense prohibiting (men) from mischief
			in the earth except a few among them whom We saved (from harm)?
			But the wrongdoers pursued the enjoyment of the good things of
			life which were given them and persisted in sin. <sup class='fn'>1619</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1620</sup>
Nor would thy Lord be the One to destroy communities for a single\n\t\t\twrongdoing if its members were likely to mend. <sup class='fn'>1621</sup>
If thy Lord had so willed He could have made mankind one People:\n\t\t\tbut they will not cease to dispute <sup class='fn'>1622</sup>

Except those on whom He hath bestowed His Mercy: and for this did\n\t\t\tHe create them: and the Word of thy Lord shall be fulfilled: "I\n\t\t\twill fill Hell with jinns and men all together." <sup class='fn'>1623</sup>

All that We relate to thee of the stories of the apostles with it
			We make firm thy heart: in them there cometh to thee the Truth as
			well as an exhortation and a message of remembrance to those who
			believe. <sup class='fn'>1624</sup>
Say to those who do not believe: "Do whatever ye can: we shall do\n\t\t\tour part;
"And wait ye! we too shall wait." <sup class='fn'>1625</sup>

To Allah do belong the unseen (secrets) of the heavens and the
			earth and to Him goeth back every affair (for decision): then
			worship Him and put thy trust in Him: and thy Lord is not
			unmindful of aught that ye do. <sup class='fn'>1626</sup>
Alif Lam Ra. These are the Symbols (or Verses) of the Perspicuous\n\t\t\tBook. <sup class='fn'>1627</sup> <sup class='fn'>1628</sup> <sup class='fn'>1629</sup>
We have sent it down as an Arabic Qur'an in order that ye may\n\t\t\tlearn wisdom. <sup class='fn'>1630</sup>

We do relate unto thee the most beautiful of stories in that We\n\t\t\treveal to thee this (portion of the) Qur'an: before this thou too\n\t\t\twast among those who knew it not. <sup class='fn'>1631</sup>

Behold Joseph said to his father: "O my father! I did see eleven\n\t\t\tstars and the sun and the moon: I saw them prostrate themselves\n\t\t\tto me!" <sup class='fn'>1632</sup> <sup class='fn'>1633</sup>

Said (the father): "My (dear) little son! relate not thy vision\n\t\t\tto thy brothers lest they concoct a plot against thee: for Satan\n\t\t\tis to man an avowed enemy! <sup class='fn'>1634</sup> <sup class='fn'>1635</sup>

"Thus will thy Lord choose thee and teach thee the interpretation
			of stories (and events) and perfect His favor to thee and to the
			posterity of Jacob even as He perfected it to thy fathers Abraham
			and Isaac aforetime! For Allah is full of knowledge and wisdom."
			<sup class='fn'>1636</sup> <sup class='fn'>1637</sup>
Verily in Joseph and his brethren are Signs (or Symbols) for\n\t\t\tSeekers (after Truth). <sup class='fn'>1638</sup>

They said: "Truly Joseph and his brother are loved more by our\n\t\t\tfather than we: but we are a goodly body! Really our father is\n\t\t\tobviously wandering (in his mind)! <sup class='fn'>1639</sup>

"Slay ye Joseph or cast him out to some (unknown) land that so
			the favor of your father may be given to you alone: (There will
			be time enough) for you to be righteous after that!"
			<sup class='fn'>1640</sup>
Said one of them: "Slay not Joseph but if ye must do something\n\t\t\tthrow him down to the bottom of the well: he will be picked up by\n\t\t\tsome caravan of travellers." <sup class='fn'>1641</sup>
They said: "O our father! why dost thou not trust us with Joseph \n\t\t\tseeing we are indeed his sincere well-wishers? <sup class='fn'>1642</sup>
"Send him with us tomorrow to enjoy himself and play and we shall\n\t\t\ttake every care of him." <sup class='fn'>1643</sup>
(Jacob) said: "Really it saddens me that ye should take him away:\n\t\t\tI fear lest the wolf should devour him while ye attend not to\n\t\t\thim." <sup class='fn'>1644</sup>
They said: "If the wolf were to devour him while we are (so\n\t\t\tlarge) a party then should we indeed (first) have perished\n\t\t\tourselves!" <sup class='fn'>1645</sup>

So they did take him away and they all agreed to throw him down
			to the bottom of the well: and We put into his heart (this
			Message): "Of a surety thou shalt (one day) tell them the truth
			of this their affair while they know (thee) not." <sup class='fn'>1646</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1647</sup>
Then they came to their father in the early part of the night\n\t\t\tweeping. <sup class='fn'>1648</sup>

They said: "Oh our father! we went racing with one another and
			left Joseph with our things: and the wolf devoured him.  But thou
			wilt never believe us even though we tell the truth."
			<sup class='fn'>1649</sup> <sup class='fn'>1650</sup>

They stained his shirt with false blood.  He said: "Nay but your
			minds have made up a tale (that may pass) with you.  (For me)
			patience is most fitting: against that which ye assert it is
			Allah (alone) whose help can be sought"... <sup class='fn'>1651</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1652</sup>

Then there came a caravan of travellers: they sent their
			water-carrier (for water) and he let down his bucket (into the
			well)...  He said: "Ah there! Good news! Here is a (fine) young
			man! So they concealed him as a treasure! But Allah knoweth well
			all that they do! <sup class='fn'>1653</sup> <sup class='fn'>1654</sup> <sup class='fn'>1655</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1656</sup>
The (Brethren) sold him for a miserable price for a few dirhams\n\t\t\tcounted out: in such low estimation did they hold him!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1657</sup> <sup class='fn'>1658</sup>

The man in Egypt who bought him said to his wife: "Make his stay
			(among us) honorable: maybe he will bring us much good or we
			shall adopt him as a son." Thus did we establish Joseph in the
			land that We might teach him the interpretation of stories (and
			events).  And Allah hath full power and control over His affairs;
			but most among mankind know it not. <sup class='fn'>1659</sup> <sup class='fn'>1660</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1661</sup> <sup class='fn'>1662</sup> <sup class='fn'>1663</sup>
When Joseph attained his full manhood We gave him power and\n\t\t\tknowledge: thus do We reward those who do right. <sup class='fn'>1664</sup>\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1665</sup>

But she in whose house he was sought to seduce him from his
			(true) self: she fastened the doors and said: "Now come thou
			(dear one)!" He said: "Allah forbid! truly (thy husband) is my
			lord! He made my sojourn agreeable! Truly to no good come those
			who do wrong!" <sup class='fn'>1666</sup> <sup class='fn'>1667</sup>

And (with passion) did she desire him and he would have desired
			her but that he saw the evidence of his Lord: thus (did We order)
			that We might turn away from him (all) evil and shameful deeds:
			for he was one of Our servants sincere and purified.
			<sup class='fn'>1668</sup> <sup class='fn'>1669</sup>

So they both raced each other to the door and she tore his shirt
			from the back: they both found her lord near the door.	She said:
			"What is the (fitting) punishment for one who formed an evil
			design against thy wife but prison or a grievous chastisement?"
			<sup class='fn'>1670</sup> <sup class='fn'>1671</sup>

He said: "It was she that sought to seduce me from my (true)
			self." And one of her household saw (this) and bore witness
			(thus) "If it be that his shirt is rent from the front then is
			her tale true and he is a liar! <sup class='fn'>1672</sup> <sup class='fn'>1673</sup>
"But if it be that his shirt is torn from the back then is she\n\t\t\tthe liar and he is telling the truth!" <sup class='fn'>1674</sup>
So when he saw his shirt that it was torn at the back (her\n\t\t\thusband) said: "Behold! it is a snare of you women! Truly mighty\n\t\t\tis your snare! <sup class='fn'>1675</sup>
"O Joseph pass this over! (O wife) ask forgiveness for thy sin\n\t\t\tfor truly thou hast been at fault!" <sup class='fn'>1676</sup>

Ladies said in the City: "The wife of the (great) `Aziz is
			seeking to seduce her slave from his (true) self: truly hath he
			inspired her with violent love: we see she is evidently going
			astray." <sup class='fn'>1677</sup> <sup class='fn'>1678</sup>
