When (Zulaikha) heard of their malicious talk she sent for them
			and prepared a banquet for them: she gave each of them a knife;
			and she said (to Joseph) "Come out before them.  When they saw
			him they did extol him and (in their amazement) cut their hands:
			they said "Allah preserve us! no mortal is this! This is none
			other than a noble angel!" <sup class='fn'>1679</sup>

She said: "There before you is the man about whom ye did blame
			me! I did seek to seduce him from his (true) self but he did
			firmly save himself guiltless!... And now if he doth not my
			bidding he shall certainly be cast into prison and (what is more)
			be in the company of the vilest!" <sup class='fn'>1680</sup>

He said: "O my Lord! the prison is more to my liking than that to
			which they invite me: unless thou turn away their snare from me I
			should (in my youthful folly) feel inclined towards them and join
			the ranks of the ignorant." <sup class='fn'>1681</sup> <sup class='fn'>1682</sup>
So his Lord heard him (in his prayer) and turned away from him\n\t\t\ttheir snare: verily He heareth and knoweth (all things).\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1683</sup>
Then it occurred to the men after they had seen the Signs (that\n\t\t\tit was best) to imprison him for a time. <sup class='fn'>1684</sup>

Now with him there came into the prison two young men.	Said one
			of them: "I see myself (in a dream) pressing wine." Said the
			other: "I see myself (in a dream) carrying bread on my head and
			birds are eating thereof." "Tell us" (they said) "the truth and
			meaning thereof: for we see thou art one that doth good (to
			all)." <sup class='fn'>1685</sup> <sup class='fn'>1686</sup> <sup class='fn'>1687</sup>

He said: "Before any food comes (in due course) to feed either of
			you I will surely reveal to you the truth and meaning of this ere
			it come to pass: that is part of the (Duty) which my Lord hath
			taught me.  I have (I assure you) abandoned the ways of a people
			that believe not in Allah and that (even) deny the Hereafter.
			<sup class='fn'>1688</sup> <sup class='fn'>1689</sup> <sup class='fn'>1690</sup>

"And I follow the ways of my fathers Abraham Isaac and Jacob; and
			never could we attribute any partners whatever to Allah: that
			(comes) of the grace of Allah to us and to mankind: yet most men
			are not grateful. <sup class='fn'>1691</sup>
"O my two companions of the prison! (I ask you): are many lords\n\t\t\tdiffering among themselves better or Allah the One Supreme and\n\t\t\tIrresistible? <sup class='fn'>1692</sup>

"If not Him ye worship nothing but names which ye have named ye
			and your fathers for which Allah hath sent you no authority: the
			Command is for none but Allah: He hath commanded that ye worship
			none but Him: that is the right religion but Most men understand
			not... <sup class='fn'>1693</sup>

"O my two companions of the prison! as to one of you he will pour
			out the wine for his lord to drink: as for the other he will hang
			from the cross and the birds will eat from off his head.  (So)
			hath been decreed that matter whereof ye twain do enquire..."
			<sup class='fn'>1694</sup> <sup class='fn'>1695</sup> <sup class='fn'>1696</sup>

And of the two to that one whom he considered about to be saved
			he said: "Mention me to thy lord." But Satan made him forget to
			mention him to his lord: and (Joseph) lingered in prison a few
			(more) years. <sup class='fn'>1697</sup> <sup class='fn'>1698</sup> <sup class='fn'>1699</sup>

The king (of Egypt) said: "I do see (in a vision) seven fat kine
			whom seven lean ones devour and seven green ears of corn and
			seven (others) withered.  O ye chiefs! expound to me my vision if
			it be that ye can interpret visions." <sup class='fn'>1700</sup>
They said: "A confused medley of dreams: and we are not skilled\n\t\t\tin the interpretation of dreams." <sup class='fn'>1701</sup>

But the man who had been released one of the two (who had been in
			prison) and who now bethought him after (so long) a space of time
			said: "I will tell you the truth of its interpretation: send ye
			me (therefor)." <sup class='fn'>1702</sup>

"O Joseph!" (he said) "O man of truth! expound to us (the dream)
			of seven fat kine whom seven lean ones devour and of seven green
			ears of corn and (seven) others withered: that I may return to
			the people and that they may understand." <sup class='fn'>1703</sup>

(Joseph) said: "For seven years shall ye diligently sow as is\n\t\t\tyour wont: and the harvests that ye reap ye shall leave them in\n\t\t\tthe ear  except a little of which ye shall eat. <sup class='fn'>1704</sup>

"Then will come after that (period) seven dreadful (years) which
			will devour what ye shall have laid by in advance for them (all)
			except a little which ye shall have (specially) guarded.
			<sup class='fn'>1705</sup>
"Then will come after that (period) a year in which the people\n\t\t\twill have abundant water and in which they will press (wine and\n\t\t\toil)." <sup class='fn'>1706</sup>

So the king said: "Bring ye him unto me." But when the messenger
			came to him (Joseph) said: "Go thou back to thy lord and ask him
			`What is the state of mind of the ladies who cut their hands?'
			for my Lord is certainly well aware of their snare."
			<sup class='fn'>1707</sup> <sup class='fn'>1708</sup> <sup class='fn'>1709</sup>

(The king) said (to the ladies): "What was your affair when ye
			did seek to seduce Joseph from his (true) self?" The ladies said:
			"Allah preserve us! no evil know we against him!" Said the
			`Aziz's wife: "Now is the truth manifest (to all): it was I who
			sought to seduce him from his (true) self: he is indeed of those
			who are (ever) true (and virtuous). <sup class='fn'>1710</sup> <sup class='fn'>1711</sup>
"This (say I) in order that he may know that I have never been\n\t\t\tfalse to him in his absence and that Allah will never guide the\n\t\t\tsnare of the false ones. <sup class='fn'>1712</sup>

"Nor do I absolve my own self (of blame): the (human soul) is
			certainly prone to evil unless my Lord do bestow His Mercy: but
			surely certainly my Lord is Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful."
			<sup class='fn'>1713</sup>

So the king said: "Bring him unto me; I will take him specially
			to serve about my own person." Therefore when he had spoken to
			him he said: "Be assured this day thou art before our own
			Presence with rank firmly established and fidelity fully proved!"
			<sup class='fn'>1714</sup> <sup class='fn'>1715</sup>
(Joseph) said: "Set me over the storehouses of the land: I will\n\t\t\tindeed guard them as one that knows (their importance)."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1716</sup>

Thus did We give established power to Joseph in the land to take
			possession therein as when or where he pleased.  We bestow of Our
			mercy on whom We please and We suffer not to be lost the reward
			of those who do good. <sup class='fn'>1717</sup>
But verily the reward of the Hereafter is the best for those who\n\t\t\tbelieve and are constant in righteousness. <sup class='fn'>1718</sup>
Then came Joseph's brethren: they entered his presence and he\n\t\t\tknew them but they knew him not. <sup class='fn'>1719</sup>

And when he had furnished them forth with provisions (suitable)
			for them he said: "Bring unto me a brother ye have of the same
			father as yourselves (but a different mother): see ye not that I
			pay out full measure and that I do provide the best hospitality?
			<sup class='fn'>1720</sup>
"Now if ye bring him not to me ye shall have no measure (of corn)\n\t\t\tfrom me nor shall be ye (even) come near me."
They said: "We shall certainly seek to get our wish about him\n\t\t\tfrom his father: indeed we shall do it." <sup class='fn'>1721</sup>

And (Joseph) told his servants to put their stock in trade (with
			which they had bartered) into their saddlebags so they should
			know it only when they returned to their people in order that
			they might come back. <sup class='fn'>1722</sup> <sup class='fn'>1723</sup>

Now when they returned to their father they said: "O our father!
			no more measure of grain shall we get (unless we take our
			brother): so send our brother with us that we may get our
			measure; and we will indeed take every care of him."
			<sup class='fn'>1724</sup>

He said: "Shall I trust you with him with any result other than
			when I trusted you with his brother aforetime? But Allah is the
			best to take care (of him) and He is the Most Merciful of those
			who show mercy!" <sup class='fn'>1725</sup>

Then when they opened their baggage they found their stock in
			trade had been returned to them.  They said: "O our father! what
			(more) can we desire? This our stock in trade has been returned
			to us: so we shall get (more) food for our family; we shall take
			care of our brother; and add (at the same time) a full camel's
			load (of grain to our provisions): this is but a small quantity."
			<sup class='fn'>1726</sup> <sup class='fn'>1727</sup>

(Jacob) said: "Never will I send him with you until ye swear a
			solemn oath to me in Allah's name that ye will be sure to bring
			him back to me unless ye are yourselves hemmed in (and made
			powerless)." And when they had sworn their solemn oath he said:
			"Over all that we say be Allah the Witness and Guardian!"
			<sup class='fn'>1728</sup> <sup class='fn'>1729</sup>

Further he said; "O my sons! enter not all by one gate: enter ye
			by different gates.  Not that I can profit you aught against
			Allah (with my advice): none can command except Allah: on Him do
			I put my trust and let all that trust put their trust on Him."
			<sup class='fn'>1730</sup>

And when they entered in the manner their father had enjoined it
			did not profit them in the least against (the Plan of) Allah: it
			was but a necessity of Jacob's soul which he discharged.  For he
			was by Our instruction full of knowledge (and experience): but
			most men know not. <sup class='fn'>1731</sup> <sup class='fn'>1732</sup> <sup class='fn'>1733</sup>

Now when they came into Joseph's presence he received his (full)
			brother to stay with him.  He said (to him): "Behold! I am thy
			(own) brother; so grieve not at aught of their doings."
			<sup class='fn'>1734</sup> <sup class='fn'>1735</sup> <sup class='fn'>1736</sup>

At length when he had furnished them forth with provisions
			(suitable) for them he put the drinking cup into his brother's
			saddlebag.  Then shouted out a Crier: "O ye (in) the Caravan!
			Behold! ye are thieves without doubt!" <sup class='fn'>1737</sup>
They said turning towards them: "What is it that ye miss?"
They said: "We miss the great beaker of the king; for him who\n\t\t\tproduces it is (the reward of) a camel-load; I will be bound by\n\t\t\tit."
(The brothers) said: "By Allah! well ye know that we came not to\n\t\t\tmake mischief in the land and we are no thieves!" <sup class='fn'>1738</sup>
(The Egyptians) said: "What then shall be the penalty of this if\n\t\t\tye are (proved) to have lied?" <sup class='fn'>1739</sup>

They said: "The penalty should be that he in whose saddle bag it\n\t\t\tis found should be held (as bondman) to atone for the (crime). \n\t\t\tThus it is we punish the wrongdoers!" <sup class='fn'>1740</sup> <sup class='fn'>1741</sup>

So he began (the search) with their baggage before (he came to)
			the baggage of his brother: at length He brought it out of his
			brother's baggage.  Thus did We plan for Joseph.  He could not
			take his brother by the law of the king except that Allah willed
			it (so). We raise to degrees (of wisdom) whom We please: but over
			all endued with knowledge is One the All-Knowing. <sup class='fn'>1742</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1743</sup> <sup class='fn'>1744</sup> <sup class='fn'>1745</sup> <sup class='fn'>1746</sup>

They said: "If he steals there was a brother of his who did steal
			before (him)." But these things did Joseph keep locked in his
			heart revealing not the secrets to them.  He (simply) said (to
			himself): "Ye are the worse situated; and Allah knoweth best the
			truth of what ye assert!" <sup class='fn'>1747</sup> <sup class='fn'>1748</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1749</sup>

They said: "O exalted one! Behold! he has a father aged and
			venerable (who will grieve for him): so take one of us in his
			place: for we see that thou art (gracious) in doing good."
			<sup class='fn'>1750</sup>
He said: "Allah forbid that we take other than him with whom we\n\t\t\tfound our property: indeed (if we did so) we should be acting\n\t\t\twrongfully." <sup class='fn'>1751</sup>

Now when they saw no hope of his (yielding) they held a
			conference in private. The leader among them said: "Know ye not
			that your father did take an oath from you in Allah's name and
			how before this ye did fail in your duty with Joseph? Therefore
			will I not leave this land until my father permits me or Allah
			commands me; and He is the best to command. <sup class='fn'>1752</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1753</sup>

"Turn ye back to your father and say `O our father! behold! thy\n\t\t\tson committed theft: we bear witness only to what we know and we\n\t\t\tcould not well guard against the unseen! <sup class='fn'>1754</sup>
" `Ask at the town where we have been and the caravan in which we\n\t\t\treturned and (you will find) we are indeed telling the truth.' "\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1755</sup>

Jacob said: "Nay but ye have yourselves contrived a story (good
			enough) for you.  So patience is most fitting (for me).  Maybe
			Allah will bring them (back) all to me (in the end): for He is
			indeed full of knowledge and wisdom." <sup class='fn'>1756</sup> <sup class='fn'>1757</sup>
And he turned away from them and said: "How great is my grief for\n\t\t\tJoseph!" And his eyes became white with sorrow and he fell into\n\t\t\tsilent melancholy. <sup class='fn'>1758</sup>
They said: "By Allah! (never) wilt thou cease to remember Joseph\n\t\t\tuntil thou reach the last extremity of illness or until thou\n\t\t\tdie!" <sup class='fn'>1759</sup>
He said: "I only complain of my distraction and anguish to Allah\n\t\t\tand I know from Allah that which ye know not... <sup class='fn'>1760</sup>\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1761</sup>

"O my sons! go ye and enquire about Joseph and his brother and
			never give up hope of Allah's Soothing Mercy: truly no one
			despairs of Allah's Soothing Mercy except those who have no
			faith." <sup class='fn'>1762</sup> <sup class='fn'>1763</sup>

Then when they came (back) into (Joseph's) presence they said: "O
			exalted one! distress has seized us and our family; we have (now)
			brought but scanty capital: So pay us full measure (we pray thee)
			and treat it as charity to us: for Allah doth reward the
			charitable." <sup class='fn'>1764</sup>
He said: "Know ye how ye dealt with Joseph and his brother not\n\t\t\tknowing (what ye were doing)?" <sup class='fn'>1765</sup>

They said: "Art thou indeed Joseph?" He said: "I am Joseph and
			this is my brother: Allah has indeed been gracious to us (all):
			behold he that is righteous and patient never will Allah suffer
			the reward to be lost of those who do right." <sup class='fn'>1766</sup>
They said: "By Allah! indeed has Allah preferred thee above us\n\t\t\tand we certainly have been guilty of sin!" <sup class='fn'>1767</sup>
He said: "This day let no reproach be (cast) on you: Allah will\n\t\t\tforgive you and He is the Most Merciful of those who show mercy?\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1768</sup>
"Go with this my shirt and cast it over the face of my father: he\n\t\t\twill come to see (clearly).  Then come ye (here) to me together\n\t\t\twith all your family." <sup class='fn'>1769</sup>
When the caravan left (Egypt) their father said: "I do indeed\n\t\t\tscent the presence of Joseph: nay think me not a dotard."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1770</sup>
They said: "By Allah! truly thou art in thine old wandering\n\t\t\tmind." <sup class='fn'>1771</sup>

Then when the bearer of the good news came he cast (the shirt)
			over his face and he forthwith regained clear sight.  He said:
			"Did I not say to you `Know from Allah that which ye know not?' "
			<sup class='fn'>1772</sup> <sup class='fn'>1773</sup> <sup class='fn'>1774</sup> <sup class='fn'>1775</sup>
They said: "O our father! ask for us forgiveness for our sins for\n\t\t\twe were truly at fault."
He said: "Soon will I ask my Lord for forgiveness for you: for He\n\t\t\tis indeed Oft-Forgiving Merciful." <sup class='fn'>1776</sup>

Then when they entered the presence of Joseph he provided a home\n\t\t\tfor his parents with himself and said: "Enter ye Egypt (all) in\n\t\t\tsafety if it please Allah." <sup class='fn'>1777</sup> <sup class='fn'>1778</sup>

And he raised his parents high on the throne (of dignity) and
			they fell down in prostration (all) before him.  He said: "O my
			father! this is the fulfillment of my vision of old! Allah hath
			made it come true! He was indeed good to me when He took me out
			of prison and brought you (all here) out of the desert (even)
			after Satan had sown enmity between me and my brothers.  Verily
			my Lord understandeth best the mysteries of all that He planneth
			to do: for verily He is full of knowledge and wisdom.
			<sup class='fn'>1779</sup> <sup class='fn'>1780</sup>

"O my Lord! Thou hast indeed bestowed on me some power and taught
			me something of the interpretation of dreams and events O Thou
			Creator of the heavens and the earth! Thou art my Protector in
			this world and in the Hereafter take thou my soul (at death) as
			one submitting to Thy Will (as a Muslim) and unite me with the
			righteous." <sup class='fn'>1781</sup> <sup class='fn'>1782</sup> <sup class='fn'>1783</sup>

Such is one of the stories of what happened unseen which We
			reveal by inspiration unto thee: nor wast thou (present) with
			them when they concerted their plans together in the process of
			weaving their plots. <sup class='fn'>1784</sup> <sup class='fn'>1785</sup>
Yet no faith will the greater part of mankind have however\n\t\t\tardently thou dost desire it. <sup class='fn'>1786</sup>
And no reward dost thou ask of them for this: it is no less than\n\t\t\ta Message for all creatures. <sup class='fn'>1787</sup>
And how many Signs in the heavens and the earth do they pass by?\n\t\t\tYet they turn (their faces) away from them! <sup class='fn'>1788</sup>
And most of them believe not in Allah without associating (others\n\t\t\tas partners) with Him! <sup class='fn'>1789</sup>

Do they then feel secure from the coming against them of the
			covering veil of the wrath of Allah or of the coming against them
			of the (final) Hour all of a sudden while they perceive not?
			<sup class='fn'>1790</sup> <sup class='fn'>1791</sup>

Say thou: "This my way: I do invite unto Allah on evidence clear\n\t\t\tas the seeing with one's eyes I and whoever follows me: Glory to\n\t\t\tAllah! and never will I join gods with Allah!" <sup class='fn'>1792</sup>

Nor did We send before thee (as Apostles) any but men whom We did
			inspire (men) living in human habitations. Do they not travel
			through the earth and see what was the end of those before them?
			But the home of the Hereafter is best for those who do right. 
			Will ye not then understand? <sup class='fn'>1793</sup> <sup class='fn'>1794</sup>

(Respite will be granted) until when the apostles give up hope
			(of their people) and (come to ) think that they were treated as
			liars there reaches them Our help.  And those whom We will are
			delivered into safety.	But never will be warded off Our
			punishment from those who are in sin. <sup class='fn'>1795</sup>

There is in their stories instruction for men endued with
			understanding.	It is not a tale invented but a confirmation of
			what went before it a detailed exposition of all things and a
			Guide and a Mercy to any such as believe. <sup class='fn'>1796</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1797</sup>

Alif Lam Mim Ra. These are the Signs (or Verses) of the Book:\n\t\t\tthat which hath been revealed unto thee from thy Lord is the\n\t\t\tTruth; but most men believe not. <sup class='fn'>1798</sup> <sup class='fn'>1799</sup>

Allah is He Who raised the heavens without any pillars that ye
			can see; is firmly established on the throne (of authority); He
			has subjected the sun and the moon (to His law)! each one runs
			(its course) for a term appointed.  He doth regulate affairs
			explaining the Signs in detail that ye may believe with certainty
			in the meeting with your Lord. <sup class='fn'>1800</sup> <sup class='fn'>1801</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1802</sup> <sup class='fn'>1803</sup>

And it is He Who spread out the earth and set thereon mountains
			standing firm and (flowing) rivers: and fruit of every kind He
			made in pairs two and two: He draweth the Night as a veil o'er
			the Day. Behold verily in these things there are Signs for those
			who consider! <sup class='fn'>1804</sup> <sup class='fn'>1805</sup>

And in the earth are tracts (diverse though) neighboring and
			gardens of vines and fields sown with corn and palm trees growing
			out of single roots or otherwise: watered with the same water yet
			some of them We make more excellent than others to eat.  Behold
			verily in these things there are Signs for those who understand!
			<sup class='fn'>1806</sup> <sup class='fn'>1807</sup>

If thou dost marvel (at their want of faith) strange is their
			saying: "When we are (actually) dust shall we indeed then be in a
			creation renewed?" They are those who deny their Lord! They are
			those round whose necks will be yokes (of servitude): they will
			be Companions of the Fire who dwell therein (for aye)!
			<sup class='fn'>1808</sup> <sup class='fn'>1809</sup>

They ask thee to hasten on the evil in preference to the good:
			yet have come to pass before them (many) exemplary punishments!
			But verily thy Lord is full of forgiveness for mankind for their
			wrongdoing: and verily thy Lord is (also) strict in punishment.
			<sup class='fn'>1810</sup>

And the Unbelievers say! "Why is not a Sign sent down to him from\n\t\t\this Lord?" But thou art truly a warner and to every people a\n\t\t\tguide. <sup class='fn'>1811</sup> <sup class='fn'>1812</sup>

Allah doth know what every female (womb) doth bear by how much
			the wombs fall short (of their time or number) or do exceed. 
			Every single thing is before His sight in (due) proportion.
			<sup class='fn'>1813</sup>
He knoweth the Unseen and that which is open: He is the Great the\n\t\t\tMost High. <sup class='fn'>1814</sup>
It is the same (to Him) whether any of you conceal his speech or\n\t\t\tdeclare it openly; whether he lie hid by night or walk freely by\n\t\t\tday. <sup class='fn'>1815</sup>

For each (such person) there are (angels) in succession before
			and behind him: they guard him by command of Allah.  Verily never
			will Allah change the condition of a people until they change it
			themselves (with their own souls). But when (once) Allah willeth
			a people's punishment there can be no turning it back nor will
			they find besides Him any to protect. <sup class='fn'>1816</sup> <sup class='fn'>1817</sup>
It is He Who doth show you the lightning by way both of fear and\n\t\t\tof hope: it is He Who doth raise up the clouds heavy with\n\t\t\t(fertilizing) rain! <sup class='fn'>1818</sup>

Nay thunder repeateth His praises and so do the angels with awe:
			He flingeth the loud-voiced thunderbolts and therewith He
			striketh whomsoever He will...	Yet these (are the men) who (dare
			to) dispute about Allah with the strength of His power (supreme)!
			<sup class='fn'>1819</sup> <sup class='fn'>1820</sup> <sup class='fn'>1821</sup>

For Him (alone) is prayer in Truth: any others that they call
			upon besides Him hear them no more than if they were to stretch
			forth their hands for water to reach their mouth but it reaches
			them not: for the prayer of those without Faith is nothing but
			(futile) wandering (in the mind). <sup class='fn'>1822</sup> <sup class='fn'>1823</sup>

Whatever beings there are in the heavens and the earth do
			prostrate themselves to Allah (acknowledging subjection) with
			good will or in spite of themselves: so do their shadows in the
			mornings and evenings. <sup class='fn'>1824</sup> <sup class='fn'>1825</sup> <sup class='fn'>1826</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1827</sup>

Say: "Who is the Lord and Sustainer of the heavens and the
			earth?" Say: "It is Allah." Say: "Do ye then take (for worship)
			protectors other than Him such as have no power either for good
			or for harm to themselves?" Say: "Are the blind equal with those
			who see? Or the depths of darkness equal with Light?" Or do they
			assign to Allah partners who have created (anything) as He has
			created so that the creation seemed to them similar? Say: "Allah
			is the Creator of all things: He is the One the Supreme and
			Irresistible." <sup class='fn'>1828</sup> <sup class='fn'>1829</sup> <sup class='fn'>1830</sup>

He sends down water from the skies and the channels flow each
			according to its measure: but the torrent bears away the foam
			that mounts up to the surface.	Even so from that (ore) which
			they heat in the fire to make ornaments or utensils therewith
			there is a scum likewise.  Thus doth Allah (by parables) show
			forth Truth and Vanity: for the scum disappears like froth cast
			out; while that which is for the good of mankind remains on the
			earth.	Thus doth Allah set forth parables. <sup class='fn'>1831</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1832</sup>

For those who respond to their Lord are (all) good things.  But
			those who respond not to Him even if they had all that is in the
			heavens and on earth and as much more (in vain) would they offer
			it for ransom.	For them will the reckoning be terrible: their
			abode will be Hell what a bed of misery! <sup class='fn'>1833</sup>

Is then one who doth know that that which hath been revealed unto
			these from thy Lord is the Truth like one who is blind? It is
			those who are endued with understanding that receive admonition
			<sup class='fn'>1834</sup>
Those who fulfil the Covenant of Allah and fail not in their\n\t\t\tplighted word;
Those who join together those things which Allah hath commanded\n\t\t\tto be joined hold their Lord in awe and fear the terrible\n\t\t\treckoning; <sup class='fn'>1835</sup>

Those who patiently persevere seeking the countenance their Lord;
			establish regular prayers; spend out of (the gifts) We have
			bestowed for their sustenance secretly and openly; and turn off
			Evil with good: for such there is the final attainment of the
			(Eternal) Home <sup class='fn'>1836</sup>

Gardens of perpetual bliss: they shall enter there as well as the
			righteous among their fathers their spouses and their offspring:
			and angels shall enter unto them from every gate (with the
			salutation): <sup class='fn'>1837</sup>
"Peace unto you for that ye persevered in patience! Now how\n\t\t\texcellent is the final Home!"

But those who break the Covenant of Allah after having plighted
			their word thereto and cut asunder those things which Allah has
			commanded to be joined and work mischief in the land on them is
			the Curse; for them is the terrible Home! <sup class='fn'>1838</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1839</sup>

Allah doth enlarge or grant by (strict) measure the Sustenance
			(which He giveth) to whom so He pleaseth.  (The worldly) rejoice
			in the life of this world: but the life of this world is but
			little comfort in the Hereafter. <sup class='fn'>1840</sup> <sup class='fn'>1841</sup>

The Unbelievers say: "Why is not a Sign sent down to him from his
			Lord?" Say: "Truly Allah leaveth to stray whom He will; but He
			guideth to Himself those who turn to Him in penitence
			<sup class='fn'>1842</sup>
"Those who believe and whose hearts find satisfaction in the\n\t\t\tremembrance of Allah: for without doubt in the remembrance of\n\t\t\tAllah do hearts find satisfaction. <sup class='fn'>1843</sup>
"For those who believe and work righteousness is (every)\n\t\t\tblessedness and a beautiful place of (final) return."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1844</sup>

Thus have We sent thee amongst a People before whom (long since)
			have (other) Peoples (gone and) passed away; in order that thou
			mightest rehearse unto them what We send down unto thee by
			inspiration; yet do they reject (Him) the Most Gracious! Say: "He
			is my Lord! There is no god but He! On Him is my trust and to Him
			do I turn!" <sup class='fn'>1845</sup> <sup class='fn'>1846</sup>

If there were a Qur'an with which mountains were moved or the
			earth were cloven asunder or the dead were made to speak (this
			would be the one!)  But truly the Command is with Allah in
			things! Do not the Believers know that had Allah (so) willed He
			could have guided all mankind (to the Right)? But the Unbelievers
			never will disaster cease to seize them for their (ill) deeds or
			to settle close to their homes until the Promise of Allah come to
			pass for verily Allah will not fail in His promise. <sup class='fn'>1847</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1848</sup>

Mocked were (many) Apostles before thee: but I granted respite to\n\t\t\tthe Unbelievers and finally I punished them; then how (terrible)\n\t\t\twas My requital! <sup class='fn'>1849</sup> <sup class='fn'>1850</sup>

Is then He Who standeth over every soul (and knoweth) all that it
			doth (like any others)? And yet they ascribe partners to Allah. 
			Say: "But name them! Is it that ye will inform Him of something
			He knoweth not on earth or is it (just) a show of words?" Nay! to
			those who believe not their pretence seems pleasing but they are
			kept back (thereby) from the Path: and those whom Allah leaves to
			stray no one can guide. <sup class='fn'>1851</sup> <sup class='fn'>1852</sup>
For them is a Penalty in the life of this world but harder truly\n\t\t\tis the Penalty of the Hereafter; and defender have they none\n\t\t\tagainst Allah. <sup class='fn'>1853</sup>

The parable of the Garden which the righteous are promised!
			beneath it flow rivers: perpetual is the enjoyment thereof and
			the shade therein: such is the End of the Righteous; and the End
			of Unbelievers is the Fire. <sup class='fn'>1854</sup> <sup class='fn'>1855</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1856</sup>

Those to whom We have given the Book rejoice at what hath been
			revealed unto thee: but there are among the clans those who
			reject a part thereof.	Say: "I am commanded to worship Allah and
			not to join partners with Him.	Unto Him do I call and unto Him
			is my return." <sup class='fn'>1857</sup> <sup class='fn'>1858</sup>

Thus have We revealed it to be a judgment of authority in Arabic.
			Wert thou to follow their (vain) desires after the knowledge
			which hath reached thee then wouldst thou find neither protector
			nor defender against Allah. <sup class='fn'>1859</sup> <sup class='fn'>1860</sup>

We did send apostles before thee and appointed for them wives and
			children: and it was never the part of an apostle to bring a Sign
			except as Allah permitted (or commanded).  For each period is a
			Book (revealed). <sup class='fn'>1861</sup> <sup class='fn'>1862</sup> <sup class='fn'>1863</sup>
Allah doth blot out or confirm what He pleaseth: with Him is the\n\t\t\tMother of the Book. <sup class='fn'>1864</sup>

Whether We shall show thee (within thy lifetime) part of what We
			promised them or take to Ourselves thy soul (before it is all
			accomplished) thy duty is to (make the Message) reach them: it is
			Our part to call them to account.

See they not that We gradually reduce the land (in their control)
			from its outlying borders? (Where) Allah commands there is none
			to put back His command: and He is swift in calling to account.
			<sup class='fn'>1865</sup>

Those before them did (also) devise plots; but in all things the
			master planning is Allah's.  He knoweth the doings of every soul:
			and soon will the Unbelievers know who gets home in the End.
			<sup class='fn'>1866</sup>

The Unbelievers say: "No apostle art thou." Say: "Enough for a\n\t\t\twitness between me and you is Allah and such as have knowledge of\n\t\t\tthe Book." <sup class='fn'>1867</sup> <sup class='fn'>1868</sup>

Alif Lam Ra.  A Book which We have revealed unto thee in order
			that thou mightest lead mankind out of the depths of darkness
			into light  by the leave of their Lord to the Way of (Him)
			Exalted in Power Worthy of all Praise! <sup class='fn'>1870</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1871</sup>
Of Allah to Whom do belong all things in the heavens and on\n\t\t\tearth! But alas for the Unbelievers for a terrible Penalty (their\n\t\t\tUnfaith will bring them)! <sup class='fn'>1872</sup>

Those who love the life of this world more than the Hereafter who\n\t\t\thinder (men) from the Path of Allah and seek therein something\n\t\t\tcrooked: they are astray by a long distance. <sup class='fn'>1873</sup>

We sent an apostle except (to teach) in the language of his (own)
			people in order to make (things) clear to them.  Now Allah leaves
			straying those whom He pleases and guides whom He pleases: and He
			is Exalted in power Full of Wisdom. <sup class='fn'>1874</sup> <sup class='fn'>1875</sup>

We sent Moses with Our Signs (and the command) "Bring out thy
			people from the depths of darkness into light and teach them to
			remember the Days of Allah." Verily in this there are Signs for
			such as are firmly patient and constant grateful and
			appreciative. <sup class='fn'>1876</sup> <sup class='fn'>1877</sup>

Remember! Moses said to his people: "Call to mind the favor of
			Allah to you when He delivered you from the people of Pharaoh:
			They set you hard tasks and punishments slaughtered your sons and
			let your womenfolk live: therein was a tremendous trial from your
			Lord." <sup class='fn'>1878</sup>

And remember! your Lord caused to be declared (publicly): "If ye
			are grateful I will add more (favors) unto you; but if ye show
			ingratitude truly My punishment is terrible indeed."
			<sup class='fn'>1879</sup>
And Moses said: "If ye show ingratitude ye and all on earth\n\t\t\ttogether--yet is Allah Free of all wants Worthy of all praise.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1880</sup> <sup class='fn'>1881</sup>

Has not the story reached you (O people!) of those who (went)
			before you? of the people of Noah and `Ad and Thamud? and of
			those who (came) after them? None knows them but Allah.  To them
			came apostles with Clear (Signs); but they put their hands up to
			their mouths and said: "We do deny (the mission) on which ye have
			been sent and we are really in suspicious (disquieting) doubt as
			to that to which ye invite us." <sup class='fn'>1882</sup> <sup class='fn'>1883</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1884</sup>

Their apostles said: "Is there a doubt about Allah the Creator of
			the heavens and the earth? It is He Who invites you in order that
			He may forgive you your sins and give you respite for a term
			appointed!" They said: "Ah! ye are no more than human like
			ourselves! Ye wish to turn us away from the (gods) our fathers
			used to worship: then bring us some clear authority."
			<sup class='fn'>1885</sup> <sup class='fn'>1886</sup>

Their apostles said to them: "True we are human like yourselves
			but Allah doth grant His grace to such of His servants as He
			pleases.  It is not for us to bring you an authority except as
			Allah permits.	And on Allah let all men of faith put their
			trust.

"No reason have we why we should not put our trust on Allah. 
			Indeed He has guided us to the Ways we (follow).  We shall
			certainly bear with patience all the hurt you may cause us: for
			those who put their trust should put their trust on Allah."

And the Unbelievers said to their apostles: "Be sure we shall
			drive you out of our land or ye shall return to our religion."
			But their Lord inspired (this Message) to them: "Verily We shall
			cause the wrongdoers to perish! <sup class='fn'>1887</sup>

"And verily We shall cause you to abide in the land and succeed\n\t\t\tthem. This for such as fear the time when they shall stand before\n\t\t\tMy tribunal such as fear the punishment denounced." <sup class='fn'>1888</sup>
But they sought victory and decision (there and then) and\n\t\t\tfrustration was the lot of every powerful obstinate transgressor.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1889</sup> <sup class='fn'>1890</sup>
In front of such a one is Hell and he is given for drink boiling\n\t\t\tfetid water.

In gulps will he sip it but never well he be near swallowing it
			down his throat: Death will come to him from every quarter yet 
			will he not die: and in front of him will be a chastisement
			unrelenting. <sup class='fn'>1891</sup>

The parable of those who reject their Lord is that their works
			are as ashes on which the wind blows furiously on a tempestuous
			day: No power have they over aught that they have earned: That is
			the straying far far (from the goal). <sup class='fn'>1892</sup>
Seest thou not that Allah created the Heavens and the earth in\n\t\t\tTruth? If He so will He can remove you and put (in your place) a\n\t\t\tnew Creation? <sup class='fn'>1893</sup>
Nor is that for Allah any great matter. <sup class='fn'>1894</sup>

They will all be marshalled before Allah together: then will the
			weak say to those who were arrogant "For us we but followed you;
			can ye then avail us at all against the wrath of Allah?" They
			will reply "If we had received the guidance of Allah we should
			have given it to you: to us it makes no difference (now) whether
			we rage or bear (these torments) with patience: for ourselves
			there is no way of escape." <sup class='fn'>1895</sup> <sup class='fn'>1896</sup>

And Satan will say when the matter is decided: "It was Allah Who
			gave you a promise of truth: I too promised but I failed in my
			promise to you.  I had no authority over you except to call you
			but ye listened to me: then reproach not me but reproach your own
			souls.	I cannot listen to your cries nor can ye listen to mine. 
			I reject your former act in associating me with Allah.	For
			wrongdoers there must be a Grievous Penalty." <sup class='fn'>1897</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1898</sup>

But those who believe and work righteousness will be admitted to
			Gardens beneath which rivers flow to dwell therein for aye with
			the leave of their Lord: their greeting therein will be: "Peace!"
			<sup class='fn'>1899</sup>
Seest thou not how Allah sets forth a parable? a goodly Word like\n\t\t\ta goodly tree whose root is firmly fixed and its branches (reach)\n\t\t\tto the heavens <sup class='fn'>1900</sup>
It brings forth its fruit at all times by the leave of its Lord. \n\t\t\tSo Allah sets forth parables for men in order that they may\n\t\t\treceive admonition. <sup class='fn'>1901</sup>
And the parable of an evil Word is that of an evil tree.  It is\n\t\t\ttorn up by the root from the surface of the earth: it has no\n\t\t\tstability. <sup class='fn'>1902</sup>

Allah will establish in strength those who believe with the Word
			that stands firm in this world and in the Hereafter; but Allah
			will leave to stray those who do wrong: Allah doeth what He
			willeth. <sup class='fn'>1903</sup>
Hast thou not turned thy vision to those who have changed the\n\t\t\tfavor of Allah into blasphemy and caused their people to descend\n\t\t\tto the House of Perdition? <sup class='fn'>1904</sup>
Into Hell? They will burn therein an evil place to stay in!
And they set up (idols) as equal to Allah to mislead (men) from\n\t\t\tthe Path! Say: "Enjoy (your brief power)! But verily ye are\n\t\t\tmaking straightway for Hell!"

Speak to My servants who have believed that they may establish
			regular prayers and spend (in charity) out of the Sustenance We
			have given them secretly and openly before the coming of a Day in
			which there will be neither mutual bargaining nor befriending.
			<sup class='fn'>1905</sup> <sup class='fn'>1906</sup> <sup class='fn'>1907</sup>

It is Allah Who hath created the heavens and the earth and
			sendeth down rain from the skies and with it bringeth out fruits
			wherewith to feed you; it is He Who hath made the ships subject
			to you that they may sail through the sea by His command; and the
			rivers (also) hath He made subject to you. <sup class='fn'>1908</sup>
And He hath made subject to you the sun and the moon both\n\t\t\tdiligently pursuing their courses: and the Night and the Day hath\n\t\t\tHe (also) made subject to you. <sup class='fn'>1909</sup>

And He giveth you of all that ye ask for.  But if ye count the
			favors of Allah never will ye be able to number them: verily man
			is given up to injustice and ingratitude. <sup class='fn'>1910</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1911</sup>
Remember Abraham said: "O my Lord! make this city one of peace\n\t\t\tand security: and preserve me and my sons from worshipping idols.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1912</sup> <sup class='fn'>1913</sup>
"O my Lord! they have indeed led astray many among mankind: he\n\t\t\tthen who follows my (ways) is of me and he that disobeys me but\n\t\t\tthou art indeed Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful.

"O our Lord! I have made some of my offspring to dwell in a
			valley without cultivation by thy Sacred House; in order O our
			Lord that they may establish regular prayer: so fill the hearts
			of some among men with love towards them and feed them with
			Fruits: so that they may give thanks. <sup class='fn'>1914</sup> <sup class='fn'>1915</sup>
"O our Lord! truly Thou dost know what we conceal and what we\n\t\t\treveal: for nothing whatever is hidden from Allah whether on\n\t\t\tearth or in heaven. <sup class='fn'>1916</sup>
"Praise be to Allah who hath granted unto me in old age Ismail\n\t\t\tand Isaac: for truly my Lord is He the Hearer of Prayer!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1917</sup>
"O my Lord! make me one who establishes regular Prayer and also\n\t\t\t(raise such) among my offspring O our Lord! and accept Thou my\n\t\t\tPrayer. <sup class='fn'>1918</sup>

"O our Lord! cover (us) with Thy Forgiveness me my parents and
			(all) Believers on the Day that the Reckoning will be
			established!" <sup class='fn'>1919</sup> <sup class='fn'>1920</sup> <sup class='fn'>1921</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1922</sup>
Think not that Allah doth not heed the deeds of those who do\n\t\t\twrong.\tHe but giveth them respite against a Day when the eyes\n\t\t\twill fixedly stare in horror
They are running forward with necks outstretched their heads\n\t\t\tuplifted their gaze returning not towards them and their hearts a\n\t\t\t(gaping) void. <sup class='fn'>1923</sup>

So warn mankind of the Day when the Wrath will reach them: then
			will the wrongdoers say: "Our Lord! respite us (if only) for a
			short term: we will answer Thy Call and follow the apostles!" 
			"What! were ye not wont to swear aforetime that ye should suffer
			no decline? <sup class='fn'>1924</sup>
"And ye dwelt in the dwellings of men who wronged their own\n\t\t\tsouls: ye were clearly shown how We dealt with them; and We put\n\t\t\tforth many parables in your behalf!"
Mighty indeed were the plots which they made but their plots were\n\t\t\t(well) within the sight of Allah even though they were such as to\n\t\t\tshake the hills!
Never think that Allah would fail His apostles in His promise:\n\t\t\tfor Allah is Exalted in power the Lord of Retribution.
One day the Earth will be changed to a different Earth and so\n\t\t\twill be the Heavens and (men) will be marshalled forth before\n\t\t\tAllah the One the Irresistible; <sup class='fn'>1925</sup>
And thou wilt see the Sinners that day bound together in fetters\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1926</sup>
Their garments of liquid pitch and their faces covered with Fire;\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1927</sup> <sup class='fn'>1928</sup>
That Allah may requite each soul according to its deserts; and\n\t\t\tverily Allah is Swift in calling account. <sup class='fn'>1929</sup>\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1930</sup>
Here is a Message for mankind: let them take warning therefrom\n\t\t\tand let them know that He is (no other than) One Allah: let men\n\t\t\tof understanding take heed. <sup class='fn'>1931</sup>
Alif Lam Ra. These are the Ayats of Revelation of a Qur'an that\n\t\t\tmakes things clear. <sup class='fn'>1932</sup> <sup class='fn'>1933</sup> <sup class='fn'>1934</sup>
Again and again will those who disbelieve wish that they had\n\t\t\tbowed (to Allah's Will) in Islam. <sup class='fn'>1935</sup>

Leave them alone to enjoy (the good things of this life) and to\n\t\t\tplease themselves: let (false) Hope amuse them: soon will\n\t\t\tknowledge (undeceive them). <sup class='fn'>1936</sup> <sup class='fn'>1937</sup>
Never did We destroy a population that had not a term decreed and\n\t\t\tassigned beforehand. <sup class='fn'>1938</sup>
Neither can a people anticipate its Term nor delay it.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1939</sup>
They say: "O thou to whom the Message is being revealed! Truly\n\t\t\tthou art mad (or possessed)! <sup class='fn'>1940</sup>
"Why bringest thou not angels to us if it be that thou hast the\n\t\t\tTruth?" <sup class='fn'>1941</sup>
We send not the angels down except for just cause: if they came\n\t\t\t(to the ungodly) behold! no respite would they have!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1942</sup> <sup class='fn'>1943</sup>
We have without doubt sent down the Message; and We will\n\t\t\tassuredly guard it (from corruption). <sup class='fn'>1944</sup>
We did send apostles before thee amongst the religious sects of\n\t\t\told: <sup class='fn'>1945</sup>
But never came an apostle to them but they mocked him.
Even so do We let it creep into the hearts of the sinners\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1946</sup>
That they should not believe in the (Message); but the ways of\n\t\t\tthe ancients have passed away. <sup class='fn'>1947</sup>
Even if We opened out to them a gate from heaven and they were to\n\t\t\tcontinue (all day) ascending therein <sup class='fn'>1948</sup>
They would only say: "Our eyes have been intoxicated: nay we have\n\t\t\tbeen bewitched by sorcery."
It is We who have set out the Zodiacal Signs in the heavens and\n\t\t\tmade them fair-seeming to (all) beholders; <sup class='fn'>1949</sup>\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1950</sup>
And (moreover) we have guarded them from every evil spirit\n\t\t\taccursed: <sup class='fn'>1951</sup> <sup class='fn'>1952</sup>
But any that gains a hearing by stealth is pursued by a flaming\n\t\t\tfire bright (to see). <sup class='fn'>1953</sup> <sup class='fn'>1954</sup>

And the earth We have spread out (like a carpet); set thereon\n\t\t\tmountains firm and immovable; and produced therein all kinds of\n\t\t\tthings in due balance. <sup class='fn'>1955</sup> <sup class='fn'>1956</sup>
And We have provided therein means of subsistence for you and for\n\t\t\tthose for whose sustenance ye are not responsible. <sup class='fn'>1957</sup>

And there is not a thing but its (sources and) treasures\n\t\t\t(inexhaustible) are with Us; but We only send down thereof in due\n\t\t\tand ascertainable measures. <sup class='fn'>1958</sup> <sup class='fn'>1959</sup>

And We send the fecundating winds then cause the rain to descend
			from the sky therewith providing you with water (in abundance)
			though ye are not the guardians of its stores. <sup class='fn'>1960</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>1961</sup> <sup class='fn'>1962</sup>
And verily it is We Who give life and who give death: it is We\n\t\t\tWho remain Inheritors (after all else passes away). <sup class='fn'>1963</sup>\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1964</sup>
To Us are known those of you who hasten forward and those who lag\n\t\t\tbehind. <sup class='fn'>1965</sup>
Assuredly it is thy Lord who will gather them together: for He is\n\t\t\tPerfect in Wisdom and Knowledge.
We created man from sounding clay from mud molded into shape;\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1966</sup>
And the Jinn race We had created before from the fire of a\n\t\t\tscorching wind. <sup class='fn'>1967</sup>
Behold! thy Lord said to the angels: "I am about to create man\n\t\t\tfrom sounding clay from mud molded into shape;
"When I have fashioned him (in due proportion) and breathed into\n\t\t\thim of My spirit fall ye down in obeisance unto him."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1968</sup>
So the angels prostrated themselves all of them together:
Not so Iblis: he refused to be among those who prostrated\n\t\t\tthemselves. <sup class='fn'>1969</sup> <sup class='fn'>1970</sup> <sup class='fn'>1971</sup>
(Allah) said: "O Iblis! what is your reason for not being among\n\t\t\tthose who prostrated themselves?"
(Iblis) said: "I am not one to prostrate myself to man whom thou\n\t\t\tdidst create from sounding clay from mud molded into shape."
(Allah) said: "Then get thee out from here; for thou art rejected\n\t\t\taccursed.
"And the Curse shall be on thee till the Day of Judgment."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1972</sup>
(Iblis) said: "O my Lord! give me then respite till the Day the\n\t\t\t(dead) are raised." <sup class='fn'>1973</sup>
(Allah) said: "Respite is granted thee
"Till the Day of the Time Appointed."

(Iblis) said: "O my Lord! because Thou hast put me in the wrong I\n\t\t\twill make (wrong) fair-seeming to them on the earth and I will\n\t\t\tput them all in the wrong <sup class='fn'>1974</sup> <sup class='fn'>1975</sup>
"Except Thy servants among them sincere and purified (by Thy\n\t\t\tgrace)."
(Allah) said: "This (Way of My sincere servants) is indeed a Way\n\t\t\tthat leads straight to Me. <sup class='fn'>1976</sup>
"For over My servants no authority shalt thou have except such as\n\t\t\tput themselves in the wrong and follow thee."
And verily Hell is the promised abode for them all!
To it are seven Gates: for each of those Gates is (special) class\n\t\t\t(of sinners assigned). <sup class='fn'>1977</sup>
The righteous (will be) amid Gardens and fountains (of\n\t\t\tclear-flowing water).
(Their greeting will be): "Enter ye here in Peace and Security."
And We shall remove from their hearts any lurking sense of\n\t\t\tinjury: (they will be) brothers (joyfully) facing each other on\n\t\t\tthrones (of dignity). <sup class='fn'>1978</sup>
There no sense of fatigue shall touch them nor shall they (ever)\n\t\t\tbe asked to leave.
Tell My servants that I am indeed the Oft-Forgiving Most\n\t\t\tMerciful; <sup class='fn'>1979</sup>
And that My Penalty will be indeed the most grievous Penalty.
Tell them about the guests of Abraham. <sup class='fn'>1980</sup>
When they entered his presence and said "Peace!" He said "We feel\n\t\t\tafraid of you!" <sup class='fn'>1981</sup>
They said: "Fear not! we give thee glad tidings of a son endowed\n\t\t\twith wisdom." <sup class='fn'>1982</sup>
He said: "Do ye give me glad tidings that old age has seized me?\n\t\t\tOf what then is your good news?"
They said: "We give thee glad tidings in truth: be not then in\n\t\t\tdespair!"
He said: "And who despairs of the mercy of his Lord but such as\n\t\t\tgo astray?" <sup class='fn'>1983</sup>
Abraham said: "What then is the business on which ye (have come)\n\t\t\tO ye messengers (of Allah)?" <sup class='fn'>1984</sup>
They said: "We have been sent to a people (deep) in sin.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1985</sup>
"Excepting the adherents of Lut: them we are certainly (charged)\n\t\t\tto save (from harm) all <sup class='fn'>1986</sup>
"Except his wife who we have ascertained will be among those who\n\t\t\twill lag behind." <sup class='fn'>1987</sup>
At length when the messengers arrived among the adherents of Lut\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>1988</sup>
He said: "Ye appear to be uncommon folk."
They said: "Yea we have come to thee to accomplish that of which\n\t\t\tthey doubt. <sup class='fn'>1989</sup>
"We have brought to thee that which is inevitably due and\n\t\t\tassuredly we tell the truth. <sup class='fn'>1990</sup>
"Then travel by night with thy household when a portion of the\n\t\t\tnight (yet remains) and do thou bring up the rear: let no one\n\t\t\tamongst you look back but pass on whither ye are ordered."
And We made known this decree to him that the last remnants of\n\t\t\tthose (sinners) should be cut off by the morning. <sup class='fn'>1991</sup>
The inhabitants of the City came in (mad) joy (at news of the\n\t\t\tyoung men). <sup class='fn'>1992</sup>
Lut said: "These are my guests: disgrace me not:
"But fear Allah and shame me not."
They said: "Did we not forbid thee (to speak) for all and\n\t\t\tsundry?" <sup class='fn'>1993</sup>
He said: "There are my daughters (to marry).  If ye must act\n\t\t\t(so)." <sup class='fn'>1994</sup>
Verily by thy life (O Prophet) in their wild intoxication they\n\t\t\twander in distraction to and fro. <sup class='fn'>1995</sup>
But the (mighty) Blast overtook them before morning <sup class='fn'>1996</sup>
And We turned (the Cities) upside down and rained down on them\n\t\t\tbrimstones hard as baked clay. <sup class='fn'>1997</sup>
Behold! in this are Signs for those who by tokens do understand.
And the (cities were) right on the highroad. <sup class='fn'>1998</sup>
Behold! in this is a Sign for those who believe! <sup class='fn'>1999</sup>
And the Companions of the Wood were also wrongdoers;\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2000</sup>
So We exacted retribution from them.  They were both on an open\n\t\t\thighway plain to see. <sup class='fn'>2001</sup>
The Companions of the Rocky Tract also rejected the apostles:\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2002</sup>
We sent them Our Signs but they persisted in turning away from\n\t\t\tthem.
Out of the mountains did they hew (their) edifices (feeling\n\t\t\tthemselves) secure. <sup class='fn'>2003</sup>
But the (mighty) Blast seized them of a morning <sup class='fn'>2004</sup>
And of no avail to them was all that they did (with such art and\n\t\t\tcare)!

We created not the heavens the earth and all between them but for
			just ends.  And the Hour is surely coming (when this will be
			manifest).  So overlook (any human faults) with gracious
			forgiveness. <sup class='fn'>2005</sup> <sup class='fn'>2006</sup>
For verily it is thy Lord Who is the Master-Creator knowing all\n\t\t\tthings. <sup class='fn'>2007</sup>
And We have bestowed upon thee the Seven Oft-Repeated (verses)\n\t\t\tand the Grand Qur'an. <sup class='fn'>2008</sup>

Strain not thine eyes (wistfully) at what We have bestowed on
			certain classes of them nor grieve over them: but lower thy wing
			(in gentleness) to the Believers. <sup class='fn'>2009</sup> <sup class='fn'>2010</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2011</sup>
And say: "I am indeed he that warneth openly and without\n\t\t\tambiguity" <sup class='fn'>2012</sup>
(Of just such wrath) as We sent down on those who divided\n\t\t\t(Scripture into arbitrary parts) <sup class='fn'>2013</sup>
(So also on such) as have made the Qur'an into shreds (as they\n\t\t\tplease). <sup class='fn'>2014</sup>
Therefore by thy Lord We will of a surety call them to account
For all their deeds. <sup class='fn'>2015</sup>
Therefore expound openly what thou art commanded and turn away\n\t\t\tfrom those who join false gods with Allah.
For sufficient are We unto thee against those who scoff\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2016</sup>
Those who adopt with Allah another god: but soon will they come\n\t\t\tto know.
We do indeed know how thy heart is distressed at what they say.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2017</sup>
But celebrate the praises of thy Lord and be of those who\n\t\t\tprostrate themselves in adoration.
And serve thy Lord until there come unto thee the Hour that is\n\t\t\tCertain. <sup class='fn'>2018</sup>
(Inevitable) cometh (to pass) the Command of Allah: seek ye not\n\t\t\tthen to hasten it: glory to Him and far is He above having the\n\t\t\tpartners they ascribe unto Him! <sup class='fn'>2019</sup>

He doth send down His angels with inspiration of His Command to\n\t\t\tsuch of His servants as He pleaseth (saying): "Warn (Man) that\n\t\t\tthere is no god but I: so do your duty unto Me." <sup class='fn'>2020</sup>
He has created the heavens and the earth for just ends: far is He\n\t\t\tabove having the partners they ascribe to Him! <sup class='fn'>2021</sup>
He has created man from a sperm drop; and behold this same (man)\n\t\t\tbecomes an open disputer! <sup class='fn'>2022</sup>
And cattle He has created for you (men): from them ye derive\n\t\t\twarmth and numerous benefits and of their (meat) ye eat.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2023</sup> <sup class='fn'>2024</sup>
And ye have a sense of pride and beauty in them as ye drive them\n\t\t\thome in the evening and as ye lead them forth to pasture in the\n\t\t\tmorning. <sup class='fn'>2025</sup>
And they carry your heavy loads to lands that ye could not\n\t\t\t(otherwise) reach except with souls distressed: for your Lord is\n\t\t\tindeed Most Kind Most Merciful. <sup class='fn'>2026</sup>

And (He has created) horses mules and donkeys for you to ride and\n\t\t\tuse for show; and He has created (other) things of what ye have\n\t\t\tno knowledge. <sup class='fn'>2027</sup> <sup class='fn'>2028</sup>
And unto Allah leads straight the Way but there are ways that\n\t\t\tturn aside: if Allah had willed He could have guided all of you.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2029</sup>
It is He Who sends down rain from the sky: from it ye drink and\n\t\t\tout of it (grows) the vegetation on which ye feed your cattle.
With it He produces for you corn olives date-palms grapes and\n\t\t\tevery kind of fruit: verily in this is a Sign for those who give\n\t\t\tthought. <sup class='fn'>2030</sup>

He has made subject to you the Night and the Day; the Sun and the\n\t\t\tMoon; and the Stars are in subjection by His Command: verily in\n\t\t\tthis are Signs for men who are wise. <sup class='fn'>2031</sup>

And the things on this earth which He has multiplied in varying
			colors (and qualities): verily in this is a Sign for men who
			celebrate the praises of Allah (in gratitude). <sup class='fn'>2032</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2033</sup>

It is He Who has made the sea subject that ye may eat thereof
			flesh that is fresh and tender and that ye may extract therefrom
			ornaments to wear; and thou seest the ships therein that plough
			the waves that ye may seek (thus) of the bounty of Allah and that
			ye may be grateful. <sup class='fn'>2034</sup> <sup class='fn'>2035</sup> <sup class='fn'>2036</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2037</sup>

And He has set up on the earth mountains standing firm lest it\n\t\t\tshould shake with you; and rivers and roads; that ye may guide\n\t\t\tyourselves <sup class='fn'>2038</sup> <sup class='fn'>2039</sup>
And marks and signposts; and by the stars (men) guide themselves.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2040</sup>
Is then He Who creates like one that creates not? Will ye not\n\t\t\treceive admonition? <sup class='fn'>2041</sup>
If ye would count up the favors of Allah never would ye be able\n\t\t\tto number them: for Allah is Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2042</sup>
And Allah doth know what ye conceal and what ye reveal.
Those whom they invoke besides Allah create nothing and are\n\t\t\tthemselves created. <sup class='fn'>2043</sup>
(They are things) dead lifeless: nor do thy know when they will\n\t\t\tbe raised up. <sup class='fn'>2044</sup>
Your Allah is One Allah: as to those who believe not in the\n\t\t\tHereafter their hearts refuse to know and they are arrogant.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2045</sup>
Undoubtedly Allah doth know what they conceal and what they\n\t\t\treveal: verily He loveth not the arrogant. <sup class='fn'>2046</sup>
When it is said to them "What is it that your Lord has revealed?"\n\t\t\tThey say "Tales of the ancients!" <sup class='fn'>2047</sup>

Let them bear on the Day of Judgment their own burdens in full
			and also (something) of the burdens of those without knowledge
			whom they misled. Alas how grievous the burdens they will bear!
			<sup class='fn'>2048</sup>

Those before them did also plot (against Allah's Way): but Allah
			took their structures from their foundations and the roof fell
			down on them from above; and the Wrath seized them from
			directions they did not perceive. <sup class='fn'>2049</sup>

Then on the Day of Judgment He will cover them with shame and
			say: "Where are My `partners' concerning whom ye used to dispute
			(with the godly)?" Those endued with knowledge will say: "This
			Day indeed are the Unbelievers covered with Shame and Misery
			<sup class='fn'>2050</sup>

"(Namely) those whose lives the angels take in a state of
			wrongdoing to their own souls. Then would they offer submission
			(with the pretence) `We did no evil (knowingly).' " (The angels
			will reply) "Nay but verily Allah knoweth all that ye did;
			<sup class='fn'>2051</sup> <sup class='fn'>2052</sup>
"So enter the gates of Hell to dwell therein.  Thus evil indeed\n\t\t\tis the abode of the arrogant."

To the righteous (when) it is said "What is it that your Lord has
			revealed?" they say "All that is good." To those who do good
			there is good in this world and the Home of the Hereafter is even
			better. And excellent indeed is the Home of the righteous
			<sup class='fn'>2053</sup> <sup class='fn'>2054</sup>
Gardens of Eternity which they will enter: beneath them flow\n\t\t\t(pleasant) rivers: they will have therein all that they wish:\n\t\t\tthus doth Allah reward the righteous

(Namely) those whose lives the angels take in a state of purity\n\t\t\tsaying (to them) "Peace be on you; enter ye the Garden because of\n\t\t\tthe good which ye did (in the world)." <sup class='fn'>2055</sup>

Do the (ungodly) wait until the angels come to them or there
			comes the Command of thy Lord (for their doom)? So did those who
			went before them.  But Allah wronged them not: nay they wronged
			their own souls. <sup class='fn'>2056</sup>
But the evil results of their deeds overtook them and that very\n\t\t\t(Wrath) at which they had scoffed hemmed them in.

The worshippers of false gods say: "If Allah had so willed we
			should not have worshipped aught but Him neither we nor our
			fathers nor should we have prescribed prohibitions other than
			His." So did those who went before them.  But what is the mission
			of apostles but to preach the Clear Message? <sup class='fn'>2057</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2058</sup> <sup class='fn'>2059</sup>

For We assuredly sent amongst every People an apostle (with the
			Command) "Serve Allah and eschew Evil": of the people were some
			whom Allah guided and some on whom Error became inevitably
			(established). So travel through the earth and see what was the
			end of those who denied (the Truth). <sup class='fn'>2060</sup> <sup class='fn'>2061</sup>
If thou art anxious for their guidance yet Allah guideth not such\n\t\t\tas He leaves to stray and there is none to help them.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2062</sup>

They swear their strongest oaths by Allah that Allah will not
			raise up those who die: Nay but it is a promise (binding) on Him
			in truth: but most among mankind realize it not. <sup class='fn'>2063</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2064</sup>

(They must be raised up) in order that He may manifest to them
			the truth of that wherein they differ and that the rejecters of
			Truth may realize that they had indeed (surrendered to)
			Falsehood. <sup class='fn'>2065</sup>
For to anything which We have willed We but say the Word "Be" and\n\t\t\tit is. <sup class='fn'>2066</sup>

To those who leave their homes in the cause of Allah after
			suffering oppression We will assuredly give a goodly home in this
			world: but truly the reward of the Hereafter will be greater if
			they only realize (this)! <sup class='fn'>2067</sup>
(They are) those who persevere in patience and put their trust on\n\t\t\ttheir Lord.

And before thee also the apostles We sent were but men to whom We\n\t\t\tgranted inspiration: if ye realize this not ask of those who\n\t\t\tpossess the Message. <sup class='fn'>2068</sup> <sup class='fn'>2069</sup>

(We sent them) with Clear Signs and Books of dark prophecies; and
			We have sent down unto thee (also) the Message; that thou mayest
			explain clearly to men what is sent for them and that they may
			give thought. <sup class='fn'>2070</sup>

Do then those who devise evil (plots) feel secure that Allah will\n\t\t\tnot cause the earth to swallow them up or that the Wrath will not\n\t\t\tseize them from directions they little perceive? <sup class='fn'>2071</sup>
Or that He may not call them to account in the midst of their\n\t\t\tgoings to and fro without a chance of their frustrating Him?\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2072</sup>
Or that He may not call them to account by a process of slow\n\t\t\twastage--for thy Lord is indeed full of kindness and mercy.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2073</sup>

Do they not look at Allah's creation (even) among (inanimate)
			things how their (very) shadows turn round from the right and the
			left prostrating themselves to Allah and that in the humblest
			manner? <sup class='fn'>2074</sup>

And to Allah doth obeisance all that is in the heavens and on\n\t\t\tearth whether moving (living) creatures or the angels: for none\n\t\t\tare arrogant (before their Lord). <sup class='fn'>2075</sup>
They all revere their Lord high above them and they do all that\n\t\t\tthey are commanded. <sup class='fn'>2076</sup>
Allah has said: "Take not (for worship) two gods: for He is just\n\t\t\tOne Allah: then fear Me (and Me alone)." <sup class='fn'>2077</sup>
To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and on earth and to Him\n\t\t\tis duty due always: then will ye fear other than Allah?\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2078</sup>
And ye have no good thing but is from Allah: and moreover when ye\n\t\t\tare touched by distress unto Him ye cry with groans;\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2079</sup>
Yet when He removes the distress from you behold! some of you\n\t\t\tturn to other gods to join with their Lord
(As if) to show their ingratitude for the favors We have bestowed\n\t\t\ton them! Then enjoy (your brief day); but soon will ye know (your\n\t\t\tfolly)!

And they (even assign to things they do not know a portion out of
			that which we have bestowed for their sustenance! By Allah ye
			shall certainly be called to account for your false inventions.
			<sup class='fn'>2080</sup> <sup class='fn'>2081</sup>
And they assign daughters for Allah! Glory be to Him! and for\n\t\t\tthemselves (sons the issue) they desire! <sup class='fn'>2082</sup>
When news is brought to one of them of (the birth of) a female\n\t\t\t(child) his face darkens and he is filled with inward grief!

With shame does he hide himself from his people because of the
			bad news he has had! Shall he retain it on (sufferance and)
			contempt or bury it in the dust? Ah! what an evil (choice) they
			decide on! <sup class='fn'>2083</sup> <sup class='fn'>2084</sup> <sup class='fn'>2085</sup>

To those who believe not in the Hereafter applies the similitude\n\t\t\tof evil: to Allah applies the highest similitude: for He is the\n\t\t\tExalted in Power Full of Wisdom. <sup class='fn'>2086</sup>

If Allah were to punish men for their wrongdoing He would not
			leave on the (earth) a single living creature: but He gives them
			respite for a stated term: when their term expires they would not
			be able to delay (the punishment) for a single hour just as they
			would not be able to anticipate it (for a single hour).
			<sup class='fn'>2087</sup>

They attribute to Allah what they hate (for themselves) and their
			tongues assert the falsehood that all good things are for
			themselves: without doubt for them is the fire and they will be
			the first to be hastened on into it! <sup class='fn'>2088</sup> <sup class='fn'>2089</sup>

By Allah We (also) sent (our apostles) to peoples before thee;
			but Satan made (to the wicked) their own acts seem alluring: he
			is also their patron today but they shall have a most grievous
			Penalty. <sup class='fn'>2090</sup>

And We sent down the Book to thee for the express purpose that
			thou shouldst make clear to them those things in which they
			differ and that it should be a guide and a mercy to those who
			believe. <sup class='fn'>2091</sup>
And Allah sends down rain from the skies and gives therewith life\n\t\t\tto the earth after its death: verily in this is a Sign for those\n\t\t\twho listen. <sup class='fn'>2092</sup>

And verily in cattle (too) will ye find an instructive Sign. 
			From what is within their bodies between excretions and blood We
			produce for your drink milk pure and agreeable to those who drink
			it. <sup class='fn'>2093</sup> <sup class='fn'>2094</sup> <sup class='fn'>2095</sup>
And from the fruit of the date-palm and the vine ye get out\n\t\t\twholesome drink and food: behold in this also is a Sign for those\n\t\t\twho are wise. <sup class='fn'>2096</sup>
And thy Lord taught the Bee to build its cells in hills on trees\n\t\t\tand in (men's) habitations; <sup class='fn'>2097</sup>

Then to eat of all the produce (of the earth) and find with skill
			the spacious paths of its Lord: there issues from within their
			bodies a drink of varying colors wherein is healing for men:
			verily in this is a Sign for those who give thought.
			<sup class='fn'>2098</sup> <sup class='fn'>2099</sup>

It is Allah who creates you and takes your souls at death; and of
			you there are some who are sent back to a feeble age so that they
			know nothing after having known (much): for Allah is All-Knowing
			All-Powerful. <sup class='fn'>2100</sup> <sup class='fn'>2101</sup>

Allah has bestowed His gifts of sustenance more freely on some of
			you than on others; those more favored are not going to throw
			back their gifts to those whom their right hands possess so as to
			be equal in that respect.  Will they then deny the favors of
			Allah? <sup class='fn'>2102</sup>

And Allah has made for you mates (and companions) of your own
			nature. And made for you out of them sons and daughters and
			grandchildren and provided for you sustenance of the best: will
			they then believe in vain things and be ungrateful for Allah's
			favors? <sup class='fn'>2103</sup> <sup class='fn'>2104</sup>
And worship others than Allah such as have no power of providing\n\t\t\tthem for sustenance with anything in heavens or earth and cannot\n\t\t\tpossibly have such power? <sup class='fn'>2105</sup>
Invent not similitudes for Allah: for Allah knoweth and ye know\n\t\t\tnot. <sup class='fn'>2106</sup>

Allah sets forth the Parable (of two men: one) a slave under the
			dominion of another; he has no power of any sort; and (the other)
			a man on whom We have bestowed goodly favors from ourselves and
			he spends thereof (freely) privately and publicly: are the two
			equal? (By no means); praise be to Allah.  But most of them
			understand not. <sup class='fn'>2107</sup>

Allah sets forth (another) Parable of two men: one of them dumb
			with no power of any sort; a wearisome burden is he to his
			master; whichever way he directs him he brings no good: is such a
			man equal with one who commands justice and is on a straight way?
			<sup class='fn'>2108</sup> <sup class='fn'>2109</sup>

To Allah belongeth the mystery of the heavens and the earth.  And
			the decision of the Hour (of Judgment) is as the twinkling of an
			eye or even quicker: for Allah hath power over all things.
			<sup class='fn'>2110</sup> <sup class='fn'>2111</sup>

It is He Who brought you forth from the wombs of your mothers
			when ye knew nothing; and He gave you hearing and sight and
			intelligence and affections: that ye may give thanks (to Allah).
			<sup class='fn'>2112</sup>

Do they not look at the birds held poised in the midst of (the\n\t\t\tair and) the sky? Nothing holds them up but (the power of) Allah.\n\t\t\t Verily in this are Signs for those who believe. <sup class='fn'>2113</sup>

It is Allah who made your habitations homes of rest and quiet for
			you; and made for you out of the skins of animals (tents for)
			dwellings which ye find so light (and handy) when ye travel and
			when ye stop (in your travels); and out of their wool and their
			soft fibers (between wool and hair) and their hair rich stuff and
			articles of convenience (to serve you) for a time. <sup class='fn'>2114</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2115</sup> <sup class='fn'>2116</sup> <sup class='fn'>2117</sup>

It is Allah who made out of the things He created some things to
			give you shade; of the hills He made some for your shelter; He
			made you garments to protect you from heat and coats of mail to
			protect you from your (mutual) violence.  Thus does He complete
			his favors on you that ye may bow to His will (in Islam).
			<sup class='fn'>2118</sup> <sup class='fn'>2119</sup> <sup class='fn'>2120</sup>
But if they turn away thy duty is only to preach the clear\n\t\t\tmessage.
They recognize the favors of Allah; then they deny them; and most\n\t\t\tof them are (creatures) ungrateful. <sup class='fn'>2121</sup>
One day We shall raise from all peoples a witness: then will no\n\t\t\texcuse be accepted from Unbelievers nor will they receive any\n\t\t\tfavors. <sup class='fn'>2122</sup>
When the wrongdoers (actually) see the Penalty then will it in no\n\t\t\tway be mitigated nor will they then receive respite.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2123</sup>

When those who gave partners to Allah will see their "partners"
			they will say: "Our Lord! these are our `partners' those whom we
			used to invoke besides thee." But they will throw back their word
			at them (and say): "Indeed ye are liars!" <sup class='fn'>2124</sup>
That day shall they (openly) show (their) submission to Allah;\n\t\t\tand all their inventions shall leave them in the lurch.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2125</sup>
Those who reject Allah and hinder (men) from the path of Allah\n\t\t\tfor them will We add Penalty to Penalty; for that they used to\n\t\t\tspread mischief.

One day We shall raise from all peoples a witness against them
			from amongst themselves: and We shall bring thee as a witness
			against these (thy people): and We have sent down to thee the
			Book explaining all things a guide a Mercy and glad tidings to
			Muslims. <sup class='fn'>2126</sup>

Allah commands justice the doing of good and liberality to kith
			and kin and He forbids all shameful deeds and injustice and
			rebellion: He instructs you that ye may receive admonition.
			<sup class='fn'>2127</sup>

Fulfil the covenant of Allah when ye have entered into it and
			break not your oaths after ye have confirmed them; indeed ye have
			made Allah your surety; for Allah knoweth all that ye do.
			<sup class='fn'>2128</sup>

And be not like a woman who breaks into untwisted strands the
			yarn which she has spun after it has become strong.  Nor take
			your oaths to practice deception between yourselves lest one
			party should be more numerous than another: for Allah will test
			you by this; and on the Day of Judgment He will certainly make
			clear to you (the truth of) that wherein ye disagree.
			<sup class='fn'>2129</sup> <sup class='fn'>2130</sup> <sup class='fn'>2131</sup> <sup class='fn'>2132</sup>

If Allah so willed He could make you all one people: but He
			leaves straying whom He pleases and He guides whom He pleases:
			but ye shall certainly be called to account for all your actions.
			<sup class='fn'>2133</sup>

And take not your oaths to practice deception between yourselves
			with the result that someone's foot may slip after it was firmly
			planted; and ye may have to taste the evil (consequences) of
			having hindered (men) from the path of Allah and a mighty Wrath
			descend on you. <sup class='fn'>2134</sup>
Nor sell the covenant of Allah for a miserable price: for with\n\t\t\tAllah is (a prize) far better for you if ye only knew.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2135</sup>

What is with you must vanish: what is with Allah will endure. 
			And We will certainly bestow on those who patiently persevere
			their reward according to the best of their actions.
			<sup class='fn'>2136</sup>

Whoever works righteousness man or woman and has faith verily to
			him will We give a new life a life that is good and pure and We
			will bestow on such their reward according to the best of their
			actions. <sup class='fn'>2137</sup> <sup class='fn'>2138</sup>
When thou dost read the Qur'an seek Allah's protection from Satan\n\t\t\tthe rejected one. <sup class='fn'>2139</sup>
No authority has he over those who believe and put their trust in\n\t\t\ttheir Lord.
His authority is over those only who take him as patron and who\n\t\t\tjoin partners with Allah.

When We substitute one revelation for another and Allah knows\n\t\t\tbest what He reveals (in stages) they say "Thou art but a\n\t\t\tforger": but most of them understand not. <sup class='fn'>2140</sup>

Say the Holy Spirit has brought the revelation from thy Lord in\n\t\t\ttruth in order to strengthen those who believe and as a guide and\n\t\t\tGlad Tidings to Muslims. <sup class='fn'>2141</sup> <sup class='fn'>2142</sup>
We know indeed that they say "It is a man that teaches him." The\n\t\t\ttongue of him they wickedly point to is notable foreign while\n\t\t\tthis is Arabic pure and clear. <sup class='fn'>2143</sup>
Those who believe not in the Signs of Allah Allah will not guide\n\t\t\tthem and theirs will be a grievous Penalty.
It is those who believe not in the Signs of Allah that forge\n\t\t\tfalsehood: it is they who lie! <sup class='fn'>2144</sup>

Anyone who after accepting faith in Allah utters unbelief except
			under compulsion his heart remaining firm in faith but such as
			open their breast to unbelief on them is Wrath from Allah and
			theirs will be a dreadful Penalty. <sup class='fn'>2145</sup>
This because they love the life of this world better than the\n\t\t\tHereafter: and Allah will not guide those who reject faith.
Those are they whose hearts ears and eyes Allah has sealed up and\n\t\t\tthey take no heed. <sup class='fn'>2146</sup>
Without doubt in the hereafter they will perish.

But verily thy Lord to those who leave their homes after trials
			and persecutions and who thereafter strive and fight for the
			faith and patiently persevere thy Lord after all this is
			Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful. <sup class='fn'>2147</sup>
One day every soul will come up struggling for itself and every\n\t\t\tsoul will be recompensed (fully) for all its actions and none\n\t\t\twill be unjustly dealt with. <sup class='fn'>2148</sup>

Allah sets forth a parable: a city enjoying security and quiet
			abundantly supplied with sustenance from every place: yet was it
			ungrateful for the favors of Allah: so Allah made it taste of
			hunger and terror (in extremes) (closing in on it) like a garment
			(from every side) because of the (evil) which (its people)
			wrought. <sup class='fn'>2149</sup> <sup class='fn'>2150</sup>
And there came to them an Apostle from among themselves but they\n\t\t\tfalsely rejected him; so the wrath seized them even in the midst\n\t\t\tof their iniquities.
So eat of the sustenance which Allah has provided for you lawful\n\t\t\tand good; and be grateful for the favors of Allah if it is He\n\t\t\twhom ye serve. <sup class='fn'>2151</sup>

He has only forbidden you dead meat and blood and the flesh of
			swine and any (food) over which the name of other than Allah has
			been invoked.  But if one is forced by necessity without willful
			disobedience nor transgressing due limits then Allah is
			Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful. <sup class='fn'>2152</sup>

But say not for any false thing that your tongues may put forth
			"This is lawful and this is forbidden" so as to ascribe false
			things to Allah.  For those who ascribe false things to Allah
			will never prosper. <sup class='fn'>2153</sup>
