(In such falsehood) is but a paltry profit; but they will have a\n\t\t\tmost grievous Penalty.
To the Jews We prohibited such things as We have mentioned to\n\t\t\tthee before: We did them no wrong but they were used to doing\n\t\t\twrong to themselves. <sup class='fn'>2154</sup>
But verily thy Lord to those who do wrong in ignorance but who\n\t\t\tthereafter repent and make amends thy Lord after all this is\n\t\t\tOft-Forgiving Most Merciful. <sup class='fn'>2155</sup>
Abraham was indeed a model devoutly obedient to Allah (and) true\n\t\t\tin faith and he joined not gods with Allah: <sup class='fn'>2156</sup>\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2157</sup>
He showed his gratitude for the favors of Allah Who chose him and\n\t\t\tguided him to a straight way.
And We gave him good in this world and he will be in the\n\t\t\tHereafter in the ranks of the righteous. <sup class='fn'>2158</sup>
So We have taught thee the inspired (message) "Follow the ways of\n\t\t\tAbraham the true in faith and he joined not gods with Allah."

The Sabbath was only made (strict) to those who disagreed (as to\n\t\t\tits observance); but Allah will judge between them on the Day of\n\t\t\tJudgment as to their differences. <sup class='fn'>2159</sup> <sup class='fn'>2160</sup>

Invite (all) to the way of thy Lord with wisdom and beautiful
			preaching; and argue with them in ways that are best and most
			gracious: for thy Lord knoweth best who have strayed from His
			Path and who receive guidance. <sup class='fn'>2161</sup> <sup class='fn'>2162</sup>

And if ye do catch them out catch them out no worse than they\n\t\t\tcatch you out: but if ye show patience that is indeed the best\n\t\t\t(course) for those who are patient. <sup class='fn'>2163</sup>
And do thou be patient for thy patience is but from Allah; nor\n\t\t\tgrieve over them: and distress not thyself because of their\n\t\t\tplots. <sup class='fn'>2164</sup>
For Allah is with those who restrain themselves and those who do\n\t\t\tgood. <sup class='fn'>2165</sup>

Glory to (Allah) Who did take His Servant for Journey by night
			from the Sacred Mosque to the Farthest Mosque whose precincts We
			did Bless  in order that We might show him some of Our Signs: for
			He is the one Who heareth and seeth (all things). <sup class='fn'>2166</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2167</sup> <sup class='fn'>2168</sup> <sup class='fn'>2169</sup>

We gave Moses the Book and made it a Guide to the Children of\n\t\t\tIsrael (commanding): "Take not other than Me as Disposer of\n\t\t\t(your) affairs." <sup class='fn'>2170</sup> <sup class='fn'>2171</sup>
O ye that are sprung from those whom We carried (in the Ark) with\n\t\t\tNoah!  verily he was a devotee most grateful. <sup class='fn'>2172</sup>

And We gave (clear) warning to the Children of Israel in the Book
			that twice would they do mischief on the earth and be elated with
			mighty arrogance (and twice would they be punished)!
			<sup class='fn'>2173</sup> <sup class='fn'>2174</sup>

When the first of the warnings came to pass We sent against you
			Our servants given to terrible warfare: They entered the very
			inmost parts of your homes; and it was a warning (completely)
			fulfilled. <sup class='fn'>2175</sup>
Then did We grant you the Return as against them: We gave you\n\t\t\tincrease in resources and sons and made you the more numerous in\n\t\t\tmanpower. <sup class='fn'>2176</sup>

If ye did well ye did well for yourselves; if ye did evil (ye did
			it) against yourselves; so when the second of the warnings came
			to pass (We permitted your enemies) to disfigure your faces and
			to enter your Temple as they had entered if before and to visit
			with destruction all that fell into their power. <sup class='fn'>2177</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2178</sup> <sup class='fn'>2179</sup> <sup class='fn'>2180</sup>

It may be that your Lord may (yet) show Mercy unto you; but if ye
			revert (to your sins) We shall revert (to Our punishments): and
			We have made Hell a prison for those who reject (all Faith).
			<sup class='fn'>2181</sup> <sup class='fn'>2182</sup>

Verily this Qur'an doth guide to that which is most right (or
			stable) and giveth the glad tidings to the Believers who work
			deeds of righteousness that they shall have a magnificent reward;
			<sup class='fn'>2183</sup>
And to those who believe not in the Hereafter (it announceth)\n\t\t\tthat We have prepared for them a Penalty grievous (indeed).
The prayer that man should make for good he maketh for evil: for\n\t\t\tman is given to hasty (deeds). <sup class='fn'>2184</sup>

We have made the Night and the Day as two (of Our) Signs: the
			Sign of the Night have We obscured while the Sign of the day We
			have made to enlighten you; that ye may seek Bounty from your
			Lord and that ye may know the number and count of the years: all
			things have We explained in detail. <sup class='fn'>2185</sup> <sup class='fn'>2186</sup>

Every man's fate We have fastened on his own neck: on the Day of\n\t\t\tJudgment We shall bring out for him a scroll which he will see\n\t\t\tspread open. <sup class='fn'>2187</sup> <sup class='fn'>2188</sup>
(It will be said to him:) "Read thine (own) record: sufficient is\n\t\t\tthy soul this day to make out an account against thee."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2189</sup>

Who receiveth guidance receiveth it for his own benefit: who
			goeth astray doth so to his own loss: no bearer of burdens can
			bear the burden of another: nor would We visit with Our Wrath
			until We had sent an apostle (to give warning). <sup class='fn'>2190</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2191</sup>

When We decide to destroy a population We (first) send a definite
			order to those among them who are given the good things of this
			life and yet transgress; so that the word is proved true against
			them: then (it is) We destroy them utterly. <sup class='fn'>2192</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2193</sup>
How many generations have We destroyed after Noah? And enough is\n\t\t\tthy Lord to note and see the sins of His servants. <sup class='fn'>2194</sup>\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2195</sup>

If any do wish for the transitory things (of this life) We
			readily grant them--such things as We will to such persons as We
			will: in the end have We provided Hell for them: they will burn
			therein disgraced and rejected. <sup class='fn'>2196</sup> <sup class='fn'>2197</sup>

Those who do wish for the (things of) the Hereafter and strive
			therefor with all due striving and have Faith they are the ones
			whose striving is acceptable (to Allah). <sup class='fn'>2198</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2199</sup>
Of the bounties of thy Lord We bestow freely on all these as well\n\t\t\tas those: the bounties of thy Lord are not closed (to anyone).\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2200</sup>
See how We have bestowed more on some than on others; but verily\n\t\t\tthe Hereafter is more in rank and gradation and more in\n\t\t\texcellence. <sup class='fn'>2201</sup>
Take not with Allah another object of worship; or thou (O man!)\n\t\t\twilt sit in disgrace and destitution. <sup class='fn'>2202</sup> <sup class='fn'>2203</sup>

Thy Lord hath decreed that ye worship none but Him and that ye be
			kind to parents.  Whether one or both of them attain old age in
			thy life say not to them a word of contempt nor repel them but
			address them in terms of honor. <sup class='fn'>2204</sup>

And out of kindness lower to them the wing of humility and say:\n\t\t\t"My Lord! bestow on them Thy Mercy even as they cherished me in\n\t\t\tchildhood." <sup class='fn'>2205</sup> <sup class='fn'>2206</sup>

Your Lord knoweth best what is in your hearts: if ye do deeds of\n\t\t\trighteousness verily He is Most Forgiving to those who turn to\n\t\t\tHim again and again (in true penitence). <sup class='fn'>2207</sup>

And render to the kindred their due rights as (also) to those in\n\t\t\twant and to the wayfarer: but squander not (your wealth) in the\n\t\t\tmanner of a spendthrift. <sup class='fn'>2208</sup> <sup class='fn'>2209</sup>
Verily spendthrifts are brothers of the Evil Ones; and the Evil\n\t\t\tOne is to his Lord (Himself) ungrateful. <sup class='fn'>2210</sup>
And even if thou hast to turn away from them in pursuit of the\n\t\t\tMercy from thy Lord which thou dost expect yet speak to them a\n\t\t\tword of easy kindness. <sup class='fn'>2211</sup>
Make not thy hand tied (like a niggard's) to thy neck nor stretch\n\t\t\tit forth to its utmost reach so that thou become blameworthy and\n\t\t\tdestitute. <sup class='fn'>2212</sup>
Verily thy Lord doth provide sustenance in abundance for whom He\n\t\t\tpleaseth and He provideth in a just measure: for He doth know and\n\t\t\tregard all His servants. <sup class='fn'>2213</sup>
Kill not your children for fear of want: We shall provide\n\t\t\tsustenance for them as well as for you: verily the killing of\n\t\t\tthem is a great sin. <sup class='fn'>2214</sup>
Nor come nigh to adultery: for it is a shameful (deed) and an\n\t\t\tevil opening the road (to other evils). <sup class='fn'>2215</sup>

Nor take life which Allah has made sacred except for just cause. 
			And if anyone is slain wrongfully We have given his heir
			authority (to demand Qisas or to forgive): but let him not exceed
			bounds in the matter of taking life: for he is helped (by the
			Law). <sup class='fn'>2216</sup>

Come not nigh to the orphan's property except to improve it until
			he attains the age of full strength; and fulfil (every)
			engagement for (every) engagement will be enquired into (on the
			Day of Reckoning). <sup class='fn'>2217</sup> <sup class='fn'>2218</sup> <sup class='fn'>2219</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2220</sup>
Give full measure when ye measure and weigh with a balance that\n\t\t\tis straight: that is the most fitting and the most advantageous\n\t\t\tin the final determination. <sup class='fn'>2221</sup>

And pursue not that of which thou hast no knowledge; for every\n\t\t\tact of hearing or of seeing or of (feeling in) the heart will be\n\t\t\tenquired into (on the Day of Reckoning). <sup class='fn'>2222</sup>
Nor walk on the earth with insolence: for thou canst not rend the\n\t\t\tearth asunder nor reach the mountains in height. <sup class='fn'>2223</sup>
Of all such things the evil is hateful in the sight of thy Lord.

These are among the (precepts of) wisdom which thy Lord Has
			revealed to thee.  Take not with Allah another object of worship
			lest thou shouldst be thrown into Hell blameworthy and rejected.
			<sup class='fn'>2224</sup> <sup class='fn'>2225</sup>
Has then your Lord (O Pagans!) preferred for you sons and taken\n\t\t\tfor Himself daughters among the angels? Truly ye utter a most\n\t\t\tdreadful saying! <sup class='fn'>2226</sup>
We have explained (things) in various (ways) in this Qur'an in\n\t\t\torder that they may receive admonition but it only increases\n\t\t\ttheir flight (from the Truth)! <sup class='fn'>2227</sup>
Say: if there had been (other) gods with Him as they say behold\n\t\t\tthey would certainly have sought out a way to the Lord of the\n\t\t\tThrone! <sup class='fn'>2228</sup>
Glory to him! He is high above all that they say! Exalted and\n\t\t\tGreat (beyond measure)!

The seven heavens and the earth and all beings therein declare
			His glory: there not a thing but celebrates His praise; and yet
			ye understand not how they declare His glory! Verily He is Oft-
			Forbearing Most Forgiving! <sup class='fn'>2229</sup>
When thou dost recite the Qur'an We put between thee and those\n\t\t\twho believe not in the Hereafter a veil invisible: <sup class='fn'>2230</sup>

And We put coverings over their hearts (and minds) lest they
			should understand the Qur'an and deafness into their ears: when
			thou dost commemorate thy Lord and Him alone in the Qur'an they
			turn on their backs fleeing (from the Truth). <sup class='fn'>2231</sup>

We know best why it is they listen when they listen to thee; and\n\t\t\twhen they meet in private conference Behold the wicked say "Ye\n\t\t\tfollow none other than a man bewitched!" <sup class='fn'>2232</sup>
See what similes thy strike for thee; but they have gone astray\n\t\t\tand never can they find a way. <sup class='fn'>2233</sup>
They say: "What! when we are reduced to bones and dust should we\n\t\t\treally be raised up (to be) a new creation?" <sup class='fn'>2234</sup>
Say: "(Nay!) be ye stones or iron

"Or created matter which in your minds is hardest (to be raised
			up)--(yet shall ye be raised up)!" Then will they say: "Who will
			cause us to return?" Say: "He Who created you first!" Then will
			they wag their heads towards thee and say "When will that be?"
			Say "Maybe it will be quite soon! <sup class='fn'>2235</sup>

"It will be on a Day when He will call you and ye will answer\n\t\t\t(His call) with (words of) His praise and ye will think that ye\n\t\t\ttarried but a little while!" <sup class='fn'>2236</sup> <sup class='fn'>2237</sup>
Say to My servants that they should (only) say those things that\n\t\t\tare best: for Satan doth sow dissensions among them: for Satan is\n\t\t\tto man an avowed enemy. <sup class='fn'>2238</sup>

It is your Lord that knoweth you best: if He please He granteth\n\t\t\tyou mercy or if He please punishment: We have not sent thee to be\n\t\t\ta disposer of their affairs for them. <sup class='fn'>2239</sup>

And it is your Lord that knoweth best all beings that are in the
			heavens and on earth: We did bestow on some Prophets more (and
			other) gifts than on others: and We gave to David (the gift of)
			the Psalms. <sup class='fn'>2240</sup> <sup class='fn'>2241</sup>
Say: "Call on those besides Him whom ye fancy: they have neither\n\t\t\tthe power to remove your troubles from you nor to change them."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2242</sup>

Those whom they call upon do desire (for themselves) means of
			access to their Lord even those who are nearest: they hope for
			His Mercy and fear His Wrath: for the Wrath of thy Lord is
			something to take heed of. <sup class='fn'>2243</sup>
There is not a population but We shall destroy it before the Day\n\t\t\tof Judgment or punish it with a dreadful Penalty: that is written\n\t\t\tin the (eternal) Record. <sup class='fn'>2244</sup>

And We refrain from sending the Signs only because the men of
			former generations treated them as false: We sent the She-camel:
			to the Thamud to open their eyes but they treated her wrongfully:
			We only send the Signs by way of terror (and warning from evil).
			<sup class='fn'>2245</sup> <sup class='fn'>2246</sup> <sup class='fn'>2247</sup>

Behold! We told thee that thy Lord doth encompass mankind round
			about: We granted the Vision which We showed thee but as a trial
			for men  as also the Cursed Tree (mentioned) in the Qur'an: We
			put terror (and warning) into them but it only increases their
			inordinate transgression! <sup class='fn'>2248</sup> <sup class='fn'>2249</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2250</sup>
Behold! We said to the angels: "Bow down unto Adam": they bowed\n\t\t\tdown except Iblis: he said "Shall I bow down to one whom Thou\n\t\t\tdidst create from clay?" <sup class='fn'>2251</sup>

He said "Seest Thou? This is the one whom thou hast honored above
			me! If Thou wilt but respite me to the Day of Judgment I will
			surely bring his descendants under my sway all but a few!"
			<sup class='fn'>2252</sup>
Allah said: "Go thy way; if any of them follow thee verily Hell\n\t\t\twill be the recompense of you (all) an ample recompense.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2253</sup>

"Lead to destruction those whom thou canst among them with thy
			(seductive) voice; make assaults on them with thy cavalry and thy
			infantry; mutually share with them wealth and children; and make
			promises to them. But Satan promises them nothing but deceit.
			<sup class='fn'>2254</sup> <sup class='fn'>2255</sup> <sup class='fn'>2256</sup> <sup class='fn'>2257</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2258</sup>
"As for My servants no authority shalt thou have over them."\n\t\t\tEnough is thy Lord for a Disposer of affairs. <sup class='fn'>2259</sup>\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2260</sup>
Your Lord is He that maketh the Ship go smoothly for you through\n\t\t\tthe sea in order that ye may seek of His Bounty: for He is unto\n\t\t\tyou Most Merciful. <sup class='fn'>2261</sup>

When distress seizes you at sea those that ye call upon besides
			Himself leave you in the lurch! But when He brings you back safe
			to land ye turn away (from Him).  Most ungrateful is man!
			<sup class='fn'>2262</sup>

Do ye then feel secure that He will not cause you to be swallowed
			up beneath the earth when ye are on land or that He will not send
			against you a violent tornado (with showers of stones) so that ye
			shall find no one to carry out your affairs for you?
			<sup class='fn'>2263</sup>

Or do ye feel secure that He will not send you back a second time
			to sea and send against you a heavy gale to drown you because of
			your ingratitude so that ye find no helper therein against Us?
			<sup class='fn'>2264</sup>

We have honored the sons of Adam; provided them with transport on
			land and sea; given them for sustenance things good and pure; and
			conferred on them special favors above a great part of Our
			Creation. <sup class='fn'>2265</sup>

One day We shall call together all human beings with their
			(respective) Imams:  those who are given their record in their
			right hand will read it (with pleasure) and they will not be
			dealt with unjustly in the least. <sup class='fn'>2266</sup> <sup class='fn'>2267</sup>
But those who were blind in this world will be blind in the\n\t\t\tHereafter and most astray from the Path. <sup class='fn'>2268</sup>

And their purpose was to tempt thee away from that which We had
			revealed unto thee to substitute in Our name something quite
			different: (in that case) behold! they would certainly have made
			thee (their) friend! <sup class='fn'>2269</sup>
And had We not given thee strength thou wouldst nearly have\n\t\t\tinclined to them a little. <sup class='fn'>2270</sup>

In that case We should have made thee taste an equal portion (of
			punishment) in this life and an equal portion in death: and
			moreover thou wouldst have found none to help thee against Us!
			<sup class='fn'>2271</sup> <sup class='fn'>2272</sup>

Their purpose was to scare thee off the land in order to expel\n\t\t\tthee; but in that case they would not have stayed (therein) after\n\t\t\tthee except for a little while. <sup class='fn'>2273</sup>
(This was Our) way with the apostles We sent before thee: thou\n\t\t\twilt find no change in Our ways. <sup class='fn'>2274</sup>

Establish regular prayers at the sun's decline till the darkness
			of the night and the morning prayer and reading: for the prayer
			and reading in the morning carry their testimony. <sup class='fn'>2275</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2276</sup>

And pray in the small watches of the morning: (it would be) an
			additional prayer (or spiritual profit) for thee: soon will thy
			Lord raise thee to a station of Praise and Glory! <sup class='fn'>2277</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2278</sup>

Say: "O my Lord! let my entry be by the Gate of Truth and Honor
			and likewise my exit by the Gate of Truth and Honor; and grant me
			from Thy Presence an authority to aid (me)." <sup class='fn'>2279</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2280</sup>
And say: "Truth has (now) arrived and Falsehood perished: for\n\t\t\tFalsehood is (by its nature) bound to perish." <sup class='fn'>2281</sup>
We send down (stage by stage) in the Qur'an that which is a\n\t\t\thealing and a mercy to those who believe: to the unjust it causes\n\t\t\tnothing but loss after loss. <sup class='fn'>2282</sup>

Yet when We bestow Our favors on man he turns away and becomes\n\t\t\tremote on his side (instead of coming to Us) and when Evil seizes\n\t\t\thim he gives himself up to despair! <sup class='fn'>2283</sup>
Say: "Everyone acts according to his own disposition: but your\n\t\t\tLord knows best who it is that is best guided on the Way."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2284</sup>

They ask thee concerning the Spirit (of inspiration). Say: "The\n\t\t\tSpirit (cometh) by command of my Lord: of knowledge it is only a\n\t\t\tlittle that is communicated to you (O men!) <sup class='fn'>2285</sup>
If it were Our Will We could take away that which We have sent\n\t\t\tthee by inspiration: then would thou find none to plead thy\n\t\t\taffair in that matter as against Us <sup class='fn'>2286</sup>
Except for Mercy from thy Lord: for His Bounty is to thee\n\t\t\t(indeed) great. <sup class='fn'>2287</sup>

Say: "If the whole of mankind and Jinns were to gather together
			to produce the like of this Qur'an they could not produce the
			like thereof even if they backed up each other with help and
			support. <sup class='fn'>2288</sup> <sup class='fn'>2289</sup>

And We have explained to man in this Qur'an every kind of\n\t\t\tsimilitude: yet the grater part of men refuse (to receive it)\n\t\t\texcept with ingratitude! <sup class='fn'>2290</sup> <sup class='fn'>2291</sup>
They say: "We shall not believe in thee until thou cause spring\n\t\t\tto gush forth for us from the earth <sup class='fn'>2292</sup>
"Or (until) thou have a garden of date trees and vines and cause\n\t\t\trivers to gush forth in their midst carrying abundant water;\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2293</sup>

"Or thou cause the sky to fall in pieces as thou sayest (will\n\t\t\thappen) against us; or thou bring Allah and the angels before\n\t\t\t(us) face to face; <sup class='fn'>2294</sup> <sup class='fn'>2295</sup>

"Or thou have a house adorned with gold or thou mount a ladder
			right into the skies.  No we shall not even believe in thy
			mounting until thou send down to us a book that we could read."
			Say: "Glory to my Lord! am I aught but a man an apostle?"
			<sup class='fn'>2296</sup> <sup class='fn'>2297</sup> <sup class='fn'>2298</sup>
What kept men back from Belief when Guidance came to them was\n\t\t\tnothing but this: they said "Has Allah sent a man like us) to be\n\t\t\t(His) Apostle?" <sup class='fn'>2299</sup>
Say "If there were settled on earth angels walking about in peace\n\t\t\tand quiet We should certainly have sent them down from the\n\t\t\theavens an angel for an apostle." <sup class='fn'>2300</sup>
Say: "Enough is Allah for a witness between me and you: for He is\n\t\t\twell-acquainted with His servants and He sees (all things)."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2301</sup>

It is he whom Allah guides that is on true guidance; but he whom
			He leaves astray for such wilt thou find no protector besides
			Him.  On the Day of Judgment We shall gather them together prone
			on their faces blind dumb and deaf: their abode will be Hell:
			every time it shows abatement We shall increase for them the
			fierceness of the Fire. <sup class='fn'>2302</sup> <sup class='fn'>2303</sup>

That is their recompense because they rejected Our Signs and said\n\t\t\t"When we are reduced to bones and broken dust should we really be\n\t\t\traised up (to be) a new Creation?" <sup class='fn'>2304</sup>

See they not that Allah Who created the heavens and the earth has
			power to create the like of them (anew)? Only He has decreed a
			term appointed of which there is no doubt. But the unjust refuse
			(to receive it) except with ingratitude. <sup class='fn'>2305</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2306</sup>
Say: "If ye had control of the Treasures of the Mercy of my Lord\n\t\t\tbehold ye would keep them back for fear of spending them: for man\n\t\t\tis (ever) niggardly!" <sup class='fn'>2307</sup>

To Moses We did give nine Clear Signs: ask the Children of
			Israel: when he came to them Pharaoh said to him: "O Moses! I
			consider thee indeed to have been worked upon by sorcery!"
			<sup class='fn'>2308</sup> <sup class='fn'>2309</sup> <sup class='fn'>2310</sup>

Moses said "Thou knowest well that these things have been sent
			down by none but the Lord of the heavens and the earth as
			eye-opening evidence: and I consider thee indeed O Pharaoh to be
			one doomed to destruction!" <sup class='fn'>2311</sup>
So he resolved to remove them from the face of the earth: but We\n\t\t\tdid drown him and all who were with him. <sup class='fn'>2312</sup>

And We said thereafter to the Children of Israel "Dwell securely
			in the land (of promise)": but when the second of the warnings
			came to pass We gathered you together in a mingled crowd.
			<sup class='fn'>2313</sup> <sup class='fn'>2314</sup>
We sent down the (Qur'an) in Truth and in Truth has it descended:\n\t\t\tand We sent thee but to give Glad Tidings and to warn (sinners).\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2315</sup> <sup class='fn'>2316</sup>

(It is) a Qur'an which We have divided (into parts from time to\n\t\t\ttime) in order that thou mightest recite it to men at intervals:\n\t\t\tWe have revealed it by stages. <sup class='fn'>2317</sup>

Say: "Whether ye believe in it or not it is true that those who\n\t\t\twere given knowledge beforehand when it is recited to them fall\n\t\t\tdown on their faces in humble prostration" <sup class='fn'>2318</sup>
And say: "Glory to our Lord! truly has the promise of our Lord\n\t\t\tbeen fulfilled!" <sup class='fn'>2319</sup>
They fall down on their faces in tears and it increases their\n\t\t\t(earnest) humility. <sup class='fn'>2320</sup>

Say: "Call upon Allah or call upon Rahman: by whatever name ye
			call upon Him (it is well): for to Him belong the Most Beautiful
			Names. Neither speak thy Prayer aloud nor speak it in a low tone
			but seek a middle course between." <sup class='fn'>2321</sup> <sup class='fn'>2322</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2323</sup>

Say: "Praise be to Allah Who begets no son and has no partner in
			(His) dominion: nor (needs) He any to protect Him from
			humiliation: Yea magnify Him for His greatness and glory!"
			<sup class='fn'>2324</sup>
Praise be to Allah Who hath sent to His Servant the Book and hath\n\t\t\tallowed therein no Crookedness: <sup class='fn'>2325</sup> <sup class='fn'>2326</sup>

(He hath made it) Straight (and Clear) in order that He may warn
			(the godless) of a terrible Punishment from Him and that He may
			give Glad Tidings to the Believers who work righteous deeds that
			they shall have a goodly Reward. <sup class='fn'>2327</sup>
Wherein they shall remain forever: <sup class='fn'>2328</sup>
Further that He may warn those (also) who say "Allah hath\n\t\t\tbegotten a son": <sup class='fn'>2329</sup>

No knowledge have they of such a thing nor had their fathers.  It\n\t\t\tis a grievous thing that issues from their mouths as a saying. \n\t\t\tWhat they say is nothing but falsehood! <sup class='fn'>2330</sup>
Thou wouldst only perchance fret thyself to death following after\n\t\t\tthem in grief if they believe not in this Message. <sup class='fn'>2331</sup>
That which is on earth We have made but as a glittering show for\n\t\t\tthe earth in order that We may test them as to which of them are\n\t\t\tbest in conduct. <sup class='fn'>2332</sup>
Verily what is on earth We shall make but as dust and dry soil\n\t\t\t(without growth or herbage). <sup class='fn'>2333</sup>

Or dost thou reflect that the Companions of the Cave and of the\n\t\t\tInscription were wonders among Our Signs? <sup class='fn'>2334</sup>\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2335</sup> <sup class='fn'>2336</sup>

Behold the youths betook themselves to the Cave: they said "Our\n\t\t\tLord! bestow on us Mercy from Thyself and dispose of our affair\n\t\t\tfor us in the right way! <sup class='fn'>2337</sup> <sup class='fn'>2338</sup>
Then We drew (a veil) over their ears for a number of years in\n\t\t\tthe cave (so that they heard not): <sup class='fn'>2339</sup>
Then We roused them in order to test which of the two parties was\n\t\t\tbest at calculating the term of years they had tarried!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2340</sup> <sup class='fn'>2341</sup>
We relate to thee their story in truth: they were youths who\n\t\t\tbelieved in their Lord and We advanced them in guidance:\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2342</sup>

We gave strength to their hearts: Behold they stood up and said:
			"Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and of the earth: never
			shall we call upon any god other than Him: if we did; we should
			indeed have uttered an enormity!" <sup class='fn'>2343</sup> <sup class='fn'>2344</sup>

"These our people have taken for worship gods other than Him: why
			do they not bring forward an authority clear (and convincing) for
			what they do? Who doth more wrong than such as invent a falsehood
			against Allah? <sup class='fn'>2345</sup>

"When ye turn away from them and the things they worship other
			than Allah betake yourselves to the Cave: your Lord will shower
			his mercies on you and dispose of your affair towards comfort and
			ease." <sup class='fn'>2346</sup>

Thou wouldst have seen the sun when it rose declining to the
			right from their Cave and when it set turning away from them to
			the left while they lay in the open space in the midst of the
			Cave.  Such are among the Signs of Allah: he whom Allah guided;
			but he whom Allah leaves to stray for him wilt thou find no
			protector to lead him to the Right Way. <sup class='fn'>2347</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2348</sup>

Thou wouldst have deemed them awake whilst they were asleep and
			We turned them on their right and their left sides: their dog
			stretching forth his two forelegs on the threshold: if thou hadst
			come up on to them thou wouldst have certainly turned back from
			them in flight and wouldst certainly have been filled with terror
			of them. <sup class='fn'>2349</sup> <sup class='fn'>2350</sup> <sup class='fn'>2351</sup>

Such (being their state) We raised them up (from sleep) that they
			might question each other.  Said one of them "How long have ye
			stayed (here)?" They said "We have stayed (perhaps) a day or part
			of a day." (At length) they (all) said "Allah (alone) knows best
			how long ye have stayed here...Now send ye then one of you with
			this money of yours to the town: let him find out which is the
			best food (to be had) and bring some to you that (ye may) satisfy
			hunger herewith: and let him behave with care and courtesy and
			let him not inform anyone about you. <sup class='fn'>2352</sup> <sup class='fn'>2353</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2354</sup>

"For if thy should come upon you they would stone you or force\n\t\t\tyou to return to their cult and in that case ye would never\n\t\t\tattain prosperity." <sup class='fn'>2355</sup> <sup class='fn'>2356</sup>

Thus did We make their case known to the people that they might
			know that the promise of Allah is true and that there can be no
			doubt about the Hour of Judgment.  Behold they dispute among
			themselves as to their affair.	(Some) said "Construct a building
			over them": their Lord knows best about them: those who prevailed
			over their affair said "Let us surely build a place of worship
			over them." <sup class='fn'>2357</sup> <sup class='fn'>2358</sup>

(Some) say they were three the dog being the fourth among them;
			(others) say they were five the dog being the sixth doubtfully
			guessing at the unknown; (yet others) say they were seven the dog
			being the eighth.  Say thou: "My Lord knoweth best their number;
			it is but few that know their (real case)." Enter not therefore
			into controversies concerning them except on a matter that is
			clear nor consult any of them about (the affair of) the Sleepers.
			<sup class='fn'>2359</sup> <sup class='fn'>2360</sup> <sup class='fn'>2361</sup> <sup class='fn'>2362</sup>
Nor say of anything "I shall be sure to do so and so tomorrow"

Without adding "So please Allah!" And call thy Lord to mind when
			thou forgettest and say "I hope that my Lord will guide me ever
			closer (even) than this to the right road." <sup class='fn'>2363</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2364</sup>
So they stayed in their Cave three hundred years and (some) add\n\t\t\tnine (more). <sup class='fn'>2365</sup>

Say: "Allah knows best how long they stayed: with Him is (the
			knowledge of) the secrets of the heavens and the earth: how
			clearly He sees how finely He hears (everything)! They have no
			protector other than Him; nor does He share His Command with any
			person whatsoever. <sup class='fn'>2366</sup> <sup class='fn'>2367</sup>
And recite (and teach) what has been revealed to thee of the Book\n\t\t\tof thy Lord: none can change His Words and none wilt thou find as\n\t\t\ta refuge other than Him. <sup class='fn'>2368</sup>

And keep thy soul content with those who call on their Lord
			morning and evening seeking his Face; and let not thine eyes pass
			beyond them seeking the pomp and glitter of this Life; nor obey
			any whose heart We have permitted to neglect the remembrance of
			Us one who follows his own desires whose case has gone beyond all
			bounds. <sup class='fn'>2369</sup> <sup class='fn'>2370</sup>

Say "The Truth is from your Lord": let him who will believe and
			let him who will reject (it): for the wrongdoers We have prepared
			a Fire whose (smoke and flames) like the wall and roof of a tent
			will hem them in: if they implore relief they will be granted
			water like melted brass that will scald their faces.  How
			dreadful the drink! How uncomfortable a couch to recline on!
			<sup class='fn'>2371</sup>
As to those who believe and work righteousness verily We shall\n\t\t\tnot suffer to perish the reward of any who do a (single)\n\t\t\trighteous deed. <sup class='fn'>2372</sup>

For them will be Gardens of Eternity; beneath them rivers will
			flow; they will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and
			they will wear green garments of fine silk and heavy brocade;
			they will recline therein on raised thrones.  How good the
			recompense! How beautiful a couch to recline on! <sup class='fn'>2373</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2374</sup>

Set forth to them the parable of two men: for one of them We
			provided two gardens of grapevines and surrounded them with
			date-palms: in between the two We placed corn-fields.
			<sup class='fn'>2375</sup>
Each of those gardens brought forth its produce and failed not in\n\t\t\tthe least therein: in the midst of them We caused a river to\n\t\t\tflow.

(Abundant) was the produce this man had: he said to his companion\n\t\t\tin the course of a mutual argument: "More wealth have I than you\n\t\t\tand more honor and power in (my following of) men." <sup class='fn'>2376</sup>
He went into his garden in a state (of mind) unjust to his soul:\n\t\t\tHe said "I deem not that this will ever perish. <sup class='fn'>2377</sup>
"Nor do I deem that the Hour (of Judgment) will (ever) come: even\n\t\t\tif I am brought back to my Lord I shall surely find (there)\n\t\t\tsomething better in exchange." <sup class='fn'>2378</sup>

His companion said to him in the course of the argument with him:\n\t\t\t"Dost thou deny Him Who created thee out of dust then out of a\n\t\t\tsperm-drop then fashioned thee into a man? <sup class='fn'>2379</sup>
"But (I think) for my part that He is Allah my Lord and none\n\t\t\tshall I associate with my Lord.

"Why didst thou not as thou wentest into thy garden say: `Allah's\n\t\t\tWill (be done)! There is no power but with Allah!' If thou dost\n\t\t\tsee me less than thee in wealth and sons <sup class='fn'>2380</sup>
"It may be that my Lord will give me something better than thy\n\t\t\tgarden and that He will send on thy garden thunderbolts (by way\n\t\t\tof reckoning) from heaven making it (but) slippery sand!
"Or the water of the garden will run off underground so that thou\n\t\t\twilt never be able to find it." <sup class='fn'>2381</sup>

So his fruits (and enjoyment) were encompassed (with ruin) and he
			remained twisting and turning his hands over what he had spent on
			his property which had (now) tumbled to pieces to its very
			foundations and he could only say "Woe is me! would I had never
			ascribed partners to my Lord and Cherisher!" <sup class='fn'>2382</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2383</sup>
Nor had he numbers to help him against Allah nor was he able to\n\t\t\tdeliver himself. <sup class='fn'>2384</sup>
There the (only) protection comes from Allah the True One.  He is\n\t\t\tthe Best to reward and the Best to give success. <sup class='fn'>2385</sup>

Set forth to them the similitude of the life of this world: it is
			like the rain which We send down from the skies: the earth's
			vegetation absorbs it but soon it becomes dry stubble which the
			winds do scatter: it is (only) Allah Who prevails over all
			things. <sup class='fn'>2386</sup>

Wealth and sons are allurements of the life of this world: but
			the things that endure Good Deeds are best in the sight of thy
			Lord as rewards and best as (the foundation for) hopes.
			<sup class='fn'>2387</sup>

One Day We shall remove the mountains and thou wilt see the earth\n\t\t\tas a level stretch and We shall gather them all together nor\n\t\t\tshall We leave out any one of them. <sup class='fn'>2388</sup>

And they will be marshalled before thy Lord in ranks (with the
			announcement) "Now have ye come to Us (bare) as We created you
			first: aye ye thought We shall not fulfil the appointment made to
			you to meet (Us)!": <sup class='fn'>2389</sup> <sup class='fn'>2390</sup>

And the Book (of Deeds) will be placed (before you); and thou
			wilt see the sinful in great terror because of what is (recorded)
			therein; they will say "Ah! woe to us! what a book is this! It
			leaves out nothing small or great but takes account thereof!"
			They will find all that they did placed before them: and not one
			will thy Lord treat with injustice. <sup class='fn'>2391</sup>

Behold! We said to the angels "Bow down to Adam": they bowed down
			except Iblis.  He was one of the Jinns and he broke the Command
			of his Lord.  Will ye then take him and his progeny as protectors
			rather than Me? And they are enemies to you! Evil would be the
			exchange for the wrongdoers! <sup class='fn'>2392</sup> <sup class='fn'>2393</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2394</sup> <sup class='fn'>2395</sup>

I called them not to witness the creation of the heavens and the\n\t\t\tearth nor (even) their own creation: nor is it for Me to take as\n\t\t\thelpers such as lead (men) astray! <sup class='fn'>2396</sup>

One Day He will say "Call on those whom ye thought to be My
			partners" and they will call on them but they will not listen to
			them; and We shall make for them a place of common perdition.
			<sup class='fn'>2397</sup>
And the Sinful shall see the Fire and apprehend that they have to\n\t\t\tall therein; no means will they find to turn away therefrom.
We have explained in detail in this Qur'an for the benefit of\n\t\t\tmankind every kind of similitude: but man is in most things\n\t\t\tcontentious. <sup class='fn'>2398</sup>

And what is there to keep back men from believing now that
			Guidance has come to them nor from praying for forgiveness from
			their Lord but that (they ask that) the ways of the ancients be
			repeated with them or the Wrath be brought to them face to face?
			<sup class='fn'>2399</sup>

We only send the Apostles to give glad tidings and to give
			warnings: but the Unbelievers dispute with vain argument in order
			therewith to weaken the truth and they treat My Signs as a jest
			as also the fact that they are warned! <sup class='fn'>2400</sup>

And who doth more wrong than one who is reminded of the Signs of
			his Lord but turns away from them forgetting the (deeds) which
			his hands have sent forth? Verily We have set veils over their
			hearts lest they should understand this and over their ears
			deafness.  If thou callest them to guidance even then will they
			never accept guidance. <sup class='fn'>2401</sup>

But your Lord is Most Forgiving Full of Mercy.	If He were to
			call them (at once) to account for what they have earned then
			surely He would have hastened their Punishment: but they have
			their appointed time beyond which they will find no refuge.
			<sup class='fn'>2402</sup>
Such were the populations We destroyed when they committed\n\t\t\tiniquities; but We fixed an appointed time for their destruction.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2403</sup>

Behold Moses said to his attendant "I will not give up until I\n\t\t\treach the junction of the two seas or (until) I spend years and\n\t\t\tyears in travel." <sup class='fn'>2404</sup> <sup class='fn'>2405</sup> <sup class='fn'>2406</sup>
But when they reached the Junction they forgot (about) their Fish\n\t\t\twhich took its course through the sea (straight) as in a tunnel.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2407</sup> <sup class='fn'>2408</sup>

When they had passed on (some distance) Moses said to his\n\t\t\tattendant: "Bring us our early meal; truly we have suffered much\n\t\t\tfatigue at this (stage of) our journey." <sup class='fn'>2409</sup>

He replied: "Sawest thou (what happened) when we betook ourselves
			to the rock? I did indeed forget (about) the Fish: none but Satan
			made me forget to tell (you) about it: it took its course through
			the sea in a marvelous way!" <sup class='fn'>2410</sup>
Moses said: "That was what we were seeking after": so they went\n\t\t\tback on their footsteps following (the path they had come).

So they found one of Our servants on whom We had bestowed Mercy\n\t\t\tfrom Ourselves and whom We had taught knowledge from Our own\n\t\t\tpresence. <sup class='fn'>2411</sup> <sup class='fn'>2412</sup>
Moses said to him: "May I follow thee on the footing that thou\n\t\t\tteach me something of the (Higher) Truth which thou hast been\n\t\t\ttaught?" <sup class='fn'>2413</sup>
(The other) said: "Verily thou wilt not be able to have patience\n\t\t\twith me! <sup class='fn'>2414</sup>
"And how canst thou have patience about things about which thy\n\t\t\tunderstanding is not complete?" <sup class='fn'>2415</sup>
Moses said: "Thou wilt find me if Allah so will (truly) patient:\n\t\t\tnor shall I disobey thee in aught." <sup class='fn'>2416</sup>
The other said: "If then thou wouldst follow me ask me no\n\t\t\tquestions about anything until I myself speak to thee concerning\n\t\t\tit."

So they both proceeded: until when they were in the boat he
			scuttled it.  Said Moses: "Hast thou scuttled it in order to
			drown those in it? Truly a strange thing hast thou done!"
			<sup class='fn'>2417</sup>
He answered: "Did I not tell thee that thou canst have no\n\t\t\tpatience with me?"
Moses said: "Rebuke me not for forgetting nor grieve me by\n\t\t\traising difficulties in my case."

Then they proceeded: until when they met a young man he slew him.
			Moses said: "Hast thou slain an innocent person who had slain
			none? Truly a foul (unheard-of) thing hast thou done!"
			<sup class='fn'>2418</sup>
He answered: "Did I not tell thee that thou canst have no\n\t\t\tpatience with me?"
(Moses) said: "If ever I ask thee about anything after this keep\n\t\t\tme not in thy company: then wouldst thou have received (full)\n\t\t\texcuse from my side."

Then they proceeded: until when they came to the inhabitants of a
			town they asked them for food but they refused them hospitality.
			They found there a wall on the point of falling down but he set
			it up straight.  (Moses) said: "If thou hadst wished surely thou
			couldst have exacted some recompense for it!" <sup class='fn'>2419</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2420</sup>
He answered: "This is the parting between me and thee: now will I\n\t\t\ttell thee the interpretation of (those things) over which thou\n\t\t\twast unable to hold patience. <sup class='fn'>2421</sup>

As for the boat it belonged to certain men in dire want: they
			plied on the water: I but wished to render it unserviceable for
			there was after them a certain king who seized on every boat by
			force. <sup class='fn'>2422</sup>
"As for the youth his parents were people of Faith and we feared\n\t\t\tthat he would grieve them by obstinate rebellion and ingratitude\n\t\t\t(to Allah and man). <sup class='fn'>2423</sup>
"So we desired that their Lord would give them in exchange (a\n\t\t\tson) better in purity (of conduct) and closer in affection.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2424</sup>

"As for the wall it belonged to two youths orphans in the Town;
			there was beneath it a buried treasure to which they were
			entitled: their father had been a righteous man: so thy Lord
			desired that they should attain their age of full strength and
			get out their treasure	a mercy (and favor) from thy Lord.  I did
			it not of my own accord. Such is the interpretation of (those
			things) over which thou wast unable to hold patience."
			<sup class='fn'>2425</sup> <sup class='fn'>2426</sup> <sup class='fn'>2427</sup>
They ask thee concerning Zul-qarnain.  Say "I will rehearse to\n\t\t\tyou something of his story." <sup class='fn'>2428</sup>
Verily We established his power on earth and We gave him the ways\n\t\t\tand the means to all ends. <sup class='fn'>2429</sup>
One (such) way he followed

Until when he reached the setting of the sun He found it set in a
			spring of murky water: near it he found a People: We said: "O
			Zul-qarnain! (thou hast authority) either to punish them or to
			treat them with kindness." <sup class='fn'>2430</sup> <sup class='fn'>2431</sup>
He said: "Whoever doth wrong him shall we punish; then shall he\n\t\t\tbe sent back to his Lord; and He will punish him with a\n\t\t\tpunishment unheard-of (before). <sup class='fn'>2432</sup>
"But whoever believes and works righteousness he shall have a\n\t\t\tgoodly reward and easy will be his task as we order it by our\n\t\t\tcommand." <sup class='fn'>2433</sup>
Then followed he (another) way.

Until when he came to the rising of the sun he found it rising on\n\t\t\ta people for whom We had provided no covering protection against\n\t\t\tthe sun. <sup class='fn'>2434</sup> <sup class='fn'>2435</sup>
(He left them) as they were: We completely understood what was\n\t\t\tbefore him. <sup class='fn'>2436</sup>
Then followed he (another) way
Until when he reached (a tract) between two mountains he found\n\t\t\tbeneath them a people who scarcely understood a word.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2437</sup> <sup class='fn'>2438</sup>

They said: "O Zul-qarnain! the Gog and Magog (people) do great
			mischief on earth: shall we then render thee tribute in order
			that thou mightest erect a barrier between us and them?"
			<sup class='fn'>2439</sup>

He said: "(The power) in which my Lord has established me is
			better (than tribute): help me therefore with strength (and
			labor): I will erect a strong barrier between you and them:
			<sup class='fn'>2440</sup>

"Bring me blocks of iron." At length when he had filled up the
			space between the two steep mountain sides he said "Blow (with
			your bellows)." Then when he had made it (red) as fire he said:
			"Bring me that I may pour over it molten lead." <sup class='fn'>2441</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2442</sup>
Thus were they made powerless to scale it or to dig through it.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2443</sup>
He said: "This is a mercy from my Lord: but when the promise of\n\t\t\tmy Lord comes to pass He will make it into dust; and the promise\n\t\t\tof My Lord is true." <sup class='fn'>2444</sup>
On that day We shall leave them to surge like waves on one\n\t\t\tanother; the trumpet will be blown and We shall collect them all\n\t\t\ttogether. <sup class='fn'>2445</sup>
And We shall present Hell that day for Unbelievers to see all\n\t\t\tspread out <sup class='fn'>2446</sup>
(Unbelievers) whose eyes had been under a veil from Remembrance\n\t\t\tof Me and who had been unable even to hear. <sup class='fn'>2447</sup>
Do the Unbelievers think that they can take my servants as\n\t\t\tprotectors besides Me? Verily We have prepared Hell for the\n\t\t\tUnbelievers for (their) entertainment.
Say: "Shall we tell you of those who lose most in respect of\n\t\t\ttheir deeds? <sup class='fn'>2448</sup>
"Those whose efforts have been wasted in this life while they\n\t\t\tthought that they were acquiring good by their works?"\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2449</sup>

They are those who deny the Signs of their Lord and the fact of
			their having to meet Him (in the Hereafter): vain will be their
			works nor shall We on the Day of Judgment give them any Weight.
			<sup class='fn'>2450</sup>
That is their reward Hell; because they rejected Faith and took\n\t\t\tMy Signs and My Messengers by way of jest. <sup class='fn'>2451</sup>
As to those who believe and work righteous deeds they have for\n\t\t\ttheir entertainment the Gardens of Paradise <sup class='fn'>2452</sup>
Wherein they shall dwell (for aye): no change will they wish for\n\t\t\tfrom them.

Say: "If the ocean were ink (wherewith to write out) the words of
			my Lord sooner would the ocean be exhausted than would the words
			of my Lord even if we added another ocean like it for its aid."
			<sup class='fn'>2453</sup>

Say: "I am but a man like yourselves (but) the inspiration has
			come to me that your Allah is one Allah: whoever expects to meet
			his Lord let him work righteousness and in the worship of his
			Lord admit no one as partner." <sup class='fn'>2454</sup>
Kaf. Ha. Ya. `Ain.  Sad. <sup class='fn'>2455</sup>
(This is) a recital of the Mercy of thy Lord to His Servant\n\t\t\tZakariya. <sup class='fn'>2456</sup>
Behold! he cried to his Lord in secret <sup class='fn'>2457</sup>
Praying: "O my Lord! infirm indeed are my bones and the hair of\n\t\t\tmy head doth glisten with grey: but never am I unblest O my Lord\n\t\t\tin my prayer to Thee! <sup class='fn'>2458</sup>
"Now I fear (what) my relatives (and colleagues) (will do) after\n\t\t\tme: but my wife is barren: so give me an heir as from Thyself\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2459</sup>
"(One that) will (truly) represent me and represent the posterity\n\t\t\tof Jacob; and make him O my Lord! one with whom Thou art\n\t\t\twell-pleased!" <sup class='fn'>2460</sup>
(His prayer was answered): "O Zakariya! We give thee good news of\n\t\t\ta son: his name shall be Yahya: on none by that name have We\n\t\t\tconferred distinction before." <sup class='fn'>2461</sup>
He said: "O my Lord! how shall I have a son when my wife is\n\t\t\tbarren and I have grown quite decrepit from old age?"
He said: "So (it will be): thy Lord saith `That is easy for Me: I\n\t\t\tdid indeed create thee before when thou hadst been nothing!' "\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2462</sup> <sup class='fn'>2463</sup>

(Zakariya) said "O my Lord! give me a Sign." "Thy Sign" was the\n\t\t\tanswer "shall be that thou shalt speak to no man for three nights\n\t\t\talthough thou art not dumb." <sup class='fn'>2464</sup> <sup class='fn'>2465</sup>
So Zakariya came out to his people from his chamber: he told them\n\t\t\tby signs to celebrate Allah's praises in the morning and in the\n\t\t\tevening.
(To his son came the command): "O Yahya! take hold of the Book\n\t\t\twith might": and We gave him wisdom even as a youth.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2466</sup> <sup class='fn'>2467</sup>
And pity (for all creatures) as from Us and purity: he was devout\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2468</sup>
And kind to his parents and he was not overbearing or rebellious.
So Peace on him the day he was born the day that he dies and the\n\t\t\tday that he will be raised up to life (again)! <sup class='fn'>2469</sup>
Relate in the Book (the story of) Mary when she withdrew from her\n\t\t\tfamily to a place in the East. <sup class='fn'>2470</sup> <sup class='fn'>2471</sup>
She placed a screen (to screen herself) from them: then We sent\n\t\t\tto her Our angel and he appeared before her as a man in all\n\t\t\trespects.
She said: "I seek refuge from thee to (Allah) Most Gracious:\n\t\t\t(come not near) if thou dost fear Allah."
He said: "Nay I am only a messenger from thy Lord (to announce)\n\t\t\tto thee the gift of a holy son." <sup class='fn'>2472</sup>
She said: "How shall I have a son seeing that no man has touched\n\t\t\tme and I am not unchaste?"

He said: "So (it will be): thy Lord saith `That is easy for Me:\n\t\t\tand (We wish) to appoint him as a Sign unto men and a Mercy from\n\t\t\tUs': it is a matter (so) decreed." <sup class='fn'>2473</sup> <sup class='fn'>2474</sup>
So she conceived him and she retired with him to a remote place.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2475</sup>

And the pains of childbirth drove her to the trunk of a
			palm-tree: she cried (in her anguish): "Ah! would that I had died
			before this! Would that I had been a thing forgotten and out of
			sight!" <sup class='fn'>2476</sup>
But (a voice) cried to her from beneath the (palm-free): "Grieve\n\t\t\tnot! for thy Lord hath provided a rivulet beneath thee;
"And shake towards thyself the trunk of the palm-tree: it will\n\t\t\tlet fall fresh ripe dates upon thee. <sup class='fn'>2477</sup>

"So eat and drink and cool (thine) eye.  And if thou dost see any
			man say `I have vowed a fast to (Allah) Most Gracious and this
			day will I enter into no talk with any human being.' "
			<sup class='fn'>2478</sup> <sup class='fn'>2479</sup>
At length she brought the (babe) to her people carrying him (in\n\t\t\ther arms).  They said: "O Mary! truly an amazing thing hast thou\n\t\t\tbrought! <sup class='fn'>2480</sup>
"O sister of Aaron! thy father was not a man of evil nor thy\n\t\t\tmother a woman unchaste!" <sup class='fn'>2481</sup>
But she pointed to the babe.  They said: "How can we talk to one\n\t\t\twho is a child in the cradle?" <sup class='fn'>2482</sup>
He said: "I am indeed a servant of Allah: He hath given me\n\t\t\trevelation and made me a prophet;
"And He hath made me Blessed wheresoever I be and hath enjoined\n\t\t\ton me Prayer and Charity as long as I live; <sup class='fn'>2483</sup>
"(He) hath made me kind to my mother and not overbearing or\n\t\t\tmiserable; <sup class='fn'>2484</sup>
"So Peace is on me the day I was born the day that I die and the\n\t\t\tDay that I shall be raised up to life (again)"! <sup class='fn'>2485</sup>
Such (was) Jesus the son of Mary: (it is) a statement of truth\n\t\t\tabout which they (vainly) dispute. <sup class='fn'>2486</sup>
It is not befitting to (the majesty of) Allah that He should\n\t\t\tbeget a son.  Glory be to Him! When He determines a matter He\n\t\t\tonly says to it "Be" and it is. <sup class='fn'>2487</sup>
Verily Allah is my Lord and your Lord: Him therefore serve ye:\n\t\t\tthis is a Way that is straight. <sup class='fn'>2488</sup>
But the sects differ among themselves: and woe to the Unbelievers\n\t\t\tbecause of the (coming) Judgment of a momentous Day!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2489</sup>
How plainly will they see and hear the Day that they will appear\n\t\t\tbefore Us! But the unjust today are in error manifest!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2490</sup>
But warn them of the Day of Distress when the matter will be\n\t\t\tdetermined: for (behold) they are negligent and they do not\n\t\t\tbelieve! <sup class='fn'>2491</sup>
It is We Who will inherit the earth and all beings thereon: to Us\n\t\t\twill they all be returned. <sup class='fn'>2492</sup>
Also mention in the Book (the story of) Abraham: he was a man of\n\t\t\tTruth a prophet.
Behold he said to his father: "O my father! why worship that\n\t\t\twhich heareth not and seeth not and can profit thee nothing?\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2493</sup>

"O my father! to me hath come knowledge which hath not reached\n\t\t\tthee: so follow me: I will guide thee to a Way that is even and\n\t\t\tstraight. <sup class='fn'>2494</sup> <sup class='fn'>2495</sup>
"O my father! serve not Satan: for Satan is a rebel against\n\t\t\t(Allah) Most Gracious. <sup class='fn'>2496</sup>
"O my father! I fear lest a Penalty afflict thee from (Allah)\n\t\t\tMost Gracious so that thou become to Satan a friend."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2497</sup>
(The father) replied: "Dost thou hate my gods O Abraham? If thou\n\t\t\tforbear not I will indeed stone thee: now get away from me for a\n\t\t\tgood long while!" <sup class='fn'>2498</sup>
Abraham said: "Peace be on thee: I will pray to my Lord for thy\n\t\t\tforgiveness: for He is to me Most Gracious. <sup class='fn'>2499</sup>

"And I will turn away from you (all) and from those whom ye\n\t\t\tinvoke besides Allah: I will call on my Lord: Perhaps by my\n\t\t\tprayer to my Lord I shall be not unblest." <sup class='fn'>2500</sup>
When he had turned away from them and from those whom they\n\t\t\tworshipped besides Allah We bestowed on him Isaac and Jacob and\n\t\t\teach one of them We made a prophet. <sup class='fn'>2501</sup>
And We bestowed of Our Mercy on them and We granted them lofty\n\t\t\thonor on the tongue of truth. <sup class='fn'>2502</sup>
Also mention in the Book (the story of) Moses: for he was\n\t\t\tspecially chosen and he was an apostle (and) a prophet.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2503</sup>
And We called him from the right side of Mount (Sinai) and made\n\t\t\thim draw near to Us for mystic (converse). <sup class='fn'>2504</sup>
And out of Our Mercy We gave him his brother Aaron (also) a\n\t\t\tprophet. <sup class='fn'>2505</sup>
Also mention in the Book (the story of) Ismail: He was (strictly)\n\t\t\ttrue to what he promised and he was an apostle (and) a prophet.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2506</sup>
He used to enjoin on his people Prayer and Charity and he was\n\t\t\tmost acceptable in the sight of his Lord. <sup class='fn'>2507</sup>
Also mention in the Book the case of Idris: he was a man of truth\n\t\t\t(and sincerity) (and) a prophet: <sup class='fn'>2508</sup>
And We raised him to a lofty station.

Those were some of the prophets on whom Allah did bestow His
			Grace of the posterity of Adam and of those whom We carried (in
			the Ark) with Noah and of the posterity of Abraham and Israel of
			those whom We guided and chose; whenever the Signs of (Allah)
			Most Gracious were rehearsed to them they would fall down in
			prostrate adoration and in tears. <sup class='fn'>2509</sup> <sup class='fn'>2510</sup>
But after them there followed a posterity who missed prayers and\n\t\t\tfollowed after lusts: soon then will they face Destruction\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2511</sup>
Except those who repent and believe and work righteousness: for\n\t\t\tthese will enter the Garden and will not be wronged in the least
Gardens of Eternity those which (Allah) Most Gracious has\n\t\t\tpromised to His servants in the Unseen: for His promise must\n\t\t\t(necessarily) come to pass.

They will not there hear any vain discourse but only salutations\n\t\t\tof peace: and they will have therein their sustenance morning and\n\t\t\tevening. <sup class='fn'>2512</sup> <sup class='fn'>2513</sup>
Such is the Garden which We give as an inheritance to those of\n\t\t\tOur Servants who guard against evil.

(The angels say:) "We descend not but by command of thy Lord: to\n\t\t\tHim belongeth what is before us and what is behind us and what is\n\t\t\tbetween: and thy Lord never doth forget" <sup class='fn'>2514</sup>

"Lord of the heavens and of the earth and of all that is between
			them: so worship Him and be constant and patient in His worship:
			knowest thou of any who is worthy of the same Name as He?"
			<sup class='fn'>2515</sup>
Man says: "What! when I am dead shall I then be raised up alive?"
But does not man call to mind that We created him before out of\n\t\t\tnothing?

So by thy Lord without doubt We shall gather them together and\n\t\t\t(also) the Evil Ones (with them); then shall We bring them forth\n\t\t\ton their knees round about Hell; <sup class='fn'>2516</sup> <sup class='fn'>2517</sup>
Then shall We certainly drag out from every sect all those who\n\t\t\twere worst in obstinate rebellion against (Allah) Most Gracious.
And certainly We know best those who are most worthy of being\n\t\t\tburned therein.
Not one of you but will pass over it: this is with thy Lord a\n\t\t\tDecree which must be accomplished. <sup class='fn'>2518</sup>
But We shall save those who guarded against evil and We shall\n\t\t\tleave the wrongdoers therein (humbled) to their knees.

When Our Clear Signs are rehearsed to them the Unbelievers say to\n\t\t\tthose who believe "Which of the two sides is best in point of\n\t\t\tposition? Which makes the best show in council?" <sup class='fn'>2519</sup>
But how many (countless) generations before them have We\n\t\t\tdestroyed who were even better in equipment and in glitter to the\n\t\t\teye?

Say: "If any men go astray (Allah) Most Gracious extends (the
			rope) to them. Until when they see the warning of Allah (being
			fulfilled)  either in punishment or in (the approach of) the Hour
			they will at length realize who is worst in position and (who)
			weakest in forces! <sup class='fn'>2520</sup>

"And Allah doth advance in guidance those who seek guidance; and
			the things that endure. Good Deeds are best in the sight of thy
			Lord as rewards and best in respect of (their) eventual returns."
			<sup class='fn'>2521</sup>
Hast thou then seen the (sort of) man who rejects Our Signs yet\n\t\t\tsays: "I shall certainly be given wealth and children"?\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2522</sup>
Has he penetrated to the Unseen or has he taken a contract with\n\t\t\t(Allah) Most Gracious?
Nay! We shall record what he says and We Shall add and add to his\n\t\t\tpunishment. <sup class='fn'>2523</sup>
To Us shall return all that he talks of and he shall appear\n\t\t\tbefore Us bare and alone. <sup class='fn'>2524</sup>
And they have taken (for worship) gods other than Allah to give\n\t\t\tthem power and glory! <sup class='fn'>2525</sup>
Instead they shall reject their worship and become adversaries\n\t\t\tagainst them. <sup class='fn'>2526</sup>
Seest thou not that We have set the Evil Ones on against the\n\t\t\tUnbelievers to incite them with fury? <sup class='fn'>2527</sup>
So make no haste against them for We but count out to them a\n\t\t\t(limited) number (of days).
The day We shall gather the righteous to (Allah) Most Gracious\n\t\t\tlike a band presented before a king for honors.
And We shall drive the sinners to Hell like thirsty cattle driven\n\t\t\tdown to water <sup class='fn'>2528</sup>
None shall have the power of intercession but such a one as has\n\t\t\treceived permission (or promise) from (Allah) Most Gracious.
They say: "(Allah) Most Gracious has begotten a son!"
Indeed ye have put forth a thing most monstrous! <sup class='fn'>2529</sup>
At if the skies are ready to burst the earth to split asunder and\n\t\t\tthe mountains to fall down in utter ruin.
That they should invoke a son for (Allah) Most Gracious.
For it is not consonant with the majesty of (Allah) Most Gracious\n\t\t\tthat He should beget a son. <sup class='fn'>2530</sup>
Not one of the beings in the heavens and the earth but must come\n\t\t\tto (Allah) Most Gracious as a servant.
He does take and account of them (all) and hath numbered them\n\t\t\t(all) exactly. <sup class='fn'>2531</sup>
And every one of them will come to him singly on the Day of\n\t\t\tJudgment.
On those who believe and work deeds of righteousness will (Allah)\n\t\t\tMost Gracious bestow Love. <sup class='fn'>2532</sup>
So have We made the (Qur'an) easy in thine own tongue that with\n\t\t\tit thou mayest give Glad Tidings to the righteous and warnings to\n\t\t\tpeople given to contention.
But how many (countless) generation before them have We\n\t\t\tdestroyed? Canst  thou find a single one of them (now) or hear\n\t\t\t(so much as) a whisper of them? <sup class='fn'>2533</sup>
Ta Ha. <sup class='fn'>2534</sup>
We have not sent down the Qur'an to thee to be (an occasion) for\n\t\t\tthy distress <sup class='fn'>2535</sup>
But only as an admonition to those who fear (Allah)
A revelation from Him Who created the earth and the heavens on\n\t\t\thigh.
(Allah) Most Gracious is firmly established on the throne (of\n\t\t\tauthority). <sup class='fn'>2536</sup>
To Him belongs what is in the heavens and on earth and all\n\t\t\tbetween them and all beneath the soil. <sup class='fn'>2537</sup>
If thou pronounce the word aloud (it is no matter): for verily He\n\t\t\tknoweth what is secret and what is yet more hidden. <sup class='fn'>2538</sup>
Allah! there is no god but He! To Him belong the Most Beautiful\n\t\t\tNames. <sup class='fn'>2539</sup>
Has the story of Moses reached thee? <sup class='fn'>2540</sup>

Behold he saw a fire: so he said to his family "Tarry ye; I
			perceive a fire; perhaps I can bring you some burning brand
			therefrom or find some guidance at the fire." <sup class='fn'>2541</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2542</sup>
But when he came to the fire a voice was heard: "O Moses!
"Verily I am thy Lord! Therefore (in My presence) put off thy\n\t\t\tshoes: thou art in the sacred valley Tuwa. <sup class='fn'>2543</sup>\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2544</sup>
"I have chosen thee: listen then to the inspiration (sent to\n\t\t\tthee).
"Verily I am Allah: there is no god but I: so serve thou me\n\t\t\t(only) and establish regular prayer for celebrating My praise.
"Verily the Hour is coming My design is to keep it hidden for\n\t\t\tevery soul to receive its reward by the measure of its endeavor.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2545</sup> <sup class='fn'>2546</sup>
"Therefore let not such as believe not therein but follow their\n\t\t\town lusts divert thee therefrom lest thou perish!" <sup class='fn'>2547</sup>
And what is that in thy right hand O Moses?"
He said "It is my rod: on it I lean; with it I beat down fodder\n\t\t\tfor my flocks; and in it I find other uses." <sup class='fn'>2548</sup>
(Allah) said "Throw it O Moses!"
He threw it and behold! it was a snake active in motion.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2549</sup>
(Allah) said "Seize it and fear not: We shall return it at once\n\t\t\tto its former condition"...
Now draw thy hand close to thy side: it shall come forth white\n\t\t\t(and shining) without harm (or stain) as another Sign\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2550</sup>
"In order that We may show thee (two) of Our Greater Signs.
"Go thou to Pharaoh for he had indeed transgressed all bounds."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2551</sup>
(Moses) said: "O my Lord! expand me my breast;" <sup class='fn'>2552</sup>
"Ease my task for me;
"And remove the impediment from my speech. <sup class='fn'>2553</sup>
"So they may understand what I say:
"And give me a Minister from my family
"Aaron my brother;
"Add to my strength through him <sup class='fn'>2554</sup>
"And make him share my task:
"That we may celebrate Thy praise without stint <sup class='fn'>2555</sup>
"And remember Thee without stint:
For Thou art He that (ever) regardeth us." <sup class='fn'>2556</sup>
(Allah) said: "Granted is thy prayer O Moses!"
"And indeed We conferred a favor on thee another time (before).
"Behold! We sent to thy mother by inspiration the message:\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2557</sup>

" `Throw (the child) into the chest and throw (the chest) into
			the river: the river will cast him up on the bank and he will be
			taken up by one who is an enemy to Me and an enemy to him': but I
			cast (the garment of) love over thee from Me: and (this) in order
			that thou mayest be reared under Mine eye. <sup class='fn'>2558</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2559</sup> <sup class='fn'>2560</sup>

"Behold! thy sister goeth forth and saith `Shall I show you one
			who will nurse and rear the (child)?' So We brought thee back to
			thy mother that her eye might be cooled and she should not
			grieve.  Then thou didst slay a man but We saved thee from
			trouble and We tried thee in various ways.  Then didst thou tarry
			a number of years with the people of Midian.  Then didst thou
			come hither as ordained O Moses! <sup class='fn'>2561</sup> <sup class='fn'>2562</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2563</sup> <sup class='fn'>2564</sup>
"And I have prepared thee for Myself (for service)"...
"Go thou and thy brother with My Signs and slacken not either of\n\t\t\tyou in keeping Me in remembrance. <sup class='fn'>2565</sup>
"Go both of you to Pharaoh for he has indeed transgressed all\n\t\t\tbounds; <sup class='fn'>2566</sup> <sup class='fn'>2567</sup>
"But speak to him mildly; perchance he may take warning or fear\n\t\t\t(Allah)." <sup class='fn'>2568</sup>
They (Moses and Aaron) said: "Our Lord! we fear lest He hasten\n\t\t\twith insolence against us or lest he transgress all bounds."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2569</sup>
He said: "Fear not: for I am with you: I hear and see\n\t\t\t(everything).

"So go ye both to him and say `Verily we are apostles sent by thy
			Lord: send forth therefore the Children of Israel with us and
			afflict them not: with a Sign indeed have we come from thy Lord!
			And peace to all who follow guidance! <sup class='fn'>2570</sup> <sup class='fn'>2571</sup>
" `Verily it has been revealed to us that the Penalty (awaits)\n\t\t\tthose who reject and turn away.' "
(When this message was delivered) (Pharaoh) said: "Who then O\n\t\t\tMoses is the Lord of you two?" <sup class='fn'>2572</sup>
He said: "Our Lord is He Who gave to each (created) thing its\n\t\t\tform and nature and further gave (it) guidance." <sup class='fn'>2573</sup>
(Pharaoh) said: "What then is the condition of previous\n\t\t\tgenerations?" <sup class='fn'>2574</sup>
He replied: "The knowledge of that is with my Lord duly recorded:\n\t\t\tmy Lord never errs nor forgets <sup class='fn'>2575</sup>

"He Who has made for you the earth like a carpet spread out; has
			enabled you to go about therein by roads (and channels); and has
			sent down water from the sky." With it have We produced divers
			pairs of plants each separate from the others. <sup class='fn'>2576</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2577</sup> <sup class='fn'>2578</sup>
Eat (for yourselves) and pasture your cattle: verily in this are\n\t\t\tSigns for men endued with understanding.
From the (earth) did We create you and into it shall We return\n\t\t\tyou and from it shall We bring you out once again. <sup class='fn'>2579</sup>
And We showed Pharaoh all Our Signs but he did reject and refuse.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2580</sup>
He said: "Hast thou come to drive us out of our land with thy\n\t\t\tmagic O Moses? <sup class='fn'>2581</sup>

"But we can surely produce magic to match thine! So make a tryst
			between us and thee which we shall not fail to keep neither we
			nor thou in a place where both shall have even chances."
			<sup class='fn'>2582</sup>
Moses said: "Your tryst is the Day of the Festival and let the\n\t\t\tpeople be assembled when the sun is well up." <sup class='fn'>2583</sup>
So Pharaoh withdrew: he concerted his plan and then came (back).\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2584</sup>
Moses said to him: "Woe to you! forge not ye a lie against Allah\n\t\t\tlest He destroy you (at once) utterly by chastisement: the forger\n\t\t\tmust suffer frustration!" <sup class='fn'>2585</sup>
So they disputed one with another over their affair but they kept\n\t\t\ttheir talk secret. <sup class='fn'>2586</sup>

They said: "These two are certainly (expert) magicians: their\n\t\t\tobject is to drive you out from your land with their magic and to\n\t\t\tdo away with your Most cherished institutions. <sup class='fn'>2587</sup>
"Therefore concert your plan. And then assemble in (serried)\n\t\t\tranks: he wins (all along) today who gains the upper hand."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2588</sup>
They said: "O Moses! whether wilt thou that thou throw (first) or\n\t\t\tthat we be the first to throw?"
He said "Nay throw ye first!" Then behold their ropes and their\n\t\t\trods so it seemed to him on account of their magic began to be in\n\t\t\tlively motion! <sup class='fn'>2589</sup>
So Moses conceived in his mind a (sort of) fear. <sup class='fn'>2590</sup>
We said: "Fear not! for thou hast indeed the upper hand:

"Throw that which is in thy right hand: quickly will it swallow
			up that which they have faked.	What they have faked is but a
			magician's trick: and the magician thrives not (no matter) where
			he goes." <sup class='fn'>2591</sup>
So the magicians were thrown down to prostration: they said "We\n\t\t\tbelieve in the Lord of Aaron and Moses." <sup class='fn'>2592</sup>

(Pharaoh) said: "Believe ye in Him before I give you permission?
			Surely this must be your leader who has taught you magic! Be sure
			I will cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides and I will
			have you crucified on trunks of palm-trees: So shall ye know for
			certain which of us can give the more severe and the more lasting
			Punishment!" <sup class='fn'>2593</sup>

They said: "Never shall we regard thee as more than the Clear
			Signs that have come to us or than Him Who created us! So decree
			whatever thou desirest to decree: for thou canst only decree
			(touching) the life of this world. <sup class='fn'>2594</sup> <sup class='fn'>2595</sup>
For us we have believed in our Lord: may He forgive us our faults\n\t\t\tand the magic to which thou didst compel us: for Allah is Best\n\t\t\tand Most Abiding." <sup class='fn'>2596</sup>
Verily he who comes to his Lord as a sinner (at judgment) for him\n\t\t\tis Hell: therein shall he neither die nor live. <sup class='fn'>2597</sup>
But such as comes to Him as Believers who have worked righteous\n\t\t\tdeeds--for them are ranks exalted
Gardens of Eternity beneath which flow rivers: they will dwell\n\t\t\ttherein for aye: such is the reward of those who purify\n\t\t\tthemselves (from evil). <sup class='fn'>2598</sup>

We sent an inspiration to Moses: "Travel by night with my
			servants and strike a dry path for them through the sea without
			fear of being overtaken (by Pharaoh) and without (any other)
			fear." <sup class='fn'>2599</sup>
Then Pharaoh pursued them with his forces but the waters\n\t\t\tcompletely overwhelmed them and covered them up.
Pharaoh led his people astray instead of leading them aright.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2600</sup>

O ye Children of Israel! We delivered you from your enemy and We\n\t\t\tmade a Covenant with you on the side of Mount (Sinai) and We sent\n\t\t\tdown to you Manna and quails: <sup class='fn'>2601</sup>

(Saying): "Eat of the good things We have provided for your
			sustenance but commit no excess therein lest My Wrath should
			justly descend on you: and those on whom descends My Wrath do
			perish indeed! <sup class='fn'>2602</sup> <sup class='fn'>2603</sup>
"But without doubt I am (also) He that forgives again and again\n\t\t\tto those who repent believe and do right who in fine are ready to\n\t\t\treceive true guidance."
(When Moses was up on the mount Allah said:) "What made thee\n\t\t\thasten in advance of thy people O Moses?" <sup class='fn'>2604</sup>
He replied: "Behold they are close on my footsteps: I hastened to\n\t\t\tThee o my Lord to please Thee."
(Allah) said: "We have tested thy people in thy absence: the\n\t\t\tSamiri has led them astray." <sup class='fn'>2605</sup>

So Moses returned to his people in state of indignation and
			sorrow. He said: "O my people! did not your Lord make a handsome
			promise to you? Did then the promise seem to you long (in
			coming)? Or did ye desire that Wrath should descend from your
			Lord on you and so ye broke your promise to me?" <sup class='fn'>2606</sup>

They said: "We broke not the promise to thee as far as lay in our
			power: but we were made to carry the weight of the ornaments of
			the (whole) people and we threw them (into the fire) and that was
			what the Samiri suggested. <sup class='fn'>2607</sup> <sup class='fn'>2608</sup>

"Then he brought out (of the fire) before the (people) the image
			of a calf: it seemed to low: so they said: `This is your god and
			the god of Moses but (Moses) has forgotten!' " <sup class='fn'>2609</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2610</sup> <sup class='fn'>2611</sup>
Could they not see that it could not return them a word (for\n\t\t\tanswer) and that it had no power either to harm them or to do\n\t\t\tthem good? <sup class='fn'>2612</sup>

Aaron had already before this said to them: "O my people! ye are
			being tested in this: for verily your Lord is (Allah) Most
			Gracious: so follow me and obey my command." <sup class='fn'>2613</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2614</sup>
They had said: "We will not abandon this cult but we will devote\n\t\t\tourselves to it until Moses returns to us. <sup class='fn'>2615</sup>\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2616</sup>
(Moses) said: " O Aaron! what kept thee back when thou sawest\n\t\t\tthem going wrong
"From following me? Didst thou then disobey my order?"\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2617</sup>

(Aaron) replied: "O son of my mother! seize (me not) by my beard
			nor by (the hair of) my head! Truly I feared lest thou shouldst
			say `Thou hast caused a division among the Children of Israel and
			thou didst not respect my word!'" <sup class='fn'>2618</sup> <sup class='fn'>2619</sup>
(Moses) said: "What then is thy case O Samiri?" <sup class='fn'>2620</sup>

He replied: "I saw what they saw not: so I took a handful (of\n\t\t\tdust) from the footprint of the Apostle and threw it (into the\n\t\t\tcalf): thus did my soul suggest to me." <sup class='fn'>2621</sup>

(Moses) said: "Get thee gone! but thy (punishment) in this life
			will be that thou wilt say `Touch me not'; and moreover (for a
			future penalty) thou hast a promise that will not fail: now look
			at thy god of whom thou hast become a devoted worshipper: we will
			certainly (melt) it in a blazing fire and scatter it broadcast in
			the sea!" <sup class='fn'>2622</sup> <sup class='fn'>2623</sup> <sup class='fn'>2624</sup>
But the god of you all is the One Allah: there is no god but He:\n\t\t\tall things He comprehends in His knowledge.
Thus do We relate to thee some stories of what happened before:\n\t\t\tfor We have sent thee a Message from Our own Presence.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2625</sup>
If any do turn away therefrom verily they will bear a burden on\n\t\t\tthe Day of Judgement;
They will abide in this (state): and grievous will the burden be\n\t\t\tto them on that Day <sup class='fn'>2626</sup>
The Day when the Trumpet will be sounded: that Day We shall\n\t\t\tgather the sinful blear-eyed (with terror) <sup class='fn'>2627</sup>
In whispers will they consult each other: "Ye tarried not longer\n\t\t\tthan ten (Days)"; <sup class='fn'>2628</sup>
We know best what they will say when their leader most eminent in\n\t\t\tConduct will say: "Ye tarried not longer than a day!"\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2629</sup>
They ask thee concerning the mountains: say "My Lord will uproot\n\t\t\tthem and scatter them as dust;" <sup class='fn'>2630</sup> <sup class='fn'>2631</sup>
"He will leave them as plains smooth and level;"
Nothing crooked or curved wilt thou see in their place."

On that Day will they follow the Caller (straight): no
			crookedness (can they show) him: all sounds shall humble
			themselves in the presence of (Allah) Most Gracious: nothing
			shalt thou hear but the tramp of their feet (as they march).
			<sup class='fn'>2632</sup> <sup class='fn'>2633</sup>
On that Day shall no intercession avail except for those for whom\n\t\t\tpermission has been granted by (Allah) Most Gracious and whose\n\t\t\tword is acceptable to Him. <sup class='fn'>2634</sup>
He knows what (appears to His creatures as) before or after or\n\t\t\tbehind them: but they shall not compass it with their knowledge.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2635</sup>
(All) faces shall be humbled before (Him) the Living the\n\t\t\tSelf-Subsisting Eternal: hopeless indeed will be the man that\n\t\t\tcarries iniquity (on his back). <sup class='fn'>2636</sup>
But he who works deeds of righteousness and has faith will have\n\t\t\tno fear of harm nor of any curtailment (of what is his due).\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2637</sup>

Thus have we sent this down an Arabic Qur'an and explained
			therein in detail some of the warnings in order that they may
			fear Allah or that it may cause their remembrance (of Him).
			<sup class='fn'>2638</sup>
