High above all is Allah the King the Truth! Be not in haste with\n\t\t\tthe Qur'an before its revelation to thee is completed but say "O\n\t\t\tmy Lord! advance me in knowledge." <sup class='fn'>2639</sup>
We had already beforehand taken the covenant of Adam but he\n\t\t\tforgot: and We found on his part no firm resolve. <sup class='fn'>2640</sup>
When We said to the angels "Prostrate yourselves to Adam" they\n\t\t\tprostrated themselves but not Iblis: he refused.
Then We said: "O Adam! verily this is an enemy to thee and thy\n\t\t\twife: so let him not get you both out of the Garden so that thou\n\t\t\tart landed in misery. <sup class='fn'>2641</sup>
"There is therein (enough provision) for thee not to go hungry\n\t\t\tnor to go naked" <sup class='fn'>2642</sup>
"Nor to suffer from thirst nor from the sun's heat."
But Satan whispered evil to him: he said "O Adam! shall I lead\n\t\t\tthee to Tree of Eternity and to a kingdom that never decays?"\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2643</sup>

In the result they both ate of the tree and so their nakedness
			appeared to them: they began to sew together for their covering
			leaves from the Garden: thus did Adam disobey His Lord and allow
			himself to be seduced. <sup class='fn'>2644</sup> <sup class='fn'>2645</sup>
But his Lord chose him (for His Grace): He turned to him and gave\n\t\t\thim guidance.

He said: "Get ye down both of you all together from the Garden
			with enmity one to another; but if as is sure there comes to you
			guidance from Me whosoever follows My guidance will not lose his
			way nor fall into misery. <sup class='fn'>2646</sup> <sup class='fn'>2647</sup>
"But whosoever turns away from My Message verily for him is a\n\t\t\tlife narrowed down and We shall raise him up blind on the Day of\n\t\t\tJudgment." <sup class='fn'>2648</sup>
He will say: "O my Lord! why hast thou raised me up blind while I\n\t\t\thad sight (before)?" <sup class='fn'>2649</sup>
(Allah) will say: "Thus didst thou when Our Signs came unto thee\n\t\t\tdisregard them: so wilt thou this day be disregarded."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2650</sup>

And thus do We recompense him who transgresses beyond bounds and\n\t\t\tbelieves not in the Signs of his Lord: and the Penalty of the\n\t\t\tHereafter is far more grievous and more enduring. <sup class='fn'>2651</sup>

It is not a warning to such men (to call to mind) how many
			generations before them We destroyed in whose haunts they (now)
			move? Verily in this are Signs for men endued with understanding.
			<sup class='fn'>2652</sup>
Had it not been for a Word that went forth before from thy Lord\n\t\t\t(their punishment) must necessarily have come; but there is a\n\t\t\tterm appointed (for respite). <sup class='fn'>2653</sup>

Therefore be patient with what they say and celebrate
			(constantly) the praises of thy Lord before the rising of the sun
			and before its setting; yea celebrate them for part of the hours
			of the night and at the sides of the day: that thou mayest have
			(spiritual) joy. <sup class='fn'>2654</sup> <sup class='fn'>2655</sup>

Nor strain thine eyes in longing for the things We have given for
			enjoyment to parties of them the splendor of the life of this
			world through which We test them: but the provision of thy Lord
			is better and more enduring. <sup class='fn'>2656</sup>

Enjoin prayer on thy people and be constant therein.  We ask thee\n\t\t\tnot to provide sustenance: We provide it for thee.  But the\n\t\t\t(fruit of) the Hereafter is for Righteousness. <sup class='fn'>2657</sup>
They say: "Why does he not bring us a Sign from His Lord?" Has\n\t\t\tnot a clear Sign come to them of all that was in the former Books\n\t\t\tof revelation? <sup class='fn'>2658</sup>

And if We had inflicted on them a Penalty before this they would
			have said: "Our Lord! if only Thou hadst sent us an apostle we
			should certainly have followed Thy Signs before we were humbled
			and put to shame." <sup class='fn'>2659</sup>

Say: "Each one (of us) is waiting: wait ye therefore and soon
			shall ye know who it is that is on the straight and even way and
			who it is that has received guidance." <sup class='fn'>2660</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2661</sup>
Closer and closer to mankind comes their Reckoning: yet they heed\n\t\t\tnot and they turn away. <sup class='fn'>2662</sup>
Never comes (aught) to them of a renewed Message from their Lord\n\t\t\tbut they listen to it as in jest <sup class='fn'>2663</sup>

Their hearts toying as with trifles.  The wrongdoers conceal
			their private counsels (saying) "Is this (one) more than a man
			like yourselves? Will ye go to witchcraft with your eyes open?"
			<sup class='fn'>2664</sup> <sup class='fn'>2665</sup>
Say: "My Lord knoweth (every) word (spoken) in the heavens and\n\t\t\tthe earth: He is the One that heareth and knoweth (all things)."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2666</sup> <sup class='fn'>2667</sup>

"Nay" they say "(these are) medleys of dreams! nay he forged\n\t\t\tit!--nay he is (but) a poet! Let him then bring us a Sign like\n\t\t\tthe ones that were sent to (prophets) of old!" <sup class='fn'>2668</sup>
(As to those) before them not one of the populations which We\n\t\t\tdestroyed believed: will these believe? <sup class='fn'>2669</sup>
Before thee also the apostles we sent were but men to whom We\n\t\t\tgranted inspiration: if ye realize this not ask of those who\n\t\t\tpossess the Message. <sup class='fn'>2670</sup>
Nor did We give them bodies that ate no food nor were they exempt\n\t\t\tfrom death. <sup class='fn'>2671</sup>
In the end We fulfilled to them Our promise and We saved them and\n\t\t\tthose whom We pleased but We destroyed those who transgressed\n\t\t\tbeyond bounds. <sup class='fn'>2672</sup>
We have revealed for you (O men!) a book in which is a Message\n\t\t\tfor you: will ye not then understand?
How many were the populations we utterly destroyed because of\n\t\t\ttheir iniquities setting up in their places other peoples!
Yet when they felt Our Punishment (coming) behold they (tried to)\n\t\t\tflee from it. <sup class='fn'>2673</sup>
Flee not but return to the good things of this life which were\n\t\t\tgiven you and to your homes in order that ye may be called to\n\t\t\taccount. <sup class='fn'>2674</sup>
They said: "Ah! woe to us! We were indeed wrongdoers!"
And that cry of theirs ceased not till We made them as a field\n\t\t\tthat is mown as ashes silent and quenched. <sup class='fn'>2675</sup>
Not for (idle) sport did We create the heavens and the earth and\n\t\t\tall that is between! <sup class='fn'>2676</sup>
If it had been Our wish to take (just) a pastime We should surely\n\t\t\thave taken it from the things nearest to Us if We would do (such\n\t\t\ta thing)! <sup class='fn'>2677</sup>

Nay We hurl the Truth against falsehood and it knocks out its\n\t\t\tbrain and behold falsehood doth perish! Ah! woe be to you for the\n\t\t\t(false) things ye ascribe (to Us). <sup class='fn'>2678</sup>

To Him belong all (creatures) in the heavens and on earth: even\n\t\t\tthose who are in His (very) Presence are not too proud to serve\n\t\t\tHim nor are they (ever) weary (of His service): <sup class='fn'>2679</sup>
They celebrate His praises night and day nor do they ever flag or\n\t\t\tintermit.
Or have they taken (for worship) gods from the earth who can\n\t\t\traise (the dead)? <sup class='fn'>2680</sup> <sup class='fn'>2681</sup>

If there were in the heavens and the earth other gods besides
			Allah there would have been confusion in both! But glory to Allah
			the Lord of the Throne: (high is He) above what they attribute to
			Him! <sup class='fn'>2682</sup>
He cannot be questioned for His acts but they will be questioned\n\t\t\t(for theirs). <sup class='fn'>2683</sup>

Or have they taken for worship (other) gods besides Him? Say
			"Bring your convincing proof: this is the Message of those with
			me and the Message of those before me." But most of them know not
			the Truth and so turn away. <sup class='fn'>2684</sup> <sup class='fn'>2685</sup>
Not an apostle did We send before thee without this inspiration\n\t\t\tsent by Us to him: that there is no god but I; therefore worship\n\t\t\tand serve Me.
And they say: "(Allah) Most Gracious has begotten offspring."\n\t\t\tGlory to Him! they are (but) servants raised to honor.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2686</sup>
They speak not before He speaks and they act (in all things) by\n\t\t\tHis command. <sup class='fn'>2687</sup>

He knows what is before them and what is behind them and they
			offer no intercession except for those who are acceptable and
			they stand in awe and reverence of His (glory). <sup class='fn'>2688</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2689</sup>
If any of them should say "I am a god besides Him" such a god We\n\t\t\tshould reward with Hell: thus do We reward those who do wrong.

Do not the Unbelievers see that the heavens and the earth were
			joined together (as one unit of Creation) before We clove them
			asunder? We made from water every living thing.  Will they not
			then believe? <sup class='fn'>2690</sup> <sup class='fn'>2691</sup>

And We have set on the earth mountains standing firm lest it
			should shake with them and We have made therein broad highways
			(between mountains) for them to pass through: that they may
			receive guidance. <sup class='fn'>2692</sup> <sup class='fn'>2693</sup>
And We have made the heavens as a canopy well-guarded: Yet do\n\t\t\tthey turn away from the Signs which these things (point to)!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2694</sup>
It is He Who created the Night and the Day and the sun and the\n\t\t\tmoon: all (the celestial bodies) swim along each in its rounded\n\t\t\tcourse. <sup class='fn'>2695</sup>
We granted not to any man before thee permanent life (here): if\n\t\t\tthen thou shouldst die would they live permanently? <sup class='fn'>2696</sup>
Every soul shall have a taste of death: and We test you by evil\n\t\t\tand by good by way of trial: to Us must ye return. <sup class='fn'>2697</sup>

When the Unbelievers see thee they treat thee not except with
			ridicule.  "Is this" (they say) "the one who talks of your gods?"
			And they blaspheme at the mention of (Allah) Most Gracious!
			<sup class='fn'>2698</sup>
Man is a creature of haste: soon (enough) will I show you My\n\t\t\tSigns: then ye will not ask Me to hasten them! <sup class='fn'>2699</sup>
They say: "When will this promise come to pass if ye are telling\n\t\t\tthe truth?"

If only the Unbelievers knew (the time) when they will not be\n\t\t\table to ward off the Fire from their faces nor yet from their\n\t\t\tbacks and (when) no help can reach them! <sup class='fn'>2700</sup>
Nay it may come to them all of a sudden and confound them: no\n\t\t\tpower will they have then to avert it nor will they (then) get\n\t\t\trespite.
Mocked were (many) apostles before thee; but their scoffers were\n\t\t\themmed in by the thing that they mocked. <sup class='fn'>2701</sup>
Say "Who can keep you safe by night and by day from (the Wrath\n\t\t\tof) (Allah) Most Gracious?" Yet they turn away from the mention\n\t\t\tof their Lord. <sup class='fn'>2702</sup>
Or have they gods that can guard them from Us? They have no power\n\t\t\tto aid themselves nor can they be defended from Us. <sup class='fn'>2703</sup>

Nay We gave the good things of this life to these men and their
			fathers until the period grew long for them; see they not that we
			gradually reduce the land (in their control) from its outlying
			borders? Is it then they who will win? <sup class='fn'>2704</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2705</sup>
Say "I do but warn you according to revelation":  but the deaf\n\t\t\twill not hear the call (even) when they are warned! <sup class='fn'>2706</sup>
If but a breath of the Wrath of thy Lord do touch them they will\n\t\t\tthen say "Woe to us! we did wrong indeed!"

We shall set up scales of justice for the Day of Judgment so that
			not a soul will be dealt with unjustly in the least.  And if
			there be (no more than) the weight of a mustard seed We will
			bring it (to account): and enough are We to take account.
			<sup class='fn'>2707</sup> <sup class='fn'>2708</sup>
In the past We granted to Moses and Aaron the Criterion (for\n\t\t\tjudgment) and a Light and a Message for those who would do right\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2709</sup>
Those who fear their Lord in their most secret thoughts and who\n\t\t\thold the Hour (of Judgment) in awe. <sup class='fn'>2710</sup>
And this is a blessed Message which We have sent down: will ye\n\t\t\tthen reject it? <sup class='fn'>2711</sup>
We bestowed aforetime on Abraham his rectitude of conduct and\n\t\t\twell were We acquainted with him. <sup class='fn'>2712</sup> <sup class='fn'>2713</sup>
Behold! he said to his father and his people "What are these\n\t\t\timages to which ye are (so assiduously) devoted?" <sup class='fn'>2714</sup>
They said "We found our father worshipping them."
He said "Indeed ye have been in manifest error-ye and your\n\t\t\tfathers."
They said "Have you brought us the Truth or are you one of those\n\t\t\twho jest?" <sup class='fn'>2715</sup>
He said "Nay your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth\n\t\t\tHe Who created them (from nothing): and I am a witness to this\n\t\t\t(truth). <sup class='fn'>2716</sup>
And by Allah I have a plan for your idols after ye go away and\n\t\t\tturn your backs"... <sup class='fn'>2717</sup>
So he broke them to pieces (all) but the biggest of them that\n\t\t\tthey might turn (and address themselves) to it. <sup class='fn'>2718</sup>
They said "Who has done this to our gods? He must indeed be some\n\t\t\tman of impiety!"
They said "We heard a youth talk of them: he is called Abraham."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2719</sup>
They said "Then bring him before the eyes of the people that they\n\t\t\tmay bear witness:"
They said "Art thou the one that did this with our gods O\n\t\t\tAbraham?" <sup class='fn'>2720</sup>
He said: "Nay this was done by this is their is their biggest\n\t\t\tone! Ask them if they can speak intelligently!"
So they turned to themselves and said "Surely ye are the ones in\n\t\t\tthe wrong!" <sup class='fn'>2721</sup>
Then were they confounded with shame: (they said) "Thou knowest\n\t\t\tfull well that these (idols) do not speak!" <sup class='fn'>2722</sup>
(Abraham) said "Do ye then worship besides Allah things that can\n\t\t\tneither be of any good to you nor do you harm?
"Fie upon you and upon the things that ye worship besides Allah!\n\t\t\thave ye no sense?"... <sup class='fn'>2723</sup>
They said "Burn him and protect your gods if ye do (anything at\n\t\t\tall)!"
We said "O fire! be thou cool and (a means of)) safety for\n\t\t\tAbraham!" <sup class='fn'>2724</sup> <sup class='fn'>2725</sup>
Then they sought a stratagem against him: but We made them the\n\t\t\tones that lost most! <sup class='fn'>2726</sup>
But We delivered him and (his nephew) Lut (and directed them) to\n\t\t\tthe land which We have blessed for the nations. <sup class='fn'>2727</sup>
And We bestowed on him Isaac and as an additional gift (a\n\t\t\tgrandson) Jacob and We made righteous men of every one (of them).\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2728</sup>

And We made them leaders guiding (men) by Our Command and We sent
			them inspiration to do good deeds to establish regular prayers
			and to practice regular charity; and they constantly served Us
			(and Us only). <sup class='fn'>2729</sup>

And to Lut too we gave Judgment and Knowledge and We saved him\n\t\t\tfrom the town which practiced abominations: truly they were a\n\t\t\tpeople given to Evil a rebellious people. <sup class='fn'>2730</sup>
And We admitted him to Our Mercy: for he was one of the\n\t\t\tRighteous.
(Remember) Noah when he cried (to Us) aforetime: We listened to\n\t\t\this (prayer) and delivered him and his family from great\n\t\t\tdistress. <sup class='fn'>2731</sup>
We helped him against people who rejected Our Signs: truly they\n\t\t\twere a people given to Evil: so We drowned them (in the Flood)\n\t\t\tall together.
And remember David and Solomon when they gave judgment in the\n\t\t\tmatter of the field into which the sheep of certain people had\n\t\t\tstrayed by night: We did witness their judgment.

To Solomon We inspired the (right) understanding of the matter:
			to each (of them) We gave Judgment and Knowledge; it was Our
			power that made the hills and the birds celebrate Our praises
			with David: it was We Who did (these things). <sup class='fn'>2732</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2733</sup>

It was We Who taught him the making of coats of mail for your\n\t\t\tbenefit to guard you from each others violence: will ye then be\n\t\t\tgrateful? <sup class='fn'>2734</sup> <sup class='fn'>2735</sup>

(It was Our power that made) the violent (unruly) wind flow\n\t\t\t(tamely) for Solomon to his order to the land which We had\n\t\t\tblessed: for We do know all things. <sup class='fn'>2736</sup> <sup class='fn'>2737</sup>
And of the evil ones were some who dived for him and did other\n\t\t\twork besides; and lit was We Who guarded them. <sup class='fn'>2738</sup>
And (remember) Job when he cried to his Lord "Truly distress has\n\t\t\tseized me but Thou art the Most Merciful of those that are\n\t\t\tmerciful." <sup class='fn'>2739</sup>

So We listened to him: We removed the distress that was on him
			and We restored his people to him and doubled their number as a
			Grace from Ourselves and a thing for commemoration for all who
			serve Us. <sup class='fn'>2740</sup>
And (remember) Ismail Idris and Zul-kifl all (men) of constancy\n\t\t\tand patience; <sup class='fn'>2741</sup> <sup class='fn'>2742</sup> <sup class='fn'>2743</sup>
We admitted them to Our Mercy: for they were of the Righteous\n\t\t\tones.

And remember Zun-nun when he departed in wrath: he imagined that
			We had no power over him! But he cried through the depths of
			darkness "There is no god but Thou: Glory to Thee: I was indeed
			wrong!" <sup class='fn'>2744</sup>
So We listened to him: and delivered him from distress: and thus\n\t\t\tdo We deliver those who have faith.

And (remember) Zakariya when he cried to his Lord: "O my Lord!\n\t\t\tleave me not without offspring though Thou art the best of\n\t\t\tinheritors. <sup class='fn'>2745</sup> <sup class='fn'>2746</sup>

So We listened to him: and We granted him Yahya: We cured his
			wife's (barrenness) for him.  These three were ever quick in
			emulation in good works: they used to call on Us with love and
			reverence and humble themselves before Us. <sup class='fn'>2747</sup>
And (remember) her who guarded her chastity: We breathed into her\n\t\t\tof Our Spirit and We made her and her son a Sign for all peoples.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2748</sup>
Verily this Brotherhood of yours is a single Brotherhood and I am\n\t\t\tyour Lord and Cherisher: therefore serve Me (and no other).\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2749</sup>
But (later generations) cut off their affair (of unity) one from\n\t\t\tanother: (yet) will they all return to Us. <sup class='fn'>2750</sup>
Whoever works any act of righteousness and has Faith his endeavor\n\t\t\twill not be rejected: We shall record it in his favor.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2751</sup>
But there is a ban on any population which We have destroyed:\n\t\t\tthat they shall not return. <sup class='fn'>2752</sup>
Until the Gog and Magog (people) are let through (their barrier)\n\t\t\tand they swiftly swarm from every hill. <sup class='fn'>2753</sup>

Then will the True Promise draw nigh (of fulfillment): then
			behold! the eyes of the Unbelievers will fixedly stare in horror:
			"Ah! woe to us! we were indeed heedless of this; nay we truly did
			wrong!" <sup class='fn'>2754</sup>
Verily ye (Unbelievers) and the (false) gods that ye worship\n\t\t\tbesides Allah are (but) fuel for Hell! To it will ye (surely)\n\t\t\tcome!
If these had been gods they would not have got there! But each\n\t\t\tone will abide therein. <sup class='fn'>2755</sup>
There sobbing will be their lot nor will they there hear (aught\n\t\t\telse).
Those for whom the Good (Record) from Us has gone before will be\n\t\t\tremoved far therefrom. <sup class='fn'>2756</sup>
Not the slightest sound will they hear of Hell: what their souls\n\t\t\tdesired in that will they dwell.
The Great Terror will bring them no grief: but the angels will\n\t\t\tmeet them (with mutual greetings): "This is your Day (the Day)\n\t\t\tthat ye were promised." <sup class='fn'>2757</sup>

The Day that we roll up the heavens like a scroll rolled up for
			books (completed) even as We produced the first Creation so shall
			We produce a new one: a promise We have undertaken: truly shall
			We fulfil it. <sup class='fn'>2758</sup>
Before this We wrote in the Psalms after the Message (given to\n\t\t\tMoses): My servants the righteous shall inherit the earth."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2759</sup> <sup class='fn'>2760</sup>
Verily in the (Qur'an) is a Message for people who would (truly)\n\t\t\tworship Allah. <sup class='fn'>2761</sup>
We sent thee not but as a mercy for all creatures. <sup class='fn'>2762</sup>
Say: "What has come to me by inspiration is that your Allah is\n\t\t\tOne Allah: will ye therefore bow to His Will (in Islam)?"\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2763</sup>
But if they turn back say: "I have proclaimed the Message to you\n\t\t\tall alike and in truth; but I know not whether that which ye are\n\t\t\tpromised is near or far. <sup class='fn'>2764</sup>
"It is He Who knows what is open in speech and what ye hide (in\n\t\t\tyour hearts). <sup class='fn'>2765</sup>
"I know not but that it may be a trial for you and a grant of\n\t\t\t(worldly) livelihood (to you) for a time. <sup class='fn'>2766</sup>

Say: "O my Lord! judge Thou in truth!" "Our Lord Most Gracious is\n\t\t\tthe One Whose assistance should be sought against the blasphemies\n\t\t\tye utter!" <sup class='fn'>2767</sup> <sup class='fn'>2768</sup> <sup class='fn'>2769</sup>
O mankind! fear your Lord! For the convulsion of the Hour (of\n\t\t\tJudgment) will be a thing terrible! <sup class='fn'>2770</sup>

The Day ye shall see it every mother giving suck shall forget her
			suckling-babe and every pregnant female shall drop her load
			(unformed): thou shalt see mankind as in a drunken riot yet not
			drunk: but dreadful will be the Wrath of Allah. <sup class='fn'>2771</sup>
And yet among men there are such as dispute about Allah without\n\t\t\tknowledge and follow every evil one obstinate in rebellion!
About the (Evil One) it is decreed that whoever turns to him for\n\t\t\tfriendship him will he lead astray and he will guide him to the\n\t\t\tPenalty of the Fire. <sup class='fn'>2772</sup>

O mankind! if ye have a doubt about the Resurrection (consider)
			that We created you out of dust then out of sperm then out of a
			leech-like clot then out a morsel of flesh partly formed and
			partly unformed in order that We may manifest (Our Power) to you;
			and We cause whom We will to rest in the wombs for an appointed
			term then do We bring you out as babes then (foster you) that ye
			may reach your age of full strength; and some of you are called
			to die and some are sent back to the feeblest old age so that
			they know nothing after having known (much).  And (further) thou
			seest the earth barren and lifeless but when We pour down rain on
			it it is stirred (to life) it swells and it puts forth every kind
			of beautiful growth (in pairs). <sup class='fn'>2773</sup> <sup class='fn'>2774</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2775</sup> <sup class='fn'>2776</sup> <sup class='fn'>2777</sup>
This is so because Allah is the Reality: it is He Who gives life\n\t\t\tto the dead and it is He Who has power over all things.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2778</sup>
And verily the Hour will come: there can be no doubt about it or\n\t\t\tabout (the fact) that Allah will raise up all who are in the\n\t\t\tgraves.
Yet there is among men such a one as disputes about Allah without\n\t\t\tknowledge without guidance and without a Book of Enlightenment\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2779</sup>

(Disdainfully) bending his side in order to (lead men) astray
			from the Path of Allah; for him there is disgrace in this life
			and on the Day of Judgment we shall make him taste the Penalty of
			burning (Fire). <sup class='fn'>2780</sup>
(It will be said): "This is because of the deeds which thy hands\n\t\t\tsent forth for verily Allah is not unjust to His servants.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2781</sup>

There are among men some who serve Allah as it were on the verge:
			if good befalls them they are therewith well content; but if a
			trial comes to them they turn on their faces: they lose both this
			world and the Hereafter: that is loss for all to see!
			<sup class='fn'>2782</sup>
They call on such deities besides Allah as can neither hurt nor\n\t\t\tprofit them: that is straying far indeed (from the Way)!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2783</sup>
(Perhaps) they call on one whose hurt is nearer than his profit:\n\t\t\tevil indeed is the patron and evil the companion (for help)!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2784</sup>
Verily Allah will admit those who believe and work righteous\n\t\t\tdeeds to Gardens beneath which rivers flow: for Allah carries out\n\t\t\tall that He plans. <sup class='fn'>2785</sup>

If any think that Allah will not help him (His Apostle) in this
			world and the Hereafter let him stretch out a rope to the ceiling
			and cut (himself) off: then let him see whether his plan will
			remove that which enrages (him)! <sup class='fn'>2786</sup>
Thus have We sent down Clear Signs; and verily Allah doth guide\n\t\t\twhom He will! <sup class='fn'>2787</sup>

Those who believe (in the Qur'an) those who follow the Jewish
			(scriptures) and the Sabians Christians Magians and Polytheists 
			Allah will judge between them on the Day of Judgment: for Allah
			is witness of all things. <sup class='fn'>2788</sup> <sup class='fn'>2789</sup>

Seest thou not that to Allah bow down in worship all things that
			are in the heavens and on earth the sun the moon the stars; the
			hills the trees the animals; and a great number among mankind?
			But a great number are (also) such as are fit for Punishment: and
			such as Allah shall disgrace none can rise to honor: for Allah
			carries out all that He wills. <sup class='fn'>2790</sup> <sup class='fn'>2791</sup>

These two antagonists dispute with each other about their Lord:
			but those who deny (their Lord) for them will be cut out a
			garment of Fire: over their heads will be poured out boiling
			water. <sup class='fn'>2792</sup>
With it will be scalded what is within their bodies as well as\n\t\t\t(their) skins. <sup class='fn'>2793</sup>
In addition there will be maces of iron (to punish) them.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2794</sup>
Every time they wish to get away therefrom from anguish they will\n\t\t\tbe forced back therein and (it will be said) "Taste ye the\n\t\t\tPenalty of Burning!"

Allah will admit those who believe and work righteous deeds to
			Gardens beneath which rivers flow: they shall be adorned therein
			with bracelets of gold and pearls; and their garments there will
			be of silk. <sup class='fn'>2795</sup>
For they have been guided (in this life) to the purest of\n\t\t\tspeeches; they have been guided to the Path of Him Who is worthy\n\t\t\tof (all) praise.

As to those who have rejected (Allah) and would keep back (men)
			from the Way of Allah and from the Sacred Mosque which We have
			made (open) to (all) men equal is the dweller there and the
			visitor from the country and any whose purpose therein is
			profanity or wrong-doing them will We cause to taste of a most
			grievous Penalty. <sup class='fn'>2796</sup>

Behold! We gave the site to Abraham of the (Sacred) House
			(saying): "Associate not any thing (in worship) with Me; and
			sanctify My House for those who compass it round or stand up or
			bow or prostrate themselves (therein in prayer). <sup class='fn'>2797</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2798</sup>

"And proclaim the Pilgrimage among men: they will come to thee on
			foot and (mounted) on every kind of camel lean on account of
			journeys through deep and distant mountain highways;
			<sup class='fn'>2799</sup>

"That they may witness the benefits (provided) for them and
			celebrate the name of Allah through the Days appointed over the
			cattle which He has provided for them (for sacrifice): then eat
			ye thereof and feed the distressed ones in want. <sup class='fn'>2800</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2801</sup> <sup class='fn'>2802</sup>
"Then let them complete the rites prescribed for them perform\n\t\t\ttheir vows and (again) circumambulate the Ancient House."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2803</sup> <sup class='fn'>2804</sup>

Such (is the Pilgrimage): whoever honors the sacred rites of
			Allah for him it is good in the sight of his Lord.  Lawful to you
			(for food in pilgrimage) are cattle except those mentioned to you
			(as exceptions): but shun the abomination of idols and shun the
			word that is false <sup class='fn'>2805</sup>

Being true in faith to Allah and never assigning partners to Him:
			if anyone assigns partners to Allah he is as if he had fallen
			from heaven and been snatched up by birds or the wind had swooped
			(like a bird on its prey) and thrown him into a far-distant
			place. <sup class='fn'>2806</sup>
Such (is his state): and whoever holds in honor the Symbols of\n\t\t\tAllah (in the sacrifice of animals) such (honor) should come\n\t\t\ttruly from piety of heart. <sup class='fn'>2807</sup>
In them ye have benefits for a term appointed: in the end their\n\t\t\tplace of sacrifice is near the Ancient House. <sup class='fn'>2808</sup>\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2809</sup>

To every people did We appoint rites (of sacrifice) that they
			might celebrate the name of Allah over the sustenance He gave
			them from animals (fit for food) but your Allah is one Allah:
			submit then your wills to Him (in Islam) and give thou the Good
			News to those who humble themselves <sup class='fn'>2810</sup> <sup class='fn'>2811</sup>

To those whose hearts when Allah is mentioned are filled with
			fear who show patient perseverance over their afflictions keep up
			regular prayer and spend (in charity) out of what we have
			bestowed upon them. <sup class='fn'>2812</sup>

The sacrificial camels we have made for you as among the Symbols
			from Allah: in them is (much) good for you: then pronounce the
			name of Allah over them as they line up (for sacrifice): when
			they are down on their sides (after slaughter) eat ye thereof and
			feed such as (beg not but) live in contentment and such as beg
			with due humility: thus have we made animals subject to you that
			ye may be grateful. <sup class='fn'>2813</sup> <sup class='fn'>2814</sup>

It is not their meat nor their blood that reaches Allah: it is
			your piety that reaches Him: He has thus made them subject to you
			that ye may glorify Allah for His guidance to you: and proclaim
			the Good News to all who do right. <sup class='fn'>2815</sup>
Verily Allah will defend (from ill) those who believe: verily\n\t\t\tAllah loveth not any that is a traitor to faith or shows\n\t\t\tingratitude.
To those against whom war is made permission is given (to fight)\n\t\t\tbecause they are wronged and verily Allah is Most powerful for\n\t\t\ttheir aid <sup class='fn'>2816</sup>

(They are) those who have been expelled from their homes in
			defiance of right (for no cause) except that they say "Our Lord
			is Allah." Did not Allah check one set of people by means of
			another there would surely have been pulled down monasteries
			churches synagogues and mosques in which the name of Allah is
			commemorated in abundant measure. Allah will certainly aid those
			who aid His (cause); for verily Allah is Full of Strength Exalted
			in Might (Able to enforce His Will). <sup class='fn'>2817</sup> <sup class='fn'>2818</sup>

(They are) those who if We establish them in the land establish
			regular prayer and give regular charity enjoin the right and
			forbid wrong: with Allah rests the end (and decision) of (all)
			affairs. <sup class='fn'>2819</sup>
If they treat thy (mission) as false so did the Peoples before\n\t\t\tthem (with their prophets) the People of Noah and `Ad and Thamud;\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2820</sup>
Those of Abraham and Lut;

And the Companions of the Madyan people: and Moses was rejected
			(in the same way).  But I granted respite to the Unbelievers and
			(only) after that did I punish them: but how (terrible) was My
			rejection (of them)! <sup class='fn'>2821</sup> <sup class='fn'>2822</sup>

How many populations have We destroyed which were given to
			wrong-doing! They tumbled down on their roofs.	And how many
			wells are lying idle and neglected and castles lofty and
			well-built! <sup class='fn'>2823</sup> <sup class='fn'>2824</sup>

Do they not travel through the land so that their hearts (and
			mind) may thus learn wisdom and their ears may thus learn to
			hear? Truly it is not their eyes that are blind but their hearts
			which are in their breasts. <sup class='fn'>2825</sup>

Yet they ask thee to hasten on the Punishment! But Allah will not\n\t\t\tfail in His promise.  Verily a day in the sight of thy Lord is\n\t\t\tlike a thousand years of your reckoning. <sup class='fn'>2826</sup>
And to how many populations did I give respite which were given\n\t\t\tto wrong-doing? In the end I punished them.  To Me is the\n\t\t\tdestination (of all). <sup class='fn'>2827</sup>
Say: "O men! I am (sent) to you only to give a clear warning:\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2828</sup>
"Those who believe and work righteousness for them is forgiveness\n\t\t\tand a sustenance most generous. <sup class='fn'>2829</sup>
"But those who strive against Our Signs to frustrate them they\n\t\t\twill be Companions of the Fire." <sup class='fn'>2830</sup>

Never did We send an apostle or a prophet before thee but when he
			framed a desire Satan threw some (vanity) into his desire: but
			Allah will cancel anything (vain) that Satan throws in and Allah
			will confirm (and establish) His Signs: for Allah is full of
			knowledge and wisdom: <sup class='fn'>2831</sup> <sup class='fn'>2832</sup>

That He may make the suggestions thrown in by Satan but a trial
			for those in whose hearts is a disease and who are hardened of
			heart: verily the wrongdoers are in a schism far (from the
			Truth): <sup class='fn'>2833</sup> <sup class='fn'>2834</sup>

And that those on whom knowledge has been bestowed may learn that
			the (Qur'an) is the Truth from thy Lord and that they may believe
			therein and their hearts may be made humbly (open) to it:
			for verily Allah is the Guide of those who believe to the
			Straight Way. <sup class='fn'>2835</sup>

Those who reject Faith will not cease to be in doubt concerning
			(Revelation) until the Hour (of Judgment) comes suddenly upon
			them or there comes to them the Penalty of a Day of Disaster.
			<sup class='fn'>2836</sup>
On that Day the Dominion will be that of Allah: He will judge\n\t\t\tbetween them: so those who believe and work righteous deeds will\n\t\t\tbe in Gardens of Delight. <sup class='fn'>2837</sup>
And for those who reject Faith and deny Our Signs there will be a\n\t\t\thumiliating Punishment.

Those who leave their homes in the cause of Allah and are then\n\t\t\tslain or die on them will Allah bestow verily a goodly Provision:\n\t\t\ttruly Allah is He Who bestows the best Provision. <sup class='fn'>2838</sup>
Verily He will admit them to a place with which they shall be\n\t\t\twell pleased: for Allah is All-Knowing Most Forbearing.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2839</sup>

That (is so).  And if one has retaliated to no greater extent
			than the injury he received and is again set upon inordinately
			Allah will help him: for Allah is One that blots out (sins) and
			forgives (again and again). <sup class='fn'>2840</sup>
That is because Allah merges Night into Day and He merges Day\n\t\t\tinto Night and verily it is Allah Who hears and sees (all\n\t\t\tthings). <sup class='fn'>2841</sup>

That is because Allah He is the Reality: and those besides Him\n\t\t\twhom they invoke they are but vain Falsehood: verily Allah is He\n\t\t\tMost High Most Great. <sup class='fn'>2842</sup> <sup class='fn'>2843</sup>

Seest thou not that Allah sends down rain from the sky and
			forthwith the earth becomes clothed with green? For Allah is He
			Who understands the finest mysteries and is well-acquainted (with
			them). <sup class='fn'>2844</sup>
To Him belongs all that is in the heavens and on earth: for\n\t\t\tverily Allah He is Free of all wants Worthy of all praise.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2845</sup>

Seest thou not that Allah has made subject to you (men) all that
			is on the earth and the ships that sail through the sea by His
			command? He withholds the sky (rain) from falling on the earth
			except by His leave: for Allah is Most Kind and Most Merciful to
			man. <sup class='fn'>2846</sup> <sup class='fn'>2847</sup>
It is He Who gave you life will cause you to die and will again\n\t\t\tgive you life: truly man is a most ungrateful creature!

To every People have we appointed rites and ceremonies which they
			must follow let them not then dispute with thee on the matter but
			do thou invite (them) to thy Lord: for thou art assuredly on the
			Right Way. <sup class='fn'>2848</sup>
If they do wrangle with thee say "Allah knows best what it is ye\n\t\t\tare doing." <sup class='fn'>2849</sup>
"Allah will judge between you on the Day of Judgment concerning\n\t\t\tthe matters in which ye differ." <sup class='fn'>2850</sup>
Knowest thou not that Allah knows all that is in heaven and on\n\t\t\tearth? Indeed it is all in a record and that is easy for Allah.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2851</sup>

Yet they worship besides Allah things for which no authority has
			been sent down to them and of which they have (really) no
			knowledge: for those that do wrong there is no helper.
			<sup class='fn'>2852</sup>

When Our Clear Signs are rehearsed to them thou wilt notice a
			denial on the faces of the Unbelievers! They nearly attack with
			violence those who rehearse Our Signs to them.	Say "Shall I tell
			you of something (far) worse than these Signs? It is the fire (of
			Hell)! Allah has promised it to the Unbelievers! And evil is that
			destination!" <sup class='fn'>2853</sup> <sup class='fn'>2854</sup>

O men! Here is a parable set forth! Listen to it! Those on whom
			besides Allah ye call cannot create (even) a fly if they all met
			together for the purpose! And if the fly should snatch away
			anything from them they would have no power to release it from
			the fly: feeble are those who petition and those whom they
			petition! <sup class='fn'>2855</sup>
No just estimate have they made of Allah: for Allah is He Who is\n\t\t\tstrong and able to carry out His Will. <sup class='fn'>2856</sup>
Allah chooses Messengers from angels and from men: for Allah is\n\t\t\tHe Who hears and sees (all things). <sup class='fn'>2857</sup> <sup class='fn'>2858</sup>
He knows what is before them and what is behind them: and to\n\t\t\tAllah go back all questions (for decision). <sup class='fn'>2859</sup>
O ye who believe! bow down prostrate yourselves and adore your\n\t\t\tLord; and do good; that ye may prosper. <sup class='fn'>2860</sup>

And strive in His cause as ye ought to strive (with sincerity and
			under discipline): He has chosen you and has imposed no
			difficulties on you in religion; it is the cult of your father
			Abraham.  It is He Who has named you Muslims both before and in
			this (Revelation); that the Apostle may be a witness for you and
			ye be witnesses for mankind! So establish regular Prayer give
			regular Charity and hold fast to Allah! He is your Protector the
			Best to protect and the Best to help! <sup class='fn'>2861</sup> <sup class='fn'>2862</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2863</sup> <sup class='fn'>2864</sup>
The Believers must (eventually) win through <sup class='fn'>2865</sup>
Those who humble themselves in their prayers; <sup class='fn'>2866</sup>
Who avoid vain talk;
Who are active in deeds of charity;
Who abstain from sex <sup class='fn'>2867</sup>
Except with those joined to them in the marriage bond or (the\n\t\t\tcaptives) whom their right hands possess for (in their case) they\n\t\t\tare free from blame <sup class='fn'>2868</sup>
But those whose desires exceed those limits are transgressors
Those who faithfully observe their trust and their covenants;\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2869</sup>
And who (strictly) guard their prayers <sup class='fn'>2870</sup>
Those will be the heirs <sup class='fn'>2871</sup>
Who will inherit Paradise: they will dwell therein (forever).
Man We did create from a quintessence (of clay); <sup class='fn'>2872</sup>
Then We placed him as (a drop of) sperm in a place of rest firmly\n\t\t\tfixed; <sup class='fn'>2873</sup>

Then We made the sperm into a clot of congealed blood; then of
			that clot We made a (foetus) lump; then We made out of that lump
			bones and clothed the bones with flesh; then We developed out of
			it another creature: so blessed be Allah the Best to create!
			<sup class='fn'>2874</sup>
After that at length ye will die. <sup class='fn'>2875</sup>
Again on the Day of Judgment will ye be raised up.
And We have made above you seven tracts; and We are never\n\t\t\tunmindful of (Our) Creation. <sup class='fn'>2876</sup> <sup class='fn'>2877</sup>
And We send down water from the sky according to (due) measure\n\t\t\tand We cause it to soak in the soil; and We certainly are able to\n\t\t\tdrain it off (with ease). <sup class='fn'>2878</sup>
With it We grow for you gardens of date-palms and vines: in them\n\t\t\thave ye abundant fruits: and of them ye eat (and have enjoyment)\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2879</sup>
Also a tree springing out of Mount Sinai which produces oil and\n\t\t\trelish for those who use it for food. <sup class='fn'>2880</sup>

And in cattle (too) ye have an instructive example: from within
			their bodies We produce (milk) for you to drink; there are in
			them (besides) numerous (other) benefits for you; and of their
			(meat) ye eat; <sup class='fn'>2881</sup>
And on them as well as in ships ye ride.

(Further We sent a long line of prophets for your instruction.) 
			We sent Noah to his people: he said "O my people! worship Allah!
			Ye have no other god but Him: will ye not fear (Him)?"
			<sup class='fn'>2882</sup> <sup class='fn'>2883</sup> <sup class='fn'>2884</sup>

The chiefs of the Unbelievers among his people said: "He is no
			more than a man like yourselves: his wish is to assert his
			superiority over you: if Allah had wished (to send messengers) He
			could have sent down angels: never did we hear such a thing (as
			he says) among our ancestors of old." <sup class='fn'>2885</sup>
(And some said:) "He is only a man possessed: wait (and have\n\t\t\tpatience) with him for a time." <sup class='fn'>2886</sup>
(Noah) said: "O my Lord! help me: for that they accuse me of\n\t\t\tfalsehood!"

So We inspired him (with this message): "Construct the Ark within
			Our sight and under Our guidance: then when comes Our command and
			the fountains of the earth gush forth take thou on board pairs of
			every species male and female and thy family except those of them
			against whom the Word has already gone forth: and address Me not
			in favor of the wrongdoers; for they shall be drowned (in the
			Flood). <sup class='fn'>2887</sup> <sup class='fn'>2888</sup> <sup class='fn'>2889</sup> <sup class='fn'>2890</sup>
And when thou hast embarked on the Ark thou and those with thee \n\t\t\tsay: "Praise be to Allah Who has saved us from the people who do\n\t\t\twrong." <sup class='fn'>2891</sup>
And say: "O my Lord! enable me to disembark with Thy blessing:\n\t\t\tfor Thou art the Best to enable (us) to disembark." <sup class='fn'>2892</sup>
Verily in this there are Signs (for men to understand); (thus) do\n\t\t\tWe try (men). <sup class='fn'>2893</sup>
Then We raised after them another generation;
And We sent to them an apostle from among themselves (saying)\n\t\t\t"Worship Allah! ye have no other god but Him.  Will ye not fear\n\t\t\t(Him)?" <sup class='fn'>2894</sup>

And the chiefs of his people who disbelieved and denied the
			Meeting in the Hereafter and on whom We had bestowed the good
			things of this life said: "He is no more than a man like
			yourselves; he eats of that of which ye eat and drinks of what ye
			drink.
"If ye obey a man like yourselves behold it is certain ye will be\n\t\t\tlost. <sup class='fn'>2895</sup>
"Does he promise that when ye die and become dust and bones ye\n\t\t\tshall be brought forth (again)?
"Far very far is that which ye are promised!
"There is nothing but our life in this world! We shall die and we\n\t\t\tlive! But we shall never be raised up again! <sup class='fn'>2896</sup>
"He is only a man who invents a lie against Allah but we are not\n\t\t\tthe ones to believe in him!" <sup class='fn'>2897</sup>
(The prophet) said: "O my Lord! help me: for that they accuse me\n\t\t\tof falsehood." <sup class='fn'>2898</sup>
(Allah) said: "In but a little while they are sure to be sorry!"\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2899</sup>

Then the Blast overtook them with justice and We made them as\n\t\t\trubbish of dead leaves (floating on the stream of Time)! So away\n\t\t\twith the people who do wrong! <sup class='fn'>2900</sup> <sup class='fn'>2901</sup>
Then We raised after them other generations.
No people can hasten their term nor can they delay (it).

Then sent We Our apostles in succession: every time there came to
			a people their apostle they accused him of falsehood: so We made
			them follow each other (in punishment): We made them as a tale
			(that is told): so away with a people that will not believe!
			<sup class='fn'>2902</sup>
Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our Signs and\n\t\t\tauthority manifest <sup class='fn'>2903</sup>
To Pharaoh and his Chiefs: but these behaved insolently: they\n\t\t\twere arrogant people.
They said: "Shall we believe in two men like ourselves? And their\n\t\t\tpeople are subject to us!" <sup class='fn'>2904</sup>
So they accused them of falsehood and they became of those who\n\t\t\twere destroyed.
And We gave Moses the Book in order that they might receive\n\t\t\tguidance. <sup class='fn'>2905</sup>

And We made the son of Mary and his mother as a Sign: We gave\n\t\t\tthem both shelter on high ground affording rest and security and\n\t\t\tfurnished with springs. <sup class='fn'>2906</sup> <sup class='fn'>2907</sup>
O ye apostles! enjoy (all) things good and pure and work\n\t\t\trighteousness: for I am well-acquainted with (all) that ye do.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2908</sup>
And verily this Brotherhood of yours is a single Brotherhood and\n\t\t\tI am your Lord and Cherisher: therefore fear Me (and no other).\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2909</sup>
But people have cut off their affair (of unity) between them into\n\t\t\tsects: each party rejoices in that which is with itself.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2910</sup>
But leave them in their confused ignorance for a time.
Do they think that because We have granted them abundance of\n\t\t\twealth and sons
We would hasten them on in every good? Nay they do not\n\t\t\tunderstand. <sup class='fn'>2911</sup>
Verily those who live in awe for fear of their Lord;
Those who believe in the Signs of their Lord;
Those who join not (in worship) partners with their Lord;
And those who dispense their charity with their hearts full of\n\t\t\tfear because they will return to their Lord <sup class='fn'>2912</sup>
It is these who hasten in every good work and these who are\n\t\t\tforemost in them.

On no soul do We place a burden greater than it can bear: before\n\t\t\tUs is a record which clearly shows the truth: they will never be\n\t\t\twronged. <sup class='fn'>2913</sup> <sup class='fn'>2914</sup>
But their hearts are in confused ignorance of this; and there are\n\t\t\tbesides that deeds of theirs which they will (continue) to do\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2915</sup> <sup class='fn'>2916</sup>
Until when We seize in Punishment those of them who received the\n\t\t\tgood things of this world behold they will groan in supplication!
It will be said: "Groan not in supplication this day; for ye\n\t\t\tshall certainly not be helped by Us.
"My Signs used to be rehearsed to you but ye used to turn back on\n\t\t\tyour heels
"In arrogance: talking nonsense about the (Qur'an) like one\n\t\t\ttelling fables by night." <sup class='fn'>2917</sup>
Do they not ponder over the Word (of Allah) or has anything (new)\n\t\t\tcome to them that did not come to their fathers of old?\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2918</sup>
Or do they not recognize their Apostle that they deny him?
Or do they say "He is possessed"? Nay he has brought them the\n\t\t\tTruth but most of them hate the Truth.

If the Truth had been in accord with their desires truly the
			heavens and the earth and all beings therein would have been in
			confusion and corruption! Nay We have sent them their admonition
			but they turn away from their admonition. <sup class='fn'>2919</sup>
Or is it that thou askest them for some recompense? But the\n\t\t\trecompense of thy Lord is best: He is the Best of those who give\n\t\t\tsustenance. <sup class='fn'>2920</sup>
But verily thou callest them to the Straight Way;
And verily those who believe not in the Hereafter are deviating\n\t\t\tfrom that Way.
If We had mercy on them and removed the distress which is on them\n\t\t\tthey would obstinately persist in their transgression wandering\n\t\t\tin distraction to and fro. <sup class='fn'>2921</sup>
We inflicted Punishment on them but they humbled not themselves\n\t\t\tto their Lord nor do they submissively entreat (Him)!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2922</sup>
Until We open on them a gate leading to a severe Punishment: then\n\t\t\tLo! they will be plunged in despair therein! <sup class='fn'>2923</sup>
It is He Who has created for you (the faculties of) hearing sight\n\t\t\tfeeling and understanding little thanks it is ye give!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2924</sup>
And He has multiplied you through the earth and to Him shall ye\n\t\t\tbe gathered back.
It is He Who gives life and death and to Him (is due) the\n\t\t\talternation of Night and Day: will ye not then understand?\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2925</sup>
On the contrary they say things similar to what the ancients\n\t\t\tsaid. <sup class='fn'>2926</sup>
They say: "What! when we die and become dust and bones could we\n\t\t\treally be raised up again?
"Such things have been promised to us and to our fathers before!\n\t\t\tThey are nothing but tales of the ancients!"
Say: "To whom belong the earth and all beings therein? (Say) if\n\t\t\tye know!"
They will say "To Allah!" Say: "Yet will ye not receive\n\t\t\tadmonition?" <sup class='fn'>2927</sup>
Say: "Who is the Lord of the seven heavens and the Lord of the\n\t\t\tThrone (of Glory) Supreme?" <sup class='fn'>2928</sup>
They will say "(They belong) to Allah." Say: "Will ye not then be\n\t\t\tfilled with awe?" <sup class='fn'>2929</sup>
Say: "Who is it in whose hands is the governance of all things\n\t\t\twho protects (all) but is not protected (of any)? (Say) if ye\n\t\t\tknow."
They will say "(It belongs) to Allah." Say: "Then how are ye\n\t\t\tdeluded?" <sup class='fn'>2930</sup>
We have sent them the Truth: but they indeed practice Falsehood!

No son did Allah beget nor is there any god along with Him: (if
			there were many gods) behold each god would have taken away what
			he had created and some would have lorded it over others! Glory
			to Allah (He is free) from the (sort of) things they attribute to
			Him! <sup class='fn'>2931</sup>
He knows what is hidden and what is open: too high is He for the\n\t\t\tpartners they attribute to Him! <sup class='fn'>2932</sup>
Say: "O my Lord! if Thou wilt show me (in my lifetime) that which\n\t\t\tthey are warned against <sup class='fn'>2933</sup>
"Then O my Lord! put me not amongst the people who do wrong!"
And We are certainly able to show thee (in fulfillment) that\n\t\t\tagainst which they are warned.
Repel evil with that which is best: We are well-acquainted with\n\t\t\tthe things they say. <sup class='fn'>2934</sup>
And say: "O my Lord! I seek refuge with Thee from the suggestions\n\t\t\tof the Evil Ones; <sup class='fn'>2935</sup>
"And I seek refuge with Thee O my Lord! lest they should come\n\t\t\tnear me."
(In Falsehood will they be) until when death comes to one of them\n\t\t\the says: "O my Lord! send me back (to life) <sup class='fn'>2936</sup>\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2937</sup>

"In order that I may work righteousness in the things I
			neglected."  "By no means! it is but a word he says before them
			is a Partition till the Day they are raised up. <sup class='fn'>2938</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2939</sup> <sup class='fn'>2940</sup>
Then when the Trumpet is blown there will be no more\n\t\t\trelationships between them that day nor will one ask after\n\t\t\tanother! <sup class='fn'>2941</sup>
Then those whose balance (of good deeds) is heavy they will\n\t\t\tattain salvation: <sup class='fn'>2942</sup>
But those whose balance is light will be those who have lost\n\t\t\ttheir souls; in Hell will they abide. <sup class='fn'>2943</sup>
The Fire will burn their faces and they will therein grin with\n\t\t\ttheir lips displaced. <sup class='fn'>2944</sup>
"Were not My Signs rehearsed to you and ye did but treat them as\n\t\t\tfalsehoods?"
They will say: "Our Lord! our misfortune overwhelmed us and we\n\t\t\tbecame a people astray! <sup class='fn'>2945</sup>
"Our Lord! bring us out of this: if ever we return (to evil) then\n\t\t\tshall we be wrongdoers indeed!"
He will say: "Be ye driven into it (with ignominy)! and speak ye\n\t\t\tnot to Me! <sup class='fn'>2946</sup>
"A part of My servants there was who used to pray `Our Lord! we\n\t\t\tbelieve; then do Thou forgive us and have mercy upon us: for Thou\n\t\t\tart the best of those Who show mercy!'
"But ye treated them with ridicule so much so that (ridicule of)\n\t\t\tthem made you forget My Message while ye were laughing at them!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2947</sup>
"I have rewarded them this day for their patience and constancy:\n\t\t\tthey are indeed the ones that have achieved Bliss..."
He will say: "What number of years did ye stay on earth?"\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2948</sup>
They will say: "We stayed a day or part of a day: but ask those\n\t\t\twho keep account." <sup class='fn'>2949</sup>
He will say: "Ye stayed not but a little if ye had only known!
"Did ye then think that We had created you in jest and that ye\n\t\t\twould not be brought back to Us (for account)?" <sup class='fn'>2950</sup>
Therefore exalted be Allah the King the Reality; there is no god\n\t\t\tbut He the Lord of the Throne of Honor!

If anyone invokes besides Allah any other god he has no authority
			therefor; and his reckoning will be only with his Lord! And
			verily the Unbelievers will fail to win through! <sup class='fn'>2951</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2952</sup>
So say: "O my Lord! grant thou forgiveness and mercy! for Thou\n\t\t\tart the Best of those who show mercy!"
A Surah which We have sent down and which We have ordained: in it\n\t\t\thave We sent down Clear Signs in order that ye may receive\n\t\t\tadmonition. <sup class='fn'>2953</sup>

The woman and the man guilty of adultery or fornication flog each
			of them with a hundred stripes: let not compassion move you in
			their case in a matter prescribed by Allah if ye believe in Allah
			and the Last Day: and let a party of the Believers witness their
			punishment. <sup class='fn'>2954</sup> <sup class='fn'>2955</sup> <sup class='fn'>2956</sup>

Let no man guilty of adultery or fornication marry any but a
			woman similarly guilty or an Unbeliever nor let any but such a
			man or an Unbeliever marry such a woman: to the Believers such a
			thing is forbidden. <sup class='fn'>2957</sup>

And those who launch a charge against chaste women and produce
			not four witnesses (to support their allegation) flog them with
			eighty stripes: and reject their evidence ever after: for such
			men are wicked transgressors <sup class='fn'>2958</sup>
Unless they repent thereafter and mend (their conduct): for Allah\n\t\t\tis Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful. <sup class='fn'>2959</sup>

And for those who launch a charge against their spouses and have
			(in support) no evidence but their own their solitary evidence
			(can be received) if they bear witness four times (with an oath)
			by Allah that they are solemnly telling the truth; <sup class='fn'>2960</sup>
And the fifth (oath) (should be) that they solemnly invoke the\n\t\t\tcurse of Allah on themselves if they tell a lie.
But it would avert the punishment from the wife if she bears\n\t\t\twitness four times (with an oath) by Allah that (her husband) is\n\t\t\ttelling a lie;
And the fifth (oath) should be that she solemnly invokes the\n\t\t\twrath of Allah on herself if (her accuser) is telling the truth.
If it were not for Allah's grace and mercy on you and that Allah\n\t\t\tis Oft-Returning Full of Wisdom (ye would be ruined indeed).\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2961</sup>

Those who brought forward the lie are a body among yourselves:
			think it not to be an evil to you: on the contrary it is good for
			you: to every man among them (will come the punishment) of the
			sin that he earned and to him who took on himself the lead among
			them will be a Penalty grievous. <sup class='fn'>2962</sup> <sup class='fn'>2963</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2964</sup>
Why did not Believers men and women when ye heard of the affair \n\t\t\tput the best construction on it in their own minds and say "This\n\t\t\t(charge) is an obvious lie"? <sup class='fn'>2965</sup>
Why did they not bring four witnesses to prove it? When they have\n\t\t\tnot brought the witnesses such men in the sight of Allah (stand\n\t\t\tforth) themselves as liars! <sup class='fn'>2966</sup>

Were it not for the grace and mercy of Allah on you in this world\n\t\t\tand the Hereafter a grievous penalty would have seized you in\n\t\t\tthat ye rushed glibly into this affair. <sup class='fn'>2967</sup>

Behold ye received it on your tongues and said out of your mouths
			things of which ye had no knowledge; and ye thought it to be a
			light matter while it was most serious in the sight of Allah.
			<sup class='fn'>2968</sup>
And why did ye not when ye heard it say "It is not right of us to\n\t\t\tspeak of this: Glory to Allah! this is a most serious slander!"\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2969</sup>
Allah doth admonish you that ye may never repeat such (conduct)\n\t\t\tif ye are (true) Believers.
And Allah makes the Signs plain to you: for Allah is full of\n\t\t\tknowledge and wisdom.

Those who love (to see) scandal published broadcast among the\n\t\t\tBelievers will have a grievous Penalty in this life and in the\n\t\t\tHereafter: Allah knows and ye know not. <sup class='fn'>2970</sup>
Were it not for the grace and mercy of Allah on you and that\n\t\t\tAllah is full of kindness and mercy (ye would be ruined indeed).\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2971</sup>

O ye who believe! follow not Satan's footsteps: if any will
			follow the footsteps of Satan he will (but) command what is
			shameful and wrong: and were it not for the grace and mercy of
			Allah on you not one of you would ever have been pure: but Allah
			doth purify whom He pleases: and Allah is One Who hears and knows
			(all things). <sup class='fn'>2972</sup> <sup class='fn'>2973</sup>

Let not those among you who are endued with grace and amplitude
			of means resolve by oath against helping their kinsmen those in
			want and those who have left their homes in Allah's cause: let
			them forgive and overlook: do you not wish that Allah should
			forgive you? For Allah is Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful.
			<sup class='fn'>2974</sup>
Those who slander chaste women indiscreet but believing are\n\t\t\tcursed in this life and in the Hereafter: for them is a grievous\n\t\t\tPenalty <sup class='fn'>2975</sup>
On the Day when their tongues their hands and their feet will\n\t\t\tbear witness against them as to their actions. <sup class='fn'>2976</sup>
On that Day Allah will pay them back (all) their just dues and\n\t\t\tthey will realize that Allah is the (very) Truth that makes all\n\t\t\tthings manifest. <sup class='fn'>2977</sup>

Women impure are for men impure and men impure are for women
			impure; and women of purity are for men of purity and men of
			purity are for women of purity: these are not affected by what
			people say: for them there is forgiveness and a provision
			honorable. <sup class='fn'>2978</sup> <sup class='fn'>2979</sup>

O ye who believe! enter not houses other than your own until ye\n\t\t\thave asked permission and saluted those in them: that is best for\n\t\t\tyou in order that ye may heed (what is seemly). <sup class='fn'>2980</sup>

If ye find no one in the house enter not until permission is
			given to you: if ye are asked to go back go back: that makes for
			greater purity for yourselves: and Allah knows well all that ye
			do. <sup class='fn'>2981</sup>

It is no fault on your part to enter houses not used for living\n\t\t\tin which serve some (other) use for you: and Allah has knowledge\n\t\t\tof what ye reveal and what ye conceal. <sup class='fn'>2982</sup>

Say to the believing men that they should lower their gaze and\n\t\t\tguard their modesty: that will make for greater purity for them:\n\t\t\tand Allah is well acquainted with all that they do. <sup class='fn'>2983</sup>

And say to the believing women that they should lower their gaze
			and guard their modesty; that they should not display their
			beauty and ornaments except what (must ordinarily) appear
			thereof; that they should draw their veils over their bosoms and
			not display their beauty except to their husbands their fathers
			their husbands' fathers their sons their husbands' sons their
			brothers or their brothers' sons or their sisters' sons or their
			women or the slaves whom their right hands possess or male
			servants free of physical needs or small children who have no
			sense of the shame of sex; and that they should not strike their
			feet in order to draw attention to their hidden ornaments.  And O
			ye Believers! turn ye all together towards Allah that ye may
			attain Bliss. <sup class='fn'>2984</sup> <sup class='fn'>2985</sup> <sup class='fn'>2986</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2987</sup>

Marry those among you who are single or the virtuous ones among
			your slaves male or female: if they are in poverty Allah will
			give them means out of His grace: for Allah encompasseth all and
			He knoweth all things. <sup class='fn'>2988</sup> <sup class='fn'>2989</sup>

Let those who find not the wherewithal for marriage keep
			themselves chaste until Allah gives them means out of His grace. 
			And if any of your slaves ask for a deed in writing (to enable
			them to earn their freedom for a certain sum) give them such a
			deed if ye know any good in them; yea give them something
			yourselves out of the means which Allah has given to you.  But
			force not your maids to prostitution when they desire chastity in
			order that ye may make a gain in the goods of this life.  But if
			anyone compels them yet after such compulsion is Allah
			Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful (to them). <sup class='fn'>2990</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2991</sup> <sup class='fn'>2992</sup> <sup class='fn'>2993</sup> <sup class='fn'>2994</sup>

We have already sent down to you verses making things clear an\n\t\t\tillustration from (the story of) people who passed away before\n\t\t\tyou and an admonition for those who fear (Allah). <sup class='fn'>2995</sup>

Allah is the Light of the heavens and the earth.  The parable of
			His Light is as if there were a Niche and within it a lamp: the
			Lamp enclosed in Glass: the glass as it were a brilliant star:
			lit from a blessed Tree an Olive neither of the East nor of the
			West whose Oil is well-nigh luminous though fire scarce touched
			it: Light upon Light! Allah doth guide whom He will to His Light.
			Allah doth set forth Parables for men: and Allah doth know all
			things. <sup class='fn'>2996</sup> <sup class='fn'>2997</sup> <sup class='fn'>2998</sup> <sup class='fn'>2999</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3000</sup> <sup class='fn'>3001</sup> <sup class='fn'>3002</sup> <sup class='fn'>3003</sup>

(Lit is such a light) in houses which Allah hath permitted to be
			raised to honor; for the celebration in them of His name: in them
			is He glorified in the mornings and in the evenings (again and
			again) <sup class='fn'>3004</sup> <sup class='fn'>3005</sup> <sup class='fn'>3006</sup>

By men whom neither traffic nor merchandise can divert from the
			Remembrance of Allah nor from regular Prayer nor from the
			practice of regular Charity: their (only) fear is for the Day
			when hearts and eyes will be transformed (in a world wholly new)
			<sup class='fn'>3007</sup> <sup class='fn'>3008</sup>

That Allah may reward them according to the best of their deeds\n\t\t\tand add even more for them out of His Grace: for Allah doth\n\t\t\tprovide for those whom He will without measure. <sup class='fn'>3009</sup>

But the Unbelievers their deeds are like a mirage in sandy
			deserts which the man parched with thirst mistakes for water;
			until when he comes up to it he finds it to be nothing: but he
			finds Allah (ever) with him and Allah will pay him his account:
			and Allah is swift in taking account. <sup class='fn'>3010</sup> <sup class='fn'>3011</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3012</sup>

Or (the Unbelievers' state) is like the depths of darkness in a
			vast deep ocean overwhelmed with billow topped by billow topped
			by (dark) clouds: depths of darkness one above another: if a man
			stretches out his hand he can hardly see it! for any to whom
			Allah giveth not light there is no light! <sup class='fn'>3013</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3014</sup> <sup class='fn'>3015</sup>

Seest thou not that it is Allah Whose praises all beings in the
			heavens and on earth do celebrate and the birds (of the air) with
			wings outspread? Each one knows its own (mode of) prayer and
			praise.  And Allah knows well all that they do. <sup class='fn'>3016</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3017</sup>
Yea to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth;\n\t\t\tand to Allah is the final goal (of all). <sup class='fn'>3018</sup>

Seest thou not that Allah makes the clouds move gently then joins
			them together then makes them into a heap? then wilt thou see
			rain issue forth from their midst.  And He sends down from the
			sky mountain masses (of clouds) wherein is hail: He strikes
			therewith whom He pleases and He turns it away fro whom He
			pleases.  The vivid flash of His lightning well-nigh blinds the
			sight. <sup class='fn'>3019</sup>
It is Allah Who alternates the Night and the Day: verily in these\n\t\t\tthings is an instructive example for those who have vision!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3020</sup>

And Allah has created every animal from water: of them there are
			some that creep on their bellies; some that walk on two legs; and
			some that walk on four.  Allah creates what He wills: for verily
			Allah has power over all things. <sup class='fn'>3021</sup> <sup class='fn'>3022</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3023</sup>
We have indeed sent down Signs that make things manifest: and\n\t\t\tAllah guides whom He wills to a way that is straight.
They say "We believe in Allah and in the Apostle and we obey":\n\t\t\tbut even after that some of them turn away: they are not (really)\n\t\t\tBelievers. <sup class='fn'>3024</sup>
When they are summoned to Allah and His Apostle in order that He\n\t\t\tmay judge between them behold some of them decline (to come).
But if the right is on their side they come to him with all\n\t\t\tsubmission. <sup class='fn'>3025</sup>

Is it that there is a disease in their hearts? Or do they doubt\n\t\t\tor are they in fear that Allah and His Apostle will deal unjustly\n\t\t\twith them? Nay it is they themselves who do wrong. <sup class='fn'>3026</sup>

The answer of the Believers when summoned to Allah and His
			Apostle in order that He may judge between them is no other than
			this: they say "We hear and we obey": it is such as these that
			will attain felicity. <sup class='fn'>3027</sup> <sup class='fn'>3028</sup>
It is such as obey Allah and His Apostle and fear Allah and do\n\t\t\tright that will win (in the end).

They swear their strongest oaths by Allah that if only thou
			wouldst command them they would leave (their homes).  Say: "Swear
			ye not; obedience is (more) reasonable: verily Allah is
			well-acquainted with all that ye do." <sup class='fn'>3029</sup>

Say: "Obey Allah and obey the Apostle: but if ye turn away he is
			only responsible for the duty placed on him and ye for that
			placed on you. If ye obey him ye shall be on right guidance.  The
			Apostle's duty is only to preach the clear (Message)."
			<sup class='fn'>3030</sup>

Allah has promised to those among you who believe and work
			righteous deeds that He will of a surety grant them in the land
			inheritance (of power) as He granted it to those before them;
			that He will establish in authority their religion the one which
			He has chosen for them; and that He will change (their state)
			after the fear in which they (lived) to one of security and
			peace: `They will worship Me (alone) and not associate aught with
			Me.'  If any do reject faith after this they are rebellious and
			wicked. <sup class='fn'>3031</sup> <sup class='fn'>3032</sup>
So establish regular Prayer and give regular Charity: and obey\n\t\t\tthe Apostle; that ye may receive mercy.
Never think thou that the Unbelievers are going to frustrate\n\t\t\t(Allah's Plan) on earth: their abode is the Fire and it is indeed\n\t\t\tan evil refuge!

O ye who believe! let those whom your right hands possess and the
			(children) among you who have not come of age ask your permission
			(before they come to your presence) on three occasions before
			morning prayer; the while ye doff your clothes for the noonday
			heat; and after the late-night prayer: these are your three times
			of undress: outside those times it is not wrong for you or for
			them to move about attending to each other: thus does Allah make
			clear the Signs to you: for Allah is full of knowledge and
			wisdom. <sup class='fn'>3033</sup> <sup class='fn'>3034</sup> <sup class='fn'>3035</sup> <sup class='fn'>3036</sup>

But when the children among you come of age let them (also) ask
			for permission as do those senior to them (in age): thus does
			Allah make clear His Signs to you: for Allah is full of knowledge
			and wisdom. <sup class='fn'>3037</sup> <sup class='fn'>3038</sup> <sup class='fn'>3039</sup>

Such elderly women as are past the prospect of marriage there is
			no blame on them if they lay aside their (outer) garments
			provided they make not a wanton display of their beauty: but it
			is best for them to be modest: and Allah is One Who sees and
			knows all things. <sup class='fn'>3040</sup> <sup class='fn'>3041</sup>

it is no fault in the blind nor in one born lame nor in one
			afflicted with illness nor in yourselves that ye should eat in
			your own houses or those of your fathers or your mothers or your
			brothers or your sisters or your father's brothers or your
			father's sisters or your mother's brothers or your mother's
			sisters or in houses of which the keys are in your possession or
			in the house of a sincere friend of yours: there is no blame on
			you whether ye eat in company or separately.  But if ye enter
			houses salute each other a greeting or blessing and purity as
			from Allah.  Thus does Allah make clear the Signs to you: that ye
			may understand. <sup class='fn'>3042</sup> <sup class='fn'>3043</sup> <sup class='fn'>3044</sup>

Only those are Believers who believe in Allah and His Apostle:
			when they are with him on a matter requiring collective action
			they do not depart until they have asked for his leave: those who
			ask for thy leave are those who believe in Allah and His Apostle;
			so when they ask for thy leave for some business of theirs give
			leave to those of them whom thou wilt and ask Allah for their
			forgiveness: for Allah is Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful.
			<sup class='fn'>3045</sup> <sup class='fn'>3046</sup> <sup class='fn'>3047</sup>

Deem not the summons of the Apostle among yourselves like the
			summons of one of you to another: Allah doth know those of you
			who slip away under shelter of some excuse: then let those beware
			who withstand the Apostle's order lest some trial befall them or
			a grievous Penalty be inflicted on them. <sup class='fn'>3048</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3049</sup>

Be quite sure that to Allah doth belong whatever is in the
			heavens and on earth.  Well doth He know what ye are intent upon:
			and one day they will be brought back to Him and He will tell
			them the truth of what they did: for Allah doth know all things.
			<sup class='fn'>3050</sup> <sup class='fn'>3051</sup>
Blessed is He Who sent down the Criterion to His servant that it\n\t\t\tmay be an admonition to all creatures <sup class='fn'>3052</sup> <sup class='fn'>3053</sup>\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3054</sup>

He to Whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth: no
			son has He begotten nor has He a partner in His dominion: it is
			He Who created all things and ordered them in due proportions.
			<sup class='fn'>3055</sup>

Yet have they taken besides Him gods that can create nothing but
			are themselves created; that have no control of hurt or good to
			themselves; nor can they control Death nor Life nor Resurrection.
			<sup class='fn'>3056</sup>

But the Misbelievers say: "Naught is this but a lie which he has\n\t\t\tforged and others have helped him at it." In truth it is they who\n\t\t\thave put forward an iniquity and a falsehood. <sup class='fn'>3057</sup>
And they say: "Tales of the ancients which he has caused to be\n\t\t\twritten: and they are dictated before him morning and evening."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3058</sup>
Say: "The (Qur'an) was sent down by Him Who knows the Mystery\n\t\t\t(that is) in the heavens and the earth: verily He is\n\t\t\tOft-Forgiving Most Merciful." <sup class='fn'>3059</sup>

And they say: "What sort of an apostle is this who eats food and\n\t\t\twalks through the streets? Why has not an angel been sent down to\n\t\t\thim to give admonition with him? <sup class='fn'>3060</sup>

"Or (why) has not a treasure been bestowed on him or why has he\n\t\t\t(not) a garden for enjoyment?" The wicked say: "Ye follow none\n\t\t\tother than a man bewitched." <sup class='fn'>3061</sup> <sup class='fn'>3062</sup>
See what kinds of companions they make for thee! But they have\n\t\t\tgone astray and never a way will they be able to find!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3063</sup>

Blessed is He Who if that were His will could give thee better
			(things) than those Gardens beneath which rivers flow; and He
			could give thee Palaces (secure to dwell in). <sup class='fn'>3064</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>2065</sup>
Nay they deny the Hour (of the Judgment to come): but We have\n\t\t\tprepared a Blazing Fire for such as deny the Hour: <sup class='fn'>3066</sup>
When it sees them from a place far off they will hear its fury\n\t\t\tand its raging sigh. <sup class='fn'>3067</sup>
And when they are cast bound together into a constricted place\n\t\t\ttherein they will plead for destruction there and then!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3068</sup>
"This day plead not for a single destruction: plead for\n\t\t\tdestruction oft-repeated!"
Say: "Is that best or the eternal Garden promised to the\n\t\t\trighteous? For them that is a reward as well as a goal (of\n\t\t\tattainment). <sup class='fn'>3069</sup> <sup class='fn'>3070</sup>
"For them there will be therein all that they wish for: they will\n\t\t\tdwell (there) for aye: a promise to be prayed for from thy Lord."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3071</sup>

The Day He will gather them together as well as those whom they
			worship besides Allah He will ask: "Was it ye who led these my
			servants astray or did they stray from the Path themselves?"
			<sup class='fn'>3072</sup>

They will say: "Glory to Thee! not meet was it for us that we
			should take for protectors others besides Thee: but Thou didst
			bestow on them and their fathers good things (in life) until they
			forgot the Message: for they were a people (worthless and) lost.
			<sup class='fn'>3073</sup>

(Allah will say): "Now have they proved you liars in what ye say:
			so ye cannot avert (your penalty) nor (get) help." And whoever
			among you does wrong him shall We cause to taste of a grievous
			Penalty. <sup class='fn'>3074</sup>

And the apostles whom We sent before thee were all (men) who ate
			food and walked through the streets: We have made some of you as
			a trial for others: will ye have patience? For Allah is One Who
			sees (all things). <sup class='fn'>3075</sup> <sup class='fn'>3076</sup>

Such as fear not the meeting with Us (for Judgment) say: "Why are
			not the angels sent down to us or (why) do we not see our Lord?"
			Indeed they have an arrogant conceit of themselves and mighty is
			the insolence of their impiety! <sup class='fn'>3077</sup> <sup class='fn'>3078</sup>
The Day they see the angels no joy will there be to the sinners\n\t\t\tthat Day: the (angels) will say: "There is a barrier forbidden\n\t\t\t(to you) altogether!" <sup class='fn'>3079</sup>
And We shall turn to whatever deeds they did (in this life) and\n\t\t\tWe shall make such deeds as floating dust scattered about.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3080</sup>
The Companions of the Garden will be well that Day in their abode\n\t\t\tand have the fairest of places for repose. <sup class='fn'>3081</sup>
The Day the heaven shall be rent asunder with clouds and angels\n\t\t\tshall be sent down descending (in ranks) <sup class='fn'>3082</sup>
That Day the dominion as of right and truth shall be (wholly) for\n\t\t\t(Allah) Most Merciful: it will be a day of dire difficulty for\n\t\t\tthe Misbelievers. <sup class='fn'>3083</sup>
The Day that the wrongdoer will bite at his hands He will say\n\t\t\t"Oh! would that I had taken a (straight) path with the Apostle!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3084</sup>
"Ah! woe is me! would that I had never taken such a one for a\n\t\t\tfriend!
"He did lead me astray from the Message (of Allah) after it had\n\t\t\tcome to me! Ah! the Evil One is but a traitor to man!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3085</sup>
Then the Apostle will say: "O my Lord! truly my people took this\n\t\t\tQur'an for just foolish nonsense." <sup class='fn'>3086</sup>
Thus have We made for every prophet an enemy among the sinners:\n\t\t\tbut enough is thy Lord to guide and to help. <sup class='fn'>3087</sup>

Those who reject Faith say: "Why is not the Qur'an revealed to
			him all at once?" Thus (is it revealed) that We may strengthen
			thy heart thereby and We have rehearsed it to thee in slow
			well-arranged stages gradually. <sup class='fn'>3088</sup>
And no question do they bring to thee but We reveal to thee the\n\t\t\ttruth and the best explanation (thereof). <sup class='fn'>3089</sup>
Those who will be gathered to Hell (prone) on their faces they\n\t\t\twill be in an evil plight and as to Path most astray.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3090</sup> <sup class='fn'>3091</sup>
Before this We sent Moses the Book and appointed his brother\n\t\t\tAaron with him as Minister; <sup class='fn'>3092</sup>
