And We commanded: "Go ye both to the people who have rejected Our\n\t\t\tSigns": and those (people) We destroyed with utter destruction.

And the people of Noah when they rejected the apostles We drowned\n\t\t\tthem and We made them as a Sign for mankind; and We have prepared\n\t\t\tfor (all) wrongdoers a grievous Penalty <sup class='fn'>3093</sup>
As also `Ad and Thamud and the Companions of the Rass and many a\n\t\t\tgeneration between them. <sup class='fn'>3094</sup>
To teach one We set forth parables and examples; and each one We\n\t\t\tbroke to utter annihilation (for their sins).

And the (Unbelievers) must indeed have passed by the town on
			which was rained a shower of evil: did they not then see it (with
			their own eyes)? But they fear not the Resurrection.
			<sup class='fn'>3095</sup>
When they see thee they treat thee no otherwise than in mockery:\n\t\t\t"Is this the one whom Allah has sent as an apostle?"

"He indeed would well-nigh have misled us from our gods had it
			not been that we were constant to them!" Soon will they know when
			they see the Penalty who it is that is most misled in Path!
			<sup class='fn'>3096</sup>
Seest thou such a one as taketh for his god his own passion (or\n\t\t\timpulse)? Couldst thou be a disposer of affairs for him?\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3097</sup>
Or thinkest thou that most of them listen or understand? They are\n\t\t\tonly like cattle; nay they are worse astray in Path.

Hast thou not turned thy vision to thy Lord? how He doth prolong\n\t\t\tthe Shadow! If He willed He could make it stationary! Then do We\n\t\t\tmake the sun its guide: <sup class='fn'>3098</sup> <sup class='fn'>3099</sup> <sup class='fn'>3100</sup>
Then We draw it in towards Ourselves a contraction by easy\n\t\t\tstages. <sup class='fn'>3101</sup> <sup class='fn'>3102</sup>
And He it is Who makes the Night as a Robe for you; and Sleep as\n\t\t\tRepose and makes the Day (as it were) a Resurrection.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3103</sup>
And He it is Who sends the Winds as heralds of glad tidings going\n\t\t\tbefore His Mercy and We send down purifying water from the sky\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3104</sup> <sup class='fn'>3105</sup>
That with it We may give life to a dead land and slake the thirst\n\t\t\tof things We have created cattle and men in great numbers.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3106</sup>

And We have distributed the (water) amongst them in order that\n\t\t\tthey may celebrate (Our) praises but most men are averse (to\n\t\t\taught) but (rank) ingratitude. <sup class='fn'>3107</sup> <sup class='fn'>3108</sup>
Had it been Our Will We could have sent a warner to every center\n\t\t\tof population <sup class='fn'>3109</sup>
Therefore listen not to the Unbelievers but strive against them\n\t\t\twith the utmost strenuousness with the (Qur'an). <sup class='fn'>3110</sup>

It is He Who has let free the two bodies of flowing water: one
			palatable and sweet and the other salt and bitter; yet has He
			made a barrier between them a partition that is forbidden to be
			passed. <sup class='fn'>3111</sup> <sup class='fn'>3112</sup>

It is He Who has created man from water: then has He established\n\t\t\trelationships of lineage and marriage: for thy Lord has power\n\t\t\t(over all things). <sup class='fn'>3113</sup> <sup class='fn'>3114</sup>
Yet do they worship besides Allah things that can neither profit\n\t\t\tthem nor harm them: and the Misbeliever is a helper (of Evil)\n\t\t\tagainst his own Lord! <sup class='fn'>3115</sup>
But thee We only sent to give glad tidings and admonition.
Say: "No reward do I ask of you for it but this: that each one\n\t\t\twho will may take a (straight) Path to his Lord."
And put thy trust in Him Who lives and dies not; and celebrate\n\t\t\tHis praise; and enough is He to be acquainted with the faults of\n\t\t\tHis servants <sup class='fn'>3116</sup>

He Who created the heavens and the earth and all that is between
			in six days and is firmly established on the Throne (of

			<sup class='fn'>3119</sup>

When it is said to them "Adore ye (Allah) Most Gracious!" they

Blessed is He Who made Constellations in the skies and placed\n\t\t\ttherein a Lamp and a Moon giving light; <sup class='fn'>3121</sup>

And the servants of (Allah) Most Gracious are those who walk on\n\t\t\tthe earth in humility and when the ignorant address them they say\n\t\t\t"Peace!" <sup class='fn'>3123</sup>
Those who spend the night in adoration of their Lord prostrate\n\t\t\tand standing; <sup class='fn'>3124</sup>
Those who say "Our Lord! avert from us the Wrath of Hell for its\n\t\t\tWrath is indeed an affliction grievous <sup class='fn'>3125</sup>
"Evil indeed is it as an abode and as a place to rest in";\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3126</sup>
Those who when they spend are not extravagant and not niggardly\n\t\t\tbut hold a just (balance) between those (extremes); <sup class='fn'>3127</sup>

Those who invoke not with Allah any other god nor slay such life
			as Allah has made sacred except for just cause not commit
			fornication  and any that does this (not only) meets punishment
			<sup class='fn'>3128</sup>
(But) the Penalty on the Day of Judgment will be doubled to him\n\t\t\tand he will dwell therein in ignominy <sup class='fn'>3129</sup>
Unless he repents believes and works righteous deeds for Allah\n\t\t\twill change the evil of such persons into good and Allah is\n\t\t\tOft-Forgiving Most Merciful <sup class='fn'>3130</sup>
And whoever repents and does good has truly turned to Allah with\n\t\t\tan (acceptable) conversion
Those who witness no falsehood and if they pass by futility they\n\t\t\tpass by it with honorable (avoidance); <sup class='fn'>3131</sup>\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3132</sup>
Those who when they are admonished with the Signs of their Lord\n\t\t\tdroop not down at them as if they were deaf or blind:\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3133</sup>

And those who pray "Our Lord! grant unto us wives and offspring\n\t\t\twho will be the comfort of our eyes and give us (the grace) to\n\t\t\tlead the righteous." <sup class='fn'>3134</sup> <sup class='fn'>3135</sup>
Those are the ones who will be rewarded with the highest place in\n\t\t\theaven because of their patient constancy; therein shall they be\n\t\t\tmet with salutations and peace
Dwelling therein how beautiful an abode and place of rest!

Say (to the rejecters): "My Lord is not uneasy because of you if\n\t\t\tye call not on Him but ye have indeed rejected (Him) and soon\n\t\t\twill come the inevitable (punishment)!" <sup class='fn'>3136</sup>
Ta Sin Mim. <sup class='fn'>3137</sup>
These are Verses of the Book that makes (things) clear.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3138</sup>
It may be thou frettest thy soul with grief that they do not\n\t\t\tbecome Believers. <sup class='fn'>3139</sup>
If (such) were Our Will We could send down to them from the sky a\n\t\t\tSign to which they would bend their necks in humility.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3140</sup>
But there comes not to them a newly-revealed message from (Allah)\n\t\t\tMost Gracious but they turn away therefrom.
They have indeed rejected (the Message): so they will know soon\n\t\t\t(enough) the truth of what they mocked at! <sup class='fn'>3141</sup>
Do they not look at the earth how many noble things of all kinds\n\t\t\twe have produced therein? <sup class='fn'>3142</sup>
Verily in this is a Sign: but most of them do not believe.
And verily thy Lord is He the Exalted in Might Most Merciful.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3143</sup>
Behold thy Lord called Moses: "Go to the people of iniquity\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3144</sup>
"The people of Pharaoh: will they not fear Allah?"
He said: "O my Lord! I do fear that they will charge me with\n\t\t\tfalsehood:
"My breast will be straitened and my speech may not go\n\t\t\t(smoothly): so send unto Aaron. <sup class='fn'>3145</sup>
"And (further) they have a charge of crime against me; and I fear\n\t\t\tthey may slay me." <sup class='fn'>3146</sup>
Allah said: "By no means! proceed then both of you with Our\n\t\t\tSigns; We are with you and will listen (to your call).
"So go forth both of you to Pharaoh and say: `We have been sent\n\t\t\tby the Lord and Cherisher of the Worlds;
" `Send thou with us the Children of Israel.' "
(Pharaoh) said: "Did we not cherish thee as a child among us and\n\t\t\tdidst thou not stay in our midst many years of thy life?\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3147</sup>
"And thou didst a deed of thine which (thou knowest) thou didst\n\t\t\tand thou art an ungrateful (wretch)!" <sup class='fn'>3148</sup>
Moses: "I did it then when I was in error. <sup class='fn'>3149</sup>
"So I fled from you (all) when I feared you; but my Lord has\n\t\t\t(since) invested me with judgment (and wisdom) and appointed me\n\t\t\tas one of the apostles. <sup class='fn'>3150</sup>
"And this is the favor with which thou dost reproach me that thou\n\t\t\thast enslaved the Children of Israel" <sup class='fn'>3151</sup>
Pharaoh said: "And what is the `Lord and Cherisher of the\n\t\t\tWorlds?' " <sup class='fn'>3152</sup>
(Moses) said: "The Lord and Cherisher of the heavens and the\n\t\t\tearth and all between if ye want to be quite sure."
(Pharaoh) said to those around: "Do ye not listen (to what he\n\t\t\tsays)?" <sup class='fn'>3153</sup>
(Moses) said: "Your Lord and the Lord of your fathers from the\n\t\t\tbeginning!"
(Pharaoh) said: "Truly your apostle who has been sent to you is a\n\t\t\tveritable madman!" <sup class='fn'>3154</sup>
(Moses) said: "Lord of the East and the West and all between! If\n\t\t\tye only had sense!"
(Pharaoh) said: "If thou dost put forward any god other than me I\n\t\t\twill certainly put thee in prison!" <sup class='fn'>3155</sup>
(Moses) said: "Even if I showed you something clear (and)\n\t\t\tconvincing?" <sup class='fn'>3156</sup>
(Pharaoh) said: "Show it then if thou tellest the truth!"
So (Moses) threw his rod and behold it was a serpent plain (for\n\t\t\tall to see)!
And he drew out his hand and behold it was white to all\n\t\t\tbeholders! <sup class='fn'>3157</sup>
(Pharaoh) said to the Chiefs around him: "This is indeed a\n\t\t\tsorcerer well-versed: <sup class='fn'>3158</sup>
"His plan is to get you out of your land by his sorcery; then\n\t\t\twhat is it ye counsel?"
They said: "Keep him and his brother in suspense (for a while)\n\t\t\tand dispatch to the Cities heralds to collect
"And bring up to thee all (our) sorcerers well-versed."
So the sorcerers were got together for the appointment of a day\n\t\t\twell-known <sup class='fn'>3159</sup>
And the people were told: "Are ye (now) assembled?
"That we may follow the sorcerers (in religion) if they win?"\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3160</sup>
So when the sorcerers arrived they said to Pharaoh: "Of course \n\t\t\tshall we have a (suitable) reward if we win?" <sup class='fn'>3161</sup>
He said: "Yea (and more) for ye shall in that case be (raised to\n\t\t\tposts) nearest (to my person)."
Moses said to them: "Throw ye that which ye are about to throw!"\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3162</sup>
So they threw their ropes and their rods and said: "By the might\n\t\t\tof Pharaoh it is we who will certainly win!" <sup class='fn'>3163</sup>
Then Moses threw his rod when behold it straightway swallows up\n\t\t\tall the falsehoods which they fake! <sup class='fn'>3164</sup>
Then did the sorcerers fall down prostrate in adoration
Saying: "We believe in the Lord of the Worlds
"The Lord of Moses and Aaron."

Said (Pharaoh): "Believe ye in him before I give you permission?
			Surely he is your leader who has taught you sorcery! But soon
			shall ye know!	"But sure I will cut off your hands and your feet
			on opposite sides and I will cause you all to die on the cross!"
			<sup class='fn'>3165</sup>
They said: "No matter! for us we shall but return to our Lord!
"Only our desire is that our Lord will forgive us our faults that\n\t\t\twe may become foremost among the Believers!" <sup class='fn'>3166</sup>
By inspiration We told Moses: "Travel by night with My servants;\n\t\t\tfor surely ye shall be pursued." <sup class='fn'>3167</sup>
Then Pharaoh sent heralds to (all) the Cities
(Saying): "These (Israelites) are but a small band
"And they are raging furiously against us;
"But we are a multitude amply fore-warned."
So We expelled them from gardens springs <sup class='fn'>3168</sup>
Treasures and every kind of honorable position;
Thus it was but We made the Children of Israel inheritors of such\n\t\t\tthings. <sup class='fn'>3169</sup>
So they pursued them at sunrise. <sup class='fn'>3170</sup>
And when the two bodies saw each other the people of Moses said:\n\t\t\t"We are sure to be overtaken."
(Moses said: "By no means! my Lord is with me! Soon will He guide\n\t\t\tme! <sup class='fn'>3171</sup>
Then We told Moses by inspiration: "Strike the sea with thy rod."\n\t\t\tSo it divided and each separate part become like the huge firm\n\t\t\tmass of a mountain.
And We made the other party approach thither. <sup class='fn'>3172</sup>
We delivered Moses and all who were with him;
But We drowned the others.
Verily in this is a Sign: but most of them do not believe.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3173</sup>
And verily thy Lord is He the Exalted in Might Most Merciful.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3174</sup>
And rehearse to them (something of) Abraham's story.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3175</sup>
Behold he said to his father and his people: "What worship ye?"
They said: "We worship idols and we remain constantly in\n\t\t\tattendance on them." <sup class='fn'>3176</sup>
He said: "Do they listen to you when ye call (on them)
"Or do you good or harm?"
They said: "Nay but we found our fathers doing thus (what we\n\t\t\tdo)."
He said: "Do ye then see whom ye have been worshipping
"Ye and your fathers before you?
"For they are enemies to me; not so the Lord and Cherisher of the\n\t\t\tWorlds; <sup class='fn'>3177</sup>
"Who created me and it is He Who guides me;
"Who gives me food and drink
"And when I am ill it is He Who cures me;
"Who will cause me to die and then to live (again);
"And Who I hope will forgive me my faults on the Day of\n\t\t\tJudgment...
O my Lord! bestow wisdom on me and join me with the righteous;\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3178</sup>
"Grant me honorable mention on the tongue of truth among the\n\t\t\tlatest (generations); <sup class='fn'>3179</sup>
"Make me one of the inheritors of the Garden of Bliss;
"Forgive my father for that he is among those astray;
"And let me not be in disgrace on the Day when (men) will be\n\t\t\traised up
The Day whereon neither wealth nor sons will avail <sup class='fn'>3180</sup>
"But only he (will prosper) that brings to Allah a sound heart;
"To the righteous the Garden will be brought near <sup class='fn'>3181</sup>
"And to those straying in Evil the Fire will be placed in full\n\t\t\tview;
"And it shall be said to them: `Where are the (gods) ye\n\t\t\tworshipped
" `Besides Allah? Can they help you or help themselves?'
"Then they will be thrown headlong into the (Fire) they and those\n\t\t\tstraying in Evil <sup class='fn'>3182</sup>
"And the whole hosts of Iblis together.
"They will say there in their mutual bickerings:
" `By Allah we were truly in an error manifest <sup class='fn'>3183</sup>
" `When we held you as equals with the Lord of the Worlds;
" `And our seducers were only those who were steeped in guilt.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3184</sup>
" `Now then we have none to intercede (for us)
" `Nor a single friend to feel (for us).
" `Now if we only had a chance of return we shall truly be of\n\t\t\tthose who believe!' " <sup class='fn'>3185</sup>
Verily in this is a Sign but most of them do not believe.
And verily the Lord is He the Exalted in Might Most Merciful.
The people of Noah rejected the apostles.
Behold their brother Noah said to them: "Will ye not fear\n\t\t\t(Allah)? <sup class='fn'>3186</sup>
"I am to you an apostle worthy of all trust: <sup class='fn'>3187</sup>
"So fear Allah and obey me.
"No reward do I ask of you for it: my reward is only from the\n\t\t\tLord of the Worlds:
"So fear Allah and obey me." <sup class='fn'>3188</sup>
They said: "Shall we believe in thee when it is the meanest that\n\t\t\tfollow thee?" <sup class='fn'>3189</sup>
He said: "And what do I know as to what they do?
"Their account is only with my Lord if ye could (but) understand.
"I am not one to drive away those who believe. <sup class='fn'>3190</sup>
"I am sent only to warn plainly in public."
They said: "If thou desist not O Noah! thou shalt be stoned (to\n\t\t\tdeath)." <sup class='fn'>3191</sup>
He said: "O my Lord! truly my people have rejected me.
"Judge thou then between me and them openly and deliver me and\n\t\t\tthose of the Believers who are with me."
So we delivered him and those with him in the Ark filled (with\n\t\t\tall creatures). <sup class='fn'>3192</sup>
Thereafter We drowned those who remained behind.
Verily in this is a Sign: but most of them do not believe.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3193</sup>
And verily thy Lord is He the Exalted in Might Most Merciful.
The `Ad (people) rejected the apostles. <sup class='fn'>3194</sup>
Behold their brother Hud said to them: "Will ye not fear (Allah)?
"I am to you an apostle worthy of all trust. <sup class='fn'>3195</sup>
"So fear Allah and obey me.
"No reward do I ask of you for it: my reward is only from the\n\t\t\tLord of the Worlds.
"Do ye build a landmark on every high place to amuse yourselves?\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3196</sup>
"And do ye get for yourselves fine buildings in the hope of\n\t\t\tliving therein (forever)?
"And when ye exert your strong hand do ye do it like men of\n\t\t\tabsolute power? <sup class='fn'>3197</sup>
"Now fear Allah and obey me. <sup class='fn'>3198</sup>
"Yea fear Him Who has bestowed on you freely all that ye know.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3199</sup>
"Freely has He bestowed on you cattle and sons
And Gardens and Springs.
"Truly I fear for you the Penalty of a Great Day." <sup class='fn'>3200</sup>
They said: "It is the same to us whether thou admonish us or be\n\t\t\tnot among (our) Admonishers! <sup class='fn'>3201</sup>
"This is no other than a customary device of the ancients\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3202</sup>
"And we are not the ones to receive Pains and Penalties!"
So they rejected him and We destroyed them verily in this is a\n\t\t\tSign: but most of them do not believe.
And verily thy Lord is He the Exalted in Might Most Merciful.
The Thamud (people) rejected the apostles. <sup class='fn'>3203</sup>
Behold their brother Salih said to them: "Will you fear (Allah)?
"I am to you an apostle worthy of all trust.
"So fear Allah and obey me.
"No reward do I ask of you for it: my reward is only from the\n\t\t\tLord of the Worlds.
"Will ye be left secure in (the enjoyment of) all that ye have\n\t\t\there?--
"Gardens and Springs
"And corn-fields and date-palms with spathes near breaking (with\n\t\t\tthe weight of fruit)? <sup class='fn'>3204</sup>
"And ye carve house out of (rocky) mountains with great skill.
"But fear Allah and obey me;
"And follow not the bidding of those who are extravagant\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3205</sup>
"Who make mischief in the land and mend not (their ways)."
They said: "Thou art only one of those bewitched! <sup class='fn'>3206</sup>
"Thou art no more than a mortal like us: then bring us a Sign if\n\t\t\tthou tellest the truth!"
He said: "Here is a she-camel: she has a right of watering and ye\n\t\t\thave a right of watering (severally) on a day appointed.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3207</sup>
"Touch her not with harm lest the Penalty of a Great Day seize\n\t\t\tyou."
But they hamstrung her: then did they become full of regrets.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3208</sup>
But the Penalty seized them.  Verily in this is a Sign: but most\n\t\t\tof them do not believe.
And verily thy Lord is He the Exalted in Might Most Merciful.
The people of Lut rejected the apostles. <sup class='fn'>3209</sup>
Behold their brother Lut said to them: "Will ye not fear (Allah)?
"I am to you an apostle worthy of all trust.
"So fear Allah and obey me.
"No reward do I ask of you for it: my reward is only from the\n\t\t\tLord of the Worlds.
"Of all the creatures in the world will ye approach males.
"And leave those whom Allah has created for you to be your mates?\n\t\t\tNay ye are a people transgressing (all limits)!"
They said: "If thou desist not O Lut! thou wilt assuredly be cast\n\t\t\tout!" <sup class='fn'>3210</sup>
He said: "I do detest your doings." <sup class='fn'>3211</sup>
"O my Lord! deliver me and my family from such things as they\n\t\t\tdo!"
So We delivered him and his family all
Except an old woman who lingered behind. <sup class='fn'>3212</sup>
But the rest We destroyed utterly.
We rained down on them a shower (of brimstone): and evil was the\n\t\t\tshower on those who were admonished (but heeded not)!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3213</sup>
Verily in this is a Sign: but most of them do not believe.
And verily thy Lord is He the Exalted in Might Most Merciful.
The Companions of the Wood rejected the apostles. <sup class='fn'>3214</sup>
Behold Shuaib said to them: "Will ye not fear (Allah)?\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3215</sup>
"I am to you an apostle worthy of all trust.
"So fear Allah and obey me.
"No reward do I ask of you for it: my reward is only from the\n\t\t\tLord of the Worlds.
"Give just measure and cause no loss (to others by fraud).\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3216</sup>
"And weigh with scales true and upright.
"And withhold not things justly due to men nor do evil in the\n\t\t\tland working mischief.
"And fear Him Who created you and (Who created) the generations\n\t\t\tbefore (you).
They said: "Thou art only one of those bewitched!
"Thou art no more than a mortal like us and indeed we think thou\n\t\t\tart a liar! <sup class='fn'>3217</sup>
"Now cause a piece of the sky to fall on us if thou art\n\t\t\ttruthful!" <sup class='fn'>3218</sup>
He said: "My Lord knows best what ye do." <sup class='fn'>3219</sup>
But they rejected him.\tThen the punishment of a day of\n\t\t\tovershadowing gloom seized them and that was the Penalty of a\n\t\t\tGreat Day. <sup class='fn'>3220</sup> <sup class='fn'>3221</sup>
Verily in that is a Sign: but most of them do not believe.
And verily thy Lord is He.  The Exalted in Might Most Merciful.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3222</sup>
Verily this is a Revelation from the Lord of the Worlds:\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3223</sup>
With it came down the Spirit of Faith and Truth <sup class='fn'>3224</sup>
To thy heart and mind that thou mayest admonish <sup class='fn'>3225</sup>
In the perspicuous Arabic tongue.
Without doubt it is (announced) in the mystic Books of former\n\t\t\tpeoples. <sup class='fn'>3226</sup>
Is it not a Sign to them that the learned of the Children of\n\t\t\tIsrael knew it (as true)? <sup class='fn'>3227</sup>
Had We revealed it to any of the non-Arabs
And had he recited it to them they would not have believed in it.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3228</sup>
Thus have We caused it to enter the hearts of the Sinners.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3229</sup>
They will not believe in it until they see the grievous Penalty;
But the (Penalty) will come to them of a sudden while they\n\t\t\tperceive it not;
Then they will say: "Shall we be respited?"
Do they then ask for Our Penalty to be hastened on? <sup class='fn'>3230</sup>
Seest thou? If We do let them enjoy (this life) for a few years
Yet there comes to them at length the (Punishment) which they\n\t\t\twere promised!
It will profit them not that they enjoyed (this life)!
Never did We destroy a population but had its warners
By way of reminder; and We never are unjust. <sup class='fn'>3231</sup>
No evil ones have brought down this (Revelation): <sup class='fn'>3232</sup>
It would neither suit them nor would they be able (to produce\n\t\t\tit).
Indeed they have been removed far from even (a chance of) hearing\n\t\t\tit.
So call not on any other god with Allah or thou wilt be among\n\t\t\tthose under the Penalty.
And admonish thy nearest kinsmen
And lower thy wing to the Believers who follow thee.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3233</sup>
Then if they disobey thee say: "I am free (of responsibility) for\n\t\t\twhat ye do!" <sup class='fn'>3234</sup>
And put thy trust on the Exalted in Might the Merciful
Who seeth thee standing forth (in prayer)
And thy movements among those who prostrate themselves.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3235</sup>
For it is He Who heareth and knoweth all things.
Shall I inform you (O people!) on whom it is that the evil ones\n\t\t\tdescend? <sup class='fn'>3236</sup>
They descend on every lying wicked person
(Into whose ears) they pour hearsay vanities and most of them are\n\t\t\tliars.
And the Poets it is those straying in Evil who follow them:\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3237</sup>
Seest thou not that they wander distracted in every valley?
And that they say what they practice not?

Except those who believe work righteousness engage much in the
			remembrance of Allah and defend themselves only after they are
			unjustly attacked. And soon will the unjust assailants know what
			vicissitudes their affairs will take! <sup class='fn'>3238</sup> <sup class='fn'>3239</sup>
Ta Sin.  These are verses of the Qur'an a Book that makes\n\t\t\t(things) clear; <sup class='fn'>3240</sup>
A Guide; and Glad Tidings for the Believers <sup class='fn'>3241</sup>
Those who establish regular prayers and give in regular charity\n\t\t\tand also have (full) assurance of the Hereafter.
As to those who believe not in the Hereafter We have made their\n\t\t\tdeeds pleasing in their eyes; and so they wander about in\n\t\t\tdistraction. <sup class='fn'>3242</sup>
Such are they for whom a grievous Penalty is (waiting): and in\n\t\t\tthe Hereafter theirs will be the greatest loss. <sup class='fn'>3243</sup>
As to thee the Qur'an is bestowed upon thee from the presence of\n\t\t\tOne Who is Wise and All-Knowing.

Behold! Moses said to his family: "I perceive a fire; soon will I
			bring you from there some information or I will bring you a
			burning brand to light our fuel that ye may warm yourselves."
			<sup class='fn'>3244</sup>
But when he came to the (Fire) a voice was heard: "Blessed are\n\t\t\tthose in the Fire and those around: and Glory to Allah the Lord\n\t\t\tof the Worlds! <sup class='fn'>3245</sup>
"O Moses! verily I am Allah the Exalted in Might the Wise!...

"Now do thou throw thy rod!" But when he saw it moving (of its
			own accord) as if it had been a snake he turned back in retreat
			and retraced not his steps: "O Moses" (it was said) "fear not:
			truly in My presence those called as apostles have no fear
			<sup class='fn'>3246</sup> <sup class='fn'>3247</sup>
"But if any have done wrong and have thereafter substituted good\n\t\t\tto take the place of evil truly I am Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3248</sup>

"Now put thy hand into thy bosom and it will come forth white
			without stain (or harm): (these are) among the nine Signs (thou
			wilt take) to Pharaoh and his people: for they are a people
			rebellious in transgression. <sup class='fn'>3249</sup> <sup class='fn'>3250</sup>
But when our Signs came to them that should have opened their\n\t\t\teyes they said: "This is sorcery manifest!" <sup class='fn'>3251</sup>
And they rejected those Signs in iniquity and arrogance though\n\t\t\ttheir souls were convinced thereof: so see what was the end of\n\t\t\tthose who acted corruptly!

We gave (in the past) knowledge to David and Solomon: and they\n\t\t\tboth said: "Praise be to Allah Who has favored us above many of\n\t\t\tHis servants who believe!" <sup class='fn'>3252</sup> <sup class='fn'>3253</sup>

And Solomon was David's heir.  He said: "O ye people! we have
			been taught the speech of Birds and on us has been bestowed (a
			little) of all things: this is indeed Grace manifest (from
			Allah)." <sup class='fn'>3254</sup> <sup class='fn'>3255</sup> <sup class='fn'>3256</sup>
And before Solomon were marshalled his hosts of Jinns and men and\n\t\t\tbirds and they were all kept in order and ranks. <sup class='fn'>3257</sup>

At length when they came to a (lowly) valley of ants one of the
			ants said: "O ye ants get into your habitations lest Solomon and
			his hosts crush you (under foot) without knowing it."
			<sup class='fn'>3258</sup>

So he smiled amused at her speech; and he said: "O my Lord! so
			order me that I may be grateful for Thy favors which Thou hast
			bestowed on me and on my parents and that I may work the
			righteousness that will please Thee: and admit me by Thy Grace to
			the ranks of Thy righteous Servants." <sup class='fn'>3259</sup> <sup class='fn'>3260</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3261</sup>
And he took a muster of the Birds; and he said: "Why is it I see\n\t\t\tnot the Hoopoe? Or is he among the absentees? <sup class='fn'>3262</sup>
"I will certainly punish him with a severe Penalty or execute him\n\t\t\tunless he bring me a clear reason (for absence)."
But the Hoopoe tarried not far: he compassed (territory) which\n\t\t\tthou hast not compassed and I have come to thee from Saba with\n\t\t\ttidings true. <sup class='fn'>3263</sup>
"I found (there) a woman ruling over them and provided with every\n\t\t\trequisite; and she has a magnificent throne. <sup class='fn'>3264</sup>\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3265</sup>

"I found her and her people worshipping the sun besides Allah:
			Satan has made their deeds seem pleasing in their eyes and has
			kept them away from the Path so they receive no guidance
			<sup class='fn'>3266</sup>

"(Kept them away from the Path) that they should not worship\n\t\t\tAllah Who brings to light what is hidden in the heavens and the\n\t\t\tearth and knows what ye hide and what ye reveal. <sup class='fn'>3267</sup>
"Allah! there is no god but He! Lord of the Throne Supreme!"\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3268</sup>
(Solomon) said: "Soon shall we see whether thou hast told the\n\t\t\ttruth or lied! <sup class='fn'>3269</sup>
"Go thou with this letter of mine and deliver it to them: then\n\t\t\tdraw back from them and (wait to) see what answer they return"...
(The Queen) said: "Ye chiefs! here is delivered to me a letter\n\t\t\tworthy of respect.
"It is from Solomon and is (as follows): `In the name of Allah\n\t\t\tMost Gracious Most Merciful: <sup class='fn'>3270</sup>
" `Be ye not arrogant against me but come to me in submission to\n\t\t\tthe true Religion.' "
She said: "Ye chiefs! advise me in (this) my affair: no affair\n\t\t\thave I decided except in your presence."
They said: "We are endued with strength and given to vehement\n\t\t\twar: but the command is with thee; so consider what thou wilt\n\t\t\tcommand."
She said: "Kings when they enter a country despoil it and make\n\t\t\tthe noblest of its people its meanest: thus do they behave.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3271</sup>
"But I am going to send him a present and (wait) to see with what\n\t\t\t(answer) return (my) ambassadors."

How when (the embassy) came to Solomon he said: "Will ye give me
			abundance in wealth? But that which Allah has given me is better
			than that which He has given you! Nay it is ye who rejoice in
			your gift! <sup class='fn'>3272</sup>
"Go back to them and be sure we shall come to them with such\n\t\t\thosts as they will never be able to meet: we shall expel them\n\t\t\tfrom there in disgrace and they will feel humbled (indeed)."
He said (to his own men): "Ye Chiefs! which of you can bring me\n\t\t\ther throne before they come to me in submission?" <sup class='fn'>3273</sup>
Said an Ifrit of the Jinns: "I will bring it to thee before thou\n\t\t\trise from thy Council: indeed I have full strength for the\n\t\t\tpurpose and may be trusted." <sup class='fn'>3274</sup>

Said one who had knowledge of the Book: "I will bring it to thee
			within the twinkling of an eye!" Then when (Solomon) saw it
			placed firmly before him he said: "This is by the grace of my
			Lord! to test me whether I am grateful or ungrateful! And if any
			is grateful truly his gratitude is (a gain) for his own soul; but
			if any is ungrateful truly my Lord is Free of All Needs Supreme
			in Honor!" <sup class='fn'>3275</sup> <sup class='fn'>3276</sup> <sup class='fn'>3277</sup>
He said: "Transform her throne out of all recognition by her: let\n\t\t\tus see whether she is guided (to the truth) or is one of those\n\t\t\twho receive no guidance." <sup class='fn'>3278</sup>

So when she arrived she was asked "Is this thy throne?" She said
			"It was just like this; and knowledge was bestowed on us in
			advance of this and we have submitted to Allah (in Islam)."
			<sup class='fn'>3279</sup>
And he diverted her from the worship of others besides Allah: for\n\t\t\tshe was (sprung) of a people that had no faith. <sup class='fn'>3280</sup>

She was asked to enter that lofty Palace: but when she saw it she
			thought it was a lake of water and she (tucked up her skirts)
			uncovering her legs.  He said.	"This is but a palace paved
			smooth with slabs of glass." She said: "O my Lord! I have indeed
			wronged my soul: I do (now) submit (in Islam) with Solomon to the
			Lord of the Worlds." <sup class='fn'>3281</sup> <sup class='fn'>3282</sup>
We sent (aforetime) to the Thamud their brother Salih saying\n\t\t\t"Serve Allah": but behold they became two factions quarrelling\n\t\t\twith each other. <sup class='fn'>3283</sup>
He said: "O my people! why ask ye to hasten on the evil in\n\t\t\tpreference to the good? If only ye ask Allah for forgiveness ye\n\t\t\tmay hope to receive mercy." <sup class='fn'>3284</sup>
They said: "Ill omen do we augur from thee and those that are\n\t\t\twith thee." He said: "Your ill omen is with Allah; yea ye are a\n\t\t\tpeople under trial." <sup class='fn'>3285</sup>
There were in the City nine men of a family who made mischief in\n\t\t\tthe land and would not reform. <sup class='fn'>3286</sup>

They said: "Swear a mutual oath by Allah that we shall make a
			secret night attack on him and his people and that we shall then
			say to his heir (when he seeks vengeance): `We were not present
			at the slaughter of his people and we are positively telling the
			truth.' " <sup class='fn'>3287</sup>
They plotted and planned but We too planned even while they\n\t\t\tperceived it not. <sup class='fn'>3288</sup>
Then see what was the end of their plot! this, that we destroyed\n\t\t\tthem and their people all (of them).
Now such were their houses in utter ruin because they practiced\n\t\t\twrongdoing Verily in this is a Sign for people of knowledge.
And We saved those who believed and practiced righteousness.
We also sent Lut (as an apostle): behold he said to his people\n\t\t\t"Do ye do what is shameful though ye see (its iniquity)?\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3289</sup>
"Would ye really approach men in your lusts rather than women?\n\t\t\tNay ye are a people (grossly) ignorant!" <sup class='fn'>3290</sup>
But his people gave no other answer but this: they said "Drive\n\t\t\tout the followers of Lut from your city: these are indeed men who\n\t\t\twant to be clean and pure!" <sup class='fn'>3291</sup>
But We saved him and his family except his wife: her We destined\n\t\t\tto be of those who lagged behind.
And We rained down on them a shower (of brimstone): and evil was\n\t\t\tthe shower on those who were admonished (but heeded not)!
Say: Praise be to Allah and Peace on His servants whom He has\n\t\t\tchosen (for his Message).  (Who) is better? Allah or the false\n\t\t\tgods they associate with Him? <sup class='fn'>3292</sup>

Or who has created the heaven and the earth and who sends you
			down rain from the sky? Yea with it We cause to grow well-planted
			orchards full of beauty and delight: it is not in your power to
			cause the growth of the trees in them.	(Can there be another)
			god besides Allah? Nay they are a people who swerve from justice.
			<sup class='fn'>3293</sup> <sup class='fn'>3294</sup>

Or who has made the earth firm to live in; made rivers in its
			midst; set thereon mountains immovable; and made a separating bar
			between the two bodies of flowing water? (Can there be another)
			god besides Allah? Nay most of them know not. <sup class='fn'>3295</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3296</sup>

Or who listens to the (soul) distressed when it calls on Him and
			who relieves its suffering and makes you (mankind) inheritors of
			the earth? (Can there be another) god besides Allah? Little it is
			that ye heed! <sup class='fn'>3297</sup> <sup class='fn'>3298</sup>

Or who guides you through the depths of darkness on land and sea
			and who sends the winds as heralds of glad tidings going before
			His mercy? (Can there be another) god besides Allah? high is
			Allah above what they associate with Him! <sup class='fn'>3299</sup>

Or who originates Creation then repeats it and who gives you
			sustenance from heaven and earth? (Can there be another) god
			besides Allah? Say "Bring forth your argument if ye are telling
			the truth!" <sup class='fn'>3300</sup> <sup class='fn'>3301</sup> <sup class='fn'>3302</sup>
Say: None in the heavens or on earth except Allah knows what is\n\t\t\thidden: nor can they perceive when they shall be raised up (for\n\t\t\tJudgment). <sup class='fn'>3303</sup>
Still less can their knowledge comprehend the Hereafter: nay they\n\t\t\tare in doubt and uncertainty thereanent; nay they are blind\n\t\t\tthereunto! <sup class='fn'>3304</sup>
The Unbelievers say: "What! when we become dust we and our\n\t\t\tfathers--shall we really be raised (from the dead)?
"It is true we were promised this we and our fathers before (us):\n\t\t\tthese are nothing but tales of the ancients."
Say: "Go ye through the earth and see what has been the end of\n\t\t\tthose guilty (of sin)." <sup class='fn'>3305</sup>
But grieve not over them nor distress thyself because of their\n\t\t\tplots. <sup class='fn'>3306</sup>
They also say: "When will this promise (come to pass)? (Say) if\n\t\t\tye are truthful."
Say: "It may be that some of the events which ye wish to hasten\n\t\t\ton may be (close) in your pursuit!" <sup class='fn'>3307</sup>
But verily thy Lord is full of grace to mankind: yet most of them\n\t\t\tare ungrateful.
And verily thy Lord knoweth all that their hearts do hide as well\n\t\t\tas all that they reveal.
Nor is there aught of the Unseen in heaven or earth but is\n\t\t\t(recorded) in a clear record. <sup class='fn'>3308</sup>
Verily this Qur'an doth explain to the Children of Israel most of\n\t\t\tthe matters in which they disagree. <sup class='fn'>3309</sup>
And it certainly is a Guide and Mercy to those who believe.
Verily thy Lord will decide between them by His Decree: and He is\n\t\t\tExalted in Might All-Knowing. <sup class='fn'>3310</sup>
So put thy trust in Allah: for thou art on (the Path of) manifest\n\t\t\tTruth.
Truly thou canst not cause the Dead to listen nor canst thou\n\t\t\tcause the Deaf to hear the call (especially) when they turn back\n\t\t\tin retreat. <sup class='fn'>3311</sup>
Nor canst thou be a guide to the Blind (to prevent them) from\n\t\t\tstraying; only those wilt thou get to listen who believe in Our\n\t\t\tSigns and they will bow in Islam.

And when the Word is fulfilled against them (the unjust) We shall
			produce from the earth a beast to (face) them: he will speak to
			them for that mankind did not believe with assurance in our
			Signs. <sup class='fn'>3312</sup> <sup class='fn'>3313</sup>
One Day We shall gather together from every people a troop of\n\t\t\tthose who reject Our Signs and they shall be kept in ranks
Until when they come (before the Judgment-Seat) Allah will say:\n\t\t\t"Did ye reject My Signs though ye comprehended them not in\n\t\t\tknowledge or what was it ye did?" <sup class='fn'>3314</sup>
And the Word will be fulfilled against them because of their\n\t\t\twrongdoing and they will be unable to speak (in plea).\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3315</sup>
See they not that We have made the Night for them to rest in and\n\t\t\tthe Day to give them light? Verily in this are Signs for any\n\t\t\tpeople that believe! <sup class='fn'>3316</sup>

And the Day that the Trumpet will be sounded then will be smitten
			with terror those who are in the heavens and those who are on
			earth except such as Allah will please (to exempt): and all shall
			come to His (Presence) as beings conscious of their lowliness.
			<sup class='fn'>3317</sup>

Thou seest the mountains and thinkest them firmly fixed: but they
			shall pass away as the clouds pass away: (such is) the artistry
			of Allah Who disposes of all things in perfect order: for He is
			well-acquainted with all that ye do. <sup class='fn'>3318</sup> <sup class='fn'>3319</sup>
If any do good good will (accrue) to them therefrom; and they\n\t\t\twill be secure from terror that Day.

And if any do evil their faces will be thrown headlong into the\n\t\t\tFire: "Do ye receive a reward other than that which ye have\n\t\t\tearned by your deeds?" <sup class='fn'>3320</sup> <sup class='fn'>3321</sup>

For me I have been commanded to serve the Lord of this City Him
			Who has sanctified it and to Whom (belong) all things: and I am
			commanded to be of those who bow in Islam to Allah's Will
			<sup class='fn'>3322</sup>
And to rehearse the Qur'an: and if any accept guidance they do it\n\t\t\tfor the good of their own souls and if any stray say: "I am only\n\t\t\ta Warner." <sup class='fn'>3323</sup>

And say: "Praise be to Allah Who will soon show you His Signs so\n\t\t\tthat ye shall know them"; and thy Lord is not unmindful of all\n\t\t\tthat ye do. <sup class='fn'>3324</sup> <sup class='fn'>3325</sup>
Ta. Sin. Mim. <sup class='fn'>3326</sup>
These are Verses of the Book that makes (things) clear.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3327</sup>
We rehearse to thee some of the story of Moses and Pharaoh in\n\t\t\tTruth for people who believe. <sup class='fn'>3328</sup>

Truly Pharaoh elated himself in the land and broke up its people
			into sections depressing a small group among them: their sons he
			slew but he kept alive their females: for he was indeed a maker
			of mischief. <sup class='fn'>3329</sup>
And We wished to be gracious to those who were being depressed in\n\t\t\tthe land to make them leaders (in faith) and make them heirs\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3330</sup>

To establish a firm place for them in the land and to show
			Pharaoh Haman and their hosts at their hands the very things
			against which they were taking precautions. <sup class='fn'>3331</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3332</sup>

So We sent this inspiration to the mother of Moses: "Suckle (thy
			child) but when thou hast fears about him cast him into the river
			but fear not nor grieve: for We shall restore him to thee and We
			shall make him one of Our apostles." <sup class='fn'>3333</sup>

Then the people of Pharaoh picked him up (from the river): (it
			was intended) that (Moses) should be to them an adversary and a
			cause of sorrow: for Pharaoh and Haman and (all) their hosts were
			men of sin. <sup class='fn'>3334</sup>

The wife of Pharaoh said: "(Here is) a joy of the eye for me and
			for thee: slay him not.  It may be that he will be of use to us
			or we may adopt him as a son." And they perceived not (what they
			were doing)! <sup class='fn'>3335</sup> <sup class='fn'>3336</sup>

But there came to be a void in the heart of the mother of Moses:
			she was going almost to disclose his (case) had We not
			strengthened her heart (with faith) so that she might remain a
			(firm) believer. <sup class='fn'>3337</sup>
And she said to the sister of (Moses) "Follow him." So she (the\n\t\t\tsister) watched him in the character of a stranger and they knew\n\t\t\tnot.

And We ordained that he refused suck at first until (his sister
			came up and) said: "Shall I point out to you the people of a
			house that will nourish and bring him up for you and be sincerely
			attached to him?"... <sup class='fn'>3338</sup>

Thus did We restore him to his mother that her eye might be
			comforted that she might not grieve and that she might know that
			the promise of Allah is true: but most of them do not understand.
			<sup class='fn'>3339</sup>
When he reached full age and was firmly established (in life) We\n\t\t\tbestowed on him wisdom and knowledge: for thus do We reward those\n\t\t\twho do good. <sup class='fn'>3340</sup>

And he entered the City at a time when its people were not
			watching: and he found there two men fighting one of his own
			religion and the other of his foes.  Now the man of his own
			religion appealed to him against his foe and Moses struck him
			with his fist and made an end of him.  He said: "This is a work
			of Evil (Satan): for he is an enemy that manifestly misleads!"
			<sup class='fn'>3341</sup> <sup class='fn'>3342</sup>
He prayed: "O my Lord! I have indeed wronged my soul! Do Thou\n\t\t\tthen forgive me!" So (Allah) forgave him: for He is the\n\t\t\tOft-Forgiving Most Merciful.
He said: "O my Lord! for that Thou hast bestowed Thy Grace on me\n\t\t\tnever shall I be a help to those who sin!" <sup class='fn'>3343</sup>

So he saw the morning in the City looking about in a state of
			fear when behold the man who had the day before sought his help
			called aloud for his help (again).  Moses said to him: "Thou art
			truly it is clear a quarrelsome fellow!" <sup class='fn'>3344</sup>

Then when he decided to lay hold of the man who was an enemy to
			both of them that man said: "O Moses! is it thy intention to slay
			me as thou slewest a man yesterday? Thy intention is none other
			than to become a powerful violent man in the land and not to be
			one who sets things right!" <sup class='fn'>3345</sup> <sup class='fn'>3346</sup>

And there came a man running from the furthest end of the City. 
			He said: "O Moses! the Chiefs are taking counsel together about
			thee to slay thee: so get thee away for I do give thee sincere
			advice." <sup class='fn'>3347</sup>
He therefore got away therefrom looking about in a state of fear.\n\t\t\tHe prayed: "O my Lord! save me from people given to wrongdoing."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3348</sup>
Then when he turned his face towards (the land of) Madyan he\n\t\t\tsaid: "I do hope that my Lord will show me the smooth and\n\t\t\tstraight Path." <sup class='fn'>3349</sup>

And when he arrived at the watering (place) in Madyan he found
			there a group of men watering (their flocks) and besides them he
			found two women who were keeping back (their flocks).  He said:
			"What is the matter with you?" They said: "We cannot water (our
			flocks) until the shepherds take back (their flocks): and our
			father is a very old man." <sup class='fn'>3350</sup> <sup class='fn'>3351</sup>

So he watered (their flocks) for them; then he turned back to the\n\t\t\tshade and said: "O my Lord! truly am I in (desperate) need of any\n\t\t\tgood that thou dost send me!"... <sup class='fn'>3352</sup>

Afterwards one of the (damsels) came (back) to him walking
			bashfully. She said: "My father invites thee that he may reward
			thee for having watered (our flocks) for us." So when he came to
			him and narrated the story he said: "Fear thou not: (well) hast
			thou escaped from unjust people." <sup class='fn'>3353</sup> <sup class='fn'>3354</sup>

Said one of the (damsels): "O my (dear) father! engage him on\n\t\t\twages: truly the best of men for thee to employ is the (man) who\n\t\t\tis strong and trusty"... <sup class='fn'>3355</sup> <sup class='fn'>3356</sup>

He said: "I intended to wed one of these my daughters to thee on
			condition that thou serve me for eight years; but if thou
			complete ten years it will be (grace) from thee.  But I intend
			not to place thee under a difficulty: thou wilt find me indeed if
			Allah wills one of the righteous." <sup class='fn'>3357</sup>

He said: "Be that (the agreement) between me and thee: whichever\n\t\t\tof the two terms I fulfil let there be no ill-will to me.  Be\n\t\t\tAllah a witness to what we say." <sup class='fn'>3358</sup>

Now when Moses had fulfilled the term and was travelling with his
			family he perceived a fire in the direction of Mount Tur.  He
			said to his family: "Tarry ye; I perceive a fire; I hope to bring
			you from there some information or a burning firebrand that ye
			may warm yourselves." <sup class='fn'>3359</sup> <sup class='fn'>3360</sup>

But when he came to the (Fire) a voice was heard from the right\n\t\t\tbank of the valley from a tree in hallowed ground: "O Moses!\n\t\t\tverily I am Allah the Lord of the Worlds... <sup class='fn'>3361</sup>

"Now do thou throw thy rod!" But when he saw it moving (of its
			own accord) as if it had been a snake He turned back in retreat
			and retraced not his steps: "O Moses!" (It was said) "draw near
			and fear not: for thou art of those who are secure. <sup class='fn'>3362</sup>

"Move thy hand into thy bosom and it will come forth white
			without stain (or harm) and draw thy hand close to thy side (to
			guard) against fear.  Those are the two credentials from thy Lord
			to Pharaoh and his Chiefs: for truly they are a people rebellious
			and wicked." <sup class='fn'>3363</sup>
He said: "O my Lord! I have slain a man among them and I fear\n\t\t\tlest they slay me. <sup class='fn'>3364</sup>
"And my brother Aaron he is more eloquent in speech than I: so\n\t\t\tsend him with me as a helper to confirm (and strengthen) me; for\n\t\t\tI fear that they may accuse me of falsehood."

He said: "We will certainly strengthen thy arm through thy
			brother and invest you both with authority so they shall not be
			able to touch you: with Our Signs shall ye triumph you two as
			well as those who follow you." <sup class='fn'>3365</sup> <sup class='fn'>3366</sup>

When Moses came to them with Our Clear Signs they said: "This is\n\t\t\tnothing but sorcery faked up: never did we hear the like among\n\t\t\tour fathers of old!" <sup class='fn'>3367</sup> <sup class='fn'>3368</sup>

Moses said: "My Lord knows best who it is that comes with
			guidance from Him and whose End will be best in the Hereafter:
			certain it is that the wrongdoers will not prosper."
			<sup class='fn'>3369</sup>

Pharaoh said: "O Chiefs! no god do I know for you but myself:
			therefore O Haman! light me a (kiln to bake bricks) out of clay
			and build me a lofty palace that I may mount up to the god of
			Moses: but as far as I am concerned I think (Moses) is a liar!"
			<sup class='fn'>3370</sup> <sup class='fn'>3371</sup>
And he was arrogant and insolent in the land beyond reason he and\n\t\t\this hosts: they thought that they would not have to return to Us!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3372</sup>
So We seized him and his hosts and We flung them into the sea:\n\t\t\tnow behold what was the End of those who did wrong! <sup class='fn'>3373</sup>
And We made them (but) leaders inviting to the Fire; and on the\n\t\t\tDay of Judgment no help shall they find.
In this world We made a Curse to follow them: and on the Day of\n\t\t\tJudgment they will be among the loathed (and despised).\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3374</sup>

We did reveal to Moses the Book after We had destroyed the\n\t\t\tearlier generations (to give) Insight to men and Guidance and\n\t\t\tMercy that they might receive admonition. <sup class='fn'>3375</sup>
Thou wast not on the Western Side when We decreed the commission\n\t\t\tto Moses nor wast thou a witness (of those events). <sup class='fn'>3376</sup>

But We raised up (new) generations and long were the ages that
			passed over them; but thou wast not a dweller among the people of
			Madyan rehearsing Our Signs to them; but it is We Who send
			apostles (with inspiration). <sup class='fn'>3377</sup> <sup class='fn'>3378</sup>

Nor wast thou at the side of (the Mountain of) Tur when We called
			(to Moses) Yet (art thou sent) as a Mercy from thy Lord to give
			warning to a people to whom no warner had come before thee: in
			order that they may receive admonition. <sup class='fn'>3379</sup>

If (We had) not (sent thee to the Quraish) in case a calamity
			should seize them for (the deeds) that their hands have sent
			forth they might say: "Our Lord! why didst Thou not send us an
			apostle? We should then have followed the Signs and been amongst
			those who believe!" <sup class='fn'>3380</sup>

But (now) when the Truth has come to them from Ourselves they say
			"Why are not (Signs) sent to him like those which were sent to
			Moses?" Do they not then reject (the Signs) which were formerly
			sent to Moses? They say: "Two kinds of sorcery each assisting the
			other!" And they say: "For us we reject all (such things)!"
			<sup class='fn'>3381</sup> <sup class='fn'>3382</sup>
Say: "Then bring ye a Book from Allah which is a better Guide\n\t\t\tthan either of them that I may follow it! (Do) if ye are\n\t\t\ttruthful!"

But if they hearken not to thee know that they only follow their
			own lusts: and who is more astray than one who follows his own
			lusts devoid of guidance from Allah? For Allah guides not people
			given to wrongdoing. <sup class='fn'>3383</sup>
Now have We caused the word to reach them themselves in order\n\t\t\tthat they may receive admonition. <sup class='fn'>3384</sup>
Those to whom We sent the Book before this they do believe in\n\t\t\tthis (Revelation);

And when it is recited to them they say: "We believe therein for\n\t\t\tit is the Truth from our Lord: indeed we have been Muslims\n\t\t\t(bowing to Allah's Will) from before this." <sup class='fn'>3385</sup>

Twice will they be given their reward for that they have\n\t\t\tpersevered that they avert Evil with Good and that they spend (in\n\t\t\tcharity) out of what We have given them. <sup class='fn'>3386</sup>
And when they hear vain talk they turn away therefrom and say:\n\t\t\t"To us our deeds and to you yours; peace be to you: we seek not\n\t\t\tthe ignorant." <sup class='fn'>3387</sup>
It is true thou wilt not be able to guide everyone whom thou\n\t\t\tlovest: but Allah guides those whom He will and He knows best\n\t\t\tthose who receive guidance. <sup class='fn'>3388</sup>

They say: "If we were to follow the guidance with thee we should
			be snatched away from our land." Have We not established for them
			a secure Sanctuary to which are brought as tribute fruits of all
			kinds? a provision from Ourselves? But most of them understand
			not. <sup class='fn'>3389</sup>

And how many populations We destroyed which exulted in their life
			(of ease and plenty)! Now those habitations of theirs after them
			are deserted all but a (miserable) few! and We are their heirs!
			<sup class='fn'>3390</sup>

Nor was thy Lord the one to destroy a population until He had
			sent to its Center an apostle rehearsing to them Our Signs: nor
			are We going to destroy a population except when its members
			practice iniquity.

The (material) things which ye are given are but the conveniences
			of this life and the glitter thereof; but that which is with
			Allah is better and more enduring: will ye not then be wise?
			<sup class='fn'>3391</sup>

Are (these two) alike? one to whom We have made a goodly promise
			and who is going to reach its (fulfillment) and one to whom we
			have given the good things of this life but who on the Day of
			Judgment is to be among those brought up (for punishment)?
			<sup class='fn'>3392</sup>
That Day Allah will call to them and say: "Where are my\n\t\t\t`partners'?  whom ye imagined (to be such)?"

Those against whom the charge will be proved will say: "Our Lord!
			these are the ones whom we led astray: we led them astray as we
			were astray ourselves: we free ourselves (from them) in Thy
			presence! It was not us they worshipped." <sup class='fn'>3393</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3394</sup>

It will be said (to them): "Call upon your `partners' (for
			help)": they will call upon them but they will not listen to
			them; and they will see the Penalty (before them); (how they will
			wish) `If only they had been open to guidance!'
That Day (Allah) will call to them and say: "What was the answer\n\t\t\tye gave to the apostles?" <sup class='fn'>3395</sup>
Then the (whole) story that day will seem obscure to them (like\n\t\t\tlight to the blind) and they will not be able (even) to question\n\t\t\teach other. <sup class='fn'>3396</sup>
But any that (in this life) had repented believed and worked\n\t\t\trighteousness will have hopes to be among those who achieve\n\t\t\tsalvation.
Thy Lord does create and choose as He pleases: no choice have\n\t\t\tthey (in the matter): Glory to Allah! and far is He above the\n\t\t\tpartners they ascribe (to Him)! <sup class='fn'>3397</sup>
And thy Lord knows all that their hearts conceal and all that\n\t\t\tthey reveal. <sup class='fn'>3398</sup>
And He is Allah: there is no god but He.  To him be praise at the\n\t\t\tfirst and at the last: for Him is the Command and to Him shall ye\n\t\t\t(all) be brought back.

Say: see ye? If Allah were to make the Night perpetual over you\n\t\t\tto the Day of Judgment what god is there other than Allah who can\n\t\t\tgive you enlightenment? Will ye not then hearken? <sup class='fn'>3399</sup>

Say: see ye? If Allah were to make the Day perpetual over you to
			the Day of Judgment what god is there other than Allah who can
			give you a Night in which ye can rest? Will ye not then see?
			<sup class='fn'>3400</sup>
It is out of His Mercy that He has made for you Night and Day\n\t\t\tthat ye may rest therein and that ye may seek of His Grace and in\n\t\t\t;order that ye may be grateful.
The Day that He will call on them He will say: "Where are My\n\t\t\t`partners' whom ye imagined (to be such)?" <sup class='fn'>3401</sup>

And from each people shall We draw a witness and We shall say:
			"Produce your Proof": then shall they know that the Truth is in
			Allah (alone) and the (lies) which they invented will leave them
			in the lurch." <sup class='fn'>3402</sup> <sup class='fn'>3403</sup>

Qarun was doubtless of the people of Moses; but he acted
			insolently towards them: such were the treasures We had bestowed
			on him that their very keys would have been a burden to a body of
			strong men: Behold his people said to him: "Exult not for Allah
			loveth not those who exult (in riches). <sup class='fn'>3404</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3405</sup> <sup class='fn'>3406</sup>

"But seek with the (wealth) which Allah has bestowed on thee the
			Home of the Hereafter nor forget thy portion in this world: but
			do thou good as Allah has been good to thee and seek not
			(occasions for) mischief in the land: for Allah loves not those
			who do mischief." <sup class='fn'>3407</sup>

He said: "This has been given to me because of a certain
			knowledge which I have." Did he not know that Allah had destroyed
			before him (whole) generations which were superior to him in
			strength and greater in amount (of riches) they had collected? 
			But the wicked are not called (immediately) to account for their
			sins. <sup class='fn'>3408</sup> <sup class='fn'>3409</sup>

So he went forth among his people in the (pride of his worldly)
			glitter.  Said those whose aim is the Life of this World: "Oh
			that we had the like of what Qarun has got! For he is truly a
			lord of mighty good fortune." <sup class='fn'>3410</sup>

But those who had been granted (true) knowledge said: "Alas for
			you! the reward of Allah (in the Hereafter) is best for those who
			believe and work righteousness: but this none shall attain save
			those who steadfastly persevere (in good)."
Then We caused the earth to swallow him up and his house; and he\n\t\t\thad not (the least little) party to help him against Allah nor\n\t\t\tcould he defend himself. <sup class='fn'>3411</sup>

And those who had envied his position the day before began to say
			on the morrow: "Ah! it is indeed Allah Who enlarges the provision
			or restricts it to any of His servants He pleases!  Had it not
			been that Allah was gracious to us He could have caused the earth
			to swallow us up! Ah! those who reject Allah will assuredly never
			prosper." <sup class='fn'>3412</sup>
That House of the Hereafter We shall give to those who intend not\n\t\t\thigh-handedness or mischief on earth: and the End is (best) for\n\t\t\tthe righteous. <sup class='fn'>3413</sup>
If any does good the reward to him is better than his deed; but\n\t\t\tif any does evil the doers of evil are only punished (to the\n\t\t\textent) of their deeds. <sup class='fn'>3414</sup>

Verily He Who ordained the Qur'an for thee will bring thee back
			to the Place of Return.  Say: "My Lord knows best who it is that
			brings true guidance and who is in manifest error." <sup class='fn'>3415</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3416</sup> <sup class='fn'>3617</sup>

And thou hadst not expected that the Book would be sent to thee
			except as a Mercy from thy Lord: therefore lend not thou support
			in any way to those who reject (Allah's Message). <sup class='fn'>3418</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3419</sup>

And let nothing keep thee back from the Signs of Allah after they
			have been revealed to thee: and invite (men) to thy Lord and be
			not of the company of those who join gods with Allah.
			<sup class='fn'>3420</sup>

And call not besides Allah on another god.  There is no god but
			He. Everything (that exists) will perish except His own Face.  To
			him belongs the Command and to him will ye (all) be brought back.
			<sup class='fn'>3421</sup>
Alif Lam Mim. <sup class='fn'>3422</sup>
Do men think that they will be left alone on saying "We believe"\n\t\t\tand that they will not be tested? <sup class='fn'>3423</sup>
We did test those before them and Allah will certainly know those\n\t\t\twho are true from those who are false. <sup class='fn'>3424</sup>
Do those who practice evil think that they will get the better of\n\t\t\tus? Evil is their judgment! <sup class='fn'>3425</sup>

For those whose hopes are in the meeting with Allah (in the
			Hereafter let them strive); for the Term (appointed) by Allah is
			surely coming: and He hears and knows (all things). <sup class='fn'>3426</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3427</sup>
And if any strive (with might and main) they do so for their own\n\t\t\tsouls: for Allah is free of all needs from all creation.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3428</sup>

Those who believe and work righteous deeds from them shall We\n\t\t\tblot out all evil (that may be) in them and We shall reward them\n\t\t\taccording to the best of their deeds. <sup class='fn'>3429</sup>

We have enjoined on man kindness to parents: but if they (either
			of them) strive (to force) thee to join with Me (in worship)
			anything of which thou hast no knowledge obey them not.  Ye have
			(all) to return to Me and I will tell you (the truth) of all that
			ye did. <sup class='fn'>3430</sup> <sup class='fn'>3431</sup>
And those who believe and work righteous deeds them shall We\n\t\t\tadmit to the company of the Righteous. <sup class='fn'>3432</sup>

Then there are among men such as say "We believe in Allah"; but
			when they suffer affliction in (the cause of) Allah they treat
			men's oppression as if it were the Wrath of Allah! and if help
			comes (to thee) from thy Lord they are sure to say "We have
			(always) been with you!" Does not Allah know best all that is in
			the hearts of all Creation? <sup class='fn'>3433</sup>
And Allah most certainly knows those who believe and as certainly\n\t\t\tthose who are Hypocrites. <sup class='fn'>3434</sup>

And the Unbelievers say to those who believe: "Follow our path
			and we will bear (the consequences) of your faults." Never in the
			least will they bear their faults: in fact they are liars!
			<sup class='fn'>3435</sup>
They will bear their own burdens and (other) burdens along with\n\t\t\ttheir own and on the Day of Judgement they will be called to\n\t\t\taccount for their falsehoods. <sup class='fn'>3436</sup>
We (once) sent Noah to his people and he tarried among them a\n\t\t\tthousand years less fifty: but the Deluge overwhelmed them while\n\t\t\tthey (persisted in) sin. <sup class='fn'>3437</sup>
But We saved him and the Companions of the Ark and We made the\n\t\t\t(Ark) a Sign for all Peoples!
And (We also saved) Abraham: Behold he said to his people "Serve\n\t\t\tAllah and fear Him: that will be best for you if ye understand!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3438</sup>

"For ye do worship idols besides Allah and ye invent falsehood. 
			The things that ye worship besides Allah have no power to give
			you sustenance: then seek ye sustenance from Allah serve Him and
			be grateful to Him: to Him will be your return. <sup class='fn'>3439</sup>
"And if ye reject (the Message) so did generations before you:\n\t\t\tand the duty of the apostle is only to preach publicly (and\n\t\t\tclearly)."
See they not how Allah originates creation then repeats it: truly\n\t\t\tthat is easy for Allah. <sup class='fn'>3440</sup>
Say: "Travel through the earth and see how Allah did originate\n\t\t\tcreation: so will Allah produce a later creation: for Allah has\n\t\t\tpower over all things. <sup class='fn'>3441</sup>
"He punishes whom He pleases and He grants mercy to whom He\n\t\t\tpleases and towards Him are ye turned. <sup class='fn'>3442</sup>
"Not on earth nor in heaven will ye be able (fleeing) to\n\t\t\tfrustrate (His plan) nor have ye besides Allah any protector or\n\t\t\thelper."

Those who reject the Signs of Allah and the Meeting with Him (in\n\t\t\tthe Hereafter) it is they who shall despair of My mercy: it is\n\t\t\tthey who will (suffer) a most grievous Penalty. <sup class='fn'>3443</sup>

So naught was the answer of (Abraham's) people except that they
			said: "Slay him or burn him." But Allah did save him from the
			fire: verily in this are Signs for people who believe.
			<sup class='fn'>3444</sup>

And He said: "For you ye have taken (for worship) idols besides
			Allah out of mutual love and regard between yourselves in this
			life; but on the Day of Judgement ye shall disown each other and
			curse each other: and your abode will be the Fire and ye shall
			have none to help. <sup class='fn'>3445</sup>
But Lut had faith in Him: he said: "I will leave home for the\n\t\t\tsake of my Lord: for He is Exalted in Might and Wise."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3446</sup>

And We gave (Abraham) Isaac and Jacob and ordained among his
			progeny Prophethood and Revelation and We granted him his reward
			in this life; and he was in the Hereafter (of the company) of the
			Righteous. <sup class='fn'>3447</sup> <sup class='fn'>3448</sup>
And (remember) Lut; behold he said to his people: "Ye do commit\n\t\t\tlewdness such as no people in Creation (ever) committed before\n\t\t\tyou. <sup class='fn'>3449</sup>

"Do ye indeed approach men and cut off the highway? And practice
			wickedness (even) in your councils?"  But his people gave no
			answer but this: they said: "Bring us the Wrath of Allah if thou
			tellest the truth." <sup class='fn'>3450</sup> <sup class='fn'>3451</sup>
He said: "O my Lord! Help Thou me against people who do\n\t\t\tmischief!"

When Our Messengers came to Abraham with the good news they said:\n\t\t\t"We are indeed going to destroy the people of this township: for\n\t\t\ttruly they are (addicted to) crime." <sup class='fn'>3452</sup> <sup class='fn'>3453</sup>

He said: "But there is Lut there." They said: "Well do we know\n\t\t\twho is there: we will certainly save him and his following except\n\t\t\this wife: she is of those who lag behind!" <sup class='fn'>3454</sup>

And when Our Messengers came to Lut he was grieved on their
			account and felt himself powerless (to protect) them: but they
			said "Fear thou not nor grieve: we are (here) to save thee and
			thy following except thy wife: she is of those who lag behind.
			<sup class='fn'>3455</sup>
"For we are going to bring down on the people of this township a\n\t\t\tPunishment from heaven because they have been wickedly\n\t\t\trebellious." <sup class='fn'>3456</sup>
And We have left thereof an evident Sign for any people who (care\n\t\t\tto) understand. <sup class='fn'>3457</sup>
To the Madyan (people) (We sent) their brother Shu`aib.  Then he\n\t\t\tsaid: "O my people! serve Allah and fear the Last Day: nor commit\n\t\t\tevil on the earth with intent to do mischief."
But they rejected him: then the mighty Blast seized them and they\n\t\t\tlay prostrate in their homes by the morning. <sup class='fn'>3458</sup>

Remember also the `Ad and the Thamud (people): clearly will
			appear to you from (the traces) of their buildings (their fate):
			the Evil One made their deeds alluring to them and kept them back
			from the Path though they were gifted with Intelligence and
			Skill. <sup class='fn'>3459</sup> <sup class='fn'>3460</sup>

(Remember also) Qarun Pharaoh and Haman: there came to them Moses\n\t\t\twith Clear Signs but they behaved with insolence on the earth;\n\t\t\tyet they could not overreach (Us) . <sup class='fn'>3461</sup>

Each one of them We seized for his crime: of them against some We
			sent a violent tornado (with showers of stones); some were caught
			by a (mighty) Blast; some We caused the earth to swallow up; and
			some We drowned (in the waters): it was not Allah Who injured (or
			oppressed) them: they injured (and oppressed) their own souls.
			<sup class='fn'>3462</sup> <sup class='fn'>3463</sup> <sup class='fn'>3464</sup> <sup class='fn'>3465</sup>

The parable of those who take protectors other than Allah is that
			of the Spider who builds (to itself) a house; but truly the
			flimsiest of houses is the Spider's house if they but knew.
			<sup class='fn'>3466</sup> <sup class='fn'>3467</sup>
Verily Allah doth know of (everything) whatever that they call\n\t\t\tupon besides Him: and He is Exalted (in power) Wise.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3468</sup>
And such are the Parables We set for mankind but only those\n\t\t\tunderstand them who have Knowledge. <sup class='fn'>3469</sup>
Allah created the heavens and the earth in true (proportions):\n\t\t\tverily in that is a Sign for those who believe. <sup class='fn'>3470</sup>

Recite what is sent of the Book by inspiration to thee and
			establish Regular Prayer: for Prayer restrains from shameful and
			unjust deeds; and remembrance of Allah is the greatest (thing in
			life) without doubt. And Allah knows the (deeds) that ye do.
			<sup class='fn'>3471</sup>

And dispute ye not with the People of the Book except with means
			better (than mere disputation) unless it be with those of them
			who inflict wrong (and injury): but say "We believe in the
			Revelation which has come down to us and in that which came down
			to you; Our Allah and your Allah is one; and it is to Him we bow
			(in Islam)." <sup class='fn'>3472</sup> <sup class='fn'>3473</sup> <sup class='fn'>3474</sup>

And thus (it is) that We have sent down the Book to thee.  So the
			People of the Book believe therein as also do some of these
			(pagan Arabs): and none but Unbelievers reject Our Signs.
			<sup class='fn'>3475</sup> <sup class='fn'>3476</sup> <sup class='fn'>3477</sup>

And thou wast not (able) to recite a Book before this (Book came)
			nor art thou (able) to transcribe it with thy right hand: in that
			case indeed would the talkers of vanities have doubted.
			<sup class='fn'>3478</sup>
Nay here are Signs self-evident in the hearts of those endowed\n\t\t\twith knowledge: and none but the unjust reject Our Signs.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3479</sup> <sup class='fn'>3480</sup>
Yet they say: "Why are not Signs sent down to him from his Lord?"\n\t\t\tSay: "The Signs are indeed with Allah: and I am indeed a clear\n\t\t\tWarner." <sup class='fn'>3481</sup>
And is it not enough for them that We have sent down to thee the\n\t\t\tBook which is rehearsed to them? Verily in it is Mercy and\n\t\t\tReminder to those who believe. <sup class='fn'>3482</sup>

Say: "Enough is Allah for a Witness between me and you: He knows
			what is in the heavens and on earth. And it is those who believe
			in vanities and reject Allah that will perish (in the end)."
			<sup class='fn'>3483</sup> <sup class='fn'>3484</sup>

They ask thee to hasten on the Punishment (for them): had it not
			been for a term (of respite) appointed the Punishment would
			certainly have come to them: and it will certainly reach them of
			a sudden while they perceive not! <sup class='fn'>3485</sup>
They ask thee to hasten on the Punishment but of a surety Hell\n\t\t\twill encompass the rejecters of Faith! <sup class='fn'>3486</sup>

On the Day that the Punishment shall cover them from above them\n\t\t\tand from below them and (a Voice) shall say: "Taste ye (the\n\t\t\tfruits) of your deeds!" <sup class='fn'>3487</sup> <sup class='fn'>3488</sup>
O My servants who believe! truly spacious is My Earth: therefore\n\t\t\tserve ye Me (and Me alone)! <sup class='fn'>3489</sup>
Every soul shall have a taste of death: in the end to Us shall ye\n\t\t\tbe brought back. <sup class='fn'>3490</sup>

But those who believe and work deeds of righteousness to them
			shall We give a Home in Heaven lofty mansions beneath which flow
			rivers--to dwell therein for aye; an excellent reward for those
			who do (good)! <sup class='fn'>3491</sup>
Those who persevere in patience and put their trust in their Lord\n\t\t\tand Cherisher.
How many are the creatures that carry not their own sustenance?\n\t\t\tIt is Allah Who feeds (both) them and you: for He hears and knows\n\t\t\t(all things). <sup class='fn'>3492</sup>

If indeed thou ask them who has created the heavens and the earth
			and subjected the sun and the moon (to His Law); they will
			certainly reply "Allah." How are they then deluded away (from the
			truth)? <sup class='fn'>3493</sup> <sup class='fn'>3494</sup>

Allah enlarges the sustenance (which He gives) to whichever of
			His servants He pleases; and He (similarly) grants by (strict)
			measure (as He pleases): for Allah has full knowledge of all
			things. <sup class='fn'>3495</sup>

And if indeed thou ask them who it is that sends down rain from
			the sky and gives life therewith to the earth after its death
			they will certainly reply "Allah!"  Say "Praise be to Allah!" 
			But most of them understand not. <sup class='fn'>3496</sup>
What is the life of this world but amusement and play? But verily\n\t\t\tthe Home in the Hereafter that is life indeed if they but knew.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3497</sup>

Now if they embark on a boat they call on Allah making their
			devotion sincerely (and exclusively) to Him; but when He had
			delivered them safely to (dry) land Behold they give a share (of
			their worship to others)! <sup class='fn'>3498</sup>
Disdaining ungratefully Our gifts and giving themselves up to\n\t\t\t(worldly) enjoyment! But soon will they know. <sup class='fn'>3499</sup>

Do they not then see that We have made a Sanctuary secure and
			that men are being snatched away from all around them? Then do
			they believe in that which is vain and reject the Grace of Allah?
			<sup class='fn'>3500</sup>

And who does more wrong than he who invents a lie against Allah\n\t\t\tor rejects the Truth when it reaches Him? Is there not a home in\n\t\t\tHell for those who reject Faith? <sup class='fn'>3501</sup>
And those who strive in Our (Cause) We will certainly guide them\n\t\t\tto Our Paths: for verily Allah is with those who do right.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3502</sup> <sup class='fn'>3503</sup>
Alif Lam Mim. <sup class='fn'>3504</sup>
The Roman Empire has been defeated <sup class='fn'>3505</sup>
In a land close by; but they (even) after (this) defeat of theirs\n\t\t\twill soon be victorious <sup class='fn'>3506</sup>
Within a few years.  With Allah is the Decision in the Past and\n\t\t\tin the Future: on that Day shall the Believers rejoice\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3507</sup> <sup class='fn'>3508</sup>
With the help of Allah.  He helps whom He will and He is Exalted\n\t\t\tin Might Most Merciful. <sup class='fn'>3509</sup>
(It is) the promise of Allah.  Never does Allah depart from His\n\t\t\tpromise: but most men understand not. <sup class='fn'>3510</sup>
They know but the outer (things) in the life of this world: but\n\t\t\tof the End of things they are heedless. <sup class='fn'>3511</sup>\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3512</sup>

Do they not reflect in their own minds? Not but for just ends and
			for a term appointed did Allah create the heavens and the earth
			and all between them: yet are there truly many among men who deny
			the meeting with their Lord (at the Resurrection)! <sup class='fn'>3513</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3514</sup>

Do they not travel through the earth and see what was the End of
			those before them? They were superior to them in strength: they
			tilled the soil and populated it in greater numbers than these
			have done: there came to them their apostles with Clear (Signs)
			(which they rejected to their own destruction): it was not Allah
			Who wronged them but they wronged their own souls. <sup class='fn'>3515</sup>
In the long run evil in the extreme will be the End of those who\n\t\t\tdo evil; for that they rejected the Signs of Allah and held them\n\t\t\tup to ridicule. <sup class='fn'>3516</sup>
It is Allah Who begins (the process of) creation; then repeats\n\t\t\tit; then shall ye be brought back to Him. <sup class='fn'>3517</sup>
On the Day that the Hour will be established the guilty will be\n\t\t\tstruck dumb with despair. <sup class='fn'>3518</sup>
No intercessor will they have among their "Partners" and they\n\t\t\twill (themselves) reject their "Partners." <sup class='fn'>3519</sup>
On the Day that the Hour will be established that Day shall (all\n\t\t\tmen) be sorted out. <sup class='fn'>3520</sup>
Then those who have believed and worked righteous deeds shall be\n\t\t\tmade happy in a Mead of Delight.
And those who have rejected Faith and falsely denied Our Signs\n\t\t\tand the meeting of the Hereafter such shall be brought forth to\n\t\t\tPunishment.
So (give) glory to Allah when ye reach eventide and when ye rise\n\t\t\tin the morning; <sup class='fn'>3521</sup>
Yea To Him be praise in the heavens and on earth; and in the late\n\t\t\tafternoon and when the day begins to decline.

It is He Who brings out the living from the dead and brings out
			the dead from the living and Who gives life to the earth after it
			is dead: and thus shall ye be brought out (from the dead).
			<sup class='fn'>3522</sup> <sup class='fn'>3523</sup>
Among His Signs is this that He created you from dust; and then\n\t\t\tBehold ye are men scattered (far and wide)! <sup class='fn'>3524</sup>

And among His Signs is this that He created for you mates from
			among yourselves that ye may dwell in tranquillity with them and
			He has put love and mercy between your (hearts); verily in that
			are Signs for those who reflect. <sup class='fn'>3525</sup> <sup class='fn'>3526</sup>

And among His Signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth\n\t\t\tand the variations in your languages and your colors: verily in\n\t\t\tthat are Signs for those who know. <sup class='fn'>3527</sup>

And among His Signs is the sleep that ye take by night and by day
			and the quest that ye (make for livelihood) out of His Bounty:
			verily in that are Signs for those who hearken. <sup class='fn'>3528</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3529</sup>

And among His Signs He shows you the lightning by way both of
			fear and of hope and He sends down rain from the sky and with it
			gives life to the earth after it is dead: verily in that are
			Signs for those who are wise. <sup class='fn'>3530</sup>

And among His Signs is this that heaven and earth stand by His\n\t\t\tCommand: then when He calls you by a single call from the earth\n\t\t\tbehold ye (straightway) come forth. <sup class='fn'>3531</sup>
To Him belongs every being that is in the heavens and on earth:\n\t\t\tall are devoutly obedient to Him. <sup class='fn'>3532</sup>
