It is He Who begins (the process of) creation; then repeats it;
			and for Him it is most easy.  To Him belongs the loftiest
			similitude (We can think of) in the heavens and the earth: for He
			is Exalted in Might Full of Wisdom. <sup class='fn'>3533</sup> <sup class='fn'>3534</sup>

He does propound to you a similitude from your own (experience):
			do ye have partners among those whom your right hands possess to
			share as equals in the wealth We have bestowed on you? Do ye fear
			them as ye fear each other? Thus do We explain the Signs in
			detail to a people that understand. <sup class='fn'>3535</sup> <sup class='fn'>3536</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3537</sup> <sup class='fn'>3538</sup>

Nay the wrong-doers (merely) fellow their own lusts being devoid\n\t\t\tof knowledge.  But who will guide those whom Allah leaves astray?\n\t\t\tTo them there will be no helpers. <sup class='fn'>3539</sup>

So set thou thy face steadily and truly to the Faith: (Establish)
			Allah's handiwork according to the pattern on which He has made
			mankind: no change (let there be) in the work (wrought) by Allah:
			that is the standard Religion: but most among mankind understand
			not. <sup class='fn'>3540</sup> <sup class='fn'>3541</sup> <sup class='fn'>3542</sup>
Turn ye back in repentance to Him and fear Him: establish regular\n\t\t\tprayers and be not ye among those who join gods with Allah,\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3543</sup>
Those who split up their Religion and become (mere) Sects each\n\t\t\tparty rejoicing in that which is with itself! <sup class='fn'>3544</sup>

When trouble touches men they cry to their Lord turning back to
			Him in repentance: but when He gives them a taste of Mercy as
			from Himself behold some of them pay part-worship to other gods
			besides their Lord. <sup class='fn'>3545</sup>
(As if) to show their ingratitude for the (favors) We have\n\t\t\tbestowed on them! Then enjoy (your brief day); but soon will ye\n\t\t\tknow (your folly). <sup class='fn'>3546</sup>
Or have We sent down authority to them which points out to them\n\t\t\tthe things to which they pay part-worship? <sup class='fn'>3547</sup>

When We give men a taste of Mercy they exult thereat: and when\n\t\t\tsome evil afflicts them because of what their (own) hands have\n\t\t\tsent forth behold they are in despair! <sup class='fn'>3548</sup>
See they not that Allah enlarges the provision and restricts it\n\t\t\tto whomsoever He pleases? Verily in that are Signs for those who\n\t\t\tbelieve. <sup class='fn'>3549</sup>

So give what is due to kindred the needy and the wayfarer.  That\n\t\t\tis best for those who seek the Countenance of Allah and it is\n\t\t\tthey who will prosper. <sup class='fn'>3550</sup> <sup class='fn'>3551</sup>

That which ye lay out for increase through the property of
			(other) people will have no increase with Allah: but that which
			ye lay out for charity seeking the Countenance of Allah (will
			increase): it is these who will get a recompense multiplied.
			<sup class='fn'>3552</sup> <sup class='fn'>3553</sup>

It is Allah Who has created you: further He has provided for your
			sustenance; then He will cause you to die; and again He will give
			you life.  Are there any of your (false) "Partners" who can do
			any single one of these things? Glory to Him! and High is He
			above the partners they attribute (to Him)! <sup class='fn'>3554</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3555</sup>

Mischief has appeared on land and sea because of (the meed) that
			the hands of men have earned that (Allah) may give them a taste
			of some of their deeds: in order that they may turn back (from
			Evil). <sup class='fn'>3556</sup> <sup class='fn'>3557</sup>
Say: "Travel through the earth and see what was the End of those\n\t\t\tbefore (you): most of them worshipped others besides Allah."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3558</sup>

But set thou thy face to the right Religion before there come\n\t\t\tfrom Allah the Day which there is no chance of averting: on that\n\t\t\tDay shall men be divided (in two). <sup class='fn'>3559</sup> <sup class='fn'>3560</sup>
Those who reject Faith will suffer from that rejection: and those\n\t\t\twho work righteousness will spread their couch (of repose) for\n\t\t\tthemselves (in heaven):
That He may reward those who believe and work righteous deeds out\n\t\t\tof His Bounty: for He loves not those who reject Faith.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3561</sup> <sup class='fn'>3562</sup>

Among His Signs is this that He sends the Winds as heralds of
			Glad Tidings giving you a taste of His (Grace and) Mercy that the
			ships may sail (majestically) by His Command and that ye may seek
			of His Bounty: in order that ye may be grateful. <sup class='fn'>3563</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3564</sup> <sup class='fn'>3565</sup>

We did indeed send before thee apostles to their (respective)
			peoples and they came to them with Clear Signs: then to those who
			transgressed We meted out Retribution: and it was due from us to
			aid those who believed.

It is Allah Who sends the Winds and they raise the Clouds: then
			does He spread them in the sky as He wills and break them into
			fragments until thou seest rain-drops issue from the midst
			thereof: then when He has made them reach such of his servants as
			He wills behold they do rejoice! <sup class='fn'>3566</sup> <sup class='fn'>3567</sup>
Even though before they received (the rain) just before this they\n\t\t\twere dumb with despair!

Then contemplate (O man!) the memorials of Allah's Mercy! How He
			gives life to the earth after its death: verily the Same will
			give life to the men who are dead: for He has power over all
			things. <sup class='fn'>3568</sup>
And if We (but) send a Wind from which they see (their tilth)\n\t\t\tturn yellow behold they become thereafter ungrateful\n\t\t\t(Unbelievers)! <sup class='fn'>3569</sup>
So verily thou canst not make the dead to hear nor canst thou\n\t\t\tmake the deaf to hear the call when they show their backs and\n\t\t\tturn away. <sup class='fn'>3570</sup>
Nor canst thou lead back the blind from their straying: only\n\t\t\tthose wilt thou make to hear who believe in Our Signs and submit\n\t\t\t(their wills in Islam). <sup class='fn'>3571</sup>

It is Allah Who created you in a state of (helpless) weakness
			then gave (you) strength after weakness then after strength give
			(you) weakness and a hoary head: He creates as He wills and it is
			He Who has all knowledge and power. <sup class='fn'>3572</sup>

On the Day that the Hour (of reckoning) will be established the\n\t\t\ttransgressors will swear that they tarried not but an hour: thus\n\t\t\twere they used to being deluded! <sup class='fn'>3573</sup>

But those endued with knowledge and faith will say: "Indeed ye
			did tarry within Allah's Decree to the Day of Resurrection and
			this is the Day of Resurrection: but ye ye were not aware!"
			<sup class='fn'>3574</sup>
So on that Day no excuse of theirs will avail the Transgressors\n\t\t\tnor will they be invited (then) to seek grace (by repentance).\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3575</sup>

Verily We have propounded for men in this Qur'an every kind of\n\t\t\tParable: but if thou bring to them any Sign the Unbelievers are\n\t\t\tsure to say "Ye do nothing but talk vanities." <sup class='fn'>3576</sup>
Thus does Allah seal up the hearts of those who understand not.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3577</sup>
So patiently persevere: for verily the promise of Allah is true:\n\t\t\tnor let those shake thy firmness who have (themselves) no\n\t\t\tcertainty of faith. <sup class='fn'>3578</sup>
Alif Lam Mim. <sup class='fn'>3579</sup>
These are Verses of the Wise Book, <sup class='fn'>3580</sup>
A Guide and a Mercy to the Doers of Good, <sup class='fn'>3581</sup>
Those who establish regular Prayer and give regular Charity and\n\t\t\thave (in their hearts) the assurance of the Hereafter.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3582</sup>
These are on (true) guidance from their Lord; and these are the\n\t\t\tones who will prosper. <sup class='fn'>3583</sup>

But there are among men those who purchase idle tales without
			knowledge (or meaning) to mislead (men) from the Path of Allah
			and throw ridicule (on the Path): for such there will be a
			humiliating Penalty. <sup class='fn'>3584</sup>

When Our Signs are rehearsed to such a one he turns away in\n\t\t\tarrogance as if he heard them not as if there were deafness in\n\t\t\tboth his ears: announce to him a grievous Penalty. <sup class='fn'>3585</sup>
For those who believe and work righteous deeds there will be\n\t\t\tGardens of Bliss.
To dwell therein.  The promise of Allah is true: and He is\n\t\t\tExalted in power Wise. <sup class='fn'>3586</sup>

He created the heavens without any pillars that ye can see; He
			set on the earth mountains standing firm lest it should shake
			with you; and He scattered through it beasts of all kinds.  We
			send down rain from the sky and produce on the earth every kind
			of noble creature in pairs. <sup class='fn'>3587</sup> <sup class='fn'>3588</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3589</sup> <sup class='fn'>3590</sup> <sup class='fn'>3591</sup>
Such is the Creation of Allah: now show Me what is there that\n\t\t\tothers besides Him have created: nay but the Transgressors are in\n\t\t\tmanifest error. <sup class='fn'>3592</sup>

We bestowed (in the past) wisdom on Luqman: "Show (thy) gratitude
			to Allah." Any who is (so) grateful does so to the profit of his
			own soul: but if any is ungrateful verily Allah is free of all
			wants worthy of all praise. <sup class='fn'>3593</sup> <sup class='fn'>3594</sup>
Behold Luqman said to his son by way of instruction: "O my son!\n\t\t\tJoin not in worship (others) with Allah: for false worship is\n\t\t\tindeed the highest wrong-doing." <sup class='fn'>3595</sup>

And We have enjoined on man (to be good) to his parents: in
			travail upon travail did his mother bear him and in years twain
			was his weaning: (hear the command) "Show gratitude to Me and to
			thy parents: to Me is (thy final) Goal. <sup class='fn'>3596</sup>

"But if they strive to make the join in worship with Me things of
			which thou hast no knowledge obey them not; Yet bear them company
			in this life with justice (and consideration) and follow the way
			of those who turn to Me (in love): in the End the return of you
			all is to Me and I will tell you the truth (and meaning) of all
			that ye did." <sup class='fn'>3597</sup> <sup class='fn'>3598</sup> <sup class='fn'>3599</sup>

"O my son!" (said Luqman) "If there be (but) the weight of a
			mustard-seed and it were (hidden) in a rock or (anywhere) in the
			heavens or on earth Allah will bring it forth: for Allah
			understands the finest mysteries (and) is well-acquainted (with
			them). <sup class='fn'>3600</sup> <sup class='fn'>3601</sup> <sup class='fn'>3602</sup>

"O my son! establish regular prayer enjoin what is just and
			forbid what is wrong: and bear with patient constancy whatever
			betide thee; for this is firmness (of purpose) in (the conduct
			of) affairs.
"And swell not thy cheek (for pride) at men nor walk in insolence\n\t\t\tthrough the earth; for Allah loveth not any arrogant boaster.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3603</sup>
"And be moderate in thy pace and lower thy voice; for the\n\t\t\tharshest of sounds without doubt is the braying of the ass."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3604</sup>

Do ye not see that Allah has subjected to your (use) all things
			in the heavens and on earth and has made His bounties flow to you
			in exceeding measure (both) seen and unseen? Yet there are among
			men those who dispute about Allah without knowledge and without
			guidance and without a Book to enlighten them! <sup class='fn'>3605</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3606</sup> <sup class='fn'>3607</sup>

When they are told to follow the (revelation) that Allah has sent
			down they say: "Nay we shall follow the ways that we found our
			fathers (following)."  What! even if it is Satan beckoning them
			to the Penalty of the (Blazing) Fire! <sup class='fn'>3608</sup>

Whoever submits his whole self to Allah and is a doer of good has
			grasped indeed the most trustworthy hand-hold: and with Allah
			rests the End and Decision of (all) affairs. <sup class='fn'>3609</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3610</sup>

But if any reject Faith let not his rejection grieve thee: to Us\n\t\t\tis their return and We shall tell them the truth of their deeds:\n\t\t\tfor Allah knows well all that is in (men's) hearts. <sup class='fn'>3611</sup>
We grant them their pleasure for a little while: in the end shall\n\t\t\tWe drive them to a chastisement unrelenting. <sup class='fn'>3612</sup>

If thou ask them who it is that created the heavens and the earth\n\t\t\tthey will certainly say "Allah." Say: "Praise be to Allah!" But\n\t\t\tmost of them understand not. <sup class='fn'>3613</sup> <sup class='fn'>3614</sup>
To Allah belong all things in heaven and earth: verily Allah is\n\t\t\tHe (that is) free of all wants worthy of all praise.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3615</sup>

And if all the trees on earth were pens and the Ocean (were ink)
			with seven Oceans behind it to add to its (supply) yet would not
			the Words of Allah be exhausted (in the writing): for Allah is
			Exalted in power Full of Wisdom. <sup class='fn'>3616</sup>
And your creation or your resurrection is in no wise but as an\n\t\t\tindividual soul: for Allah is He Who hears and sees (all things).\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3617</sup>

Seest thou not that Allah merges Night into Day and He merges Day
			into Night; that He has subjected the sun and the moon (to His
			Law) each running its course for a term appointed: and that Allah
			is well acquainted with all that ye do? <sup class='fn'>3618</sup>
That is because Allah is the (only) Reality and because whatever\n\t\t\telse they invoke besides Him is Falsehood; and because Allah He\n\t\t\tis the Most High Most Great. <sup class='fn'>3619</sup>

Seest thou not that the ships sail through the Ocean by the grace
			of Allah? That He may show you of His Signs? Verily in this are
			Signs for all who constantly persevere and give thanks.
			<sup class='fn'>3620</sup>

When a wave covers them like the canopy (of clouds) they call to
			Allah offering Him sincere devotion.  But when He has delivered
			them safely to land there are among them those that halt between
			(right and wrong).  But none reject Our Signs except only a
			perfidious ungrateful (wretch)! <sup class='fn'>3621</sup> <sup class='fn'>3622</sup>

O mankind! do your duty to your Lord and fear (the coming of) a
			Day when no father can avail aught for his son nor a son avail
			aught for his father.  Verily the promise of Allah is true: let
			not then this present life deceive you nor let the Chief Deceiver
			deceive you about Allah. <sup class='fn'>3623</sup> <sup class='fn'>3624</sup>

Verily the knowledge of the Hour is with Allah (alone).  It is He
			Who sends down rain and He Who knows what is in the wombs.  Nor
			does anyone know what it is that he will earn on the morrow: nor
			does anyone know in what land he is to die.  Verily with Allah is
			full knowledge and He is acquainted (with all things).
			<sup class='fn'>3625</sup> <sup class='fn'>3626</sup> <sup class='fn'>3627</sup>
Alif  Lam  Mim. <sup class='fn'>3628</sup>
(This is) the revelation of the Book in which there is no doubt, \n\t\t\tfrom the Lord of the Worlds. <sup class='fn'>3629</sup>

Or do they say "He has forged it"? Nay it is the Truth from the
			Lord that thou mayest admonish a people to whom no warner has
			come before thee: in order that they may receive guidance.
			<sup class='fn'>3630</sup> <sup class='fn'>3631</sup>

It is Allah Who has created the heavens and the earth and all
			between them in six Days and is firmly established on the Throne
			(of authority): ye have none besides Him to protect or intercede
			(for you): will ye not then receive admonition? <sup class='fn'>3632</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3633</sup>

He rules (all) affairs from the heavens to the earth: in the end\n\t\t\twill (all affairs) go up to Him on a Day the space whereof will\n\t\t\tbe (as) a thousand years of your reckoning. <sup class='fn'>3634</sup>
Such as He the knower of all things hidden and open the Exalted\n\t\t\t(in power) the Merciful; <sup class='fn'>3635</sup>
He Who has made everything which He has created most Good.  He\n\t\t\tbegan the creation of man with (nothing more than) clay\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3636</sup> <sup class='fn'>3637</sup>
And made his progeny from a quintessence of the nature of a fluid\n\t\t\tdespised: <sup class='fn'>3638</sup>

But He fashioned him in due proportion and breathed into him
			something of His spirit.  And He gave you (the faculties of)
			hearing and sight and feeling (and understanding): little thanks
			do ye give! <sup class='fn'>3639</sup> <sup class='fn'>3640</sup>
And they say: "What! when we lie hidden and lost in the earth\n\t\t\tshall we indeed be in a creation renewed?" Nay they deny the\n\t\t\tmeeting with their Lord! <sup class='fn'>3641</sup>
Say: "The Angel of Death put in charge of you will (duly) take\n\t\t\tyour souls: then shall ye be brought back to your Lord."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3642</sup>

If only thou couldst see when the guilty ones will bend low their
			heads before their Lord (saying:) "Our Lord! We have seen and we
			have heard: now then send us back (to the world): we will work
			righteousness: for we do indeed (now) believe." <sup class='fn'>3643</sup>

If We had so willed We could certainly have brought every soul
			its true guidance: but the Word from Me will come true.  "I will
			fill Hell with Jinns and men all together." <sup class='fn'>3644</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3645</sup>
"Taste ye then for ye forgot the meeting of this day of yours and\n\t\t\tWe too will forget you taste ye the Penalty of Eternity for your\n\t\t\t(evil) deeds!" <sup class='fn'>3646</sup>

Only those believe in Our Signs who when they are recited to them\n\t\t\tfall down in adoration and celebrate the praises of their Lord\n\t\t\tnor are they (ever) puffed up with pride. <sup class='fn'>3647</sup>

Their limbs do forsake their beds of sleep the while they call on
			their Lord in Fear and Hope: and they spend (in charity) out of
			the sustenance which We have bestowed on them. <sup class='fn'>3648</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3649</sup>
Now no person knows what delights of the eye are kept hidden (in\n\t\t\treserve) for them as a reward for their (good) Deeds.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3650</sup>
Is then the man who believes no better than the man who is\n\t\t\trebellious and wicked? No equal are they. <sup class='fn'>3651</sup>
For those who believe and do righteous deeds are Gardens as\n\t\t\thospitable homes for their (good) deeds. <sup class='fn'>3652</sup>

As to those who are rebellious and wicked their abode will be the
			Fire: every time they wish to get away therefrom they will be
			forced thereinto and it will be said to them: "taste ye the
			Penalty of the Fire the which ye were wont to reject as false.
			<sup class='fn'>3653</sup>
And indeed We will make them taste of the Penalty of this (life)\n\t\t\tprior to the supreme Penalty in order that they may (repent and)\n\t\t\treturn. <sup class='fn'>3654</sup>

And who does more wrong than one to whom are recited the Signs of\n\t\t\this Lord and who then turns away therefrom? Verily from those who\n\t\t\ttransgress We shall exact (Due) Retribution. <sup class='fn'>3655</sup>

We did indeed aforetime give the Book to Moses: be not then in\n\t\t\tdoubt of its reaching (thee): and We made it a guide to the\n\t\t\tChildren of Israel. <sup class='fn'>3656</sup> <sup class='fn'>3657</sup>
And We appointed from among them Leaders giving guidance under\n\t\t\tOur command so long as they persevered with patience and\n\t\t\tcontinued to have faith in Our Signs. <sup class='fn'>3658</sup>
Verily thy Lord will judge between them on the Day of Judgement\n\t\t\tin the matters wherein they differ (among themselves).\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3659</sup>

Does it not teach them a lesson how many generations We destroyed
			before them in whose dwellings they (now) go to and fro? Verily
			in that are Signs: do they not then listen? <sup class='fn'>3660</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3661</sup>

And do they not see that We do drive Rain to parched soil (bare
			of herbage) and produce therewith crops providing food for their
			cattle and themselves? Have they not the vision? <sup class='fn'>3662</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3663</sup>
They say: "When will this decision be if ye are telling the\n\t\t\ttruth?" <sup class='fn'>3664</sup>
Say: "On the Day of Decision no profit will it be to Unbelievers\n\t\t\tif they (then) believe! Nor will they be granted a respite."
So turn away from them and wait: they too are waiting.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3665</sup>
O Prophet! Fear Allah and hearken not to the Unbelievers and the\n\t\t\tHypocrites: verily Allah is full of knowledge and wisdom.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3666</sup>
But follow that which comes to thee by inspiration from thy Lord:\n\t\t\tfor Allah is well acquainted with (all) that ye do. <sup class='fn'>3667</sup>
And put thy trust in Allah and enough is Allah as a Disposer of\n\t\t\taffairs. <sup class='fn'>3668</sup>

Allah has not made for any man two hearts in his (one) body: nor
			has He made your wives whom ye divorce by Zihar your mothers: nor
			has He made your adopted sons your sons.  Such is (only) your
			(manner of) speech by your mouths.  But Allah tells (you) the
			Truth and He shows the (right) Way. <sup class='fn'>3669</sup> <sup class='fn'>3670</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3671</sup>

Call them by (the names) of their fathers: that is juster in the
			sight of Allah but if ye know not their father's (names call
			them) your Brothers in faith or your Maulas.  But there is no
			blame on you if ye make a mistake therein: (what counts is) the
			intention of your hearts: and Allah is Oft-Returning Most
			Merciful. <sup class='fn'>3672</sup> <sup class='fn'>3673</sup>

The Prophet is closer to the Believers than their own selves and
			his wives are their mothers.  Blood-relations among each other
			have closer personal ties in the Decree of Allah than (the
			Brotherhood of) Believers and Muhajirs: nevertheless do ye what
			is just to your closest friends: such is the writing in the
			Decree (of Allah). <sup class='fn'>3674</sup> <sup class='fn'>3675</sup> <sup class='fn'>3676</sup>

And remember We took from the Prophets their Covenant as (We did)\n\t\t\tfrom thee: from Noah Abraham Moses and Jesus the son of Mary: We\n\t\t\ttook from them a solemn Covenant: <sup class='fn'>3677</sup>
That (Allah) may question the (Custodians) of Truth concerning\n\t\t\tthe Truth they (were charged with): and He has prepared for the\n\t\t\tUnbelievers a grievous Penalty. <sup class='fn'>3678</sup>

O ye who believe! Remember the Grace of Allah (bestowed) on you
			when there came down on you hosts (to overwhelm you): but We sent
			against them a hurricane and force that ye saw not.  But Allah
			sees (clearly) all that ye do. <sup class='fn'>3679</sup> <sup class='fn'>3680</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3681</sup>

Behold! they came on you from above you and from below you and
			behold the eyes became dim and the hearts gaped up to the throats
			and ye imagined various (vain) thoughts about Allah!
			<sup class='fn'>3682</sup>
In that situation were the Believers tried: they were shaken as\n\t\t\tby a tremendous shaking.
And behold! the Hypocrites and those in whose hearts is a disease\n\t\t\t(even) say: "Allah and His Apostle promised us nothing but\n\t\t\tdelusion!" <sup class='fn'>3683</sup>

Behold! a party among them said: "Ye men of Yathrib! Ye cannot
			stand (the attack)! Therefore go back!" and a band of them ask
			for leave of the Prophet saying "Truly our houses are bare and
			exposed" though they were not exposed: they intended nothing but
			to run away. <sup class='fn'>3684</sup>

And if an entry had been effected to them from the sides of the
			(City) and they had been incited to sedition they would certainly
			have brought it to pass with none but a brief delay!
			<sup class='fn'>3685</sup>
And yet they had already covenanted with Allah not to turn their\n\t\t\tbacks and a covenant with Allah must (surely) be answered for.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3686</sup>

Say: "Running away will not profit you if ye are running away\n\t\t\tfrom death or slaughter; and even if (ye do escape) no more than\n\t\t\ta brief (respite) will ye be allowed to enjoy!" <sup class='fn'>3687</sup>

Say: "Who is it that can screen you from Allah if it be His wish
			to give you Punishment or to give you Mercy?" Nor will they find
			for themselves besides Allah any protector or helper.
			<sup class='fn'>3688</sup>
Verily Allah knows those among you who keep back (men) and those\n\t\t\twho say to their brethren "Come along to us" but come not to the\n\t\t\tfight except for just a little while.

Covetous over you.  Then when fear comes thou wilt see them
			looking to thee their eyes revolving like (those of) one over
			whom hovers death: but when the fear is past they will smite you
			with sharp tongues covetous of goods.  Such men have no faith and
			so Allah has made their deeds of none effect: and that is easy
			for Allah. <sup class='fn'>3689</sup> <sup class='fn'>3690</sup> <sup class='fn'>3691</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3692</sup>

They think that the Confederates have not withdrawn; and if the
			Confederates should come (again) they would wish they were in the
			deserts (wandering) among the Bedouins and seeking news about you
			(from a safe distance); and if they were in your midst they would
			fight but little. <sup class='fn'>3693</sup>

Ye have indeed in the Apostle of Allah a beautiful pattern of
			(conduct) for anyone whose hope is in Allah and the Final Day and
			who engages much in the praise of Allah. <sup class='fn'>3694</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3695</sup>

When the Believers saw the Confederate forces they said: "This is
			what Allah and His Apostle had promised us and Allah and his
			Apostle told us what was true." And it only added to their faith
			and their zeal in obedience. <sup class='fn'>3696</sup>

Among the Believers are men who have been true to their Covenant
			with Allah: of them some have completed their vow to (the
			extreme) and some (still) wait: but they have never changed
			(their determination) in the least: <sup class='fn'>3697</sup>

That Allah may reward the men of Truth for their Truth and punish\n\t\t\tthe Hypocrites if that be His Will or turn to them in Mercy: for\n\t\t\tAllah is Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful. <sup class='fn'>3698</sup>

And Allah turned back the Unbelievers for (all) their fury: no
			advantage did they gain and enough is Allah for the Believers in
			their fight. And Allah is full of Strength Able to enforce His
			Will. <sup class='fn'>3699</sup> <sup class='fn'>3700</sup>

And those of the people of the Book who aided them Allah did take
			them down from their strongholds and cast terror into their
			hearts (so that) some ye slew and some ye made prisoners.
			<sup class='fn'>3701</sup> <sup class='fn'>3702</sup> <sup class='fn'>3703</sup> <sup class='fn'>3704</sup>
And He made you heirs of their lands their houses and their goods\n\t\t\tand of a land which ye had not frequented (before).  And Allah\n\t\t\thas power over all things. <sup class='fn'>3705</sup>

O Prophet! say to thy Consorts: "If it be that ye desire the life\n\t\t\tof this world and its glitter then come! I will provide for your\n\t\t\tenjoyment and set you free in a handsome manner." <sup class='fn'>3706</sup>
But if ye seek Allah and His Apostle and the Home of the\n\t\t\tHereafter verily Allah has prepared for the well-doers amongst\n\t\t\tyou a great reward. <sup class='fn'>3707</sup>

O Consorts of the Prophet! if any of you were guilty of evident\n\t\t\tunseemly conduct the Punishment would be doubled to her and that\n\t\t\tis easy for Allah. <sup class='fn'>3708</sup> <sup class='fn'>3709</sup>

But any of you that is devout in the service of Allah and His
			Apostle and works righteousness to her shall We grant her reward
			twice: and We have prepared for her a generous Sustenance.
			<sup class='fn'>3710</sup> <sup class='fn'>3711</sup>

O Consorts of the Prophet! ye are not like any of the (other)
			women: if ye do fear (Allah) be not too complaisant of speech
			lest one in whose heart is a disease should be moved with desire:
			but speak ye a speech (that is) just. <sup class='fn'>3712</sup> <sup class='fn'>3713</sup>

And stay quietly in your houses and make not a dazzling display
			like that of the former Times of Ignorance; and establish regular
			Prayer and give regular Charity; and obey Allah and His Apostle. 
			And Allah only wishes to remove all abomination from you ye
			Members of the Family and to make you pure and spotless.
			<sup class='fn'>3714</sup> <sup class='fn'>3715</sup>

And recite what is rehearsed to you in your homes of the Signs of\n\t\t\tAllah and His wisdom: for Allah understands the finest mysteries\n\t\t\tand is well-acquainted (with them). <sup class='fn'>3716</sup> <sup class='fn'>3717</sup>

For Muslim men and women for believing men and women for devout
			men and women for true men and women for men and women who are
			patient and constant for men and women who humble themselves for
			men and women who give in charity for men and women who fast (and
			deny themselves) for men and women who guard their chastity and
			for men and women who engage much in Allah's praise for them has
			Allah prepared forgiveness and great reward. <sup class='fn'>3718</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3719</sup> <sup class='fn'>3720</sup>

It is not fitting for a Believer man or woman when a matter has
			been decided by Allah and His Apostle to have any option about
			their decision: if anyone disobeys Allah and His Apostle he is
			indeed on a clearly wrong Path. <sup class='fn'>3721</sup>

Behold! thou didst say to one who had received the grace of Allah
			and thy favor: "Retain thou (in wedlock) thy wife and fear
			Allah." But thou didst hide in thy heart that which Allah was
			about to make manifest: thou didst fear the people but it is more
			fitting that thou shouldst fear Allah.	Then when Zaid had
			dissolved (his marriage) with her with the necessary (formality)
			We joined her in marriage to thee: in order that (in future)
			there may be no difficulty to the Believers in (the matter of)
			marriage with the wives of their adopted sons when the latter
			have dissolved with the necessary (formality) (their marriage)
			with them: and Allah's command must be fulfilled. <sup class='fn'>3722</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3723</sup> <sup class='fn'>3724</sup> <sup class='fn'>3725</sup> <sup class='fn'>3726</sup>

There can be no difficulty to the Prophet in what Allah has
			indicated to him as a duty. It was the practice (approved) of
			Allah amongst those of old that have passed away and the command
			of Allah is a decree determined. <sup class='fn'>3727</sup> <sup class='fn'>3728</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3729</sup>
(It is the practice of those) who preach the Messages of Allah\n\t\t\tand fear Him and fear none but Allah: and enough is Allah to call\n\t\t\t(men) to account. <sup class='fn'>3730</sup>
Muhammad is not the father of any of your men but (he is) the\n\t\t\tApostle of Allah and the Seal of the Prophets: and Allah has full\n\t\t\tknowledge of all things. <sup class='fn'>3731</sup>
O ye who believe! celebrate the praises of Allah and do this\n\t\t\toften;
And glorify Him morning and evening.

He it is Who sends blessings on you as do His angels that He may\n\t\t\tbring you out from the depths of Darkness into Light: and He is\n\t\t\tFull of Mercy to the Believers. <sup class='fn'>3732</sup> <sup class='fn'>3733</sup>
Their salutation on the Day they meet Him will be "peace!": and\n\t\t\tHe has prepared for them a generous Reward.
O Prophet! Truly We have sent thee as a Witness a Bearer of Glad\n\t\t\tTidings and a Warner <sup class='fn'>3734</sup>
And as one who invites to Allah's (Grace) by His leave and as a\n\t\t\tLamp spreading Light. <sup class='fn'>3735</sup>
Then give the glad tidings to the Believers that they shall have\n\t\t\tfrom Allah a very great Bounty. <sup class='fn'>3736</sup>

And obey not (the behests) of the Unbelievers and the Hypocrites\n\t\t\tand heed not their annoyances but put thy trust in Allah for\n\t\t\tenough is Allah as a Disposer of affairs. <sup class='fn'>3737</sup>

O ye who believe! when ye marry believing women and then divorce
			them before ye have touched them no period of `Iddah have ye to
			count in respect of them: so give them a present and set them
			free in a handsome manner. <sup class='fn'>3738</sup> <sup class='fn'>3739</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3740</sup>

O prophet! We have made lawful to thee thy wives to whom thou
			hast paid their dowers; and those whom thy right hand possesses
			out of the prisoners of war whom Allah has assigned to thee; and
			daughters of thy paternal uncles and aunts and daughters of thy
			maternal uncles and aunts who migrated (from Mecca) with thee;
			and any believing woman who dedicates her soul to the Prophet if
			the Prophet wishes to wed her this only for thee and not for the
			Believers (at large); We know what We have appointed for them as
			to their wives and the captives whom their right hands possess in
			order that there should be no difficulty for Thee.  And Allah is
			Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful. <sup class='fn'>3741</sup> <sup class='fn'>3742</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3743</sup> <sup class='fn'>3744</sup> <sup class='fn'>3745</sup> <sup class='fn'>3746</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3747</sup> <sup class='fn'>3748</sup>

Thou mayest defer (the turn of) any of them that thou pleasest
			and thou mayest receive any thou pleasest: and there is no blame
			on thee if thou invite one whose (turn) thou hadst set aside. 
			This were nigher to the cooling of their eyes the prevention of
			their grief and their satisfaction--that of all of them--with
			that which thou hast to give them: and Allah knows (all) that is
			in your hearts: and Allah is All-Knowing Most Forbearing.
			<sup class='fn'>3749</sup> <sup class='fn'>3750</sup> <sup class='fn'>3751</sup> <sup class='fn'>3752</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3753</sup>

It is not lawful for thee (to marry more) women after this nor to
			change them for (other) wives even though their beauty attract
			thee except any thy right hand should possess (as handmaidens):
			and Allah doth watch over all things. <sup class='fn'>3754</sup>

O ye who Believe! enter not the Prophet's houses until leave is
			given you for a meal (and then) not (so early as) to wait for its
			preparation: but when ye are invited enter; and when ye have
			taken your meal disperse without seeking familiar talk.  Such
			(behavior) annoys the Prophet: He is ashamed to dismiss you but
			Allah is not ashamed (to tell you) the truth.  And when ye ask
			(his ladies) for anything ye want ask them from before a screen:
			that makes for greater purity for your hearts and for theirs. 
			Nor is it right for you that ye should annoy Allah's Apostle or
			that ye should marry his widows after him at any time.	Truly
			such a thing is in Allah's sight an enormity. <sup class='fn'>3755</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3756</sup> <sup class='fn'>3757</sup> <sup class='fn'>3758</sup>
Whether ye reveal anything or conceal it verily Allah has full\n\t\t\tknowledge of all things. <sup class='fn'>3759</sup>

There is no blame (on these ladies if they appear) before their
			fathers or their sons their brothers or their brothers' sons or
			their sisters' sons or their women or the (slaves) whom their
			right hands possess.  And (ladies) fear Allah: for Allah is
			Witness to all things. <sup class='fn'>3360</sup>
Allah and His angels send blessings on the Prophet: O ye that\n\t\t\tbelieve! send ye blessings on him and salute him with all\n\t\t\trespect. <sup class='fn'>3761</sup>
Those who annoy Allah and his Apostle Allah has cursed them in\n\t\t\tthis world and in the Hereafter and has prepared for them a\n\t\t\thumiliating Punishment. <sup class='fn'>3762</sup>
And those who annoy believing men and women undeservedly bear (on\n\t\t\tthemselves) a calumny and a glaring sin. <sup class='fn'>3763</sup>

O prophet! tell thy wives and daughters and the believing women
			that they should cast their outer garments over their persons
			(when abroad): that is most convenient that they should be known
			(as such) and not molested: and Allah is Oft-Forgiving Most
			Merciful. <sup class='fn'>3764</sup> <sup class='fn'>3765</sup> <sup class='fn'>3766</sup> <sup class='fn'>3767</sup>

Truly if the Hypocrites and those in whose hearts is a disease
			and those who stir up sedition in the City desist not We shall
			certainly stir thee up against them: then will they not be able
			to stay in it as thy neighbors for any length of time:
			<sup class='fn'>3768</sup>
They shall have a curse on them: wherever they are found they\n\t\t\tshall be seized and slain (without mercy). <sup class='fn'>3769</sup>
(Such was) the practice (approved) of Allah among those who lived\n\t\t\taforetime: no change wilt thou find in the practice (approved) of\n\t\t\tAllah. <sup class='fn'>3770</sup>
Men ask thee concerning the Hour: say "The knowledge thereof is\n\t\t\twith Allah (alone)": and what will make thee understand?\n\t\t\tPerchance the Hour is nigh! <sup class='fn'>3771</sup>
Verily Allah has cursed the Unbelievers and prepared for them a\n\t\t\tBlazing Fire
To dwell therein forever: no protector will they find nor helper.
The Day that their faces will be turned upside down in the Fire\n\t\t\tthey will say: "Woe to us! would that we had obeyed Allah and\n\t\t\tobeyed the Apostle!" <sup class='fn'>3772</sup>
And they would say: "Our Lord! we obeyed our chiefs and our great\n\t\t\tones and they misled us as to the (right) path.
"Our Lord! give them Double Penalty and curse them with a very\n\t\t\tgreat Curse!" <sup class='fn'>3773</sup>

O ye who believe! be ye not like those who vexed and insulted\n\t\t\tMoses but Allah cleared him of the (calumnies) they had uttered:\n\t\t\tand he was honorable in Allah's sight. <sup class='fn'>3774</sup>
O ye who believe! fear Allah and (always) say a word directed to\n\t\t\tthe Right: <sup class='fn'>3775</sup>
That He may make your conduct whole and sound and forgive you\n\t\t\tyour sins: he that obeys Allah and His Apostle has already\n\t\t\tattained the highest Achievement. <sup class='fn'>3776</sup>

We did indeed offer the Trust to the Heavens and the Earth and
			the Mountains: but they refused to undertake it being afraid
			thereof: but man undertook it he was indeed unjust and foolish
			<sup class='fn'>3777</sup> <sup class='fn'>3778</sup> <sup class='fn'>3779</sup> <sup class='fn'>3780</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3781</sup> <sup class='fn'>3782</sup>

(With the result) that Allah has to punish the Hypocrites men and
			women and the Unbelievers men and women and Allah turns in Mercy
			to the Believers men and women: for Allah is Oft-Forgiving Most
			Merciful. <sup class='fn'>3783</sup> <sup class='fn'>3784</sup>

Praise be to Allah to Whom belong all things in the heavens and\n\t\t\ton earth: to Him be Praise in the Hereafter: and He is Full of\n\t\t\tWisdom acquainted with all things. <sup class='fn'>3785</sup>

He knows all that goes into the earth and all that comes out
			thereof; all that comes down from the sky and all that ascends
			thereto: and He is the Most Merciful the Oft-Forgiving.
			<sup class='fn'>3786</sup> <sup class='fn'>3787</sup>

The Unbelievers say "Never to us will come the hour": say "Nay!
			but most surely by my Lord it will come upon you by Him Who knows
			the unseen from Whom is not hidden the least little atom in the
			Heavens or on earth: nor is there anything less than that or
			greater but is in the Record Perspicuous: <sup class='fn'>3788</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3789</sup> <sup class='fn'>3790</sup>
That He may reward those who believe and work deeds of\n\t\t\trighteousness: for such is Forgiveness and a Sustenance Most\n\t\t\tGenerous." <sup class='fn'>3791</sup>
But those who strive against Our Signs to frustrate them for such\n\t\t\twill be a Penalty a Punishment most humiliating. <sup class='fn'>3792</sup>

And those to whom knowledge has come see that the (Revelation)
			sent down to thee from thy Lord that is the Truth and that it
			guides to the Path of the Exalted (in Might) Worthy of all
			praise. <sup class='fn'>3793</sup>

The Unbelievers say (in ridicule): "Shall we point out to you a
			man that will tell you when ye are all scattered to pieces in
			disintegration that ye shall (then be raised) in a New Creation?
			<sup class='fn'>3794</sup>

"Has he invented a falsehood against Allah or has a spirit\n\t\t\t(seized) him?" Nay it is those who believe not in the Hereafter\n\t\t\tthat are in (real) Penalty and in farthest Error. <sup class='fn'>3795</sup>

See they not what is before them and behind them of the sky and
			the earth? If We wished We could cause the earth to swallow them
			up or cause a piece of the sky to fall upon them.  Verily in this
			is a Sign for every devotee that turns to Allah (in repentance).
			<sup class='fn'>3796</sup> <sup class='fn'>3797</sup> <sup class='fn'>3798</sup>

We bestowed Grace aforetime on David from Ourselves: "O ye
			Mountains! sing ye back the Praises of Allah with him! and ye
			birds (also)! and We made the iron soft for Him <sup class='fn'>3799</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3800</sup>

(Commanding) "Make thou coats of mail balancing well the rings of\n\t\t\tchain armor and work ye righteousness; for be sure I see\n\t\t\t(clearly) all that ye do." <sup class='fn'>3801</sup> <sup class='fn'>3802</sup>

And to Solomon (We made) the Wind (obedient): its early morning
			(stride) was a month's (journey) and its evening (stride) was a
			month's (journey); and We made a Font of molten brass to flow for
			him; and there were Jinns that worked in front of him by the
			leave of his Lord and if any of them turned aside from Our
			command We made Him taste of the Penalty of the Blazing Fire.
			<sup class='fn'>3803</sup> <sup class='fn'>3804</sup> <sup class='fn'>3805</sup>

They worked for him as he desired (making) Arches Images Basins
			as large as Reservoirs and (cooking) Cauldrons fixed (in their
			places): "Work ye sons of David with thanks! But few of My
			servants are grateful!" <sup class='fn'>3806</sup> <sup class='fn'>3807</sup>

Then when We decreed (Solomon's) death nothing showed them his
			death except a little worm of the earth which kept (slowly)
			gnawing away at his staff: so when he fell down the Jinns saw
			plainly that if they had known the unseen they would not have
			tarried in the humiliating Penalty (of their Task). <sup class='fn'>3808</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3809</sup>

There was for Saba' aforetime a Sign in their homeland two
			Gardens to the right and to the left.  Eat of the Sustenance
			(provided) by your Lord and be grateful to Him: a territory fair
			and happy and a Lord Oft-Forgiving! <sup class='fn'>3810</sup> <sup class='fn'>3811</sup>

But they turned away (from Allah) and We sent against them the
			flood (released) from the Dams and We converted their two Garden
			(rows) into "gardens" producing bitter fruit and tamarisks and
			some few (stunted) Lote trees. <sup class='fn'>3812</sup> <sup class='fn'>3813</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3814</sup>
That was the Requital We gave them because they ungratefully\n\t\t\trejected Faith: and never do We give (such) requital except to\n\t\t\tsuch as are ungrateful rejecters. <sup class='fn'>3815</sup>

Between them and the Cities on which We had poured Our blessings
			We had placed Cities in prominent positions and between them We
			had appointed stages of journey in due proportion: "Travel
			therein secure by night and by day." <sup class='fn'>3816</sup>

But they said: "Our Lord! place longer distances between our
			journey-stages."  But they wronged themselves (therein).  At
			length We made them as a tale (that is told) and We dispersed
			them all in scattered fragments.  Verily in this are Signs for
			every (soul that is) patiently constant and grateful.
			<sup class='fn'>3817</sup> <sup class='fn'>3818</sup> <sup class='fn'>3819</sup>
And on them did Satan prove true his idea and they followed him\n\t\t\tall but a Party that believed. <sup class='fn'>3820</sup>

But he had no authority over them except that We might test the
			man who believes in the Hereafter from him who is in doubt
			concerning it: and thy Lord doth watch over all things.
			<sup class='fn'>3821</sup>

Say: "Call upon other (gods) whom ye fancy besides Allah: they
			have no power not the weight of an atom in the heavens or on
			earth; no (sort of) share have they therein nor is any of them a
			helper to Allah. <sup class='fn'>3822</sup> <sup class='fn'>3823</sup>

"No intercession can avail in His Presence except for those for
			whom He has granted permission.  So far (is this the case) that
			when terror is removed from their hearts (at the Day of Judgement
			then) will they say `What is it that your Lord commanded?' They
			will say `That which is true and just; and He is the Most High
			Most Great.' " <sup class='fn'>3824</sup> <sup class='fn'>3825</sup> <sup class='fn'>3826</sup>

Say: "Who gives you sustenance from the heavens and the earth?"\n\t\t\tSay: "It is Allah and certain it is that either we or ye are on\n\t\t\tright guidance or in manifest error!" <sup class='fn'>3827</sup> <sup class='fn'>3828</sup>
Say: "Ye shall not be questioned as to our sins nor shall we be\n\t\t\tquestioned as to what ye do." <sup class='fn'>3829</sup>

Say: "Our Lord will gather us together and will in the end decide\n\t\t\tthe matter between us (and you) in truth and justice: and He is\n\t\t\tthe One to decide the One Who knows all." <sup class='fn'>3830</sup>
Say: "Show me those whom ye have joined with Him as partners: by\n\t\t\tno means (can ye).  Nay He is Allah the Exalted in Power the\n\t\t\tWise." <sup class='fn'>3831</sup>
We have not sent thee but as a universal (Messenger) to men\n\t\t\tgiving them glad tidings and warning them (against sin) but most\n\t\t\tmen understand not. <sup class='fn'>3832</sup>
They say: "When will this promise (come to pass) if ye are\n\t\t\ttelling the truth?"
Say: "The appointment to you is for a day which ye cannot put\n\t\t\tback for an hour nor put forward." <sup class='fn'>3833</sup>

The Unbelievers say: "We shall neither believe in this scripture
			nor in (any) that (came) before it." Couldst thou but see when
			the wrong-doers will be made to stand before their Lord throwing
			back the word (of blame) on one another! Those who had been
			despised will say to the arrogant ones: "Had it not been for you
			we should certainly have been believers!" <sup class='fn'>3834</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3835</sup> <sup class='fn'>3836</sup>

The arrogant ones will say to those who had been despised: "Was\n\t\t\tit we who kept you back from Guidance after it reached you? Nay\n\t\t\trather it was ye who transgressed." <sup class='fn'>3837</sup>

Those who had been despised will say to the arrogant ones: "Nay!
			it was a plot (of yours) by day and by night.  Behold! ye
			(constantly) ordered us to be ungrateful to Allah and to
			attribute equals to Him!" They will declare (their) repentance
			when they see the Penalty: We shall put yokes on the necks of the
			Unbelievers: it would only be a requital for their (ill) deeds.
			<sup class='fn'>3838</sup> <sup class='fn'>3839</sup> <sup class='fn'>3840</sup>
Never did We send a Warner to a population but the wealthy ones\n\t\t\tamong them said: "We believe not in the (message) with which ye\n\t\t\thave been sent." <sup class='fn'>3841</sup>
They said: "We have more in wealth and in sons and we cannot be\n\t\t\tpunished." <sup class='fn'>3842</sup>
Say: "Verily my Lord enlarges and restricts the provision to whom\n\t\t\tHe pleases but most men understand not." <sup class='fn'>3843</sup>

It is not your wealth nor your sons that will bring you nearer to
			Us in degree: but only those who believe and work Righteousness
			these are the ones for whom there is a multiplied Reward for
			their deeds while secure they (reside) in the dwellings on high!
			<sup class='fn'>3844</sup> <sup class='fn'>3845</sup> <sup class='fn'>3846</sup>
Those who strive against Our Signs to frustrate them will be\n\t\t\tgiven over into Punishment. <sup class='fn'>3847</sup>

Say: "Verily my Lord enlarges and restricts the Sustenance to
			such of His servants as He pleases: and nothing do ye spend in
			the least (in his cause) but He replaces it: for He is the Best
			of those Who grant Sustenance. <sup class='fn'>3848</sup> <sup class='fn'>3849</sup>
One day He will gather them all together and say to the angels\n\t\t\t"Was it you that these men used to worship?" <sup class='fn'>3850</sup>

They will say "Glory to thee! Our (tie) is with thee as Protector\n\t\t\t not with them.  Nay but they worshipped the Jinns: most of them\n\t\t\tbelieved in them." <sup class='fn'>3851</sup> <sup class='fn'>3852</sup>

So on that day no power shall they have over each other for
			profit or harm: and We shall say to the wrong-doers "Taste ye the
			penalty of the Fire the which ye were wont to deny!"
			<sup class='fn'>3853</sup>

When Our Clear Signs are rehearsed to them they say "This is only
			a man who wishes to hinder you from the (worship) which your
			fathers practiced." And they say "This is only a falsehood
			invented!" And the Unbelievers say of the Truth when it comes to
			them "This is nothing but evident magic!" <sup class='fn'>3854</sup>
But We had not given them Books which they could study nor sent\n\t\t\tapostles to them before thee as Warners. <sup class='fn'>3855</sup>

And their predecessors rejected (the Truth); these have not
			received a tenth of what We had granted to those: yet when they
			rejected My apostles how (terrible) was My rejection (of them)!
			<sup class='fn'>3856</sup>

Say: "I do admonish you on one point: that ye do stand up before
			Allah--(it may be) in pairs or (it may be) singly and reflect
			(within yourselves): your Companion is not possessed: he is no
			less than a Warner to you in face of a terrible Penalty."
			<sup class='fn'>3857</sup> <sup class='fn'>3858</sup>
Say: "No reward do I ask of you: it is (all) in your interest: my\n\t\t\treward is only due from Allah: and He is Witness to all things."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3859</sup>
Say: "Verily my Lord doth cast the (mantle of) Truth (over His\n\t\t\tservants) He that has full knowledge of (all) that is hidden."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3860</sup>
Say: "The Truth has arrived and Falsehood neither creates\n\t\t\tanything new nor restores anything." <sup class='fn'>3861</sup>

Say: "If I am astray I only stray to the loss of my own soul: but
			if I receive guidance it is because of the inspiration of my Lord
			to me: it is He Who hears all things and is (ever) near."
			<sup class='fn'>3862</sup>
If thou couldst but see when they will quake with terror: but\n\t\t\tthen there will be no escape (for them) and they will be seized\n\t\t\tfrom a position (quite) near. <sup class='fn'>3863</sup>
And they will say "We do believe (now) in the (truth)": but how\n\t\t\tcould they receive (faith) from a position (so) far off\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3864</sup>
Seeing that they did reject faith (entirely) before and that they\n\t\t\t(continually) cast (slanders) on the Unseen from a position far\n\t\t\toff? <sup class='fn'>3865</sup>

And between them and their desires is placed a barrier as was
			done in the past with their partisans: for they were indeed in
			suspicious (disquieting) doubt. <sup class='fn'>3866</sup> <sup class='fn'>3867</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3868</sup>

Praise be to Allah Who created (out of nothing) the heavens and
			the earth Who made the angels messengers with wings two or three
			or four (Pairs): He adds to Creation as He pleases: for Allah has
			power over all things. <sup class='fn'>3869</sup> <sup class='fn'>3870</sup> <sup class='fn'>3871</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3872</sup>

What Allah out of His Mercy doth bestow on mankind there is none
			can withhold: what He doth withhold there is none can grant apart
			from Him: and He is the Exalted in Power Full of Wisdom.
			<sup class='fn'>3873</sup>

O men! call to mind the grace of Allah unto you! Is there a
			Creator other than Allah to give you Sustenance from heaven or
			earth? There is no god but He: how then are ye deluded away from
			the Truth? <sup class='fn'>3874</sup>
And if they reject thee so were apostles rejected before thee: to\n\t\t\tAllah go back for decision all affairs. <sup class='fn'>3875</sup>

O men! certainly the promise of Allah is true.\tLet not then this\n\t\t\tpresent life deceive you nor let the Chief Deceiver deceive you\n\t\t\tabout Allah. <sup class='fn'>3876</sup> <sup class='fn'>3877</sup>
Verily Satan is an enemy to you: so treat him as an enemy.  He\n\t\t\tonly invites his adherents that they may become Companions of the\n\t\t\tBlazing Fire. <sup class='fn'>3878</sup>
For those who reject Allah is a terrible Penalty: but for those\n\t\t\twho believe and work righteous deeds is Forgiveness and a\n\t\t\tmagnificent Reward. <sup class='fn'>3879</sup>

Is he then to whom the evil of his conduct is made alluring so
			that he looks upon it as good (equal to one who is rightly
			guided)? For Allah leaves to stray whom He wills and guides whom
			He wills.  So let not thy soul go out in (vainly) sighing after
			them: for Allah knows well all that they do! <sup class='fn'>3880</sup>

It is Allah Who sends forth the Winds so that they raise up the
			Clouds and We drive them to a Land that is dead and revive the
			earth therewith after its death: even so (will be) the
			Resurrection! <sup class='fn'>3881</sup>

If any do seek for glory and power to Allah belong all glory and
			power. To Him mount up (all) Words of Purity: it is He Who exalts
			each Deed of Righteousness.  Those that lay Plots of Evil for
			them is a Penalty terrible; and the plotting of such will be void
			(of result). <sup class='fn'>3882</sup> <sup class='fn'>3883</sup>

And Allah did create you from dust; then from a sperm-drop; then
			He made you in pairs.  And no female conceives or lays down (her
			load) but with His knowledge.  Nor is a man long-lived granted
			length of days nor is a part cut off from his life but is in a
			Decree (ordained). All this is easy for Allah. <sup class='fn'>3884</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3885</sup> <sup class='fn'>3886</sup> <sup class='fn'>3887</sup>

Nor are the two bodies of flowing water alike the one palatable
			sweet and pleasant to drink and the other salty and bitter.  Yet
			from each (kind of water) do ye eat flesh fresh and tender and ye
			extract ornaments to wear; and thou seest the ships therein that
			plough the waves that ye may seek (thus) of the Bounty of Allah
			that ye may be grateful. <sup class='fn'>3888</sup> <sup class='fn'>3889</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3890</sup>

He merges Night into Day and He merges Day into Night and He has
			subjected the sun and the moon (to His Law): each one runs its
			course for a term appointed.  Such is Allah your Lord: to Him
			belongs all Dominion.  And those whom ye invoke besides Him have
			not the least power. <sup class='fn'>3891</sup> <sup class='fn'>3892</sup> <sup class='fn'>3893</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3894</sup>

If ye invoke them they will not listen to your call and if they
			were to listen they cannot answer your (prayer).  On the Day of
			Judgement they will reject your "Partnership."	And none (O man!)
			can tell thee (the Truth) like the One Who is acquainted with all
			things. <sup class='fn'>3895</sup> <sup class='fn'>3896</sup> <sup class='fn'>3897</sup>
O ye men! it is ye that have need of Allah: but Allah is the One\n\t\t\tFree of all wants Worthy of all praise. <sup class='fn'>3898</sup>
If He so pleased He could blot you out and bring in a New\n\t\t\tCreation:
Nor is that (at all) difficult for Allah. <sup class='fn'>3899</sup>

Nor can a bearer of burdens bear another's burden.  If one
			heavily laden should call another to (bear) his load not the
			least portion of it can be carried (by the other) even though he
			be nearly related. Thou canst but admonish such as fear their
			Lord unseen and establish regular Prayer and whoever purifies
			himself does so for the benefit of his own soul; and the
			destination (of all) is to Allah. <sup class='fn'>3900</sup> <sup class='fn'>3901</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>3902</sup> <sup class='fn'>3903</sup>
The blind and the seeing are not alike; <sup class='fn'>3904</sup>
Nor are the depths of Darkness and the Light;
Nor are the (chilly) shade and the (genial) heat of the sun:

Nor are alike those that are living and those that are dead. \n\t\t\tAllah can make any that He wills to hear; but thou canst not make\n\t\t\tthose to hear who are (buried) in graves. <sup class='fn'>3905</sup>
Thou art no other than a warner. <sup class='fn'>3906</sup>

Verily We have sent thee in truth as a bearer of glad tidings and\n\t\t\tas a warner: and there never was a people without a warner having\n\t\t\tlived among them (in the past). <sup class='fn'>3907</sup>
And if they reject thee so did their predecessors to whom came\n\t\t\ttheir apostles with Clear Signs Books of Dark Prophecies and the\n\t\t\tBook of Enlightenment. <sup class='fn'>3908</sup>
In the end did I punish those who rejected Faith: and how\n\t\t\t(terrible) was My rejection (of them)! <sup class='fn'>3909</sup>

Seest thou not that Allah sends down rain from the sky? With it
			We then bring out produce of various colors.  And in the
			mountains are tracts white and red of various shades of color and
			black intense in hue. <sup class='fn'>3910</sup> <sup class='fn'>3911</sup>

And so amongst men and crawling creatures and cattle are they of
			various colors.  Those truly fear Allah among His Servants who
			have knowledge: for Allah is Exalted in Might Oft-Forgiving.
			<sup class='fn'>3912</sup> <sup class='fn'>3913</sup>

Those who rehearse the Book of Allah establish regular Prayer and
			spend (in Charity) out of what We have provided for them secretly
			and openly hope for a Commerce that will never fail:
			<sup class='fn'>3914</sup> <sup class='fn'>3915</sup>

For He will pay them their meed nay He will give them (even) more\n\t\t\tout of His Bounty; for He is Oft-Forgiving Most Ready to\n\t\t\tappreciate (service). <sup class='fn'>3916</sup> <sup class='fn'>3917</sup>

That which We have revealed to thee of the Book is the Truth 
			confirming what was (revealed) before it: for Allah is assuredly
			with respect to his servants well acquainted and fully-Observant.
			<sup class='fn'>3918</sup>

Then We have given the Book for inheritance to such of Our
			servants as We have chosen: but there are among them some who
			wrong their own souls; some who follow a middle course; and some
			who are by Allah's leave foremost in good deeds; that is the
			highest Grace. <sup class='fn'>3919</sup> <sup class='fn'>3920</sup>

Gardens of Eternity will they enter: therein will they be adorned\n\t\t\twith bracelets of gold and pearls; and their garments there will\n\t\t\tbe of silk. <sup class='fn'>3921</sup> <sup class='fn'>3922</sup>
And they will say: "Praise be to Allah Who has removed from us\n\t\t\t(all) sorrow: for Our Lord is indeed Oft-Forgiving Ready to\n\t\t\tappreciate (service): <sup class='fn'>3923</sup>
"Who has out of His bounty settled us in a Home that will last:\n\t\t\tno toil nor sense of weariness shall touch us therein."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3924</sup>

But those who reject (Allah) for them will be the Fire of Hell:
			no term shall be determined for them so they should die nor shall
			its Penalty be lightened for them: thus do We reward every
			ungrateful one! <sup class='fn'>3925</sup>

Therein will they cry aloud (for assistance): "Our Lord! bring us
			out: we shall work righteousness not the (deeds) we used to do!"
			Did we not give you long enough life so that he that would should
			receive admonition? And (moreover) the warner came to you.  So
			taste ye (the fruit of your deeds): for the Wrongdoers there is
			no helper." <sup class='fn'>3926</sup> <sup class='fn'>3927</sup> <sup class='fn'>3928</sup>
Verily Allah knows (all) the hidden things of the heavens and the\n\t\t\tearth: verily He has full knowledge of all that is in (men's)\n\t\t\thearts. <sup class='fn'>3929</sup>

He it is that has made you inheritors in the earth: if then any
			do reject (Allah) their rejection (works) against themselves:
			their rejection but adds to the odium for the Unbelievers in the
			sight of their Lord: their rejection but adds to (their own)
			undoing. <sup class='fn'>3930</sup> <sup class='fn'>3931</sup>

Say: "Have ye seen (these) `partners' of yours whom ye call upon
			besides Allah?" Show me what it is they have created in the
			(wide) earth.  Or have they a share in the heavens? Or have We
			given them a Book from which they (can derive) clear (evidence)?
			Nay the wrongdoers promise each other nothing but delusions.
			<sup class='fn'>3932</sup>

It is Allah Who sustains the heavens and the earth lest they
			cease (to function): and if they should fail there is none not
			one can sustain them thereafter: verily He is Most Forbearing
			Oft-Forgiving. <sup class='fn'>3933</sup> <sup class='fn'>3934</sup>

They swore their strongest oaths by Allah that if a warner came
			to them they would follow his guidance better than any (other) of
			the Peoples: but when a warner came to them it has only increased
			their flight (from righteousness) <sup class='fn'>3935</sup>

On account of their arrogance in the land and their plotting of
			Evil. But the plotting of Evil will hem in only the authors
			thereof.  Now are they but looking for the way the ancients were
			dealt with? But no change wilt thou find in Allah's way (of
			dealing): no turning off wilt thou find in Allah's way (of
			dealing). <sup class='fn'>3936</sup> <sup class='fn'>3937</sup> <sup class='fn'>3938</sup>

Do they not travel through the earth and see what was the end of
			those before them though they were superior to them in strength?
			Nor is Allah to be frustrated by anything whatever in the heavens
			or on earth: for He is All-Knowing All-Powerful. <sup class='fn'>3939</sup>

If Allah were to punish men according to what they deserve He
			would not leave on the back of the (earth) a single living
			creature: but He gives them respite for a stated Term: when their
			Term expires verily Allah has in his sight all His servants.
			<sup class='fn'>3940</sup> <sup class='fn'>3941</sup> <sup class='fn'>3942</sup>
Ya Sin. <sup class='fn'>3943</sup>
By the Qur'an full of Wisdom <sup class='fn'>3944</sup>
Thou art indeed one of the apostles.
On a Straight Way.
It is a Revelation sent down by (Him) the Exalted in Might Most\n\t\t\tMerciful. <sup class='fn'>3945</sup>
In order that thou mayest admonish a people whose fathers had\n\t\t\treceived no admonition and who therefore remain heedless (of the\n\t\t\tSigns of Allah). <sup class='fn'>3946</sup>
The Word is proved true against the greater part of them; for\n\t\t\tthey do not believe. <sup class='fn'>3947</sup>
We have put yokes round their necks right up to their chins so\n\t\t\tthat their heads are forced up (and they cannot see).\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3948</sup>
And We have put a bar in front of them and a bar behind them and\n\t\t\tfurther We have covered them up; so that they cannot see.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3949</sup>
The same is it to them whether thou admonish them or thou do not\n\t\t\tadmonish them: they will not believe. <sup class='fn'>3950</sup>

Thou canst but admonish: such a one as follows the Message and
			fears the (Lord) Most Gracious unseen: give such a one therefore
			good tidings of Forgiveness and a Reward most generous.
			<sup class='fn'>3951</sup> <sup class='fn'>3952</sup> <sup class='fn'>3953</sup>

Verily We shall give life to the dead and We record that which
			they sent before and that which they leave behind and of all
			things have We taken account in a clear Book (of evidence).
			<sup class='fn'>3954</sup> <sup class='fn'>3955</sup> <sup class='fn'>3956</sup>
Set forth to them by way of a parable the (story of) the\n\t\t\tCompanions of the City.  Behold there came apostles to it.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3957</sup>
When We (first) sent to them two apostles they rejected them: but\n\t\t\tWe strengthened them with a third: they said "Truly we have been\n\t\t\tsent on a mission to you." <sup class='fn'>3958</sup>
The (people) said: "Ye are only men like ourselves; and (Allah)\n\t\t\tMost Gracious sends no sort of revelation: Ye do nothing but\n\t\t\tlie." <sup class='fn'>3959</sup> <sup class='fn'>3960</sup>
They said: "Our Lord doth know that we have been sent on a\n\t\t\tmission to you: <sup class='fn'>3961</sup>
"And Our duty is only to proclaim the clear Message."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3962</sup>

The (people) said: "for us We augur an evil omen from you: if ye\n\t\t\tdesist not we will certainly stone you and a grievous punishment\n\t\t\tindeed will be inflicted on you by us." <sup class='fn'>3963</sup>

They said: "Your evil omens are with yourselves: (deem ye this an\n\t\t\tevil omen) if ye are admonished? Nay but ye are a people\n\t\t\ttransgressing all bounds!" <sup class='fn'>3964</sup> <sup class='fn'>3965</sup>
Then there came running from the farthest part of the City a man\n\t\t\tsaying "O my people! obey the apostles: <sup class='fn'>3966</sup>
"Obey those who ask no reward of you (for themselves) and who\n\t\t\thave themselves received Guidance. <sup class='fn'>3967</sup>
"It would not be reasonable in me if I did not serve Him Who\n\t\t\tcreated me and to Whom ye shall (all) be brought back.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3968</sup>

"Shall I take (other) gods besides Him? If (Allah) Most Gracious\n\t\t\tshould intend some adversity for me of no use whatever will be\n\t\t\ttheir intercession for me nor can they deliver me. <sup class='fn'>3969</sup>
"I would indeed if I were to do so be in manifest Error.
"For me I have faith in the Lord of you (all): listen then to\n\t\t\tme!" <sup class='fn'>3970</sup>
It was said: "Enter thou the Garden." He said "Ah me! would that\n\t\t\tmy People knew (what I know)! <sup class='fn'>3971</sup>
"For that my Lord has granted me Forgiveness and has enrolled me\n\t\t\tamong those held in honor!" <sup class='fn'>3972</sup>
And We sent not down against his People after Him any hosts from\n\t\t\theaven nor was it needful for Us so to do.
It was no more than a single mighty Blast and behold! they were\n\t\t\t(like ashes) quenched and silent. <sup class='fn'>3973</sup> <sup class='fn'>3974</sup>
Ah! alas for (My) servants! There comes not an apostle to them\n\t\t\tbut they mock Him! <sup class='fn'>3975</sup>
See they not how many generations before them We destroyed? Not\n\t\t\tto them will they return: <sup class='fn'>3976</sup>
But each one of them all will be brought before Us (for\n\t\t\tjudgment).
A Sign for them is the earth that is dead; We do give it life and\n\t\t\tproduce grain therefrom of which ye do eat. <sup class='fn'>3977</sup>
And We produce therein orchards with date-palms and Vines and We\n\t\t\tcause springs to gush forth therein. <sup class='fn'>3978</sup>
That they may enjoy the fruits of this (artistry): it was not\n\t\t\ttheir hands that made this: will they not then give thanks?\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3979</sup> <sup class='fn'>3980</sup>
Glory to Allah Who created in pairs all things that the earth\n\t\t\tproduces as well as their own (human) kind and (other) things of\n\t\t\twhich they have no knowledge. <sup class='fn'>3981</sup>
And a Sign for them is the Night: We withdraw therefrom the Day\n\t\t\tand behold they are plunged in darkness; <sup class='fn'>3982</sup>
And the Sun runs his course for a period determined for him: that\n\t\t\tis the decree of (Him) the exalted in Might the All-Knowing.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3983</sup>
And the Moon We have measured for her mansions (to traverse) till\n\t\t\tshe returns like the old (and withered) lower part of date-stalk.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3984</sup> <sup class='fn'>3985</sup>

It is not permitted to the Sun to catch up the Moon nor can the\n\t\t\tNight outstrip the Day: each (just) swims along in (its own)\n\t\t\torbit (according to Law). <sup class='fn'>3986</sup> <sup class='fn'>3987</sup>
And a Sign for them is that We bore their race (through the\n\t\t\tflood) in the loaded Ark; <sup class='fn'>3988</sup>
And We have created for them similar (vessels) on which they\n\t\t\tride. <sup class='fn'>3989</sup>
If it were Our Will We could drown them; then would there be no\n\t\t\thelper (to hear their cry) nor could they be delivered.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>3990</sup>
Except by way of Mercy from Us and by way of (worldly)\n\t\t\tconvenience (to serve them) for a time. <sup class='fn'>3991</sup>
When they are told "Fear ye that which is before you and that\n\t\t\twhich will be after you in order that ye may receive Mercy" (they\n\t\t\tturn back). <sup class='fn'>3992</sup>
Not a Sign comes to them from among the Signs of their Lord but\n\t\t\tthey turn away therefrom. <sup class='fn'>3993</sup>

And when they are told "Spend ye of (the bounties) with which
			Allah has provided you." You Unbelievers say to those who
			believe: "Shall we then feed those whom if Allah had so willed He
			would have fed (himself)? Ye are in nothing but manifest error."
			<sup class='fn'>3994</sup> <sup class='fn'>3995</sup>
Further they say "When will this promise (come to pass) if what\n\t\t\tye say is true?" <sup class='fn'>3996</sup>
They will not (have to) wait for aught but a single Blast: it\n\t\t\twill seize them while they are yet disputing among themselves!
No (chance) will they then have by will to dispose (of their\n\t\t\taffairs) nor to return to their own people!
The trumpet shall be sounded when behold! from the sepulchers\n\t\t\t(men) will rush forth to their Lord! <sup class='fn'>3997</sup>

They will say: "Ah! woe unto us! Who hath raised us up from our
			beds of repose? (A voice will say:) "This is what (Allah) Most
			Gracious had promised and true was the word of the apostles!"
			<sup class='fn'>3998</sup>
It will be no more than a single Blast when lo! they will all be\n\t\t\tbrought up before Us! <sup class='fn'>3999</sup>

O David! We did indeed make thee a vicegerent on earth: so judge
			thou between men in truth (and justice): nor follow thou the
			lusts (of thy heart) for they will mislead thee from the Path of
			Allah: for those who wander astray from the Path of Allah is a
			Penalty Grievous for that they forget the Day of Account.
			<sup class='fn'>4177</sup> <sup class='fn'>4178</sup>

Not without purpose did We create heaven and earth and all\n\t\t\tbetween! That were the thought of Unbelievers! But woe to the\n\t\t\tUnbelievers because of the Fire (of Hell)! <sup class='fn'>4179</sup>

Shall We treat those who believe and work deeds of righteousness
			the same as those who do mischief on earth? Shall We treat those
			who guard against evil the same as those who turn aside from the
			right? <sup class='fn'>4180</sup>
(Here is) a Book which We have sent down unto thee full of\n\t\t\tblessings that they may meditate on its Signs and that men of\n\t\t\tunderstanding may receive admonition. <sup class='fn'>4181</sup>
To David We gave Solomon (for a son) how excellent in Our\n\t\t\tservice! Ever did he turn (to Us)! <sup class='fn'>4182</sup>
Behold there were brought before him at eventide coursers of the\n\t\t\thighest breeding; and swift of foot; <sup class='fn'>4183</sup> <sup class='fn'>4184</sup>

And he said "Truly do I love the love of Good with a view to the\n\t\t\tglory of my Lord" until (the sun) was hidden in the veil (of\n\t\t\tNight): <sup class='fn'>4185</sup> <sup class='fn'>4186</sup>
"Bring them back to me." Then began he to pass his hand over\n\t\t\t(their) legs and their necks. <sup class='fn'>4187</sup>
And We did try Solomon: We placed on his throne a body (without\n\t\t\tlife): but he did turn (to Us in true devotion): <sup class='fn'>4188</sup>\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4189</sup>

He said "O my Lord! Forgive me and grant me a Kingdom which (it
			may be) suits not another after me: for Thou art the Grantor of
			Bounties (without measure)." <sup class='fn'>4190</sup> <sup class='fn'>4191</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4192</sup>
Then We subjected the Wind to his power to flow gently to his\n\t\t\torder whithersoever he willed <sup class='fn'>4193</sup>
As also the evil ones (including) every kind of builder and diver\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4194</sup>
As also others bound together in fetters. <sup class='fn'>4195</sup>
"Such are Our Bounties: whether thou bestow them (on others) or\n\t\t\twithhold them no account will be asked." <sup class='fn'>4196</sup>
And he enjoyed indeed a Near Approach to Us and a beautiful Place\n\t\t\tof (final) Return. <sup class='fn'>4197</sup>
Commemorate Our servant Job behold he cried to his Lord: "The\n\t\t\tEvil One has afflicted me with distress and suffering"!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4198</sup> <sup class='fn'>4199</sup>
(The command was given:) "Strike with thy foot: here is (water)\n\t\t\twherein to wash cool and refreshing and (water) to drink."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4200</sup>
And We gave him (back) his people and doubled their number as a\n\t\t\tGrace from Ourselves and a thing for commemoration for all who\n\t\t\thave Understanding. <sup class='fn'>4201</sup>

"And take in thy hand a little grass and strike therewith: and
			break not (thy oath)." Truly We found him full of patience and
			constancy: how excellent in Our service! Ever did he turn (to
			Us)! <sup class='fn'>4202</sup> <sup class='fn'>4203</sup>
And commemorate Our servants Abraham Isaac and Jacob possessors\n\t\t\tof Power and Vision. <sup class='fn'>4204</sup>
Verily We did chose them for a special (purpose) proclaiming the\n\t\t\tMessage of the Hereafter.
They were in Our sight truly of the company of the Elect and the\n\t\t\tGood.
And commemorate Ismail Elisha and Zul-Kifl: each of them was of\n\t\t\tthe company of the Good. <sup class='fn'>4205</sup>
This is a message (of admonition): and verily for the Righteous\n\t\t\tis a beautiful place of (final) Return) <sup class='fn'>4206</sup>
Gardens of Eternity whose doors will (ever) be open to them;\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4207</sup>
Therein will they recline (at ease); therein can they call (at\n\t\t\tpleasure) for fruit in abundance and (delicious) drink;\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4208</sup>
And beside them will be chaste women restraining their glances\n\t\t\t(companions) of equal age. <sup class='fn'>4209</sup> <sup class='fn'>4210</sup>
Such is the promise made to you for the Day of Account!
Truly such will be Our Bounty (to you); it will never fail
Yea such! But for the wrongdoers will be an evil place of (final)\n\t\t\tReturn! <sup class='fn'>4211</sup>
Hell! They will burn therein an evil bed (indeed to lie on)!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4212</sup>
Yea such! Then shall they taste it a boiling fluid and a fluid\n\t\t\tdark murky intensely cold! <sup class='fn'>4213</sup>
And other Penalties of a similar kind to match them!
Here is a troop rushing headlong with you! No welcome for them!\n\t\t\tTruly they shall burn in the Fire! <sup class='fn'>4214</sup>
(The followers shall cry to the misleaders:) "Nay ye (too)! No\n\t\t\twelcome for you! It is ye who have brought this upon us! Now evil\n\t\t\tis (this) place to stay in!" <sup class='fn'>4215</sup>
They will say: "Our Lord! Whoever brought this upon us add to him\n\t\t\ta double Penalty in the fire!" <sup class='fn'>4216</sup>
And they will say: "What has happened to us that we see not men\n\t\t\twhom we used to number among the bad ones? <sup class='fn'>4217</sup>
"Did we treat them (as such) in ridicule or have (our) eyes\n\t\t\tfailed to perceive them?"
Truly that is just and fitting the mutual recriminations of the\n\t\t\tPeople of the Fire! <sup class='fn'>4218</sup>
Say: "Truly am I a Warner: no god is there but the One Allah\n\t\t\tSupreme and Irresistible <sup class='fn'>4219</sup>
"The Lord of the heavens and the earth and all between Exalted in\n\t\t\tMight Able to enforce His will forgiving again and again."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4220</sup> <sup class='fn'>4221</sup>
Say: "That is a message supreme (above all)
"From which ye do turn away! <sup class='fn'>4222</sup>
"No knowledge have I of the Chiefs on high when they discuss\n\t\t\t(matters) among themselves. <sup class='fn'>4223</sup>
"Only this has been revealed to me: that I am to give warning\n\t\t\tplainly and publicly." <sup class='fn'>4224</sup>
Behold thy Lord said to the angels: "I am about to create man\n\t\t\tfrom clay: <sup class='fn'>4225</sup> <sup class='fn'>4226</sup>
"When I have fashioned him (in due proportion) and breathed into\n\t\t\thim of My spirit fall ye down in obeisance unto him."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4227</sup>
So the angels prostrated themselves all of them together;
Not so Iblis: he was haughty and became one of those who reject\n\t\t\tFaith. <sup class='fn'>4228</sup>

(Allah) said: "O Iblis! what prevents thee from prostrating
			thyself to one whom I have created with My hands? Art thou
			haughty? Or art thou one of the high (and mighty) ones?"
			<sup class='fn'>4229</sup> <sup class='fn'>4230</sup>
(Iblis) said: "I am better than he: Thou createdst me from fire\n\t\t\tand him Thou createdst from clay."
(Allah) said: "Then get thee out from here: for thou art rejected\n\t\t\taccursed.
"And My Curse shall be on thee till the Day of Judgement."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4231</sup>
(Iblis) said: "O my Lord! give me then respite till the Day the\n\t\t\t(dead) are raised." <sup class='fn'>4232</sup>
(Allah) said: "Respite then is granted thee
"Till the day of the Time Appointed." <sup class='fn'>4233</sup>
(Iblis) said: "Then by Thy power I will put them all in the wrong\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4234</sup> <sup class='fn'>4235</sup>
"Except Thy Servants amongst them sincere and purified (by Thy\n\t\t\tgrace)."
(Allah) said: "Then it is just and fitting and I say what is just\n\t\t\tand fitting <sup class='fn'>4236</sup>
"That I will certainly fill Hell with thee and those that follow\n\t\t\tthee--every one." <sup class='fn'>4237</sup>
Say: "No reward do I ask of you for this (Qur'an) nor am I a\n\t\t\tpretender. <sup class='fn'>4238</sup> <sup class='fn'>4239</sup>
"This is no less than a Message to (all) the Worlds.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4240</sup>
"And ye shall certainly know the truth of it (all) after a\n\t\t\twhile." <sup class='fn'>4241</sup>
The revelation of this Book is from Allah the Exalted in Power\n\t\t\tFull of Wisdom. <sup class='fn'>4242</sup>
Verily it is We Who have revealed the Book to thee in Truth: so\n\t\t\tserve Allah offering Him sincere devotion.

Is it not to Allah that sincere devotion is due? But those who
			take for protectors other than Allah (say): "We only serve them
			in order that they may bring us nearer to Allah." Truly Allah
			will judge between them in that wherein they differ.  But Allah
