			guides not such as are false and ungrateful. <sup class='fn'>4243</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4244</sup> <sup class='fn'>4245</sup>

Had Allah wished to take to Himself a son He could have chosen
			whom He pleased out of those whom He doth create: but Glory be to
			Him! (He is above such things.) He is Allah the One the
			Irresistible. <sup class='fn'>4246</sup>

He created the heavens and the earth in true (proportions): He
			makes the Night overlap the Day and the Day overlap the Night: He
			has subjected the sun and the moon (to His law) each one follows
			a course for a time appointed.	Is not He the Exalted in Power He
			Who forgives again and again? <sup class='fn'>4247</sup> <sup class='fn'>4248</sup>

He created you (all) from a single person: then created of like
			nature his mate; and He sent down for you eight head of cattle in
			pairs: He makes you in the wombs of your mothers in stages one
			after another in three veils of darkness.  Such is Allah your
			Lord and Cherisher: to Him belongs (all) dominion.  There is no
			god but He: then how are ye turned away (from your true Center)?
			<sup class='fn'>4249</sup> <sup class='fn'>4250</sup> <sup class='fn'>4251</sup> <sup class='fn'>4252</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4253</sup>

It ye reject (Allah) truly Allah has no need of you; but He
			liketh not ingratitude from His servants: if ye are grateful He
			is pleased with you.  No bearer of burdens can bear the burden of
			another.  In the end to your Lord is your return when He will
			tell you the truth of all that ye did (in this life).  For He
			knoweth well all that is in (men's) hearts. <sup class='fn'>4254</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4255</sup>

When some trouble toucheth man he crieth unto his Lord turning to
			Him in repentance: but when He bestoweth a favor upon him as from
			Himself (man) doth forget what he cried and prayed for before and
			he doth set up rivals unto Allah thus misleading others from
			Allah's Path. Say "Enjoy thy blasphemy for a little while: verily
			thou art (one) of the Companions of the Fire!" <sup class='fn'>4256</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4257</sup>

Is one who worships devoutly during the hours of the night
			prostrating himself or standing (in adoration) who takes heed of
			the Hereafter and who places his hope in the Mercy of his Lord
			(like one who does not)? Say: "Are those equal those who know and
			those who do not know? It is those who are endued with
			understanding that receive admonition." <sup class='fn'>4258</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4259</sup>

Say: "O ye my servants who believe! Fear your Lord: good is (the
			reward) for those who do good in this world.  Spacious is Allah's
			earth! Those who patiently persevere will truly receive a reward
			without measure!" <sup class='fn'>4260</sup> <sup class='fn'>4261</sup>
Say: "Verily I am commanded to serve Allah with sincere devotion;
"And I am commanded to be the first of those who bow to Allah in\n\t\t\tIslam." <sup class='fn'>4262</sup>
Say: "I would if I disobeyed my Lord indeed have fear of the\n\t\t\tPenalty of a Mighty Day." <sup class='fn'>4263</sup>
Say: "It is Allah I serve with my sincere (and exclusive)\n\t\t\tdevotion:

"Serve ye what ye will besides Him." Say: "Truly those in loss
			are those who lose their own souls and their People on the Day of
			Judgement: Ah! that is indeed the (real and) evident Loss!"
			<sup class='fn'>4264</sup> <sup class='fn'>4265</sup>

They shall have layers of fire above them and layers (of fire)\n\t\t\tbelow them: with this doth Allah warn off His servants: "O my\n\t\t\tservants! Then fear ye Me!" <sup class='fn'>4266</sup> <sup class='fn'>4267</sup>
Those who eschew evil and fall not into its worship and turn to\n\t\t\tAllah (in repentance) for them is Good News: so announce the Good\n\t\t\tNews to My Servants <sup class='fn'>4268</sup>
Those who listen to the Word and follow the best (meaning) in it:\n\t\t\tthose are the ones whom Allah has guided and those are the ones\n\t\t\tendued with understanding. <sup class='fn'>4269</sup>
Is then one against whom the decree of Punishment is justly due\n\t\t\t(equal to one who eschews evil)? Wouldst thou then deliver one\n\t\t\t(who is) in the fire? <sup class='fn'>4270</sup>

But it is for those who fear their Lord that lofty mansions one
			above another have been built: beneath them flow rivers (of
			delight): (such is) the promise of Allah: never doth Allah fail
			in (His) promise. <sup class='fn'>4271</sup> <sup class='fn'>4272</sup>

Seest thou not that Allah sends down rain from the sky and leads
			it through springs in the earth? Then He causes to grow therewith
			produce of various colors: then it withers; thou wilt see it grow
			yellow; then He makes it dry up and crumble away.  Truly in this
			is a Message of remembrance to men of understanding.
			<sup class='fn'>4273</sup>

Is one whose heart Allah has opened to Islam so that he has
			received enlightenment from Allah (no better than one
			hard-hearted)? Woe to those whose hearts are hardened against
			celebrating the praises of Allah! They are manifestly wandering
			(in error)! <sup class='fn'>4274</sup> <sup class='fn'>4275</sup>

Allah has revealed (from time to time) the most beautiful message
			in the form of a Book consistent with itself (Yet) repeating (its
			teaching in various aspects): the skins of those who fear their
			Lord tremble thereat; then their skins and their hearts do soften
			to the celebration of Allah's  praises.  Such is the guidance of
			Allah: He guides therewith whom He pleases but such as Allah
			leaves to stray can have none to guide. <sup class='fn'>4276</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4277</sup> <sup class='fn'>4278</sup> <sup class='fn'>4279</sup>

Is then one who has to fear the brunt of the Penalty on the Day
			of Judgement (and receive it) on his face (like one guarded
			therefrom)? It will be said to the wrongdoers: "Taste ye (the
			fruits of) what ye earned!" <sup class='fn'>4280</sup> <sup class='fn'>4281</sup>
Those before them (also) rejected (revelation) and so the\n\t\t\tPunishment came to them from directions they did not perceive.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4282</sup>
So Allah gave them a taste of humiliation in the present life but\n\t\t\tgreater is the Punishment of the Hereafter if they only knew!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4283</sup>
We have put forth for men in this Qur'an every kind of Parable in\n\t\t\torder that they may receive admonition. <sup class='fn'>4284</sup>
(It is) a Qur'an in Arabic without any crookedness (therein): in\n\t\t\torder that they may guard against Evil. <sup class='fn'>4285</sup>\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4286</sup>

Allah puts forth a Parable a man belonging to many partners at
			variance with each other and a man belonging entirely to one
			master: are those two equal in comparison? Praise be to Allah!
			But most of them have no knowledge. <sup class='fn'>4287</sup> <sup class='fn'>4288</sup>
Truly thou wilt die (one day) and truly they (too) will die (one\n\t\t\tday). <sup class='fn'>4289</sup>
In the end will ye (all) on the Day of Judgement settle your\n\t\t\tdisputes in the presence of your Lord. <sup class='fn'>4290</sup>

Who then doth more wrong than one who utters a lie concerning\n\t\t\tAllah and rejects the truth when it comes to him? Is there not in\n\t\t\tHell an abode for blasphemers? <sup class='fn'>4291</sup> <sup class='fn'>4292</sup>
And he who brings the Truth and he who confirms (and supports) it\n\t\t\t such are the men who do right. <sup class='fn'>4293</sup>
They shall have all that they wish for in the presence of their\n\t\t\tLord: such is the reward of those who do good: <sup class='fn'>4294</sup>
So that Allah will turn off from them (even) the worst in their\n\t\t\tdeeds and give them their reward according to the best of what\n\t\t\tthey have done. <sup class='fn'>4295</sup>
Is not Allah enough for His servant? But they try to frighten\n\t\t\tthee with other (gods) besides him! For such as Allah leaves to\n\t\t\tstray there can be no guide. <sup class='fn'>4296</sup>

And such as Allah doth guide there can be none to lead astray is\n\t\t\tnot Allah Exalted in Power (able to enforce His Will) Lord of\n\t\t\tRetribution? <sup class='fn'>4297</sup> <sup class='fn'>4298</sup>

If indeed thou ask them who it is that created the heavens and
			the earth they would be sure to say "Allah." Say: "See ye then?
			The things that ye invoke besides Allah can they if Allah wills
			some Penalty for me remove His Penalty? Or if He wills some Grace
			for me can they keep back His Grace?" Say: "Sufficient is Allah
			for me! In Him trust those who put their trust." <sup class='fn'>4299</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4300</sup> <sup class='fn'>4301</sup>
Say: "O my people! Do whatever ye can: I will do (my part): but\n\t\t\tsoon will ye know <sup class='fn'>4302</sup>
"Who it is to whom come a Penalty of ignominy and on whom\n\t\t\tdescends a Penalty that abides." <sup class='fn'>4303</sup>

Verily We have revealed the Book to thee in Truth for
			(instructing) mankind.	He then that receives guidance benefits
			his own soul: but he that strays injures his own soul.	Nor art
			thou set over them to dispose of their affairs. <sup class='fn'>4304</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4305</sup>

It is Allah that takes the souls (of men) at death: and those
			that die not (He takes) during their sleep: those on whom He has
			passed the decree of death He keeps back (from returning to life)
			but the rest He sends (to their bodies) for a term appointed. 
			Verily in this are Signs for those who reflect. <sup class='fn'>4306</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4307</sup> <sup class='fn'>4308</sup> <sup class='fn'>4309</sup>
What! Do they take for intercessors others besides Allah? Say:\n\t\t\t"Even if they have no power whatever and no intelligence?"\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4310</sup>

Say: "To Allah belongs exclusively (the right to grant)
			Intercession: to Him belongs the dominion of the heavens and the
			earth: in the End it is to Him that ye shall be brought back."
			<sup class='fn'>4311</sup> <sup class='fn'>4312</sup>

When Allah the One and Only is mentioned the hearts of those who
			believe not in the Hereafter are filled with disgust and horror;
			but when (gods) other than He are mentioned behold they are
			filled with joy! <sup class='fn'>4313</sup>

Say: "O Allah! Creator of the heavens and the earth! Knower of
			all that is hidden and open! It is Thou that wilt judge between
			Thy Servants in those matters about which they have differed."
			<sup class='fn'>4314</sup>

Even if the wrongdoers had all that there is on earth and as much
			more (in vain) would they offer it for ransom from the pain of
			the Penalty on the Day of Judgement: but something will confront
			them from Allah which they could never have counted upon!
			<sup class='fn'>4315</sup> <sup class='fn'>4316</sup>
For the evils of their Deeds will confront them and they will be\n\t\t\t(completely) encircled by that which they used to mock at!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4317</sup>

Now when trouble touches man he cries to Us; but when We bestow a
			favor upon him as from Ourselves he says "This has been given to
			me because of a certain knowledge (I have)!" Nay but this is but
			a trial but most of them understand not! <sup class='fn'>4318</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4319</sup> <sup class='fn'>4320</sup>
Thus did the (generations) before them say! But all that they did\n\t\t\twas of no profit to them.

Nay the evil results of their deeds overtook them.  And the
			wrongdoers of this (generation) the evil results of their deeds
			will soon overtake them (too) and they will never be able to
			frustrate (Our Plan)! <sup class='fn'>4321</sup> <sup class='fn'>4322</sup>
Know they not that Allah enlarges the provision or restricts it\n\t\t\tfor any He pleases? Verily in this are signs for those who\n\t\t\tbelieve! <sup class='fn'>4323</sup>

Say: "O my Servants who have transgressed against their souls!\n\t\t\tDespair not of the Mercy of Allah: for Allah forgives all sins:\n\t\t\tfor He is Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful. <sup class='fn'>4324</sup>
"Turn ye to your Lord (in repentance) and bow to His (Will)\n\t\t\tbefore the Penalty comes on you: after that ye shall not be\n\t\t\thelped. <sup class='fn'>4325</sup>
"And follow the Best of (the courses) revealed to you from your\n\t\t\tLord before the Penalty comes on you of a sudden while ye\n\t\t\tperceive not!-- <sup class='fn'>4326</sup>
"Lest the soul should (then) say: Ah! woe is me! In that I\n\t\t\tneglected (my duty) towards Allah and was but among those who\n\t\t\tmocked!' <sup class='fn'>4327</sup>
"Or (lest) it should say: `If only Allah had guided me I should\n\t\t\tcertainly have been among the righteous!' <sup class='fn'>4328</sup>
"Or (lest) it should say when it (actually) sees the Penalty: `If\n\t\t\tonly I had another chance I should certainly be among those who\n\t\t\tdo good!' <sup class='fn'>4329</sup>

"(The reply will be) `Nay but there came to thee My signs and\n\t\t\tthou didst reject them: thou wast haughty and became one of those\n\t\t\twho reject Faith!' " <sup class='fn'>4330</sup> <sup class='fn'>4331</sup>

On the Day of Judgement wilt thou see those who told lies against\n\t\t\tAllah; their faces will be turned black; is there not in Hell an\n\t\t\tabode for the Haughty? <sup class='fn'>4332</sup> <sup class='fn'>4333</sup>
But Allah will deliver the righteous to their place of salvation:\n\t\t\tno evil shall touch them nor shall they grieve. <sup class='fn'>4334</sup>
Allah is the Creator of all things and He is the Guardian and\n\t\t\tDisposer of all affairs. <sup class='fn'>4335</sup>
To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth: and those\n\t\t\twho reject the Signs of Allah it is they who will be in loss.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4336</sup>
Say: "Is it someone other than Allah that ye order me to worship\n\t\t\tO ye ignorant ones?" <sup class='fn'>4337</sup>

But it has already been revealed to thee as it was to those
			before thee "If thou wert to join (gods with Allah) truly
			fruitless will be thy work (in life) and thou wilt surely be in
			the ranks of those who lose (all spiritual good)." <sup class='fn'>4338</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4339</sup>
Nay but worship Allah and be of those who give thanks.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4340</sup>

No just estimate have they made of Allah such as is due to Him:
			on the Day of Judgement the whole of the earth will be but His
			handful and the heavens will be rolled up in His right hand:
			Glory to Him! High is He above the Partners they attribute to
			Him! <sup class='fn'>4341</sup> <sup class='fn'>4342</sup>

The Trumpet will (just) be sounded when all that are in the
			heavens and on earth will swoon except such as it will please
			Allah (to exempt).  Then will a second one be sounded when behold
			they will be standing and looking on! <sup class='fn'>4343</sup>

And the Earth will shine with the glory of its Lord: the Record
			(of Deeds) will be placed (open); the prophets and the witnesses
			will be brought forward: and a just decision pronounced between
			them; and they will not be wronged (in the least). <sup class='fn'>4344</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4345</sup>
And to every soul will be paid in full (the fruit) of its deeds;\n\t\t\tand (Allah) knoweth best all that they do. <sup class='fn'>4346</sup>

The Unbelievers will be led to Hell in crowds; until when they
			arrive there its gates will be opened and its Keepers will say
			"Did not apostles come to you from among yourselves rehearsing to
			you the Signs of your Lord and warning you of the meeting of this
			Day of yours?" The answer will be: "True: but the Decree of
			Punishment has been proved true against the Unbelievers!"
			<sup class='fn'>4347</sup> <sup class='fn'>4348</sup> <sup class='fn'>4349</sup>
(To them) will be said: "Enter ye the gates of Hell to dwell\n\t\t\ttherein: and evil is (this) abode of the arrogant!" <sup class='fn'>4350</sup>

And those who feared their Lord will be led to the Garden in
			crowds: until behold they arrive there; its gates will be opened:
			and its Keepers will say: "Peace be upon you! Well have ye done!
			Enter ye here to dwell therein." <sup class='fn'>4351</sup> <sup class='fn'>4352</sup>

They will say: "Praise be to Allah Who has truly fulfilled His
			promise to us and has given us (this) land in heritage: we can
			dwell in the Garden as we will: how excellent a reward for those
			who work (righteousness)!" <sup class='fn'>4353</sup> <sup class='fn'>4354</sup>

And thou wilt see the angels surrounding the Throne (Divine) on
			all sides singing Glory and Praise to their Lord.  The Decision
			between them (at Judgment) will be in (perfect) justice.  And the
			cry (on all sides) will be "Praise be to Allah the Lord of the
			Worlds!" <sup class='fn'>4355</sup>
Ha Mim. <sup class='fn'>4356</sup>
The revelation of this Book is from Allah Exalted in Power Full\n\t\t\tof Knowledge <sup class='fn'>4357</sup>
Who forgiveth Sin accepteth Repentance is strict in Punishment\n\t\t\tand hath a Long Reach (in all things).\tThere is no god but He:\n\t\t\tto Him is the Final Goal. <sup class='fn'>4358</sup>
None can dispute about the Signs of Allah but the Unbelievers. \n\t\t\tLet not then their strutting about through the land deceive thee!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4359</sup> <sup class='fn'>4360</sup>

But (there were people) before them who denied (the Signs) the
			People of Noah and the confederates (of Evil) after them; and
			every People plotted against their prophet to seize him and
			disputed by means of vanities therewith to condemn the truth; but
			it was I that seized them! And how (terrible) was My Requital!
			<sup class='fn'>4361</sup> <sup class='fn'>4362</sup> <sup class='fn'>4363</sup>
Thus was the Decree of thy Lord proved true against the\n\t\t\tUnbelievers; that truly they are Companions of Fire!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4364</sup>

Those who sustain the Throne (of Allah) and those around it sing
			Glory and Praise to their Lord; believe in Him; and implore
			forgiveness for those who believe: "Our Lord! Thy reach is over
			all things in Mercy and Knowledge.  Forgive then those who turn
			in repentance and follow Thy Path: and preserve them from the
			Penalty of the Blazing Fire! <sup class='fn'>4365</sup> <sup class='fn'>4366</sup>

"And grant our Lord! That they enter the Gardens of Eternity
			which Thou hast promised to them and to the righteous among their
			fathers their wives and their posterity! For Thou art (He) the
			Exalted in Might Full of Wisdom. <sup class='fn'>4367</sup>

"And preserve them from (all) ills; and any whom thou dost
			preserve from ills that Day on them wilt Thou have bestowed Mercy
			indeed: and that will be truly (for them) the highest
			Achievement. <sup class='fn'>4368</sup> <sup class='fn'>4369</sup>

The Unbelievers will be addressed: "Greater was the aversion of\n\t\t\tAllah to you than (is) your aversion to yourselves seeing that ye\n\t\t\twere called to the Faith and ye used to refuse." <sup class='fn'>4370</sup>

They will say:" Our Lord! twice hast Thou made us without life\n\t\t\tand twice hast Thou given us Life! Now have we recognized our\n\t\t\tsins: is there any way out (of this)?" <sup class='fn'>4371</sup>

(The answer will be:) "This is because when Allah was invoked as
			the only (object of worship) ye did reject Faith but when
			partners were joined to Him ye believed! The command is with
			Allah Most High Most Great!" <sup class='fn'>4372</sup> <sup class='fn'>4373</sup>
He it is Who showeth you His Signs and sendeth down sustenance\n\t\t\tfor you from the sky: but only those receive admonition who turn\n\t\t\t(to Allah). <sup class='fn'>4374</sup>
Call ye then upon Allah with sincere devotion to Him even though\n\t\t\tthe Unbelievers may detest it. <sup class='fn'>4375</sup>

Raised high above ranks (or degrees) (He is) the Lord of the
			Throne (of authority): by his command doth He send the spirit (of
			inspiration) to any of His servants He pleases that it may warn
			(men) of the Day of Mutual Meeting <sup class='fn'>4376</sup> <sup class='fn'>4377</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4378</sup>

The Day whereon they will (all) come forth: Not a single thing\n\t\t\tconcerning them is hidden from Allah.  Whose will be the dominion\n\t\t\tthat Day? That of Allah the One the Irresistible! <sup class='fn'>4379</sup>
That Day will every soul be requited for what it earned; no\n\t\t\tinjustice will there be that Day for Allah is Swift in taking\n\t\t\taccount. <sup class='fn'>4380</sup>

Warn them of the Day that is (ever) drawing near when the Hearts
			will (come) right up to the Throats to choke (them); no intimate
			friend nor intercessor will the wrongdoers have who could be
			listened to. <sup class='fn'>4381</sup> <sup class='fn'>4382</sup>
(Allah) knows of (the tricks) that deceive with the eyes and all\n\t\t\tthat hearts (of men) conceal. <sup class='fn'>4383</sup> <sup class='fn'>4384</sup>

And Allah will judge with (Justice and) Truth: but those whom
			(men) invoke besides Him will not (be in a position) to judge at
			all. Verily it is Allah (alone) Who hears and sees (all things).
			<sup class='fn'>4385</sup>

Do they not travel through the earth and see what was the End of
			those before them? They were even superior to them in strength
			and in the traces (they have left) in the land: but Allah did
			call them to account for their sins and none had they to defend
			them against Allah. <sup class='fn'>4386</sup> <sup class='fn'>4387</sup>

That was because there came to them their apostles with Clear\n\t\t\t(Signs) but they rejected them: So Allah called them to account:\n\t\t\tfor He is full of Strength Strict in Punishment. <sup class='fn'>4388</sup>
Of old We sent Moses with Our Signs and Authority manifest\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4389</sup>
To Pharaoh Haman and Qarun; but they called (him) "a sorcerer\n\t\t\ttelling lies!"... <sup class='fn'>4390</sup>

Now when he came to them in Truth from Us they said "Slay the
			sons of those who believe with him and keep alive their females"
			but the plots of Unbelievers (end) in nothing but errors (and
			delusions)!"... <sup class='fn'>4391</sup> <sup class='fn'>4392</sup>

Said Pharaoh: "Leave me to slay Moses; and let him Call on his
			Lord! What I fear is lest he should change your religion or lest
			he should cause mischief to appear in the land!" <sup class='fn'>4393</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4394</sup>
Moses said: "I have indeed called upon my Lord and your Lord (for\n\t\t\tprotection) from every arrogant one who believes not in the Day\n\t\t\tof Account!" <sup class='fn'>4395</sup>

A believer a man from among the people of Pharaoh who had
			concealed his faith said: "Will ye slay a man because he says `My
			Lord is Allah'? When he has indeed come to you with Clear (Signs)
			from your Lord? And if he be a liar on him is (the sin of) his
			lie: but if he is telling the Truth then will fall on you
			something of the (calamity) of which he warns you: truly Allah
			guides not one who transgresses and lies! <sup class='fn'>4396</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4397</sup> <sup class='fn'>4398</sup>

"O my people! yours is the dominion this day: ye have the upper
			hand in the land: but who will help us from the Punishment of
			Allah should it befall us?" Pharaoh said: "I but point out to you
			that which I see (myself); nor do I guide you but to the Path of
			Right!" <sup class='fn'>4399</sup> <sup class='fn'>4400</sup>

Then said the man who believed: "O my People! truly I do fear for\n\t\t\tyou something like the Day (of disaster) of the Confederates (in\n\t\t\tsin)! <sup class='fn'>4401</sup> <sup class='fn'>4402</sup>
"Something like the fate of the people of Noah the `Ad and the\n\t\t\tThamud and those who came after them: but Allah never wishes\n\t\t\tinjustice to His Servants. <sup class='fn'>4403</sup>
"And O my People! I fear for you a Day when there will be mutual\n\t\t\tcalling (and wailing) <sup class='fn'>4404</sup>
A day when ye shall turn your backs and flee: no defender shall\n\t\t\tye have from Allah: any whom Allah leaves to stray there is none\n\t\t\tto guide...

"And to you there came Joseph in times gone by with Clear Signs
			but ye ceased not to doubt of the (mission) for which he had
			come: at length when he died ye said: `No apostle will Allah send
			after him.' Thus doth Allah leave to stray such as transgress and
			live in doubt <sup class='fn'>4405</sup> <sup class='fn'>4406</sup>

"(Such) as dispute about the Signs of Allah without any authority
			that hath reached them.  Grievous and odious (is such conduct) in
			the sight of Allah and of the Believers.  Thus doth Allah seal up
			every heart of arrogant and obstinate transgressors."
			<sup class='fn'>4407</sup>
Pharaoh said: "O Haman! Build me a lofty palace that I may attain\n\t\t\tthe ways and means <sup class='fn'>4408</sup>

"The ways and means of (reaching) the heavens and that I may
			mount up to the Allah of Moses; but as far as I am concerned I
			think (Moses) is a liar!" Thus was made alluring in Pharaoh's
			eyes the evil of his deeds and he was hindered from the Path; and
			the plot of Pharaoh led to nothing but perdition (for him).
			<sup class='fn'>4409</sup> <sup class='fn'>4410</sup>
The man who believed said further: "O my People! follow me: I\n\t\t\twill lead you to the Path of Right. <sup class='fn'>4411</sup>
"O my people! This life of the present is nothing but (temporary)\n\t\t\tconvenience: it is the Hereafter that is the Home that will last.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4412</sup>

"He that works evil will not be requited but by the like thereof:
			and he that works a righteous deed whether man or woman and is a
			believer such will enter the Garden (of Bliss): therein will they
			have abundance without measure. <sup class='fn'>4413</sup>
"And O my People! how (strange) it is for me to call you to\n\t\t\tSalvation while ye call me to the Fire! <sup class='fn'>4414</sup>

"Ye do call upon me to blaspheme against Allah and to join with\n\t\t\tHim Partners of whom I have no knowledge; and I call you to the\n\t\t\tExalted in Power Who forgives again and again!" <sup class='fn'>4415</sup>

"Without doubt ye do call me to one who is not fit to be called
			to whether in this world or in the Hereafter; our Return will be
			to Allah; and the Transgressors will be Companions of the Fire!
			<sup class='fn'>4416</sup>
"Soon will ye remember what I say to you (now) my (own) affair I\n\t\t\tcommit to Allah: for Allah (ever) watches over His Servants."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4417</sup>
Then Allah saved him from (every) ill that they plotted (against\n\t\t\thim) but the brunt of the Penalty encompassed on all sides the\n\t\t\tPeople of Pharaoh. <sup class='fn'>4418</sup>

In front of the Fire will they be brought morning and evening:
			and (the Sentence will be) on the Day that Judgment will be
			established: "Cast ye the People of Pharaoh into the severest
			Penalty!" <sup class='fn'>4419</sup>

Behold they will dispute with each other in the Fire! The weak
			ones (who followed) will say to those who had been arrogant "We
			but followed you: can ye then take (on yourselves) from us some
			share of the Fire?" <sup class='fn'>4420</sup>
Those who had been arrogant will say: "We are all in this (Fire)!\n\t\t\tTruly Allah has judged between (His) Servants!" <sup class='fn'>4421</sup>
Those in the Fire will say to the Keepers of Hell: "Pray to your\n\t\t\tLord to lighten us the Penalty for a Day (at least)!"\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4422</sup>

They will say: "Did there not come to you your apostles with
			Clear Signs?" They will say "Yes."  They will reply "Then pray
			(as ye like) but the Prayer of those without Faith is nothing but
			(futile wandering) in (mazes of) error!" <sup class='fn'>4423</sup>
We will without doubt help Our apostles and those who believe\n\t\t\t(both) in this world's life and on the Day when the Witnesses\n\t\t\twill stand forth <sup class='fn'>4424</sup>
The Day when no profit will it be to Wrongdoers to present their\n\t\t\texcuses but they will (only) have the Curse and the Home of\n\t\t\tMisery. <sup class='fn'>4425</sup>
We did aforetime give Moses the (Book of) Guidance and We gave\n\t\t\tthe Book in inheritance to the Children of Israel <sup class='fn'>4426</sup>
A Guide and a Message to men of understanding.

Patiently then persevere: for the Promise of Allah is true: and
			ask forgiveness for thy fault and celebrate the Praises of thy
			Lord in the evening and in the morning. <sup class='fn'>4427</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4428</sup> <sup class='fn'>4429</sup>

Those who dispute about the Signs of Allah without any authority
			bestowed on them there is nothing in their breasts but (the quest
			of) greatness which they shall never attain to: seek refuge then
			in Allah: it is He Who hears and sees (all things). <sup class='fn'>4430</sup>
Assuredly the creation of the heavens and the earth is a greater\n\t\t\t(matter) than the creation of men: Yet most men understand not.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4431</sup>

Not equal are the blind and those who (clearly) see: nor are
			(equal) those who believe and work deeds of righteousness and
			those who do evil.  Little do ye learn by admonition!
			<sup class='fn'>4432</sup>
The Hour will certainly come: therein is no doubt: yet most men\n\t\t\tbelieve not. <sup class='fn'>4433</sup>
And your Lord says: "Call on Me; I will answer your (Prayer): But\n\t\t\tthose who are too arrogant to serve Me will surely find\n\t\t\tthemselves in Hell in humiliation!" <sup class='fn'>4434</sup>

It is Allah Who has made the Night for you that ye may rest
			therein and the Day as that which helps (you) to see.  Verily
			Allah is Full of Grace and Bounty to men: yet most men give no
			thanks. <sup class='fn'>4435</sup>
Such is Allah your Lord the Creator of all things there is no god\n\t\t\tbut He: then how ye are deluded away from the Truth!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4436</sup>
Thus are deluded those who are wont to reject the Signs of Allah.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4437</sup>

It is Allah Who has made for you the earth as a resting place and
			the sky as a canopy and has given you shapes and made your shapes
			beautiful and has provided for you Sustenance of things pure and
			good such is Allah your Lord. So Glory to Allah the Lord of the
			Worlds! <sup class='fn'>4438</sup> <sup class='fn'>4439</sup> <sup class='fn'>4440</sup> <sup class='fn'>4441</sup>
He is the living (One): There is no god but He: Call upon Him\n\t\t\tgiving Him sincere devotion.  Praise be to Allah Lord of the\n\t\t\tWorlds! <sup class='fn'>4442</sup>

Say: "I have been forbidden to invoke those whom ye invoke
			besides Allah seeing that the Clear Signs have come to me from my
			Lord: and I have been commanded to bow (in Islam) to the Lord of
			the Worlds." <sup class='fn'>4443</sup>

It is He Who has created you from dust then from a sperm-drop
			then from a leech-like clot; then does He get you out (into the
			light) as a child: then lets you (grow and) reach your age of
			full strength; then lets you become old though of you there are
			some who die before; and lets you reach a Term appointed: in
			order that ye may learn wisdom. <sup class='fn'>4444</sup>
It is He Who gives Life and Death; and when He decides upon an\n\t\t\taffair He says to it "Be" and it is. <sup class='fn'>4445</sup>
Seest thou not those that dispute concerning the signs of Allah?\n\t\t\tHow are they turned away (from Reality)? <sup class='fn'>4446</sup>
Those who reject the Book and the (revelations) with which We\n\t\t\tsent Our apostles: But soon shall they know <sup class='fn'>4447</sup>
When the yokes (shall be) round their necks and the chains; they\n\t\t\tshall be dragged along <sup class='fn'>4448</sup>
In the boiling fetid fluid then in the Fire shall they be burned;\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4449</sup>
Then shall it be said to them: "Where are the (deities) to which\n\t\t\tye gave part-worship

"In derogation of Allah?" They will reply: "They have left us in
			the lurch: nay we invoked not of old anything (that had real
			existence)." Thus does Allah leave the Unbelievers to stray.
			<sup class='fn'>4450</sup>
"That was because ye were wont to rejoice on the earth in things\n\t\t\tother than the Truth and that ye were wont to be insolent.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4451</sup>
"Enter ye the gates of Hell to dwell therein: and evil is (this)\n\t\t\tabode of the arrogant!" <sup class='fn'>4452</sup>

So persevere in patience! For the Promise of Allah is true: and
			whether We show thee (in this life) some part of what We promise
			them or We take thy soul (to Our Mercy) (Before that) (in any
			case) it is to Us that they shall (all) return. <sup class='fn'>4453</sup>

We did aforetime send apostles before thee: of them there are
			some whose story We have related to thee and some whose story We
			have not related to thee.  It was not (possible) for any apostle
			to bring a Sign except by the leave of Allah: but when the
			Command of Allah issued the matter was decided in truth and
			justice and there perished there and then those who stood on
			Falsehoods. <sup class='fn'>4454</sup> <sup class='fn'>4455</sup>
It is Allah Who made cattle for you that ye may use some for\n\t\t\triding and some for food; <sup class='fn'>4456</sup>
And there are (other) advantages in them for you (besides); that\n\t\t\tye may through them attain to any need (there may be) in your\n\t\t\thearts; and on them and on ships ye are carried.
And He shows you always His Signs; then which of the Signs of\n\t\t\tAllah will ye deny? <sup class='fn'>4457</sup>

Do they not travel through the earth and see what was the end of
			those before them? They were more numerous than these and
			superior in strength and in the traces (they have left) in the
			land: yet all that they accomplished was of no profit to them.
			<sup class='fn'>4458</sup>

For when their apostles came to them with Clear Signs they
			exulted in such knowledge (and skill) as they had; but that very
			(Wrath) at which they were wont to scoff hemmed them in.
			<sup class='fn'>4459</sup> <sup class='fn'>4460</sup>
But when they saw Our punishment they said: "We believe in Allah\n\t\t\tthe One Allah and we reject the partners we used to join with\n\t\t\tHim."

But their professing the Faith when they (actually) saw Our
			Punishment was not going to profit them.  (Such has been) Allah's
			way of dealing with His servants (from the most ancient times). 
			And even thus did the rejecters of Allah perish (utterly)!
			<sup class='fn'>4461</sup>
Ha Mim. <sup class='fn'>4462</sup>
A revelation from (Allah) Most Gracious Most Merciful\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4463</sup>
A Book whereof the verses are explained in detail a Qur'an in\n\t\t\tArabic for people who understand
Giving Good News and Admonition: yet most of them turn away and\n\t\t\tso they hear not. <sup class='fn'>4464</sup>

They say: "Our hearts are under veils (concealed) from that to
			which thou dost invite us and in [our ears is] a deafness and
			between us and thee is a screen: so do thou (what thou wilt); for
			us we shall do (what we will!)." <sup class='fn'>4465</sup> <sup class='fn'>4466</sup>

Say thou: "I am but a man like you: it is revealed to me by
			inspiration that your Allah is One Allah: so stand true to Him
			and ask for His forgiveness." And woe to those who join gods with
			Allah <sup class='fn'>4467</sup> <sup class='fn'>4468</sup>
Those who practice not Regular Charity and who even deny the\n\t\t\tHereafter.
For those who believe and work deeds of righteousness is a reward\n\t\t\tthat will never fail. <sup class='fn'>4469</sup>
Say: Is it that ye Deny Him Who created the earth in two Days?\n\t\t\tAnd do ye join equals with Him? He is the Lord of (all) the\n\t\t\tWorlds. <sup class='fn'>4470</sup>

He set on the (earth) Mountains standing firm high above it and
			bestowed blessings on the earth and measured therein all things
			to give them nourishment in due proportion in four Days in
			accordance with (the needs of) those who seek (sustenance).
			<sup class='fn'>4471</sup> <sup class='fn'>4472</sup> <sup class='fn'>4473</sup>

Moreover He Comprehended in His design the sky and it had been
			(as) smoke: He said to it and to the earth: "Come ye together
			willingly or unwillingly." They said: "We do come (together) in
			willing obedience." <sup class='fn'>4474</sup> <sup class='fn'>4475</sup> <sup class='fn'>4476</sup>

So He completed them as seven firmaments in two Days and He
			assigned to each heaven its duty and command.  And We adorned the
			lower heaven with lights and (provided it) with guard.	Such is
			the Decree of (Him) the Exalted in Might Full of knowledge.
			<sup class='fn'>4477</sup> <sup class='fn'>4478</sup>
But if they turn away say thou: "I have warned you of a stunning\n\t\t\tPunishment (as of thunder and lightning) like that which\n\t\t\t(overtook) the `Ad and the Thamud!" <sup class='fn'>4479</sup>

Behold the apostles came to them from before them and behind them
			(preaching): "Serve none but Allah." They said "If our Lord had
			so pleased He would certainly have sent down angels (to preach):
			now we reject your mission (altogether)." <sup class='fn'>4480</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4481</sup>

Now the `Ad behaved arrogantly through the land against (all)
			truth and reason and said: "Who is superior to us in strength?"
			What! did they not see that Allah Who created them was superior
			to them in strength? But they continued to reject Our Signs!
			<sup class='fn'>4482</sup>

So We sent against them a furious Wind through days of disaster
			that We might give them a taste of a Penalty of humiliation in
			this Life; but the Penalty of the Hereafter will be more
			humiliating still: and they will find no help. <sup class='fn'>4483</sup>

As to the Thamud We gave them guidance but they preferred
			blindness (of heart) to Guidance; so the stunning Punishment of
			humiliation seized them because of what they had earned.
			<sup class='fn'>4484</sup> <sup class='fn'>4485</sup>
But We delivered those who believed and practiced righteousness.
On the Day that the enemies of Allah will be gathered together to\n\t\t\tthe Fire they will be marched in ranks. <sup class='fn'>4486</sup>
At length when they reach the (Fire) their hearing their sight\n\t\t\tand their skins will bear witness against them as to (all) their\n\t\t\tdeeds. <sup class='fn'>4487</sup>

They will say to their skins: "Why bear ye witness against us?"
			They will say: "Allah hath given us speech (He) Who giveth speech
			to everything: He created you for the first time and unto Him
			were ye to return. <sup class='fn'>4488</sup>

"Ye did not seek to hide yourselves lest your hearing your sight
			and your skins should bear witness against you! But ye did think
			that Allah knew not many of the things that ye used to do!
			<sup class='fn'>4489</sup>
"But this thought of yours which ye did entertain concerning your\n\t\t\tLord hath brought you to destruction and (now) have ye become of\n\t\t\tthose utterly lost!" <sup class='fn'>4490</sup>
If then they have patience the Fire will be a Home for them! And\n\t\t\tif they beg to be received into favor into favor will they not\n\t\t\t(then) be received. <sup class='fn'>4491</sup>

And We have destined for them intimate companions (of like
			nature) Who made alluring to them what was before them and behind
			them; and the sentence among the previous generations of Jinns
			and men who have passed away is proved against them; for they are
			utterly lost. <sup class='fn'>4492</sup> <sup class='fn'>4493</sup> <sup class='fn'>4494</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4495</sup>
The Unbelievers say: "Listen not to this Qur'an but talk at\n\t\t\trandom in the midst of its (reading) that ye may gain the upper\n\t\t\thand!" <sup class='fn'>4496</sup>
But We will certainly give the Unbelievers a taste of a severe\n\t\t\tPenalty and We will requite them for the worst of their deeds.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4497</sup>
Such is the requital of the enemies of Allah the Fire: therein\n\t\t\twill be for them the Eternal Home: a (fit) requital for that they\n\t\t\twere wont to reject Our Signs.

And the Unbelievers will say: "Our Lord! show us those among\n\t\t\tJinns and men who misled us: we shall crush them beneath our feet\n\t\t\tso that they become the vilest (before all)." <sup class='fn'>4498</sup>

In the case of those who say "Our Lord is Allah" and further
			stand straight and steadfast the angels descend on them (from
			time to time): "Fear ye not!" (they suggest) "nor grieve! but
			receive the Glad Tidings of the Garden (of Bliss) the which ye
			were promised! <sup class='fn'>4499</sup>

"We are your protectors in this life and in the Hereafter:\n\t\t\ttherein shall ye have all that your souls shall desire; therein\n\t\t\tshall ye have all that ye ask for! <sup class='fn'>4500</sup> <sup class='fn'>4501</sup>
"A hospitable gift from One Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful!"\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4502</sup>
Who is better in speech than one who calls (men) to Allah works\n\t\t\trighteousness and says "I am of those who bow in Islam"?\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4503</sup>

Nor can Goodness and Evil be equal.  Repel (Evil) with what is\n\t\t\tbetter: then will he between whom and thee was hatred become as\n\t\t\tit were thy friend and intimate! <sup class='fn'>4504</sup> <sup class='fn'>4505</sup>
And no one will be granted such goodness except those who\n\t\t\texercise patience and self-restraint none but persons of the\n\t\t\tgreatest good fortune. <sup class='fn'>4506</sup>
And if (at any time) an incitement to discord is made to thee by\n\t\t\tthe Evil One seek refuge in Allah.  He is the One Who hears and\n\t\t\tknows all things. <sup class='fn'>4507</sup>
Among His Signs are the Night and the Day and the sun and moon.\n\t\t\tAdore not the Sun and the Moon but adore Allah Who created them\n\t\t\tif it is Him ye wish to serve. <sup class='fn'>4508</sup>

But if they (Unbelievers) are arrogant (no matter): for in the
			presence of thy Lord are those who celebrate His praises by night
			and by day.  And they never flag (nor feel themselves above it).
			<sup class='fn'>4509</sup>

And among His Signs is this: thou seest the earth barren and
			desolate; but when We send down rain to it it is stirred to life
			and yields increase.  Truly He Who gives life to the (dead) earth
			can surely give life to (men) who are dead.  For He has power
			over all things. <sup class='fn'>4510</sup> <sup class='fn'>4511</sup>

Those who pervert the Truth in Our Signs are not hidden from Us.
			Which is better? He that is cast into the Fire or he that comes
			safe through on the Day of Judgement? Do what ye will: Verily He
			seeth (clearly) all that ye do. <sup class='fn'>4512</sup>
Those who reject the Message when it comes to them (are not\n\t\t\thidden from Us); and indeed it is a Book of exalted power.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4513</sup>
No falsehood can approach it from before or behind it: it is sent\n\t\t\tdown by One Full of Wisdom Worthy of all Praise. <sup class='fn'>4514</sup>
Nothing is said to thee that was not said to the apostles before\n\t\t\tthee: That thy Lord has at His command (all) Forgiveness as well\n\t\t\tas a most Grievous Penalty. <sup class='fn'>4515</sup>

Had We sent this as a Qur'an (in a language) other than Arabic
			they would have said: "Why are not its verses explained in
			detail? What! (a Book) not in Arabic and (a Messenger) an Arab?"
			Say: "It is a guide and a healing to those who believe; and for
			those who believe not there is a deafness in their ears and it is
			blindness in their (eyes); they are (as it were) being called
			from a place far distant!" <sup class='fn'>4516</sup> <sup class='fn'>4517</sup>

We certainly gave Moses the Book aforetime: but dispute arose
			therein. Had it not been for a word that went forth before from
			thy Lord (their differences) would have been settled between
			them: but they remained in suspicious disquieting doubt thereon.
			<sup class='fn'>4518</sup>
Whoever works righteousness benefits his own soul; whoever works\n\t\t\tevil it is against his own soul: nor is thy Lord ever unjust (in\n\t\t\tthe least) to His servants.

To Him is referred the Knowledge of the Hour (of Judgment: He
			knows all): no date-fruit comes out of its sheath nor does a
			female conceive (within her womb) nor bring forth (young) but by
			His Knowledge.	The Day that (Allah) will propound to them the
			(question) "Where are the partners (ye attributed) to Me?" They
			will say "We do assure thee not one of us can bear witness!"
			<sup class='fn'>4519</sup> <sup class='fn'>4520</sup>
The (deities) they used to invoke aforetime will leave them in\n\t\t\tthe lurch and they will perceive that they have no way of escape.
Man does not weary of asking for good (things) but if ill touches\n\t\t\thim he gives up all hope (and) is lost in despair. <sup class='fn'>4521</sup>

When We give him a taste of some mercy from Ourselves after some
			adversity has touched him he is sure to say "This is due to my
			(merit): I think not that the Hour (of Judgment) will (ever) be
			established; but if I am brought back to my Lord I have (much)
			good (stored) in His sight!" But We will show the Unbelievers the
			truth of all that they did and We shall give them the taste of a
			severe Penalty. <sup class='fn'>4522</sup>

When We bestow favors on man he turns away and gets himself
			remote on his side (instead of coming to Us); and when Evil
			seizes him (he comes) full of prolonged prayer! <sup class='fn'>4523</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4524</sup>
Say: "See ye if the (Revelation) is (really) from Allah and yet\n\t\t\tdo ye reject it? Who is more astray than one who is in schism far\n\t\t\t(from any purpose)?"

Soon will We show them Our Signs in the (furthest) regions (of
			the earth) and in their own souls until it becomes manifest to
			them that this is the Truth.  Is it not enough that thy Lord doth
			witness all things?
Ah indeed! are they in doubt concerning the Meeting with their\n\t\t\tLord? Ah indeed! it is He that doth encompass all things!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4525</sup>
Ha Mim; <sup class='fn'>4526</sup>
`Ain  Sin  Qaf. <sup class='fn'>4527</sup>
Thus doth (He) send Inspiration to thee as (He did) to those\n\t\t\tbefore thee Allah Exalted in Power full of Wisdom. <sup class='fn'>4528</sup>
To Him belongs all that is in the heavens and on earth: and He is\n\t\t\tMost High Most Great. <sup class='fn'>4529</sup>

The heavens are almost rent asunder from above them (by His
			Glory): and the angels celebrate the Praises of their Lord and
			pray for forgiveness for (all) beings on earth: Behold! Verily
			Allah is He the Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful. <sup class='fn'>4530</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4531</sup>
And those who take as protectors others besides Him Allah doth\n\t\t\twatch over them; and thou art not the disposer of their affairs.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4532</sup>

Thus have We sent by inspiration to thee an Arabic Qur'an: that
			thou mayest warn the Mother of Cities and all around her and warn
			(them) of the Day of Assembly of which there is no doubt: (when)
			some will be in the Garden and some in the Blazing Fire.
			<sup class='fn'>4533</sup> <sup class='fn'>4534</sup> <sup class='fn'>4535</sup>
If Allah had so willed He could have made them a single people;\n\t\t\tbut He admits whom He will to His Mercy; and the wrongdoers will\n\t\t\thave no protector nor helper. <sup class='fn'>4536</sup>

What! Have they taken (for worship) protectors besides Him? But\n\t\t\tit is Allah He is the Protector and it is He Who gives life to\n\t\t\tthe dead: it is He Who has power over all things. <sup class='fn'>4537</sup>
Whatever it be wherein ye differ the decision thereof is with\n\t\t\tAllah: Such is Allah my Lord: in Him I trust and to Him I turn.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4538</sup>

(He is) the Creator of the heavens and the earth: He has made for
			you pairs from among yourselves and pairs among cattle: by this
			means does He multiply you: there is nothing whatever like unto
			Him and He is the One that hears and sees (all things).
			<sup class='fn'>4539</sup>
To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth: He enlarges\n\t\t\tand restricts the Sustenance to whom He will: for He knows full\n\t\t\twell all things. <sup class='fn'>4540</sup>

The same religion has He established for you as that which He
			enjoined on Noah--the which We have sent by inspiration to
			thee--and that which We enjoined on Abraham Moses and Jesus:
			Namely that ye should remain steadfast in Religion and make no
			divisions therein: to those who worship other things than Allah
			hard is the (way) to which thou callest them.  Allah chooses to
			Himself those whom He pleases and guides to Himself those who
			turn (to Him). <sup class='fn'>4541</sup> <sup class='fn'>4542</sup> <sup class='fn'>4543</sup>

And they became divided only after knowledge reached them through
			selfish envy as between themselves.  Had it not been for a Word
			that went forth before from thy Lord (tending) to a Term
			appointed the matter would have been settled between them: but
			truly those who have inherited the Book after them are in
			suspicious (disquieting) doubt concerning it. <sup class='fn'>4544</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4545</sup> <sup class='fn'>4546</sup>

Now then for that (reason) call (them to the Faith) and stand
			steadfast as thou art commanded nor follow thou their vain
			desires; but say: "I believe in the Book which Allah has sent
			down; and I am commanded to judge justly between you.  Allah is
			Our Lord and your Lord. For us (is the responsibility for) Our
			deeds and for you for your deeds.  There is no contention between
			us and you.  Allah will bring us together and to Him is (Our)
			final goal. <sup class='fn'>4547</sup> <sup class='fn'>4548</sup>

But those who dispute concerning Allah after He has been accepted\n\t\t\tfutile is their dispute in the sight of their Lord: on them is\n\t\t\tWrath and for them will be a Penalty Terrible. <sup class='fn'>4549</sup>

It is Allah Who has sent down the Book in truth and the Balance\n\t\t\t(by which to weigh conduct).  And what will make thee realize\n\t\t\tthat perhaps the Hour is close at hand? <sup class='fn'>4550</sup>

Only those wish to hasten it who believe not in it: those who
			believe hold it in awe and know that it is the Truth.  Behold
			verily those that dispute concerning the Hour are far astray.
			<sup class='fn'>4551</sup>

Gracious is Allah to His servants: He gives Sustenance to whom He\n\t\t\tpleases: and He has Power and can carry out His Will.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4552</sup> <sup class='fn'>4553</sup> <sup class='fn'>4554</sup>

To any that desires the tilth of the Hereafter We give increase
			in his tilth; and to any that desires the tilth of this world We
			grant somewhat thereof but he has no share or lot in the
			Hereafter. <sup class='fn'>4555</sup>

What! have they partners (in godhead) who have established for
			them some religion without the permission of Allah? Had it not
			been for the Decree of Judgement the matter would have been
			decided between them (at once): but verily the wrongdoers will
			have a grievous Penalty. <sup class='fn'>4556</sup>

Thou wilt see the wrongdoers in fear on account of what they have
			earned and (the burden of) that must (necessarily) fall on them. 
			But those who believe and work righteous deeds will be in the
			luxuriant meads of the Gardens: they shall have before their Lord
			all that they wish for: that will indeed be the magnificent
			Bounty (of Allah). <sup class='fn'>4557</sup> <sup class='fn'>4558</sup>

That is (the Bounty) whereof Allah gives Glad Tidings to His
			Servants who believe and do righteous deeds.  Say: "No reward do
			I ask of you for this except the love of those near of kin." And
			if anyone earns any good We shall give Him an increase of good in
			respect thereof: for Allah is Oft-Forgiving Most Ready to
			appreciate (service). <sup class='fn'>4559</sup> <sup class='fn'>4560</sup> <sup class='fn'>4561</sup>

What! do they say "He has forged a falsehood against Allah"? But
			if Allah willed He could seal up thy heart.  And Allah blots out
			Vanity and proves the Truth by His Words. For He knows well the
			secrets of all hearts. <sup class='fn'>4562</sup>
He is the One that accepts repentance from His Servants and\n\t\t\tforgives sins: and He knows all that ye do. <sup class='fn'>4563</sup>
And He listens to those who believe and do deeds of righteousness\n\t\t\tand gives them increase of His Bounty: but for the Unbelievers\n\t\t\tthere is a terrible Penalty. <sup class='fn'>4564</sup>

If Allah were to enlarge the provision for His Servants they
			would indeed transgress beyond all bounds through the earth; but
			He sends (it) down in due measure as He pleases: for He is with
			His Servants well-acquainted Watchful. <sup class='fn'>4565</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4566</sup>

He is the One that sends down rain (even) after (men) have given\n\t\t\tup all hope and scatters His Mercy (far and wide).  And He is the\n\t\t\tProtector Worthy Of all Praise. <sup class='fn'>4567</sup>

And among His Signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth
			and the living creatures that He has scattered through them: and
			He has power to gather them together when He wills. <sup class='fn'>4568</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4569</sup>
Whatever misfortune happens to you is because of the things your\n\t\t\thands have wrought and for many (of them) He grants forgiveness.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4570</sup>
Nor can ye frustrate (aught) (fleeing) through the earth; nor\n\t\t\thave ye besides Allah anyone to protect or to help. <sup class='fn'>4571</sup>
And among His Signs are the ships smooth-running through the\n\t\t\tocean (tall) as mountains. <sup class='fn'>4572</sup>

If it be His Will He can still the Wind: then would they become
			motionless on the back of the (ocean).	Verily in this are Signs
			for everyone who patiently perseveres and is grateful.
			<sup class='fn'>4573</sup>
Or He can cause them to perish because of the (evil) which (the\n\t\t\tmen) have earned: but much doth He forgive.
But let those know who dispute about Our Signs that there is for\n\t\t\tthem no way of escape. <sup class='fn'>4574</sup>

Whatever ye are given (here) is (but) a convenience of this Life:
			but that which is with Allah is better and more lasting: (it is)
			for those who believe and put their trust in their Lord;
			<sup class='fn'>4575</sup> <sup class='fn'>4576</sup>
Those who avoid the greater crimes and shameful deeds and when\n\t\t\tthey are angry even then forgive; <sup class='fn'>4577</sup>

Those who hearken to their Lord and establish regular prayer; who
			(conduct) their affairs by mutual Consultation; who spend out of
			what We bestow on them for Sustenance; <sup class='fn'>4578</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4579</sup>
And those who when an oppressive wrong is inflicted on them (are\n\t\t\tnot cowed but) help and defend themselves. <sup class='fn'>4580</sup>

The recompense for an injury is an injury equal thereto (in
			degree): but if a person forgives and makes reconciliation His
			reward is due from Allah: for (Allah) loveth not those who do
			wrong. <sup class='fn'>4581</sup> <sup class='fn'>4582</sup> <sup class='fn'>4583</sup>
But indeed if any do help and defend themselves after a wrong\n\t\t\t(done) to them against such there is no cause of blame.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4584</sup>

The blame is only against those who oppress men with wrong-doing
			and insolently transgress beyond bounds through the land defying
			right and justice: for such there will be a Penalty grievous.
			<sup class='fn'>4585</sup>
But indeed if any show patience and forgive that would truly be\n\t\t\tan exercise of courageous will and resolution in the conduct of\n\t\t\taffairs. <sup class='fn'>4586</sup>

For any whom Allah leaves astray there is no protector thereafter\n\t\t\tand thou wilt see the wrongdoers when in sight of the Penalty\n\t\t\tSay: "Is there any way (to effect) a return? <sup class='fn'>4587</sup>

And thou wilt see them brought forward to the (Penalty) in a
			humble frame of mind because of (their) disgrace (and) looking
			with a stealthy glance.  And the Believers will say: "Those are
			indeed in loss who have given the perdition their own selves and
			those belonging to them on the Day of Judgement.  Behold! truly
			the wrongdoers are in a lasting Penalty!" <sup class='fn'>4588</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4589</sup>
And no protectors have they to help them other than Allah: and\n\t\t\tfor any whom Allah leaves to stray there is no way (to the Goal).\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4590</sup>

Hearken ye to your Lord before there come a Day which there will
			be no putting back because of (the ordainment of) Allah! That Day
			there will be for you no place of refuge nor will there be for
			you any room for denial (of your sins)! <sup class='fn'>4591</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4592</sup>

If then they turn away We have not sent thee as a guard over
			them. Thy duty is but to convey (the Message).	And truly when We
			give man a taste of Mercy from Ourselves He doth exult thereat
			but when some ill happens to him on account of the deeds which
			His hands have sent forth truly then is man ungrateful!
			<sup class='fn'>4593</sup> <sup class='fn'>4594</sup>

To Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth.  He\n\t\t\tcreates what He wills (and plans).  He bestows (children) male or\n\t\t\tfemale according to His Will (and Plan). <sup class='fn'>4595</sup>
Or He bestows both males and females and He leaves barren whom He\n\t\t\twill: for He is Full of knowledge and power. <sup class='fn'>4596</sup>

It is not fitting for a man that Allah should speak to him except
			by inspiration of from behind a veil or by the sending of a
			Messenger to reveal with Allah's permission what Allah wills: for
			He is Most High Most Wise. <sup class='fn'>4597</sup> <sup class='fn'>4598</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4599</sup> <sup class='fn'>4600</sup>

And thus have We by Our command sent inspiration to thee: thou
			knowest not (before) what was Revelation and what was Faith; but
			We have made the (Qur'an) a Light wherewith We guide such of Our
			servants as We will; and verily thou dost guide (men) to the
			Straight Way <sup class='fn'>4601</sup> <sup class='fn'>4602</sup>
The Way of Allah to whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and\n\t\t\twhatever is on earth: Behold (how) all affairs tend towards\n\t\t\tAllah! <sup class='fn'>4603</sup>
Ha Mim. <sup class='fn'>4604</sup>
By the Book that makes things clear
We have made it a Qur'an in Arabic that ye may be able to\n\t\t\tunderstand (and learn wisdom). <sup class='fn'>4605</sup>
And verily it is in the Mother of the Book in Our Presence high\n\t\t\t(in dignity) full of wisdom. <sup class='fn'>4606</sup>
Shall We then take away the Message from you and repel (you) for\n\t\t\tthat ye are a people transgressing beyond bounds? <sup class='fn'>4607</sup>
But how many were the prophets We sent amongst the peoples of\n\t\t\told? <sup class='fn'>4608</sup>
And never came there a prophet to them but they mocked him.
So We destroyed (them) stronger in power than these and (thus)\n\t\t\thas passed on the Parable of the peoples of old. <sup class='fn'>4609</sup>

If thou wert to question them `Who created the heavens and the
			earth?' They would be sure to reply `They were created by (Him)
			the Exalted in Power Full of knowledge' <sup class='fn'>4610</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4611</sup>

(Yea the same that) has made for you the earth (like a carpet)
			spread out and has made for you roads (and channels) therein in
			order that ye may find guidance (on the way); <sup class='fn'>4612</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4613</sup>

That sends down (from time to time rain from the sky in due\n\t\t\tmeasure; and We raise to life therewith a land that is dead; even\n\t\t\tso will ye be raised (from the dead) <sup class='fn'>4614</sup> <sup class='fn'>4615</sup>
That has created pairs in all things and has made for you ships\n\t\t\tand cattle on which ye ride <sup class='fn'>4616</sup> <sup class='fn'>4617</sup>

In order that ye may sit firm and square on their backs and when
			so seated ye may celebrate the (kind) favor of your Lord and say
			"Glory to Him Who has subjected these to Our (use) for We could
			never have accomplished this (by ourselves). <sup class='fn'>4618</sup>
"And to Our Lord surely Must We turn back!" <sup class='fn'>4619</sup>
Yet they attribute to some of His servants a share with Him (in\n\t\t\tHis godhead)! Truly is man a blasphemous ingrate avowed!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4620</sup>
What! Has He taken Daughters out of what He Himself creates and\n\t\t\tgranted to you sons for choice? <sup class='fn'>4621</sup>

When news is brought to one of them of (the birth of) what he\n\t\t\tsets up as a likeness to (Allah) Most Gracious his face darkens\n\t\t\tand he is filled with inward grief! <sup class='fn'>4622</sup>
Is then one brought up among trinkets and unable to give a clear\n\t\t\taccount in a dispute (to be associated with Allah)? <sup class='fn'>4623</sup>

And they make into females angels who themselves serve Allah. \n\t\t\tDid they witness their creation? Their evidence will be recorded\n\t\t\tand they will be called to account! <sup class='fn'>4624</sup>

("Ah!") they say "If it had been the will of (Allah) Most
			Gracious We should not have worshipped such (deities)!" of that
			they have no knowledge! They Do nothing but lie! <sup class='fn'>4625</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4626</sup>
What! have We given them a Book before this to which they are\n\t\t\tholding fast?
Nay! they say: "We found Our fathers following a certain religion\n\t\t\tand We do guide ourselves by their footsteps." <sup class='fn'>4627</sup>

Just in the same way whenever We sent a Warner before thee to any
			people the wealthy ones among them said: "We found Our fathers
			following a certain religion and We will certainly follow in
			their footsteps." <sup class='fn'>4628</sup>

He said: "What! even if I brought you better guidance than that
			which ye found your fathers following?" They said: "For us We
			deny that ye (prophets) are sent (on a mission at all)."
			<sup class='fn'>4629</sup>
So We exacted retribution from them: now see what was the end of\n\t\t\tthose who rejected (Truth)!
Behold! Abraham said to his father and his people: "I do indeed\n\t\t\tclear myself of what ye worship: <sup class='fn'>4630</sup>
"(I worship) only Him Who made me and He will certainly guide\n\t\t\tme."
And he left it as a Word to endure among those who came after him\n\t\t\tthat they may turn back (to Allah). <sup class='fn'>4631</sup>
Yea I have given the good things of this life to these (men) and\n\t\t\ttheir fathers until the Truth has come to them and an Apostle\n\t\t\tmaking things clear. <sup class='fn'>4632</sup>
But when the Truth came to them they said: "This is sorcery and\n\t\t\tWe do reject it." <sup class='fn'>4633</sup>
Also they say: "Why is not this Qur'an sent down to some leading\n\t\t\tman in either of the two (Chief) cities?" <sup class='fn'>4634</sup>

Is it they who would portion out the Mercy of thy Lord? It is We
			Who portion out between them their livelihood in the life of this
			world: and We raise some of them above others in ranks so that
			some may command work from others.  But the Mercy of thy Lord is
			better than the (wealth) which they amass. <sup class='fn'>4635</sup>

And were it not that (all) men might become of one (evil) way of
			life We would provide for everyone that blasphemes against
			(Allah) Most Gracious silver roofs for their houses and (silver)
			stair-ways on which to go up. <sup class='fn'>4636</sup>
And (silver) doors to their houses and thrones (of silver) on\n\t\t\twhich they could recline
And also adornments of gold.  But all this were nothing but\n\t\t\tconveniences of the present life: the Hereafter in the sight of\n\t\t\tthy Lord is for the Righteous. <sup class='fn'>4637</sup>
If anyone withdraws himself from remembrance of (Allah) Most\n\t\t\tGracious We appoint for him an evil one to be an intimate\n\t\t\tcompanion to him. <sup class='fn'>4638</sup>
Such (evil ones) really hinder them from the Path but they think\n\t\t\tthat they are being guided aright! <sup class='fn'>4639</sup>

At length when (such a one) comes to Us he says (to his evil
			companion): "Would that between me and thee were the distance of
			East and West!" Ah! Evil is the companion (indeed)! <sup class='fn'>4640</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4641</sup>
When ye have done wrong it will avail you nothing that day that\n\t\t\tye shall be partners in punishment! <sup class='fn'>4642</sup>
Canst thou then make the deaf to hear or give direction to the\n\t\t\tblind or to such as (wander) in manifest error? <sup class='fn'>4643</sup>\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4644</sup>
Even if We take thee away We shall be sure to exact retribution\n\t\t\tfrom them. <sup class='fn'>4645</sup>
Or We shall show thee that (accomplished) which We have promised\n\t\t\tthem: for verily We shall prevail over them.
So hold thou fast to the Revelation sent down to thee: verily\n\t\t\tthou art on Straight Way. <sup class='fn'>4646</sup>
The (Qur'an) is indeed the Message for thee and for thy people;\n\t\t\tand soon shall ye (all) be brought to account. <sup class='fn'>4647</sup>
And question thou Our apostles whom We sent before thee; did We\n\t\t\tappoint any deities other than (Allah) Most Gracious to be\n\t\t\tworshipped? <sup class='fn'>4648</sup>
We did send Moses aforetime with Our Signs to Pharaoh and his\n\t\t\tChiefs: he said "I am an apostle of the Lord of the Worlds."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4649</sup>
But when he came to them with Our Signs behold they ridiculed\n\t\t\tthem. <sup class='fn'>4650</sup>
We showed them Sign after Sign each greater than its fellow and We\n\t\t\tseized them with Punishment in order that they might turn (to\n\t\t\tUs). <sup class='fn'>4651</sup>
And they said "O thou Sorcerer! invoke thy Lord for us according\n\t\t\tto His covenant with thee; for We shall truly accept guidance."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4652</sup>
But when We removed the Penalty from them behold they broke their\n\t\t\tword.

And Pharaoh proclaimed among his people saying: "O my people!
			does not the dominion of Egypt belong to me (witness) these
			streams flowing underneath my (palace)? What! see ye not then?
			<sup class='fn'>4653</sup>
"Am I not better than this (Moses) who is a contemptible wretch\n\t\t\tand can scarcely express himself clearly? <sup class='fn'>4654</sup>
"Then why are not gold bracelets bestowed on him or (why) come\n\t\t\t(not) with him angels accompanying him in procession?"\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4655</sup>
Thus did he make fools of his people and they obeyed him: Truly\n\t\t\twere they a people rebellious (against Allah).
When at length they provoked Us We exacted retribution from them\n\t\t\tand We drowned them all <sup class='fn'>4656</sup> <sup class='fn'>4657</sup>
And We made them (a people) of the Past and an Example to later\n\t\t\tages. <sup class='fn'>4658</sup>
When (Jesus) the son of Mary is held up as an example behold thy\n\t\t\tpeople raise a clamor there at (in ridicule)! <sup class='fn'>4659</sup>
And they say " Are Our gods best or He?" This they set forth to\n\t\t\tthee only by way of disputation: yea they are a contentious\n\t\t\tpeople.
He was no more than a servant: We granted Our favor to him and We\n\t\t\tmade him an example to the Children of Israel. <sup class='fn'>4660</sup>
And if it were Our Will We could make angels from amongst you\n\t\t\tsucceeding each other on the earth. <sup class='fn'>4661</sup>
And (Jesus) shall be a Sign (for the coming of) the Hour (of\n\t\t\tJudgment): therefore have no doubt about the (Hour) but follow ye\n\t\t\tMe: this is a Straight Way. <sup class='fn'>4662</sup>
Let not the Evil One hinder you: for he is to you an enemy\n\t\t\tavowed.

When Jesus came with Clear Signs he said: "Now have I come to you
			with Wisdom and in order to make clear to you some of the
			(points) on which ye dispute: therefore fear Allah and obey me.
			<sup class='fn'>4663</sup>
"For Allah; He is my Lord and your Lord: so worship ye Him: this\n\t\t\tis a Straight Way." <sup class='fn'>4664</sup>
But sects from among themselves fell into disagreement: then woe\n\t\t\tto the wrongdoers from the Penalty of a Grievous Day!
Do they only wait for the Hour that it should come on them all of\n\t\t\ta sudden while they perceive not? <sup class='fn'>4665</sup>
Friends on that Day will be foes one to another except the\n\t\t\tRighteous. <sup class='fn'>4666</sup>
My devotees! no fear shall be on you that Day nor shall ye grieve\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4667</sup>
(Being) those who have believed in Our Signs and bowed (their\n\t\t\twills to Ours) in Islam.
Enter ye the Garden ye and your wives in (beauty and) rejoicing.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4668</sup>

To them will be passed round dishes and goblets of gold: there
			will be there all that the souls could desire all that the eyes
			could delight in: and ye shall abide therein (for aye).
			<sup class='fn'>4669</sup>
Such will be the Garden of which ye are made heirs for your\n\t\t\t(good) deeds (in life). <sup class='fn'>4670</sup>
Ye shall have therein abundance of fruit from which ye shall have\n\t\t\tsatisfaction. <sup class='fn'>4671</sup> <sup class='fn'>4672</sup>
The Sinners will be in the Punishment of Hell to dwell therein\n\t\t\t(for aye):
Nowise will the (punishment) be lightened for them and in despair\n\t\t\twill they be there overwhelmed.
Nowise shall We be unjust to them: but it is they who have been\n\t\t\tunjust themselves. <sup class='fn'>4673</sup>
They will cry: "O Malik! would that thy Lord put an end to us!"\n\t\t\tHe will say "Nay but ye shall abide!" <sup class='fn'>4674</sup> <sup class='fn'>4675</sup>
Verily We have brought the truth to you: but most of you have a\n\t\t\thatred for Truth. <sup class='fn'>4676</sup>
What! have they settled some Plan (among themselves)? But it is\n\t\t\tWe Who settle things. <sup class='fn'>4677</sup>
Or do they think that We hear not their secrets and their private\n\t\t\tcounsels? Indeed (We do) and Our Messengers are by them to\n\t\t\trecord. <sup class='fn'>4678</sup>
Say: "If (Allah) Most Gracious had a son I would be the first to\n\t\t\tworship." <sup class='fn'>4679</sup>
Glory to the Lord of the heavens and the earth the Lord of the\n\t\t\tThrone (of Authority)! (He is free) from the things they\n\t\t\tattribute (to Him)! <sup class='fn'>4680</sup>
So leave them to babble and play (with vanities) until they meet\n\t\t\tthat Day of theirs which they have been promised. <sup class='fn'>4681</sup>
It is He Who is Allah in heaven and Allah on earth; and He is\n\t\t\tfull of Wisdom and Knowledge.

And blessed is He to Whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and
			the earth and all between them: with Him is the knowledge of the
			Hour (of Judgment): And to Him shall ye be brought back.
			<sup class='fn'>4682</sup>
And those whom they invoke besides Allah have no power of\n\t\t\tintercession; only he who bears witness to the Truth and they\n\t\t\tknow (him). <sup class='fn'>4683</sup>
If thou ask them Who Created them they will certainly say Allah:\n\t\t\thow then are they deluded away (from the Truth)? <sup class='fn'>4684</sup>
(Allah has knowledge) of the (Prophet's) cry "O my Lord! truly\n\t\t\tthese are a people who will not believe!" <sup class='fn'>4685</sup>\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4686</sup>
But turn away from them and say "Peace!" but soon shall they\n\t\t\tknow! <sup class='fn'>4687</sup>
Ha Mim. <sup class='fn'>4688</sup>
By the Book that makes things clear <sup class='fn'>4689</sup>
We sent it down during a blessed night: for We (ever) wish to\n\t\t\twarn (against Evil). <sup class='fn'>4690</sup>
In that (night) is made distinct every affair of wisdom\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4691</sup>
By command from Our presence.  For We (ever) send (revelations)
As a Mercy from thy Lord: for He hears and knows (all things);\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4692</sup>
The Lord of the heavens and the earth and all between them if ye\n\t\t\t(but) have an assured faith. <sup class='fn'>4693</sup>
There is no god but He: it is He Who gives life and gives death\n\t\t\tthe Lord and Cherisher to you and your earliest ancestors.
Yet they play about in doubt. <sup class='fn'>4694</sup>
Then watch thou for the Day that the sky will bring forth a kind\n\t\t\tof smoke (or mist) plainly visible. <sup class='fn'>4695</sup> <sup class='fn'>4696</sup>
Enveloping the people: this will be a Penalty Grievous.
(They will say:) "Our Lord! remove the Penalty from us for We do\n\t\t\treally believe!"
How shall the Message be (effectual) for them seeing that an\n\t\t\tApostle explaining things clearly has (already) come to them\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4697</sup>
Yet they turn away from him and say: "Tutored (by others) a man\n\t\t\tpossessed!" <sup class='fn'>4698</sup>
We shall indeed remove the Penalty for a while (but) truly ye\n\t\t\twill revert (to your ways). <sup class='fn'>4699</sup>
One day We shall seize you with a mighty onslaught We will indeed\n\t\t\t(then) exact Retribution!
We did before them try the people of Pharaoh: there came to them\n\t\t\tand apostle most honorable <sup class='fn'>4700</sup> <sup class='fn'>4701</sup>
Saying: "Restore to me the servants of Allah: I am to you an\n\t\t\tapostle worthy of all trust; <sup class='fn'>4702</sup> <sup class='fn'>4703</sup>
"And be not arrogant as against Allah: for I come to you with\n\t\t\tauthority manifest.
"For me I have sought Safety with my Lord and your Lord against\n\t\t\tyour injuring me. <sup class='fn'>4704</sup> <sup class='fn'>4705</sup>
"If ye believe me not at least keep yourselves away from me."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4706</sup>
(But they were aggressive): then he cried to his Lord: "These are\n\t\t\tindeed a people given to sin." <sup class='fn'>4707</sup>
(The reply came): "March forth with My servants by night: for ye\n\t\t\tare sure to be pursued.
"And leave the sea as a furrow (divided).  For they are a host\n\t\t\t(destined) to be drowned." <sup class='fn'>4708</sup>
How many were the gardens and springs they left behind.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4709</sup>
And corn-fields and noble buildings.
And wealth (and conveniences of life) wherein they had taken such\n\t\t\tdelight!
Thus (was their end)! And We made other people inherit (those\n\t\t\tthings)!
And neither heaven nor earth shed a tear over them: nor were they\n\t\t\tgiven a respite (again). <sup class='fn'>4710</sup>
We did deliver aforetime the Children of Israel from humiliating\n\t\t\tPunishment <sup class='fn'>4711</sup>
Inflicted by Pharaoh for he was arrogant (even) among inordinate\n\t\t\ttransgressors.
And We chose them aforetime above the nations knowingly\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4712</sup>
And granted them Signs in which there was a manifest trial.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4713</sup>
As to these (Quraish) they say forsooth: <sup class='fn'>4714</sup>
"There is nothing beyond our first death and we shall not be\n\t\t\traised again.
"Then bring (back) our forefathers if what ye say is true!"
What! are they better than the people of Tubba and those who were\n\t\t\tbefore them? We destroyed them because they were guilty of sin.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4715</sup> <sup class='fn'>4716</sup>
We created not the heavens the earth and all between them merely\n\t\t\tin (idle) sport: <sup class='fn'>4717</sup>
We created them not except for just ends: but most of them do not\n\t\t\tunderstand.
Verily the Day of Sorting Out is the time appointed for all of\n\t\t\tthem <sup class='fn'>4718</sup>
The Day when no protector can avail his client in aught and no\n\t\t\thelp can they receive. <sup class='fn'>4719</sup>
Except such as receive Allah's Mercy: for He is exalted in Might\n\t\t\tMost Merciful. <sup class='fn'>4720</sup>
Verily the tree of Zaqqum <sup class='fn'>4721</sup> <sup class='fn'>4722</sup>
Will be the food of the Sinful
Like molten brass; it will boil in their insides
Like the boiling of scalding water.
(A voice will cry:) "Seize ye him and drag him into the midst of\n\t\t\tthe Blazing Fire!
"Then pour over his head the Penalty of Boiling Water;
"Taste thou (this)! Truly wast thou Mighty full of honor!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4723</sup>
"Truly this is what ye used to doubt!" <sup class='fn'>4724</sup>
As to the Righteous (they will be) in a position of Security\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4725</sup>
Among Gardens and Springs;
Dressed in fine silk and in rich brocade they will face each\n\t\t\tother; <sup class='fn'>4726</sup> <sup class='fn'>4727</sup>
So; and We shall Join them to Companions with beautiful big and\n\t\t\tlustrous eyes. <sup class='fn'>4728</sup> <sup class='fn'>4729</sup>
There can they call for every kind of fruit in peace and\n\t\t\tsecurity; <sup class='fn'>4730</sup>
Nor will they there taste Death except the first Death; and He\n\t\t\twill preserve them from the Penalty of the Blazing Fire\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4731</sup> <sup class='fn'>4732</sup>
As a Bounty from thy Lord! That will be the supreme achievement!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4733</sup>
Verily We have made this (Qur'an) easy in thy tongue in order\n\t\t\tthat they may give heed. <sup class='fn'>4734</sup>
So wait thou and watch; for they (too) are waiting.
Ha Mim. <sup class='fn'>4735</sup>
The revelation of the Book is from Allah the Exalted in power\n\t\t\tFull of Wisdom. <sup class='fn'>4736</sup>
Verily in the heavens and the earth are Signs for those who\n\t\t\tbelieve. <sup class='fn'>4737</sup>
And in the creation of yourselves and the fact that animals are\n\t\t\tscattered (through the earth) are Signs for those of assured\n\t\t\tFaith. <sup class='fn'>4738</sup>

And in the alternation of Night and Day and the fact that Allah
			sends down Sustenance from the sky and revives therewith the
			earth after its death and the change of the winds are Signs for
			those that are wise. <sup class='fn'>4739</sup> <sup class='fn'>4740</sup>
Such are the Signs of Allah which We rehearse to thee in truth:\n\t\t\tthen in what exposition will they believe after (rejecting) Allah\n\t\t\tand His Signs? <sup class='fn'>4741</sup>
Woe to each sinful Dealer in Falsehoods: <sup class='fn'>4742</sup>
He hears the Signs of Allah rehearsed to him yet is obstinate and\n\t\t\tlofty as if he had not heard them: then announce to him a Penalty\n\t\t\tGrievous!
And when he learns something of Our Signs he takes them in jest:\n\t\t\tfor such there will be a humiliating Penalty. <sup class='fn'>4743</sup>

In front of them is Hell: and of no profit to them is anything
			they may have earned nor any protectors they may have taken to
			themselves besides Allah: for them is a tremendous Penalty.
			<sup class='fn'>4744</sup>
This is (true) Guidance: and for those who reject the Signs of\n\t\t\ttheir Lord is a grievous Penalty of abomination. <sup class='fn'>4745</sup>
It is Allah Who has subjected the sea to you that ships may sail\n\t\t\tthrough it by His command that ye may seek of His Bounty and that\n\t\t\tye may be grateful. <sup class='fn'>4746</sup>
