And He has subjected to you as from Him all that is in the\n\t\t\theavens and on earth: behold in that are Signs indeed for those\n\t\t\twho reflect. <sup class='fn'>4747</sup>

Tell those who believe to forgive those who do not look forward
			to the Days of Allah: it is for Him to recompense (for good or
			ill) each People according to what they have earned.
			<sup class='fn'>4748</sup> <sup class='fn'>4749</sup> <sup class='fn'>4750</sup>

If anyone does a righteous deed it is to his own benefit; if he\n\t\t\tdoes evil it works against (His own soul).  In the end will ye\n\t\t\t(all) be brought back to your Lord. <sup class='fn'>4751</sup>

We did aforetime grant to the Children of Israel the Book the
			Power of Command and Prophethood; We gave them for Sustenance
			things good and pure; and We favored them above the nations.
			<sup class='fn'>4752</sup> <sup class='fn'>4753</sup>

And We granted them clear Signs in affairs (of Religion): it was
			only after knowledge had been granted to them that they fell into
			schisms through insolent envy among themselves.  Verily thy Lord
			will judge between them on the Day of Judgement as to those
			matters in which they set up differences. <sup class='fn'>4754</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4755</sup>
Then We put thee on the (right) Way of Religion: so follow thou\n\t\t\tthat (Way) and follow not the desires of those who know not.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4756</sup>

They will be of no use to thee in the sight of Allah: it is only\n\t\t\tWrongdoers (that stand as) protectors one to another: but Allah\n\t\t\tis the Protector of the Righteous. <sup class='fn'>4757</sup>
These are clear evidences to men and a Guidance and Mercy to\n\t\t\tthose of assured Faith. <sup class='fn'>4758</sup>

What! do those who seek after evil ways think that We shall hold
			them equal with those who believe and do righteous deeds that
			equal will be their Life and their death? Ill is the judgment
			that they make. <sup class='fn'>4759</sup>
Allah created the heavens and the earth for just ends and in\n\t\t\torder that each soul may find the recompense of what it has\n\t\t\tearned and none of them be wronged. <sup class='fn'>4760</sup>

Then seest thou such a one as takes as his god his own vain
			desire? Allah has knowing (him as such) left him astray and
			sealed His hearing and his heart (and understanding) and put a
			cover on his sight. Who then will guide him after Allah (has
			withdrawn Guidance)? Will ye not then receive admonition?
			<sup class='fn'>4761</sup> <sup class='fn'>4762</sup>

And they say: "What is there but our life in this world? We shall\n\t\t\tdie and we live and nothing but Time can destroy us." But of that\n\t\t\tthey have no knowledge: they merely conjecture: <sup class='fn'>4763</sup>
And when Our Clear Signs are rehearsed to them their argument is\n\t\t\tnothing but this: they say "Bring (back) our forefathers if what\n\t\t\tye say is true!" <sup class='fn'>4764</sup>
Say: "It is Allah Who gives you life then gives you death; then\n\t\t\tHe will gather you together for the Day of Judgement about which\n\t\t\tthere is no doubt": but most men do not understand.
To Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and\n\t\t\tthe Day that the Hour of Judgment is established that Day will\n\t\t\tthe dealers in Falsehood perish! <sup class='fn'>4765</sup>
And thou wilt see every sect bowing the knee: every sect will be\n\t\t\tcalled to its Record: "This Day shall ye be recompensed for all\n\t\t\tthat ye did! <sup class='fn'>4766</sup>
"This Our Record speaks about you with truth: for We were wont to\n\t\t\tput on record all that ye did." <sup class='fn'>4767</sup>
Then as to those who believed and did righteous deeds their Lord\n\t\t\twill admit them to His Mercy: that will be the Achievement for\n\t\t\tall to see. <sup class='fn'>4768</sup>
But as to those who reject Allah (to them will be said): "Were\n\t\t\tnot Our Signs rehearsed to you? But ye were arrogant and were a\n\t\t\tpeople given to sin!

"And when it was said that the promise of Allah was true and that
			the Hour there was no doubt about its (coming) ye used to say `We
			know not what is the Hour: we only think it is an idea and we
			have no firm assurance.'" <sup class='fn'>4769</sup>
Then will appear to them the evil (fruits) of what they did and\n\t\t\tthey will be completely encircled by that which they used to mock\n\t\t\tat! <sup class='fn'>4770</sup>
It will also be said: "This Day We will forget you as ye forgot\n\t\t\tthe meeting of this Day of yours! And your abode is the Fire and\n\t\t\tno helpers have ye! <sup class='fn'>4771</sup>

"This because ye used to take the Signs of Allah in jest and the
			life of the world deceived you." (From) the Day therefore they
			shall not be taken out thence nor shall they be received into
			Grace. <sup class='fn'>4772</sup>
Then Praise be to Allah Lord of the heavens and Lord of the earth\n\t\t\tLord and Cherisher of all the worlds! <sup class='fn'>4773</sup>
To Him be Glory throughout the heavens and the earth: and He is\n\t\t\tExalted in Power Full of Wisdom!
Ha Mim. <sup class='fn'>4774</sup>
The revelation of the Book is from Allah the Exalted in Power\n\t\t\tFull of Wisdom. <sup class='fn'>4775</sup>

We created not the heavens and the earth and all between them but\n\t\t\tfor just ends and for a term appointed: but those who reject\n\t\t\tFaith turn away from that whereof they are warned. <sup class='fn'>4776</sup>

Say: "Do ye see what it is ye invoke besides Allah? Show me what
			it is they have created on earth or have they a share in the
			heavens? Bring me a Book (revealed) before this or any remnant of
			knowledge (ye may have) if ye are telling the truth!"
			<sup class='fn'>4777</sup> <sup class='fn'>4778</sup>

And who is more astray than one who invokes besides Allah such as\n\t\t\twill not answer him to the Day of Judgement and who (in fact) are\n\t\t\tunconscious of their call (to them)? <sup class='fn'>4779</sup>
And when mankind are gathered together (at the Resurrection) they\n\t\t\twill be hostile to them and reject their worship (altogether)!
When Our Clear Signs are rehearsed to them the Unbelievers say of\n\t\t\tthe Truth when it comes to them: "This is evident sorcery!"\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4780</sup>

Or do they say "He has forged it"? Say: "Had I forged it then can
			ye obtain no single (blessing) for me from Allah.  He knows best
			of that whereof ye talk (so glibly)! Enough is He for a witness
			between me and you! And He is Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful."
			<sup class='fn'>4781</sup>

Say: "I am no bringer of new-fangled doctrine among the apostles
			nor do I know what will be done with me or with you.  I follow
			but that which is revealed to me by inspiration: I am but a
			Warner open and clear." <sup class='fn'>4782</sup>

Say: "See ye? If (this teaching) be from Allah and ye reject it
			and a witness from among the Children of Israel testifies to its
			similarity (with earlier scriptures) and has believed while ye
			are arrogant (how unjust ye are!) truly Allah guides not a people
			unjust." <sup class='fn'>4783</sup> <sup class='fn'>4784</sup>

The Unbelievers say of those who believe: "If (this Message) were
			a good thing (such men) would not have gone to it first before
			us!" and seeing that they guide not themselves thereby they will
			say "This is an (old) old falsehood!" <sup class='fn'>4785</sup>

And before this was the Book of Moses as a guide and a mercy; and\n\t\t\tthis Book confirms (it) in the Arabic tongue; to admonish the\n\t\t\tunjust and as Glad Tidings to those who do right. <sup class='fn'>4786</sup>
Verily those who say "Our Lord is Allah" and remain firm (on that\n\t\t\tPath) on them shall be no fear nor shall they grieve.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4787</sup> <sup class='fn'>4788</sup>
Such shall be Companions of the Garden dwelling Therein (for\n\t\t\taye): a recompense for their (good) deeds.

We have enjoined on man Kindness to his parents: in pain did his
			mother bear him and in pain did she give him birth.  The carrying
			of the (child) to his weaning is (a period of) thirty months.  At
			length when he reaches the age of full strength and attains forty
			years he says "O my Lord! grant me that I may be grateful for Thy
			favor which Thou hast bestowed upon me and upon both my parents
			and that I may work righteousness such as Thou mayest approve;
			and be gracious to me in my issue.  Truly have I turned to Thee
			and truly do I bow (to Thee) in Islam." <sup class='fn'>4789</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4790</sup> <sup class='fn'>4791</sup>

Such are they from whom We shall accept the best of their deeds
			and pass by their ill deeds: (they shall be) among the Companions
			of the Garden: a promise of truth which was made to them (in this
			life). <sup class='fn'>4792</sup>

But (there is one) who says to his parents "Fie on you! Do ye
			hold out the promise to me that I shall be raised up even though
			generations have passed before me (without rising again)? " And
			they two seek Allah's aid (and rebuke the son): "Woe to thee!
			have Faith! For the promise of Allah is true." But he says "This
			is nothing but tales of the ancients!" <sup class='fn'>4793</sup>
Such are they against whom is proved the Sentence among the\n\t\t\tprevious generations of Jinns and men that have passed away; for\n\t\t\tthey will be (utterly) lost. <sup class='fn'>4794</sup>

And to all are (assigned) degrees according to the deeds which\n\t\t\tthey (have done) and in order that (Allah) may recompense their\n\t\t\tdeeds and no injustice be done to them. <sup class='fn'>4795</sup>

And on the Day that the Unbelievers will be placed before the
			Fire (it will be said to them): "Ye received your good things in
			the life of the world and ye took your pleasure out of them: but
			today shall ye be recompensed with a Penalty of humiliation: for
			that ye were arrogant on earth without just cause and that ye
			(ever) transgressed." <sup class='fn'>4796</sup> <sup class='fn'>4797</sup>

Mention (Hud) one of `Ad's (own) brethren: behold he warned his
			people about the winding Sand-tracts:  but there have been
			Warners before him and after him: "Worship ye none other than
			Allah: truly I fear for you the Penalty of a Mighty Day."
			<sup class='fn'>4798</sup> <sup class='fn'>4799</sup>

They said: "Hast thou come in order to turn us aside from Our\n\t\t\tgods? Then bring upon us the (calamity) with which thou dost\n\t\t\tthreaten us if thou art telling the truth!" <sup class='fn'>4800</sup>

He said: "The Knowledge (of when it will come) is only with\n\t\t\tAllah: I proclaim to you the mission on which I have been sent:\n\t\t\tbut I see that ye are a people in ignorance!"... <sup class='fn'>4801</sup>

Then when they saw the (Penalty in the shape of ) a cloud
			traversing the sky coming to meet their valleys they said "This
			cloud will give us rain!" "Nay it is the (calamity) ye were
			asking to be hastened! a wind wherein is a Grievous Penalty!
			<sup class='fn'>4802</sup>

"Everything will it destroy by the command of its Lord!" Then by\n\t\t\tthe morning they nothing was to be seen but (the ruins of) their\n\t\t\thouses! Thus do We recompense those given to sin! <sup class='fn'>4803</sup>

And We had firmly established them in a (prosperity and) power
			which We have not given to you (ye Quraish!) and We had endowed
			them with (faculties of) hearing seeing heart and intellect: but
			of no profit to them were their (faculties of) hearing sight and
			heart and intellect when they went on rejecting the Signs of
			Allah; and they were (completely) encircled by that which they
			used to mock at! <sup class='fn'>4804</sup> <sup class='fn'>4805</sup> <sup class='fn'>4806</sup>
We destroyed aforetime populations round about you; and We have\n\t\t\tshown the Signs in various ways that they may turn (to Us).\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4807</sup>

Why then was no help forthcoming to them from those whom they
			worshipped as gods besides Allah as a means of access (to Allah)?
			Nay they left them in the lurch: but that was their Falsehood and
			their invention. <sup class='fn'>4808</sup>

Behold We turned towards thee a company of Jinns (quietly)
			listening to the Qur'an: when they stood in the presence thereof
			they said "Listen in silence!" When the (reading) was finished
			they returned to their people to warn (them of their sins).
			<sup class='fn'>4809</sup>
They said "O our people! We have heard a Book revealed after\n\t\t\tMoses confirming what came before it: it guides (men) to the\n\t\t\tTruth and to a Straight Path.
"O our people hearken to the one who invites (you) to Allah and\n\t\t\tbelieve in him: He will forgive you your faults and deliver you\n\t\t\tfrom a Penalty Grievous. <sup class='fn'>4810</sup>

"If any does not hearken to the one who invites (Us) to Allah he
			cannot frustrate (Allah's Plan) on earth and no protectors can he
			have besides Allah such men (wander) in manifest error."
			<sup class='fn'>4811</sup>

See they not that Allah Who created the heavens and the earth and\n\t\t\tnever wearied with their creation is able to give life to the\n\t\t\tdead? Yea verily He has power over all things. <sup class='fn'>4812</sup>

And on the Day that the Unbelievers will be placed before the
			Fire (they will be asked) "Is this not the Truth? " They will say
			"Yea by our Lord!" (One will say:) "Then taste ye the Penalty for
			that ye were wont to deny (Truth)!" <sup class='fn'>4813</sup> <sup class='fn'>4814</sup>

Therefore patiently persevere as did (all) apostles of inflexible
			purpose; and be in no haste about the (Unbelievers).  On the Day
			that they see the (Punishment) promised them (it will be ) as if
			they had not tarried more than an hour in a single day.  (Thine
			but) to proclaim the Message: but shall any be destroyed except
			those who transgress? <sup class='fn'>4815</sup> <sup class='fn'>4816</sup>
Those who reject Allah and hinder (men) from the Path of Allah\n\t\t\ttheir deeds will Allah render astray (From their mark).\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4817</sup>

But those who believe and work deeds of righteousness and believe
			in the (Revelation) sent down to Muhammad-for it is the Truth
			from their Lord He will remove from them their ills and improve
			their condition. <sup class='fn'>4818</sup>

This because those who reject Allah follow vanities while those\n\t\t\twho believe follow the Truth from their Lord: Thus does Allah set\n\t\t\tforth for men their lessons by similitudes. <sup class='fn'>4819</sup>

Therefore when ye meet the Unbelievers (in fight) smite at their
			necks; at length when ye have thoroughly subdued them bind a bond
			firmly (on them): thereafter (is the time for) either generosity
			or ransom: Until the war lays down its burdens.  Thus (are ye
			commanded): but if it had been Allah's Will He could certainly
			have exacted retribution from them (Himself); but (He lets you
			fight) in order to test you some with others.  But those who are
			slain in the way of Allah He will never let their deeds be lost.
			<sup class='fn'>4820</sup> <sup class='fn'>4821</sup> <sup class='fn'>4822</sup> <sup class='fn'>4823</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4824</sup>
Soon will He guide them and improve their condition.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4825</sup>
And admit them to the Garden which He has announced for them.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4826</sup>
O ye who believe! if ye will aid (the cause of) Allah He will aid\n\t\t\tyou and plant your feet firmly.
But those who reject (Allah) for them is destruction and (Allah)\n\t\t\twill render their deeds astray (from their mark). <sup class='fn'>4827</sup>
That is because they hate the Revelation of Allah; so He has made\n\t\t\ttheir deeds fruitless. <sup class='fn'>4828</sup>

Do they not travel through the earth and see what was the End of
			those before them (who did evil)? Allah brought utter destruction
			on them and similar (fates await) those who reject Allah.
			<sup class='fn'>4829</sup>
That is because Allah is the Protector of those who believe but\n\t\t\tthose who reject Allah have no protector.

Verily Allah will admit those who believe and do righteous deeds
			to Gardens beneath which rivers flow; while those who reject
			Allah will enjoy (this world) and eat as cattle eat; and the Fire
			will be their abode. <sup class='fn'>4830</sup>
And how many cities with more power than thy city which has\n\t\t\tdriven thee out have We destroyed (for their sins)? And there was\n\t\t\tnone to aid them. <sup class='fn'>4831</sup>
Is then one who is on a clear (Path) from his Lord no better than\n\t\t\tone to whom the evil of his conduct seems pleasing and such as\n\t\t\tfollow their own lusts? <sup class='fn'>4832</sup>

(Here is) a Parable of the Garden which the righteous are
			promised: in it are rivers of water incorruptible: rivers of milk
			of which the taste never changes; rivers of wine a joy to those
			who drink; and rivers of honey pure and clear.	In it there are
			for them all kinds of fruits and Grace from their Lord.  (Can
			those in such Bliss) be compared to such as shall dwell for ever
			in the Fire and be given to drink boiling water so that it cuts
			up their bowels (to pieces)? <sup class='fn'>4833</sup> <sup class='fn'>4834</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4835</sup> <sup class='fn'>4836</sup>

And among them are men who listen to thee but in the end when
			they go out from thee they say to those who have received
			Knowledge: "What is it he said just then?" Such are men whose
			hearts Allah has sealed and who follow their own lusts.
			<sup class='fn'>4837</sup>
But to those who receive Guidance He increases (the light of)\n\t\t\tGuidance and bestows on them their Piety and Restraint (from\n\t\t\tevil). <sup class='fn'>4838</sup>

Do they then only wait for the Hour that it should come on them
			of a sudden? But already have come some tokens thereof and when
			it (actually) is on them how can they benefit then by their
			admonition? <sup class='fn'>4839</sup> <sup class='fn'>4840</sup>

Know therefore that there is no god but Allah and ask forgiveness
			for the fault and for the men and women who believe: for Allah
			knows how ye move about and how ye dwell in your homes.
			<sup class='fn'>4841</sup> <sup class='fn'>4842</sup>

Those who believe say "Why is not a Surah sent down (for us)?"
			But when a Surah of basic or categorical meaning is revealed and
			fighting is mentioned therein thou wilt see those in whose hearts
			is a disease looking at thee with a look of one in swoon at the
			approach of death: but more fitting for them <sup class='fn'>4843</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4844</sup> <sup class='fn'>4845</sup>
Were it to obey and say what is just and when a matter is\n\t\t\tresolved on it were best for them if they were true to Allah.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4846</sup>
Then is it to be expected of you if ye will do no mischief in the\n\t\t\tland and break your ties of kith and kin? <sup class='fn'>4847</sup>
Such are the men whom Allah has cursed for He has made them deaf\n\t\t\tand blinded their sight. <sup class='fn'>4848</sup>
Do they not then earnestly seek to understand the Qur'an or are\n\t\t\ttheir hearts locked up by them?
Those who turn back as apostates after Guidance was clearly shown\n\t\t\tto them the Evil One has instigated them and buoyed them up with\n\t\t\tfalse hopes. <sup class='fn'>4849</sup>
This because they said to those who hate what Allah has revealed\n\t\t\t"We will obey you in part of (this) matter"; but Allah knows\n\t\t\ttheir (inner) secrets. <sup class='fn'>4850</sup>
But how (will it be) when the angels take their souls at death\n\t\t\tand smite their faces and their backs? <sup class='fn'>4851</sup>\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4852</sup>
This because they followed that which called forth the Wrath of\n\t\t\tAllah and they hated Allah's good pleasure; so He made their\n\t\t\tdeeds of no effect.
Or do those in whose hearts is a disease think that Allah will\n\t\t\tnot bring to light all their rancor? <sup class='fn'>4853</sup>

Had We so willed We could have shown them up to thee and thou
			shouldst have known them by their marks: but surely thou wilt
			know them by the tone of their speech! And Allah knows All that
			ye do. <sup class='fn'>4854</sup>

And We shall try you until We test those among you who strive\n\t\t\ttheir utmost and persevere in patience; and We shall try your\n\t\t\treported (mettle). <sup class='fn'>4855</sup> <sup class='fn'>4856</sup>

Those who reject Allah hinder (men) from the Path of Allah and
			resist the Apostle after Guidance has been clearly shown to them
			will not injure Allah in the least but He will make their deeds
			of no effect. <sup class='fn'>4857</sup>
O ye who believe! obey Allah and obey the Apostle and make not\n\t\t\tvain your deeds!
Those who reject Allah and hinder (men) from the Path of Allah\n\t\t\tthen die rejecting Allah Allah will not forgive them.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4858</sup>
Be not weary and faint-hearted crying for peace.  When ye should\n\t\t\tbe Uppermost: for Allah is with you and will never put you in\n\t\t\tloss for your (good) deeds. <sup class='fn'>4859</sup>

The life of this world is but play and amusement: and if ye
			believe land guard against evil He will grant you your recompense
			and will not ask you (to give up) your possessions. <sup class='fn'>4860</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4861</sup>
If He were to ask you for all of them and press you ye would\n\t\t\tcovetously withhold and He would bring out all your ill-feeling.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4862</sup> <sup class='fn'>4863</sup>

Behold ye are those invited to spend (of your substance) in the
			way of Allah: but among you are some that are niggardly.  But any
			who are niggardly are so at the expense of their own souls.  But
			Allah is free of all wants and it is ye that are needy.  If ye
			turn back (from the Path) He will substitute in your stead
			another people; then they would not be like you! <sup class='fn'>4864</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4865</sup>
Verily We have granted thee a manifest Victory: <sup class='fn'>4866</sup>
That Allah may forgive thee thy faults of the past and those to\n\t\t\tfollow; fulfil His favor to thee; and guide thee on the Straight\n\t\t\tWay; <sup class='fn'>4867</sup>
And that Allah may help thee with powerful help. <sup class='fn'>4868</sup>

It is He who sent down Tranquillity into the hearts of the
			Believers that they may Add Faith to their Faith; for to Allah
			belong the Forces of the heavens and the earth; and Allah is full
			of Knowledge and Wisdom; <sup class='fn'>4869</sup> <sup class='fn'>4870</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4871</sup>

That He may admit the men and women who believe to Gardens
			beneath which rivers flow to dwell therein for aye and remove
			their ills from them; and that is in the sight of Allah the
			highest achievement (For man) <sup class='fn'>4872</sup>

And that He may punish the Hypocrites men and women and the
			Polytheists men and women who imagine an evil opinion of Allah. 
			On them is a round of Evil: the Wrath of Allah is on them: He has
			cursed them and got Hell ready for them: and evil is it for a
			destination. <sup class='fn'>4873</sup> <sup class='fn'>4874</sup>
For to Allah belong the Forces of the heavens and the earth; and\n\t\t\tAllah is Exalted in Power Full of Wisdom. <sup class='fn'>4875</sup>
We have truly sent thee as a witness as a bringer of Glad Tidings\n\t\t\tand as a Warner: <sup class='fn'>4876</sup>
In order that ye (o men) may believe in Allah and His Apostle\n\t\t\tthat ye may assist and honor Him and celebrate his praises\n\t\t\tmorning and evening. <sup class='fn'>4876</sup>

Verily those who plight their fealty to thee do no less than
			plight their fealty to Allah: the Hand of Allah is over their
			hands: Then anyone who violates His oath does so to the harm of
			his own soul and anyone who fulfills what he has covenanted with
			Allah Allah will soon grant him a great Reward. <sup class='fn'>4877</sup>

The desert Arabs who lagged behind will say to thee: "We were
			engaged in (looking after) our flocks and herds and our families;
			do thou then ask forgiveness for us." They say with their tongues
			what is not in their hearts.  Say: "Who then has any power at all
			(to intervene) on your behalf with Allah if His will is to give
			you some loss or to give you some profit? but Allah is well
			acquainted with all that ye do. <sup class='fn'>4878</sup> <sup class='fn'>4879</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4880</sup>

"Nay ye thought that the Apostle and the Believers would never
			return to their families; this seemed pleasing in your hearts and
			ye conceived an evil thought for ye are a people lost (in
			wickedness)." <sup class='fn'>4881</sup>
And if any believe not in Allah and His Apostle We have prepared\n\t\t\tfor those who reject Allah a Blazing Fire!

To Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth: He\n\t\t\tforgives whom He wills and He punishes whom He wills: but Allah\n\t\t\tis Oft- Forgiving Most Merciful. <sup class='fn'>4882</sup>

Those who lagged behind (will say) when ye (are free to) march
			and take booty (in war): "Permit us to follow you." They wish to
			change Allah's decree: Say: "Not thus will ye follow us: Allah
			has already declared (this) beforehand": then they will say "but
			ye are jealous of us." Nay but little do they understand (such
			things). <sup class='fn'>4883</sup> <sup class='fn'>4884</sup> <sup class='fn'>4885</sup> <sup class='fn'>4886</sup>

Say to the desert Arabs who lagged behind: "Ye shall be summoned
			(to fight) against a people given to vehement war: then shall ye
			fight or they shall submit.  Then if ye show obedience Allah will
			grant you a goodly reward but if ye turn back as ye did before He
			will punish you with a grievous Penalty." <sup class='fn'>4887</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4888</sup> <sup class='fn'>4890</sup>

No blame is there on the blind nor is there blame on the lame nor
			on one ill (if he joins not the war): but he that obeys Allah and
			His Apostle (Allah) will admit him to Gardens beneath which
			rivers flow; and he who turns back (Allah) will punish him with a
			grievous Penalty. <sup class='fn'>4890</sup>

Allah's Good Pleasure was on the believers when they swore Fealty
			to thee under the Tree: He knew what was in their hearts and He
			sent down tranquillity to them and He rewarded them with a speedy
			Victory; <sup class='fn'>4891</sup> <sup class='fn'>4892</sup> <sup class='fn'>4893</sup> <sup class='fn'>4894</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4895</sup>
And many gains will they acquire (besides): and Allah is Exalted\n\t\t\tin Power Full of Wisdom.

Allah has promised you many gains that ye shall acquire and He
			has given you these beforehand; and He has restrained the hands
			of men from you; that it may be a Sign for the Believers and that
			He may guide you to a Straight Path; <sup class='fn'>4896</sup> <sup class='fn'>4897</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4898</sup>
And other gains (there are) which are not within your power but\n\t\t\twhich Allah has compassed: and Allah has power over all things.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4899</sup>
If the Unbelievers should fight you they would certainly turn\n\t\t\ttheir backs; then would they find neither protector nor helper.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4900</sup>
(Such has been) the practice.  (Approved) of Allah already in the\n\t\t\tpast: no change wilt thou find in the practice (approved) of\n\t\t\tAllah. <sup class='fn'>4901</sup>

And it is He who has restrained their hands from you and your
			hand from them in the midst of Mecca after that He gave you the
			victory over them.  And Allah sees well all that ye do.
			<sup class='fn'>4902</sup>

They are the ones who denied revelation and hindered you from the
			Sacred Mosque and the sacrificial animals detained from reaching
			their place of sacrifice.  Had there not been believing men and
			believing women whom ye did not know that ye were trampling down
			and on whose account a crime would have accrued to you without
			(your) knowledge.  (Allah would have allowed you to force your
			way but He held back your hands) that He may admit to His mercy
			whom He will.  If they had been apart We should certainly have
			punished the Unbelievers among them with a grievous punishment.
			<sup class='fn'>4903</sup> <sup class='fn'>4903</sup> <sup class='fn'>4904</sup> <sup class='fn'>4905</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4906</sup>

While the Unbelievers got up in their hearts heat and cant--the
			heat and cant of Ignorance--Allah sent down His tranquillity to
			His Apostle and to the Believers and made them stick close to the
			command of self-restraint; and well were they entitled to it and
			worthy of it. And Allah has full knowledge of all things.
			<sup class='fn'>4907</sup> <sup class='fn'>4908</sup> <sup class='fn'>4909</sup>

Truly did Allah fulfil the vision for His Apostle: Ye shall enter
			the Sacred Mosque if Allah wills with minds secure heads shaved
			hair cut short and without fear.  For He knew what ye knew not
			and He granted besides this a speedy victory. <sup class='fn'>4910</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4911</sup>
It is He who has sent His Apostle with Guidance and the Religion\n\t\t\tof Truth to proclaim it over all religion: and enough is Allah\n\t\t\tfor a Witness. <sup class='fn'>4912</sup>

Muhammad is the Apostle of Allah; and those who are with him are
			strong against Unbelievers (but) compassionate amongst each
			other.	Thou wilt see them bow and prostrate themselves (in
			prayer) seeking Grace from Allah and (His) Good Pleasure.  On
			their faces are their marks (being) the traces of their
			prostration.  This is their similitude in the Torah; and their
			similitude in the Gospel is: like a seed which sends forth its
			blade then makes it strong; it then becomes thick and it stands
			on its own stem (filling) the sowers with wonder and delight.  As
			a result it fills the Unbelievers with rage at him.  Allah has
			promised those among them who believe and do righteous deeds
			Forgiveness and a great Reward. <sup class='fn'>4913</sup> <sup class='fn'>4914</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>4915</sup> <sup class='fn'>4916</sup> <sup class='fn'>4917</sup> <sup class='fn'>4918</sup>
O ye who believe! put not yourselves forward before Allah and His\n\t\t\tApostle: But fear Allah: for Allah is He who hears and knows all\n\t\t\tthings. <sup class='fn'>4919</sup>

O ye who believe! raise not your voices above the voice of the
			Prophet nor speak aloud to him in talk as ye may speak aloud to
			one another lest your deeds become vain and ye perceive not.
			<sup class='fn'>4920</sup> <sup class='fn'>4921</sup>
Those that lower their voice in the presence of Allah's Apostle\n\t\t\ttheir hearts has Allah tested for piety: for them is Forgiveness\n\t\t\tand a great Reward. <sup class='fn'>4922</sup>
Those who shout out to thee from without the Inner Apartments\n\t\t\tmost of them lack understanding. <sup class='fn'>4923</sup>
If only they had patience until thou couldst come out to them it\n\t\t\twould be best for them: but Allah is Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful.

O ye who believe! if a wicked person comes to you with any news
			ascertain the truth lest ye harm people unwittingly and
			afterwards become full of repentance for what ye have done.
			<sup class='fn'>4924</sup>

And know that among you is Allah's Apostle: were he in many
			matters to follow your (wishes) ye would certainly fall into
			misfortune: but Allah has endeared the Faith to you and has made
			it beautiful in your hearts and He has made hateful to you
			unbelief wickedness and rebellion: such indeed are those who walk
			in righteousness <sup class='fn'>4925</sup> <sup class='fn'>4926</sup>
A grace and favor from Allah; and Allah is full of Knowledge and\n\t\t\tWisdom.

If two parties among the Believers fall into a quarrel make ye
			peace between them: but if one of them transgresses beyond bounds
			against the other then fight ye (all) against the one that
			transgresses until it complies with the command of Allah; but if
			it complies then make peace between them with justice and be
			fair: for Allah loves those who are fair (and just).
			<sup class='fn'>4927</sup>
The believers are but a single Brotherhood: So make peace and\n\t\t\treconciliation between your two (contending) brothers: And fear\n\t\t\tAllah that ye may receive Mercy. <sup class='fn'>4928</sup>

O ye who believe! let not some men among you laugh at others: it
			may be that the (latter) are better than the (former): Nor let
			some women laugh at others: it may be that the (latter) are
			better than the (former): nor defame nor be sarcastic to each
			other nor call each other by (offensive) nicknames: Ill-seeming
			is a name connoting wickedness (to be used of one) after he has
			believed: And those who do not desist are (Indeed) doing wrong.
			<sup class='fn'>4929</sup> <sup class='fn'>4930</sup>

O ye who believe! avoid suspicion as much (as possible): for
			suspicion in some cases is a sin: and spy not on each other nor
			speak ill of each other behind their backs.  Would any of you
			like to eat the flesh of his dead brother? Nay ye would abhor
			it...but fear Allah: for Allah is Oft-Returning Most Merciful.
			<sup class='fn'>4931</sup> <sup class='fn'>4931</sup> <sup class='fn'>4932</sup>

O mankind! We created you from a single (pair) of a male and a
			female and made you into nations and tribes that ye may know each
			other (not that ye may despise each other).  Verily the most
			honored of you in the sight of Allah is (he who is) the most
			righteous of you.  And Allah has full knowledge and is well
			acquainted (with all things). <sup class='fn'>4933</sup>

The desert Arabs say "We believe." Say "Ye have no faith; but ye
			(only) say `We have submitted our wills to Allah.' For not yet
			has Faith entered your hearts.	But if ye obey Allah and His
			Apostle He will not belittle aught of your deeds: for Allah is
			Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful." <sup class='fn'>4934</sup> <sup class='fn'>4935</sup>

Only those are Believers who have believed in Allah and His
			Apostle and have never since doubted but have striven with their
			belongings and their persons in the Cause of Allah: Such are the
			sincere ones.
Say: "what! Will ye instruct Allah about your Religion?" but\n\t\t\tAllah knows all that is in the heavens and on earth: He has full\n\t\t\tknowledge of all things. <sup class='fn'>4936</sup>

They impress on thee as favor that they have embraced Islam.  Say
			"Count not your Islam as a favor upon me: Nay Allah has conferred
			a favor upon you that He has guided you to the Faith if ye be
			true and sincere. <sup class='fn'>4937</sup>
"Verily Allah knows the secrets of the heavens and the earth: and\n\t\t\tAllah sees well all that ye do." <sup class='fn'>4938</sup>
Qaf.  By the Glorious Qur'an (Thou art Allah's Apostle).\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4939</sup> <sup class='fn'>4940</sup>
But they wonder that there has come to them a Warner from among\n\t\t\tthemselves.  So the Unbelievers say: "This is a wonderful thing!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4941</sup>
"What! when we die and become dust (shall we live again?).  That\n\t\t\tis a (sort of) Return far (from our understanding)."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4942</sup>
We already know how much of them the earth takes away: with Us is\n\t\t\ta Record guarding (the full account). <sup class='fn'>4943</sup>
But they deny the truth when it comes to them: So they are in a\n\t\t\tconfused state. <sup class='fn'>4944</sup>
Do they not look at the sky above them? How We have made it and\n\t\t\tadorned it and there are no flaws in it? <sup class='fn'>4945</sup>

And the earth--We have spread it out and set thereon mountains\n\t\t\tstanding firm and produced therein every kind of beautiful growth\n\t\t\t(in pairs) <sup class='fn'>4946</sup> <sup class='fn'>4947</sup>
To be observed and commemorated by every devotee turning (to\n\t\t\tAllah). <sup class='fn'>4948</sup>
And We send down from the sky Rain charged with blessing and We\n\t\t\tproduce therewith Gardens and Grain for harvests;
And tall (and stately) palm-trees with shoots of fruit-stalks\n\t\t\tpiled one over another <sup class='fn'>4949</sup>
As sustenance for (Allah's) Servants; and We give (new) life\n\t\t\ttherewith to land that is dead: Thus will be the Resurrection.
Before them was denied (the Hereafter) by the people of Noah the\n\t\t\tCompanions of the Rass the Thamud <sup class='fn'>4950</sup>
The `Ad Pharaoh the Brethren of Lut
The companions of the Wood and the people of Tubba; each one (of\n\t\t\tthem) rejected the apostles and My warning was duly fulfilled (in\n\t\t\tthem).
Were We then weary with the first Creation that they should be in\n\t\t\tconfused doubt about a new Creation? <sup class='fn'>4951</sup>
It was We who created man and We know what dark suggestions his\n\t\t\tsoul makes to him: for We are nearer to him than (his) jugular\n\t\t\tvein. <sup class='fn'>4952</sup>
Behold two (guardian angels) appointed to learn (his doings)\n\t\t\tlearn (and note them) one sitting on the right and one on the\n\t\t\tleft. <sup class='fn'>4953</sup>
Not a word does he utter but there is a sentinel by him ready (to\n\t\t\tnote it). <sup class='fn'>4954</sup>
And the stupor of death will bring truth (before his eyes): "This\n\t\t\twas the thing which thou wast trying to escape!" <sup class='fn'>4955</sup>
And the Trumpet shall be blown: that will be the Day whereof\n\t\t\twarning (had been given). <sup class='fn'>4956</sup>
And there will come forth every soul: with each will be an\n\t\t\t(angel) to drive and an (angel) to bear witness. <sup class='fn'>4957</sup>
(It will be said:) "Thou wast heedless of this; now have We\n\t\t\tremoved thy veil and sharp is thy sight this Day!" <sup class='fn'>4958</sup>
And his companion will say: "Here is (his record) ready with me!"\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4959</sup>
(The sentence will be:) "Throw throw into Hell every contumacious\n\t\t\tRejector (of Allah)! <sup class='fn'>4960</sup>
"Who forbade what was good transgressed all bounds cast doubts\n\t\t\tand suspicions;
"Who set up another god besides Allah: throw him into a severe\n\t\t\tPenalty."
His companion will say: "Our Lord! I did not make him transgress\n\t\t\tbut he was (himself) far astray." <sup class='fn'>4961</sup> <sup class='fn'>4962</sup>\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4963</sup>
He will say: "Dispute not with each other in My Presence: I had\n\t\t\talready in advance sent you Warning. <sup class='fn'>4964</sup> <sup class='fn'>4965</sup>
"The Word changes not before Me and I do not the least injustice\n\t\t\tto My Servants." <sup class='fn'>4966</sup>
One Day We will ask Hell "art thou filled to the full?" It will\n\t\t\tsay "are there any more (to come)?" <sup class='fn'>4967</sup>
And the Garden will be brought nigh to the righteous no more a\n\t\t\tthing distant. <sup class='fn'>4968</sup>
(A voice will say:) "This is what was promised for you for\n\t\t\teveryone who turned (to Allah) in sincere repentance who kept\n\t\t\t(his law). <sup class='fn'>4969</sup>
"Who feared (Allah) Most Gracious unseen and brought a heart\n\t\t\tturned in devotion (to Him): <sup class='fn'>4970</sup>
"Enter ye therein in Peace and Security; this is a Day of Eternal\n\t\t\tLife!" <sup class='fn'>4971</sup>
There will be for them therein all that they wish and more\n\t\t\tbesides in Our Presence. <sup class='fn'>4972</sup>

But how many generations before them did We destroy (for their\n\t\t\tSins) stronger in power than they? Then did they wander through\n\t\t\tthe land: Was there any place of escape (for them)? <sup class='fn'>4973</sup>
Verily in this is a Message for any that has a heart and\n\t\t\tunderstanding or who gives ear and earnestly witnesses (the\n\t\t\ttruth). <sup class='fn'>4974</sup>

We created the heavens and the earth and all between them in Six\n\t\t\tDays nor did any sense of weariness touch Us. <sup class='fn'>4975</sup>\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4976</sup> <sup class='fn'>4977</sup>
Bear then with patience all that they say and celebrate the\n\t\t\tpraises of thy Lord before the rising of the sun and before (its)\n\t\t\tsetting <sup class='fn'>4978</sup>
And during part of the night (also) celebrate His praises and (so\n\t\t\tlikewise) after the postures of adoration. <sup class='fn'>4979</sup>
And listen for the Day when the Caller will call out from a place\n\t\t\tquite near <sup class='fn'>4980</sup> <sup class='fn'>4981</sup>
The day when they will hear a (mighty) Blast in (very) truth):\n\t\t\tthat will be the day of Resurrection. <sup class='fn'>4982</sup>
Verily it is We Who give Life and Death; and to Us is the Final\n\t\t\tGoal--
The Day when the Earth will be rent asunder from (men) hurrying\n\t\t\tout: that will be a gathering together quite easy for Us.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4983</sup> <sup class='fn'>4984</sup>
We know best what they say; and thou art not one to ever awe them\n\t\t\tby force.  So admonish with the Qur'an such as fear My Warning!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4985</sup>
By the (Winds) that scatter broadcast; <sup class='fn'>4986</sup>\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4987</sup>
And those that lift and bear away heavy weights; <sup class='fn'>4988</sup>
And those that flow with ease and gentleness; <sup class='fn'>4989</sup>
And those that distribute and apportion by command <sup class='fn'>4990</sup>
Verily that which ye are promised is true; <sup class='fn'>4991</sup>
And verily Judgment and Justice must indeed come to pass.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4992</sup>
By the Sky with (its) numerous Paths <sup class='fn'>4993</sup>
Truly ye are in a doctrine discordant <sup class='fn'>4994</sup>
Through which are deluded (away from the Truth) such as would be\n\t\t\tdeluded. <sup class='fn'>4995</sup>
Woe to the falsehood-mongers
Those who (flounder) heedless in a flood of confusion:\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4996</sup>
They ask "when will be the Day of Judgment and Justice?"
(It will be) a Day when they will be tried (and tested) over the\n\t\t\tFire!
"Taste ye your trial! this is what ye used to ask to be\n\t\t\thastened!" <sup class='fn'>4997</sup>
As to the Righteous they will be in the midst of Gardens and\n\t\t\tSprings <sup class='fn'>4998</sup>
Taking joy in the things which their Lord gives them because\n\t\t\tbefore then they lived a good life.
They were in the habit of sleeping but little by night\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>4999</sup>
And in the hours of early dawn They (were found) praying for\n\t\t\tForgiveness; <sup class='fn'>5000</sup>
And in their wealth and possessions (was remembered) the right of\n\t\t\tthe (needy) him who asked and him who (for some reason) was\n\t\t\tprevented (from asking). <sup class='fn'>5001</sup>
On the earth are Signs for those of assured Faith
As also in your own selves: will ye not then see? <sup class='fn'>5002</sup>
And in heaven is your Sustenance as (also) that which ye are\n\t\t\tpromised. <sup class='fn'>5003</sup>
Then by the Lord of heaven and earth this is the very Truth as\n\t\t\tmuch as the fact that ye can speak intelligently to each other.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5004</sup>
Has the story reached thee of the honored guests of Abraham?\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5005</sup>
Behold they entered His presence and said: "Peace!" He said\n\t\t\t"Peace!" (and thought "these seem) unusual people." <sup class='fn'>5006</sup>\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5007</sup>
Then he turned quickly to his household brought out a fatted\n\t\t\tcalf. <sup class='fn'>5008</sup>
And placed it before them... He said "Will ye not eat?"
(When they did not eat) He conceived a fear of them.  They said\n\t\t\t"Fear not" and they gave him glad tidings of a son endowed with\n\t\t\tknowledge.
But his wife came forward (laughing) aloud: she smote her\n\t\t\tforehead and said: "a barren old woman!" <sup class='fn'>5009</sup>
They said "Even so has thy Lord spoken: and He is full of Wisdom\n\t\t\tand Knowledge." <sup class='fn'>5010</sup>
(Abraham) said: "And what O ye Messengers is your errand (now)?"
They said "We have been sent to a people (deep) in sin
"To bring on on them (a shower of) stones of clay (brimstone)\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5011</sup>
"Marked as from thy Lord for those who trespass beyond bounds."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5012</sup>
Then We evacuated those of the Believers who were there.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5013</sup>
But We found not there any just (Muslim) persons except in one\n\t\t\thouse: <sup class='fn'>5014</sup>
And We left there a Signs for such as fear the Grievous Penalty.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5015</sup>
And in Moses (was another Sign): Behold We sent him to Pharaoh\n\t\t\twith authority manifest. <sup class='fn'>5016</sup>
But (Pharaoh) turned back with his Chiefs and said "A sorcerer or\n\t\t\tone possessed!"
So We took him and his forces and threw them into the sea: and\n\t\t\this was the blame. <sup class='fn'>5017</sup>
And in the `Ad (people) (was another Sign): Behold We sent\n\t\t\tagainst them the devastating Wind: <sup class='fn'>5018</sup>
It left nothing whatever that it came up against but reduced it\n\t\t\tto ruin and rottenness.
And in the Thamud (was another Sign): Behold they were told\n\t\t\t"Enjoy (your brief day) for a little while!" <sup class='fn'>5019</sup>\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5020</sup>

But they insolently defied the command of their Lord: so the\n\t\t\tstunning noise (of an earthquake) seized them even while they\n\t\t\twere looking on. <sup class='fn'>5021</sup> <sup class='fn'>5022</sup>
Then they could not even stand (on their feet) nor could they\n\t\t\thelp themselves. <sup class='fn'>5023</sup>
So were the people of Noah before them: for they wickedly\n\t\t\ttransgressed. <sup class='fn'>5024</sup>
With the power and skill did We construct the Firmament: for it\n\t\t\tis We Who create the vastness of Space. <sup class='fn'>5025</sup>
And We have spread out the (spacious) earth: how excellently We\n\t\t\tdo spread out!
And of everything We have created pairs: that ye may receive\n\t\t\tinstruction. <sup class='fn'>5026</sup>
Hasten ye then (at once) to Allah: I am from Him a warner to you\n\t\t\tclear and open! <sup class='fn'>5027</sup>
And make not another an object of worship with Allah: I am from\n\t\t\tHim a Warner to you clear and open! <sup class='fn'>5028</sup>
Similarly no apostle came to the Peoples before them but they\n\t\t\tsaid (of him) in like manner "A sorcerer or one possessed"!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5029</sup>
Is this the legacy they have transmitted one to another? Nay they\n\t\t\tare themselves a people transgressing beyond bounds!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5030</sup>
So turn away from them: not thine is the blame. <sup class='fn'>5031</sup>
But teach (thy Message): for teaching benefits the Believers.
I have only created jinns and men that they may serve Me.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5032</sup>
No sustenance do I require of them nor do I require that they\n\t\t\tshould feed Me. <sup class='fn'>5033</sup>
For Allah is He Who gives (all) Sustenance Lord of Power\n\t\t\tSteadfast (for ever). <sup class='fn'>5034</sup>
For the wrongdoers their portion is like unto the portion of\n\t\t\ttheir fellows (of earlier generations): then let them not ask Me\n\t\t\tto hasten (that portion)! <sup class='fn'>5035</sup>
Woe then to the Unbelievers on account of that day of theirs\n\t\t\twhich they have been promised! <sup class='fn'>5036</sup>
By the Mount (of Revelation); <sup class='fn'>5037</sup>
By a Decree Inscribed <sup class='fn'>5038</sup>
In a Scroll unfolded;
By the much-frequented House; <sup class='fn'>5039</sup>
By the Canopy Raised High; <sup class='fn'>5040</sup>
And by the Ocean filled with Swell <sup class='fn'>5041</sup> <sup class='fn'>5042</sup>
Verily the Doom of thy Lord will indeed come to pass
There is none can avert it
On the day when the firmament will be in dreadful commotion.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5043</sup>
And the mountain will fly hither and thither. <sup class='fn'>5044</sup>
Then woe that Day to those that treat (truth) as Falsehood\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5045</sup>
That play (and paddle) in shallow trifles.
That Day shall they be thrust down to the Fire of Hell\n\t\t\tirresistibly.
"This" it will be said "is the Fire which ye were wont to deny!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5046</sup>
"Is this then a fake or is it ye that do not see? <sup class='fn'>5047</sup>
"Burn ye therein: the same is it to you whether ye bear it with\n\t\t\tpatience or not: Ye but receive the recompense of your (own)\n\t\t\tdeeds." <sup class='fn'>5048</sup>
As to the Righteous they will be in Gardens and in Happiness\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5049</sup>
Enjoying the (Bliss) which their Lord hath bestowed on them and\n\t\t\ttheir Lord shall deliver them from the Penalty of the Fire.
(To them will be said:) "Eat and drink ye with profit and health\n\t\t\tbecause of your (good) deeds." <sup class='fn'>5050</sup> <sup class='fn'>5051</sup>

They will recline (with ease) on Thrones (of dignity) arranged in\n\t\t\tranks; and We shall join them to Companions with beautiful big\n\t\t\tand lustrous eyes. <sup class='fn'>5052</sup> <sup class='fn'>5053</sup>

And those who believe and whose families follow them in Faith to
			them shall We join their families: nor shall We deprive them (of
			the fruit) of aught of their works: (Yet) is each individual in
			pledge for his deeds. <sup class='fn'>5054</sup> <sup class='fn'>5055</sup>
And We shall bestow on them of fruit and meat anything they shall\n\t\t\tdesire. <sup class='fn'>5056</sup>
They shall there exchange one with another a (loving) cup free of\n\t\t\tfrivolity free of all taint of ill. <sup class='fn'>5057</sup>
Round about them will serve (devoted) to them youths (handsome)\n\t\t\tas Pearls well-guarded. <sup class='fn'>5058</sup>
They will advance to each other engaging in mutual enquiry.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5059</sup>
They will say: "Aforetime We were not without fear for the sake\n\t\t\tof our people. <sup class='fn'>5060</sup>
"But Allah has been good to us and has delivered us from the\n\t\t\tPenalty of the Scorching Wind. <sup class='fn'>5061</sup>
"Truly we did call unto Him from of old: truly it is He the\n\t\t\tBeneficent the Merciful" <sup class='fn'>5062</sup>
Therefore proclaim thou the praises (of thy Lord): For by the\n\t\t\tGrace of thy Lord thou art no (vulgar) soothsayer nor art thou\n\t\t\tone possessed. <sup class='fn'>5063</sup>
Or do they say "A Poet! we await for him some calamity (hatched)\n\t\t\tby Time!" <sup class='fn'>5064</sup>
Say thou: "Await ye! I too will wait along with you!"\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5065</sup>
Is it that their faculties of understanding urge them to this or\n\t\t\tare they but a people transgressing beyond bounds? <sup class='fn'>5066</sup>\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5067</sup>
Or do they say "He fabricated the (Message)"? Nay they have no\n\t\t\tfaith! <sup class='fn'>5068</sup>
Let them then produce a recital like unto it  if (it be) they\n\t\t\tspeak the Truth!
Were they created of nothing or were they themselves the\n\t\t\tcreators? <sup class='fn'>5069</sup>
Or did they create the heavens and the earth? Nay they have no\n\t\t\tfirm belief. <sup class='fn'>5070</sup>
Or are the Treasures of thy Lord with them or are they the\n\t\t\tmanagers (of affairs)? <sup class='fn'>5071</sup>
Or have they a ladder by which they can (climb up to heaven and)\n\t\t\tlisten (to its secrets)? Then let (such a) listener of theirs\n\t\t\tproduce a manifest proof. <sup class='fn'>5072</sup>
Or has He only daughters and ye have sons? <sup class='fn'>5073</sup>
Or is it that thou dost ask for a reward so that they are\n\t\t\tburdened with a load of debt? <sup class='fn'>5074</sup>
Or that the Unseen is in their hands and they write it down?\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5075</sup>
Or do they intend a plot (against thee)? But those who defy Allah\n\t\t\tare themselves involved in a Plot! <sup class='fn'>5076</sup>
Or have they a god other then Allah? exalted is Allah far above\n\t\t\tthe things they associate with Him! <sup class='fn'>5077</sup>
Were they to see a piece of the sky falling (on them) they would\n\t\t\t(only) say: "clouds gathered in heaps!" <sup class='fn'>5078</sup>
So leave them alone until they encounter that Day of theirs\n\t\t\twherein they shall (perforce) swoon (with terror) <sup class='fn'>5079</sup>
The Day when their plotting will avail them nothing and no help\n\t\t\tshall be Given them.
And verily for those who do wrong there is another punishment\n\t\t\tbesides this: but most of them understand not. <sup class='fn'>5080</sup>

Now await in patience the command of thy Lord: for verily thou\n\t\t\tart in our eyes: and celebrate the praises of thy Lord the while\n\t\t\tthou standest forth. <sup class='fn'>5081</sup> <sup class='fn'>5082</sup>
And for part of the night also praise thou Him and at the retreat\n\t\t\tof the stars! <sup class='fn'>5083</sup> <sup class='fn'>5084</sup>
By the Star when it goes down <sup class='fn'>5085</sup>
Your Companion is neither astray nor being misled <sup class='fn'>5086</sup>
Nor does he say (aught) of (his own) Desire.
It is no less than inspiration sent down to him:
He was taught by one mighty in Power <sup class='fn'>5087</sup>
Endued with Wisdom: For he appeared (in stately form)
While he was in the highest part of the horizon: <sup class='fn'>5088</sup>
Then he approached and came closer
And was at a distance of but two bow-lengths or (even) nearer;\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5089</sup>
So did (Allah) convey the inspiration to His Servant (conveyed)\n\t\t\twhat He (meant) to convey. <sup class='fn'>5090</sup>
The (Prophet's) (mind and) heart in no way falsified that which\n\t\t\the saw. <sup class='fn'>5091</sup>
Will ye then dispute with him concerning what he saw?
For indeed he saw him at a second descent. <sup class='fn'>5092</sup>
Near the Lote-tree beyond which none may pass: <sup class='fn'>5093</sup>
Near it is the Garden of Abode. <sup class='fn'>5094</sup>
Behold the Lote-tree was shrouded (in mystery unspeakable!)
(His) sight never swerved nor did it go wrong!
For truly did he see of the Signs of his Lord the Greatest!
Have ye seen Lat an Uzza <sup class='fn'>5095</sup>
And another the third (goddess) Manat?
What! for you the male sex and for Him the female? <sup class='fn'>5096</sup>
Behold such would be indeed a division most unfair!

These are nothing but names which ye have devised  ye and your
			fathers  for which Allah has sent down no authority (whatever). 
			They follow nothing but conjecture and what their own souls
			desire! Even though there has already come to them Guidance from
			their Lord! <sup class='fn'>5097</sup> <sup class='fn'>5098</sup>
Nay shall man have (just) anything he hankers after?\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5099</sup>
But it is to Allah that the End and the Beginning (of all things)\n\t\t\tbelong.

How many so ever be the angels in the heavens their intercession
			will avail nothing except after Allah has given leave for whom He
			pleases and that he is acceptable to Him. <sup class='fn'>5100</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>5101</sup>
Those who believe not in the Hereafter name the angels with\n\t\t\tfemale names. <sup class='fn'>5102</sup>
But they have no knowledge therein.  They follow nothing but\n\t\t\tconjecture; and conjecture avails nothing against Truth.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5103</sup>
Therefore shun those who turn away from Our Message and desire\n\t\t\tnothing but the life of this world.
That is as far as knowledge will reach them.  Verily thy Lord\n\t\t\tknoweth best those who stray from His path and He knoweth best\n\t\t\tthose who receive guidance. <sup class='fn'>5104</sup>

Yea to Allah belongs all that is in the heavens and on earth; so\n\t\t\tthat He rewards those who do evil according to their deeds and He\n\t\t\trewards those who do good with what is best. <sup class='fn'>5105</sup>

Those who avoid great sins and shameful deeds, Only (falling
			into) small faults--verily thy Lord is ample in forgiveness.  He
			knows you well when He brings you out of the earth and when ye
			are hidden in your mother's wombs therefore justify not
			yourselves.  He knows best who it is that guards against evil.
			<sup class='fn'>5106</sup> <sup class='fn'>5107</sup>
Seest thou one who turns back. <sup class='fn'>5108</sup>
Gives a little then hardens (his heart)?
What! has he knowledge of the Unseen so that he can see?\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5109</sup>
Nay is he not acquainted with what is in the books of Moses\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5110</sup>
And of Abraham who fulfilled his engagements? <sup class='fn'>5111</sup>\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5112</sup>
Namely that no bearer of burdens can bear the burden of another;\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5113</sup>
That man can have nothing but what he strives for;
That (the fruit of) his striving will soon come in sight;\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5114</sup>
Then will he be rewarded with a reward complete;
That to thy Lord is the final Goal; <sup class='fn'>5115</sup>
That it is He who Granteth Laughter and Tears;
That it is He who Granteth Death and Life;
That He did create in pairs male and female. <sup class='fn'>5116</sup>
From a seed when lodged (in its place);
That He hath promised a Second Creation (raising of the Dead)\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5117</sup>
That it is He Who giveth wealth and satisfaction; <sup class='fn'>5118</sup>
That He is the Lord of Sirius (the Mighty Star); <sup class='fn'>5119</sup>
And that it is He Who destroyed the (powerful) ancient `Ad\n\t\t\t(people) <sup class='fn'>5120</sup>
And the Thamud nor gave them a lease of perpetual life.
And before them the people of Noah for that they were (all) Most\n\t\t\tunjust and most insolent transgressors.
And He destroyed the Overthrown Cities (of Sodom and Gomorrah)\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5121</sup>
So that (ruins unknown) have covered them up.
Then which of the gifts of thy Lord (O man) wilt thou dispute\n\t\t\tabout? <sup class='fn'>5122</sup>
This is a Warner of the (series of) Warners of old! <sup class='fn'>5123</sup>
The (Judgment) ever approaching draws nigh:
No (soul) but Allah can lay it bare.
Do ye then wonder at this recital? <sup class='fn'>5124</sup>
