			eyes of their Lord: they shall have their Reward and their Light
			but those who reject Allah and deny Our Signs they are the
			Companions of Hell-Fire. <sup class='fn'>5299</sup> <sup class='fn'>5300</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>5301</sup>

Know ye (all) that the life of this world is but play and
			amusement pomp and mutual boasting and multiplying (in rivalry)
			among yourselves riches and children: Here is a similitude: How
			rain and the growth which it brings forth delight (the hearts of)
			the tillers; soon it withers; thou wilt see it grow yellow; then
			it becomes dry and crumbles away.  But in the Hereafter is a
			Penalty severe (for the devotees of wrong) and Forgiveness from
			Allah and (His) Good Pleasure (for the devotees of Allah).  And
			what is the life of this world but goods and chattels of
			deception? <sup class='fn'>5302</sup> <sup class='fn'>5303</sup> <sup class='fn'>5304</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>5305</sup>

Be ye foremost (in seeking) forgiveness from your Lord and a
			Garden (of Bliss) the width whereof is as the width of heaven and
			earth prepared for those who believe in Allah and His apostles:
			that is the Grace of Allah which He bestows on whom He pleases:
			and Allah is the Lord of Grace abounding. <sup class='fn'>5306</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>5307</sup>

No misfortune can happen on earth or in your souls but is\n\t\t\trecorded in a decree before We bring it into existence: that is\n\t\t\ttruly easy for Allah: <sup class='fn'>5308</sup> <sup class='fn'>5309</sup>
In order that ye may not despair over matters that pass you by\n\t\t\tnor exult over favors bestowed upon you.  For Allah loveth not\n\t\t\tany vainglorious boaster <sup class='fn'>5310</sup>

Such persons as are covetous and commend covetousness to men. \n\t\t\tAnd if any turn back (from Allah's Way) verily Allah is free of\n\t\t\tall needs worthy of all praise. <sup class='fn'>5311</sup> <sup class='fn'>5312</sup>

We sent aforetime our apostles with Clear Signs and sent down
			with them the Book and the Balance (of Right and Wrong) that men
			may stand forth in justice; and We sent down Iron in which is
			(material for) mighty war as well as many benefits for mankind
			that Allah may test who it is that will help unseen Him and His
			apostles; for Allah is Full of Strength exalted in Might (and
			able to enforce His will). <sup class='fn'>5313</sup> <sup class='fn'>5314</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>5315</sup> <sup class='fn'>5316</sup> <sup class='fn'>5317</sup>

And We sent Noah and Abraham and established in their line
			Prophethood and Revelation: and some of them were on right
			guidance but many of them became rebellious transgressors.
			<sup class='fn'>5319</sup>

Then in their wake We followed them up with (others of) Our
			apostles: We sent after them Jesus the son of Mary and bestowed
			on him the Gospel; and We ordained in the hearts of those who
			followed him Compassion and Mercy.  But the monasticism which
			they invented for themselves We did not prescribe for them: (We
			commanded) only the seeking for the Good pleasure of Allah; but
			that they did not foster as they should have done.  Yet We
			bestowed on those among them who believed their (due) reward but
			many of them are rebellious transgressors. <sup class='fn'>5320</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>5321</sup> <sup class='fn'>5322</sup> <sup class='fn'>5323</sup> <sup class='fn'>5324</sup>

O ye that believe! fear Allah and believe in His apostle and He
			will bestow on you a double portion of His Mercy: He will provide
			for you a light by which ye shall walk (straight in your path)
			and He will forgive you (your past): For Allah is Oft-Forgiving. 
			Most Merciful: <sup class='fn'>5325</sup> <sup class='fn'>5326</sup> <sup class='fn'>5327</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>5328</sup>

That the People of the Book may know that they have no power
			whatever over the Grace of Allah that (His) Grace is (entirely)
			in his hand to bestow it on whomsoever He wills.  For Allah is
			the Lord of Grace abounding. <sup class='fn'>5329</sup>

Allah has indeed heard (and accepted) the statement of the woman
			who pleads with thee concerning her husband and carries her
			complaint (in prayer) to Allah: and Allah (always) hears the
			arguments between both sides among you: for Allah hears and sees
			(all things). <sup class='fn'>5330</sup> <sup class='fn'>5331</sup>

If any men among you divorce their wives by Zihar (calling them
			mothers) they cannot be their mothers: none can be their mothers
			except those who gave them birth.  And in fact they use words
			(both) iniquitous and false: but truly Allah is one that blots
			out (sins) and forgives (again and again). <sup class='fn'>5332</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>5333</sup> <sup class='fn'>5334</sup>

But those who divorce their wives by Zihar then wish to go back
			on the words they uttered (it is ordained that such a one) should
			free a slave before they touch each other: this are ye admonished
			to perform: and Allah is well-acquainted with (all) that ye do.
			<sup class='fn'>5335</sup>

And if any has not (the wherewithal) he should fast for two
			months consecutively before they touch each other.  But if any is
			unable to do so he should feed sixty indigent ones.  This that ye
			may show your faith in Allah and His Apostle.  Those are limits
			(set by) Allah. For those who Reject (Him) there is a grievous
			Penalty. <sup class='fn'>5336</sup> <sup class='fn'>5337</sup> <sup class='fn'>5338</sup>

Those who resist Allah and His Apostle will be humbled to dust as\n\t\t\twere those before them: for We have already sent down clear\n\t\t\tSigns.\tAnd the Unbelievers (will have) a humiliating Penalty .

On the Day that Allah will raise them all up (again) and show
			them the truth (and meaning) of their conduct.	Allah has
			reckoned its (value) though they may have forgotten it: for Allah
			is Witness to all things. <sup class='fn'>5340</sup>

Seest thou not that Allah doth know (all) that is in the heavens
			and on earth? There is not a secret consultation between three
			but He makes the fourth among them nor between five but He makes
			the sixth nor between fewer nor more but He is in their midst
			wheresoever they be: in the end will He tell them the truth of
			their conduct on the Day of Judgment for Allah has full knowledge
			of all things. <sup class='fn'>5341</sup>

Turnest thou not thy sight towards those who were forbidden
			secret counsels yet revert to that which they were forbidden (to
			do)? And they hold secret counsels among themselves for iniquity
			and hostility and disobedience to the Apostle.	And when they
			come to thee they salute thee not as Allah salutes thee (but in
			crooked ways): and they say to themselves "Why does not Allah
			punish us for our words?" Enough for them is Hell: in it will
			they burn and evil is that destination! <sup class='fn'>5342</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>5343</sup> <sup class='fn'>5344</sup>

O ye who believe! when ye hold secret counsel do it not for
			iniquity and hostility and disobedience to the Prophet; but do it
			for righteousness and self-restraint; and fear Allah to whom ye
			shall be brought back. <sup class='fn'>5345</sup>

Secret counsels are only (inspired) by the Evil One in order that
			he may cause grief to the Believers; but he cannot harm them in
			the least except as Allah permits; and on Allah let the Believers
			put their trust. <sup class='fn'>5346</sup>

O ye who believe! When ye are told to make room in the assemblies
			(spread out and) make room: (Ample) room will Allah provide for
			you. And when ye are told to rise up rise up: Allah will raise up
			to (suitable) ranks (and degrees) those of you who believe and
			who have been granted Knowledge: and Allah is well-acquainted
			with all ye do. <sup class='fn'>5347</sup> <sup class='fn'>5348</sup> <sup class='fn'>5349</sup>

O ye who believe! W hen ye consult the Apostle in private spend
			something in charity before your private consultation.	That will
			be best for you and most conducive to purity (of conduct).  But
			if ye find not (the wherewithal) Allah is Oft-Forgiving Most
			Merciful. <sup class='fn'>5350</sup> <sup class='fn'>5351</sup>

Is it that ye are afraid of spending sums in charity before your
			private consultation (with him)? If then ye do not so and Allah
			forgives you then (at least) establish regular prayer; practice
			regular charity; and obey Allah and His Apostle: and Allah is
			well-acquainted will all that ye do. <sup class='fn'>5352</sup> <sup class='fn'>5353</sup>

Turnest thou not thy attention to those who turn (in friendship)
			to such as have the Wrath of Allah upon them? They are neither of
			you nor of them and they swear to falsehood knowingly.
			<sup class='fn'>5354</sup> <sup class='fn'>5355</sup> <sup class='fn'>5356</sup>
Allah has prepared for them a severe Penalty: evil indeed are\n\t\t\ttheir deeds.
They have made their oaths a screen (for their misdeeds): Thus\n\t\t\tthey obstruct (men) from the Path of Allah: therefore shall they\n\t\t\thave a humiliating Penalty. <sup class='fn'>5357</sup>
Of no profit whatever to them against Allah will be their riches\n\t\t\tnor their sons: They will be Companions of the Fire to dwell\n\t\t\ttherein (for aye)! <sup class='fn'>5358</sup>

One day will Allah raise them all up (for Judgment): then will
			they swear to Him as they swear to you: and they think that they
			have something (to stand upon): No indeed! they are but liars!
			<sup class='fn'>5359</sup>

The Evil One has got the better of them: So he has made them lose
			the remembrance of Allah.  They are the Party of the Evil One. 
			Truly it is the Party of the Evil One that will perish!
			<sup class='fn'>5360</sup>
Those who resist Allah and His Apostle will be among those most\n\t\t\thumiliated. <sup class='fn'>5361</sup>
Allah has decreed: "It is I and My Apostle who must prevail": For\n\t\t\tAllah is One full of strength able to enforce His Will.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5362</sup>

Thou wilt not find any people who believe in Allah and the Last
			Day loving those who resist Allah and His Apostle even though
			they were their fathers or their sons or their brothers or their
			kindred.  For such He has written Faith in their hearts and
			strengthened them with a spirit from Himself.  And He will admit
			them to Gardens beneath which Rivers flow to dwell therein (for
			ever).	Allah will be well pleased with them and they with Him. 
			They are the Party of Allah. Truly it is the Party of Allah that
			will achieve Felicity. <sup class='fn'>5363</sup> <sup class='fn'>5364</sup> <sup class='fn'>5365</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>5366</sup> <sup class='fn'>5367</sup>
Whatever is in the heavens and on earth let it declare the\n\t\t\tPraises and Glory of Allah: for He is the Exalted in Might the\n\t\t\tWise. <sup class='fn'>5368</sup>

It is He who got out the Unbelievers among the People of the Book
			from their homes at the first gathering (of the forces).  Little
			did ye think that they would get out: and they thought that their
			fortresses would defend them from Allah! but the (wrath of) Allah
			came to them from quarters from which they little expected (it)
			and cast terror into their hearts so that they destroyed their
			dwellings by their own hands and the hands of the Believers. 
			Take warning then O ye with eyes (to see)! <sup class='fn'>5369</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>5370</sup> <sup class='fn'>5371</sup> <sup class='fn'>5372</sup>

And had it not been that Allah has decreed banishment for them He
			would certainly have punished them in this world: and in the
			Hereafter they shall (certainly) have the Punishment of the Fire.
			<sup class='fn'>5373</sup>
That is because they resisted Allah and His Apostle: and if\n\t\t\tanyone resists Allah verily Allah is severe in Punishment.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5374</sup>

Whether ye cut down (o ye Muslims!) the tender palm-trees or ye
			left them standing on their roots it was by leave of Allah and in
			order that He might cover with shame the rebellious
			transgressors. <sup class='fn'>5375</sup> <sup class='fn'>5376</sup>

What Allah has bestowed on His Apostle (and taken away) from them
			for this ye made no expedition with either cavalry or camelry:
			but Allah gives power to His apostles over any He pleases: and
			Allah has power over all things. <sup class='fn'>5377</sup> <sup class='fn'>5378</sup>

What Allah has bestowed on His Apostle (and taken away) from the
			people of the townships belongs to Allah to His Apostle and to
			kindred and orphans the needy and the wayfarer; in order that it
			may not (Merely) make a circuit between the wealth among you.  So
			take what the Apostle assigns to you and deny yourselves that
			which he withholds from you. And fear Allah; for Allah is strict
			in Punishment. <sup class='fn'>5379</sup> <sup class='fn'>5380</sup> <sup class='fn'>5381</sup>

(Some part is due) to the indigent Muhajirs those who were
			expelled from their homes and their property while seeking Grace
			from Allah and (His) Good pleasure and aiding Allah and His
			Apostle: such are indeed the sincere ones <sup class='fn'>5382</sup>

But those who before them had homes (in Medina) and had adopted
			the Faith show their affection to such as came to them for refuge
			and entertain no desire in their hearts for things given to the
			(latter) but give them preference over themselves even though
			poverty was their (own lot).  And those saved from the
			covetousness of their own souls they are the ones that achieve
			prosperity. <sup class='fn'>5383</sup>

And those who came after them say: "Our Lord! Forgive us and our
			brethren who came before us into the Faith and leave not in our
			hearts rancor (or sense of injury) against those who have
			believed our Lord! Thou art indeed Full of Kindness Most
			Merciful." <sup class='fn'>5384</sup> <sup class='fn'>5385</sup>

Hast thou not observed the Hypocrites say to their misbelieving
			brethren among the People of the Book?	"If ye are expelled We
			too will go out with you and we will never hearken to anyone in
			your affair; and if ye are attacked (in fight) we will help you."
			But Allah is witness that they are indeed liars. <sup class='fn'>5386</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>5387</sup>

If they are expelled never will they go out with them; and if
			they are attacked (in fight) they will never help them; and if
			they do help them they will turn their backs; so they will
			receive no help. <sup class='fn'>5388</sup>
Of a truth ye are stronger (than they) because of the terror in\n\t\t\ttheir hearts (sent) by Allah.  This is because they are men\n\t\t\tdevoid of understanding. <sup class='fn'>5389</sup>

They will not fight you (even) together except in fortified
			townships or from behind walls.  Strong is their fighting
			(spirit) amongst themselves: thou wouldst think they were united
			but their hearts are divided: that is because they are a people
			devoid of wisdom. <sup class='fn'>5390</sup> <sup class='fn'>5391</sup>
Like those who lately preceded them they have tasted the evil\n\t\t\tresult of their conduct and (in the Hereafter there is) for them\n\t\t\ta grievous Penalty <sup class='fn'>5392</sup>

(Their allies deceived them) like the Evil One when he says to
			man "Deny Allah"; but when (man) denies Allah (the Evil One) says
			"I am free of thee: I do fear Allah the Lord of the Worlds!"
			<sup class='fn'>5393</sup>
The end of both will be that they will go into the Fire dwelling\n\t\t\ttherein for ever. Such is the reward of wrong-doers.

O ye who believe! Fear Allah and let every soul look to what
			(provision) he has sent forth for the morrow.  Yea fear Allah:
			for Allah is well-acquainted with (all) that ye do. <sup class='fn'>5394</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>5395</sup>
And be ye not like those who forget Allah; and He made them\n\t\t\tforget their own souls! such are the rebellious transgressors!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5396</sup>
Not equal are the Companions of the Fire and the Companions of\n\t\t\tthe Garden: it is the Companions of the Garden that will achieve\n\t\t\tFelicity. <sup class='fn'>5397</sup>

Had We sent down this Qur'an on a mountain verily thou would have
			seen it humble itself and cleave asunder for fear of Allah such
			are the similitudes which We propound to men that they may
			reflect. <sup class='fn'>5398</sup> <sup class='fn'>5399</sup>
Allah is He than whom there is no other god Who knows (all\n\t\t\tthings) both secret and open; He Most Gracious Most Merciful.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5400</sup>

Allah is He other than whom there is no other god the sovereign the
			Holy One the Source of Peace (and Perfection).	The Guardian of
			Faith the Preserver of Safety the Exalted in Might the
			Irresistible the Supreme: Glory to Allah! (high is He) above the
			partners they attribute to Him. <sup class='fn'>5401</sup> <sup class='fn'>5402</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>5403</sup> <sup class='fn'>5404</sup>

He is Allah the Creator the Evolver the Bestower of Forms (or
			colors).  To Him belong the Most Beautiful Names: Whatever is in
			the heavens and on earth doth declare His Praises and Glory: and
			He is the exalted in Might the Wise. <sup class='fn'>5405</sup> <sup class='fn'>5406</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>5407</sup> <sup class='fn'>5408</sup>

O ye who believe! take not My enemies and yours as friends (or
			protectors) offering them (your) love even though they have
			rejected the Truth that has come to you and have (on the
			contrary) driven out the Prophet and yourselves (from your homes)
			(simply) because ye believe in Allah your Lord! If ye have come
			out to strive in My Way and to seek My Good Pleasure (take them
			not as friends) holding secret converse of love (and friendship)
			with them: for I know full well all that ye conceal and all that
			ye reveal.  And any of you that does this has strayed from the
			Straight Path. <sup class='fn'>5409</sup> <sup class='fn'>5410</sup>

If they were to get the better of you they would behave to you as
			enemies and stretch forth their hands and their tongues against
			you for evil; and they desire that ye should reject the Truth.
			<sup class='fn'>5411</sup>
Of no profit to you will be your relatives and your children on\n\t\t\tthe Day of Judgment: He will judge between you: for Allah sees\n\t\t\twell and that ye do. <sup class='fn'>5412</sup>

There is for you an excellent example (to follow) in Abraham and
			those with him when they said to their people: "We are clear of
			you and of whatever ye worship besides Allah: we have rejected
			you and there has arisen between us and you enmity and hatred
			forever unless ye believe in Allah and Him alone": But not when
			Abraham said to his father: "I will pray for forgiveness for thee
			though I have no power (to get) aught on thy behalf from Allah."
			(They prayed): "Our Lord! in Thee do we trust and to Thee do we
			turn in repentance: to Thee is (our) final Goal. <sup class='fn'>5413</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>5414</sup> <sup class='fn'>5415</sup> <sup class='fn'>5416</sup>
"Our Lord! Make us not a (test and) trial for the Unbelievers but\n\t\t\tforgive us our Lord! For Thou art the Exalted in Might the Wise."\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5417</sup>

There was indeed in them an excellent example for you to follow
			for those whose hope is in Allah and in the Last Day.  But if any
			turn away truly Allah is Free of all Wants Worthy of all Praise.
			<sup class='fn'>5418</sup> <sup class='fn'>5419</sup>

It may be that Allah will grant love (and friendship) between you
			and those whom ye (now) hold as enemies: for Allah has power
			(over all things); and Allah is Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful.
			<sup class='fn'>5420</sup>

Allah forbids you not with regard to those who fight you not for
			(your) Faith nor drive you out of your homes from dealing kindly
			and justly with them: for Allah loveth those who are just.
			<sup class='fn'>5421</sup>

Allah only forbids you with regard to those who fight you for
			(your) Faith and drive you out of your homes and support (others)
			in driving you out from turning to them (for friendship and
			protection). It is such as turn to them (in these circumstances)
			that do wrong.

O ye who believe! when there come to you believing women refugees
			examine (and test) them: Allah knows best as to their Faith: if
			ye ascertain that they are Believers then send them not back to
			the Unbelievers.  They are not lawful (wives) for the Unbelievers
			nor are the (Unbelievers) lawful (husbands) for them.  But pay
			the Unbelievers what they have spent (on their dower).	And there
			will be no blame on you if ye marry them on payment of their
			dower to them.	But hold not to the guardianship of unbelieving
			women: ask for what ye have spent on their dowers and let the
			(Unbelievers) ask for what they have spent (on the dowers of
			women who come over to you).  Such is the command of Allah: He
			judges (with justice) between you: and Allah is Full of Knowledge
			and Wisdom. <sup class='fn'>5422</sup> <sup class='fn'>5423</sup> <sup class='fn'>5424</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>5425</sup>

And if any of your wives deserts you to the Unbelievers and ye
			have an accession (by the coming over of a woman from the other
			side) then pay to those whose wives have deserted the equivalent
			of what they had spent (on their (dower): and fear Allah in Whom
			ye believe. <sup class='fn'>5426</sup>

O Prophet! when believing women come to thee to take the oath of
			fealty to thee that they will not associate in worship any other
			thing whatever with Allah that they will not steal that they will
			not commit adultery (or fornication) that they will not kill
			their children that they will not utter slander intentionally
			forging falsehood and that they will not disobey thee in any just
			matter	then do thou receive their fealty and pray to Allah for
			the forgiveness (of their sins): for Allah is Oft-Forgiving Most
			Merciful. <sup class='fn'>5427</sup> <sup class='fn'>5428</sup>

O ye who believe! turn not (for friendship) to people on whom is
			the Wrath of Allah.  Of the Hereafter they are already in despair
			just as the Unbelievers are in despair about those (buried) in
			graves. <sup class='fn'>5429</sup> <sup class='fn'>5430</sup>
Whatever is in the heavens and on earth let it declare the\n\t\t\tPraises and Glory of Allah: for He is the Exalted in Might the\n\t\t\tWise. <sup class='fn'>5431</sup>
O ye who believe! why say ye that which ye do not? <sup class='fn'>5432</sup>
Grievously odious is it in the sight of Allah that ye say that\n\t\t\twhich ye do not.
Truly Allah loves those who fight in His Cause in battle array as\n\t\t\tif they were a solid cemented structure. <sup class='fn'>5433</sup>

And remember Moses said to his people: "O my people! why do ye
			vex and insult me though ye know that I am the apostle of Allah
			(sent) to you?" Then when they went wrong Allah let their hearts
			go wrong: for Allah guides not those who are rebellious
			transgressors. <sup class='fn'>5434</sup> <sup class='fn'>5435</sup>

And remember Jesus the son of Mary said: "O Children of Israel! I
			am the apostle of Allah (sent) to you confirming the Law (which
			came) before me and giving glad Tidings of an Apostle to come
			after me whose name shall be Ahmad." But when he came to them
			with Clear Signs they said "This is evident sorcery!"
			<sup class='fn'>5436</sup> <sup class='fn'>5437</sup> <sup class='fn'>5438</sup> <sup class='fn'>5439</sup>
Who doth greater wrong than one who invents falsehood against\n\t\t\tAllah even as he is being invited to Islam? And Allah guides not\n\t\t\tthose who do wrong. <sup class='fn'>5440</sup>

Their intention is to extinguish Allah's Light (by blowing) with\n\t\t\ttheir mouths: but Allah will complete (the revelation of) His\n\t\t\tLight even though the Unbelievers may detest (it). <sup class='fn'>5441</sup>
It is He Who has sent His Apostle with Guidance and the Religion\n\t\t\tof Truth that he may proclaim it over all religion even though\n\t\t\tthe Pagans may detest (it). <sup class='fn'>5442</sup>
O ye who believe! shall I lead you to a bargain that will save\n\t\t\tyou from a grievous Penalty? <sup class='fn'>5443</sup>

That ye believe in Allah and His Apostle and that ye strive (your\n\t\t\tutmost) in the Cause of Allah with your property and your\n\t\t\tpersons: that will be best for you if ye but knew! <sup class='fn'>5444</sup>
He will forgive you your sins and admit you to Gardens beneath\n\t\t\twhich rivers flow and to beautiful mansions in Gardens of\n\t\t\tEternity: that is indeed the supreme Achievement.
And another (favor will He bestow) which ye do love help from\n\t\t\tAllah and a speedy victory: so give the Glad Tidings to the\n\t\t\tBelievers. <sup class='fn'>5445</sup>

O ye who believe! be ye helpers of Allah: as said Jesus the son
			of Mary to the Disciples "Who will be my helpers to (the work of)
			Allah?" Said the Disciples "We are Allah's helpers!" Then a
			portion of the Children of Israel believed and a portion
			disbelieved: but We gave power to those who believed against
			their enemies and they became the ones that prevailed.
			<sup class='fn'>5446</sup> <sup class='fn'>5447</sup> <sup class='fn'>5448</sup>

Whatever is in the heavens and on earth doth declare the Praises\n\t\t\tand Glory of Allah the Sovereign the Holy One the Exalted in\n\t\t\tMight the Wise. <sup class='fn'>5449</sup> <sup class='fn'>5450</sup>

It is He Who has sent amongst the Unlettered an apostle from
			among themselves to rehearse to them His Signs to sanctify them
			and to instruct them in Scripture and Wisdom although they had
			been before in manifest error <sup class='fn'>5451</sup> <sup class='fn'>5452</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>5453</sup> <sup class='fn'>5454</sup>
As well as (to confer all these benefits upon) others of them who\n\t\t\thave not already joined them: and He is Exalted in Might Wise.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5455</sup>
Such is the Bounty of Allah which He bestows on whom He will: and\n\t\t\tAllah is the Lord of the highest bounty. <sup class='fn'>5456</sup>

The similitude of those who were charged with the (obligations of
			the) Mosaic Law but who subsequently failed in those
			(obligations) is that of a donkey which carries huge tomes (but
			understands them not). Evil is the similitude of people who
			falsify the Signs of Allah: and Allah guides not people who do
			wrong. <sup class='fn'>5457</sup>

Say: "O ye that stand on Judaism! if ye think that ye are friends\n\t\t\tto Allah to the exclusion of (other) men then express your desire\n\t\t\tfor Death if ye are truthful!" <sup class='fn'>5458</sup> <sup class='fn'>5459</sup>
But never will they express their desire (for Death) because of\n\t\t\tthe (deeds) their hands have sent on before them! And Allah knows\n\t\t\twell those that do wrong!

Say " The Death from which ye flee will truly overtake you: then
			will ye be sent back to the Knower of things secret and open: and
			He will tell you (the truth of) the things that ye did!"
			<sup class='fn'>5460</sup>

O ye who believe! when the call is proclaimed to prayer on Friday
			(the Day of Assembly) hasten earnestly to the Remembrance of
			Allah and leave off business (and traffic): that is best for you
			if ye but knew! <sup class='fn'>5461</sup> <sup class='fn'>5462</sup> <sup class='fn'>5463</sup>

And when the Prayer is finished then may ye disperse through the
			land and seek of the Bounty of Allah: and celebrate the Praises
			of Allah often (and without stint): that ye may prosper.
			<sup class='fn'>5464</sup>

But when they see some bargain or some amusement they disperse
			headlong to it and leave thee standing.  Say: "The (blessing)
			from the Presence of Allah is better than any amusement or
			bargain! And Allah is the Best to provide (for all needs)."
			<sup class='fn'>5465</sup>

When the Hypocrites come to thee they say "We bear witness that
			thou art indeed the Apostle of Allah." Yea Allah knoweth that
			thou art indeed His Apostle and Allah beareth witness that the
			Hypocrites are indeed liars. <sup class='fn'>5466</sup>
They have made their oaths a screen (for their misdeeds): thus\n\t\t\tthey obstruct (men) from the Path of Allah: truly evil are their\n\t\t\tdeeds. <sup class='fn'>5467</sup>
That is because they believed then they rejected Faith: so a seal\n\t\t\twas set on their hearts: therefore they understand not.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5468</sup>

When thou lookest at them their exteriors please thee; and when
			they speak thou listenest to their words.  They are as (worthless
			as hollow) pieces of timber propped up (unable to stand on their
			own). They think that every cry is against them.  They are the
			enemies; so beware of them.  The curse of Allah be on them! How
			are they deluded (away from the Truth)! <sup class='fn'>5468</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>5470</sup> <sup class='fn'>5471</sup>

And when it is said to them "Come the Apostle of Allah will pray
			for your forgiveness" they turn aside their heads and thou
			wouldst see them turning away their faces in arrogance.
			<sup class='fn'>5472</sup>
It is equal to them whether thou pray for their forgiveness or\n\t\t\tnot. Allah will not forgive them.  Truly Allah guides not\n\t\t\trebellious transgressors. <sup class='fn'>5473</sup>

They are the ones who say "Spend nothing on those who are with
			Allah's Apostle to the end that they may disperse (and quit
			Madinah).  But to Allah belong the treasures of the heavens and
			the earth; but the Hypocrites understand not. <sup class='fn'>5474</sup>

They say "If we return to Madinah surely the more honorable
			(element) will expel there from the meaner." But honor belongs to
			Allah and His Apostle and to the Believers; but the Hypocrites
			know not. <sup class='fn'>5475</sup>
O ye who believe! let not your riches or your children divert you\n\t\t\tfrom the remembrance of Allah.\tIf any act thus the loss is their\n\t\t\town. <sup class='fn'>5476</sup>

And spend something (in charity) out of the substance which We
			have bestowed on you before death should come to any of you and
			he should say "O my Lord! why didst thou not give me respite for
			a little while? I should then have given (largely) in charity and
			I should have been one of the doers of good." <sup class='fn'>5477</sup>
But to no soul will Allah grant respite when the time appointed\n\t\t\t(for it) has come: and Allah is well-acquainted with (all) that\n\t\t\tye do. <sup class='fn'>5478</sup>

Whatever is in the heavens and on earth doth declare the Praises\n\t\t\tand Glory of Allah: to Him belongs Dominion and to Him belongs\n\t\t\tPraise: and He has power over all things. <sup class='fn'>5479</sup>
It is He Who has created you; and of you are some that are\n\t\t\tUnbelievers and some that are Believers: and Allah sees well all\n\t\t\tthat ye do. <sup class='fn'>5480</sup>

He has created the heavens and the earth in just proportions and\n\t\t\thas given you shape and made your shapes beautiful: and to Him is\n\t\t\tthe final Goal. <sup class='fn'>5481</sup> <sup class='fn'>5482</sup>
He knows what is in the heavens and on earth: and He knows what\n\t\t\tye conceal and what ye reveal: yes Allah knows well the (secrets)\n\t\t\tof (all) hearts. <sup class='fn'>5483</sup>
Has not the story reached you of those who rejected Faith\n\t\t\taforetime? So they tasted the evil result of their conduct; and\n\t\t\tthey had a grievous Penalty. <sup class='fn'>5484</sup>

That was because there came to them apostles with Clear Signs but
			they said: "Shall (mere) human beings direct us?" So they
			rejected (the Message) and turned away.  But Allah can do without
			(them): and Allah is free of all needs worthy of all praise.
			<sup class='fn'>5485</sup> <sup class='fn'>5486</sup>

The Unbelievers think that they will not be raised up (for
			Judgment). Say: "Yea by my Lord ye shall surely be raised up:
			then shall ye be told (the truth) of all that ye did.  And that
			is easy for Allah." <sup class='fn'>5487</sup>
Believe therefore in Allah and His Apostle and in the Light which\n\t\t\tWe have sent down.  And Allah is well-acquainted with all that ye\n\t\t\tdo. <sup class='fn'>5488</sup>

The Day that He assembles you (all) for a day of Assembly that
			will be a day of mutual loss and gain (among you).  And those who
			believe in Allah and work righteousness He will remove from them
			their ills and He will admit them to gardens beneath which rivers
			flow to dwell therein forever: that will be the Supreme
			Achievement. <sup class='fn'>5489</sup> <sup class='fn'>5490</sup> <sup class='fn'>5491</sup>
But those who reject Faith and treat Our Signs as falsehoods they\n\t\t\twill be Companions of the Fire to dwell therein for aye: and evil\n\t\t\tis that Goal.
No kind of calamity can occur except by the leave of Allah: and\n\t\t\tif anyone believes in Allah (Allah) guides his heart (aright):\n\t\t\tfor Allah knows all things. <sup class='fn'>5492</sup>
So obey Allah and obey His Apostle; but if ye turn back the duty\n\t\t\tof Our Apostle is but to proclaim (the Message) clearly and\n\t\t\topenly. <sup class='fn'>5493</sup>
Allah! there is no god but He: and on Allah therefore let the\n\t\t\tBelievers put their trust.

O ye who believe! truly among your wives and your children are
			(some that are) enemies to yourselves: so beware of them! But if
			ye forgive and overlook and cover up (their faults) verily Allah
			is Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful. <sup class='fn'>5494</sup> <sup class='fn'>5495</sup>
Your riches and your children may be but a trial: but in the\n\t\t\tPresence of Allah is the highest Reward. <sup class='fn'>5496</sup>

So fear Allah as much as ye can; listen and obey; and spend in
			charity for the benefit of your own souls: and those saved from
			the covetousness of their own souls they are the ones that
			achieve prosperity. <sup class='fn'>5497</sup> <sup class='fn'>5498</sup> <sup class='fn'>5499</sup>

If ye loan to Allah a beautiful loan He will double it to your
			(credit) and He will grant you Forgiveness: for Allah is most
			Ready to appreciate (service) Most Forbearing <sup class='fn'>5500</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>5501</sup>
Knower of what is hidden and what is open exalted in Might Full\n\t\t\tof Wisdom. <sup class='fn'>5502</sup>

O Prophet! when ye do divorce women divorce them at their
			prescribed periods and count (accurately) their prescribed
			periods: and fear Allah your Lord: and turn them not out of their
			houses nor shall they (themselves) leave except in case they are
			guilty of some open lewdness.  Those are limits set by Allah: and
			any who transgresses the limits of Allah does verily wrong his
			(own) soul: thou knowest not if perchance Allah will bring about
			thereafter some new situation. <sup class='fn'>5503</sup> <sup class='fn'>5504</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>5505</sup> <sup class='fn'>5506</sup> <sup class='fn'>5507</sup> <sup class='fn'>5508</sup>

Thus when they fulfil their term appointed either take them back
			on equitable terms or part with them on equitable terms; and take
			for witness two persons from among you endued with justice and
			establish the evidence (as) before Allah.  Such is the admonition
			given to him who believes in Allah and the Last Day. And for
			those who fear Allah He (ever) prepares a way out <sup class='fn'>5509</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>5510</sup> <sup class='fn'>5511</sup>

And He provides for him from (sources) he never could imagine. 
			And if anyone puts his trust in Allah sufficient is (Allah) for
			him.  For Allah will surely accomplish His purpose: verily for
			all things has Allah appointed a due proportion. <sup class='fn'>5512</sup>

Such of your women as have passed the age of monthly courses for
			them the prescribed period if ye have any doubt is three months
			and for those who have no courses (it is the same): for those who
			carry (life within their wombs) their period is until they
			deliver their burdens: and for those who fear Allah He will make
			their path easy. <sup class='fn'>5513</sup> <sup class='fn'>5514</sup>
That is the Command of Allah which He has sent down to you: and\n\t\t\tif anyone fears Allah He will remove his ills from him and will\n\t\t\tenlarge His reward. <sup class='fn'>5515</sup>

Let the women live (in 'iddah) in the same style as ye live
			according to your means: annoy them not so as to restrict them. 
			And if they carry (life in their wombs) then spend (your
			substance) on them until they deliver their burden: and if they
			suckle your (offspring) give them their recompense: and take
			mutual counsel together according to what is just and reasonable.
			 And if ye find yourselves in difficulties let another woman
			suckle (the child) on the (father's) behalf. <sup class='fn'>5516</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>5517</sup> <sup class='fn'>5518</sup> <sup class='fn'>5519</sup>

Let the man of means spend according to his means: and the man
			whose resources are restricted let him spend according to what
			Allah has given him.  Allah puts no burden on any person beyond
			what He has given him.	After a difficulty Allah will soon grant
			relief. <sup class='fn'>5520</sup>

How many populations that insolently opposed the command of their
			Lord and of His apostles did We not then call to account to
			severe account? And We imposed on them an exemplary Punishment.
			<sup class='fn'>5521</sup> <sup class='fn'>5522</sup>
Then did they taste the evil result of their conduct and the End\n\t\t\tof their conduct was Perdition.

Allah has prepared for them a severe Punishment (in the
			Hereafter). Therefore fear Allah O ye men of understanding who
			have believed!	for Allah hath indeed sent down to you a Message
			<sup class='fn'>5523</sup> <sup class='fn'>5524</sup>

An Apostle who rehearses to you the Signs of Allah containing
			clear explanations that he may lead forth those who believe and
			do righteous deeds from the depths of Darkness into Light.  And
			those who believe in Allah and work righteousness He will admit
			to Gardens beneath which rivers flow to dwell therein forever:
			Allah has indeed granted for them a most excellent provision.
			<sup class='fn'>5525</sup>

Allah is He Who created seven Firmaments and of the earth a
			similar number. Through the midst of them (all) descends His
			Command: that ye may know that Allah has power over all things
			and that Allah comprehends all things in (His) Knowledge.
			<sup class='fn'>5526</sup> <sup class='fn'>5527</sup> <sup class='fn'>5528</sup>

O Prophet! why holdest thou to be forbidden that which Allah has\n\t\t\tmade lawful to thee? Thou seekest to please thy consorts.  But\n\t\t\tAllah is Oft-Forgiving Most Merciful. <sup class='fn'>5529</sup> <sup class='fn'>5530</sup>
Allah has already ordained for you (O men) the dissolution of\n\t\t\tyour oaths (in some cases): and Allah is your Protector and He is\n\t\t\tFull of Knowledge and Wisdom. <sup class='fn'>5531</sup>

When the Prophet disclosed a matter in confidence to one of his
			consorts and she then divulged it (to another) and Allah made it
			known to him he confirmed part thereof and repudiated a part. 
			Then when he told her thereof she said "Who told thee this?" He
			said "He told me who knows and is well-acquainted (with all
			things)." <sup class='fn'>5532</sup> <sup class='fn'>5533</sup>

If ye two turn in repentance to Him your hearts are indeed so
			inclined; but if ye back up each other against him truly Allah is
			his Protector and Gabriel and (every) righteous one among those
			who believe and furthermore the angels will back (him) up.
			<sup class='fn'>5534</sup> <sup class='fn'>5535</sup>

It may be if he divorced you (all) that Allah will give him in
			exchange Consorts better than you who submit (their wills) who
			believe who are devout who turn to Allah in repentance who
			worship (in humility) who travel (for faith) and fast previously
			married or virgins. <sup class='fn'>5536</sup> <sup class='fn'>5537</sup>

O ye who believe! save yourselves and your families from a Fire
			whose fuel is Men and Stones over which are (appointed) angels
			stern (and) severe who flinch not (from executing) the Commands
			they receive from Allah but do (precisely) what they are
			commanded. <sup class='fn'>5538</sup> <sup class='fn'>5539</sup> <sup class='fn'>5540</sup>
(They will say) "O ye Unbelievers! make no excuses this day! Ye\n\t\t\tare being but requited for all that ye did!" <sup class='fn'>5541</sup>

O ye who believe! turn to Allah with sincere repentance: in the
			hope that your Lord will remove from you your ills and admit you
			to Gardens beneath which Rivers flow the Day that Allah will not
			permit to be humiliated the Prophet and those who believe with
			him.  Their Light will run forward before them and by their right
			hands while they say "Our Lord! perfect our Light for us and
			grant us Forgiveness; for Thou has power over all things."
			<sup class='fn'>5542</sup> <sup class='fn'>5543</sup> <sup class='fn'>5544</sup>
O Prophet! strive hard against the Unbelievers and the Hypocrites\n\t\t\tand be firm against them.  Their abode is Hell an evil refuge\n\t\t\t(indeed). <sup class='fn'>5545</sup>

Allah sets forth for an example to the Unbelievers the wife of
			Noah and the wife of Lut: they were (respectively) under two of
			Our righteous servants but they were false to their (husbands)
			and they profited nothing before Allah on their account but were
			told: "Enter ye the fire along with (others) that enter!"
			<sup class='fn'>5546</sup> <sup class='fn'>5547</sup> <sup class='fn'>5548</sup>

And Allah sets forth as an example to those who believe the wife
			of Pharaoh: Behold she said: "O my Lord! build for me in nearness
			to Thee a mansion in the Garden and save me from Pharaoh and his
			doings and save me from those that do wrong"; <sup class='fn'>5549</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>5550</sup>

And Mary the daughter of `Imran who guarded her chastity; and We
			breathed into her (body) of Our spirit; and she testified to the
			truth of the words of her Lord and of His Revelations and was one
			of the devout (Servants). <sup class='fn'>5551</sup> <sup class='fn'>5552</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>5553</sup>
Blessed be He in Whose hands is Dominion: and He over all things\n\t\t\tHath Power <sup class='fn'>5554</sup> <sup class='fn'>5555</sup>

He Who created Death and Life that He may try which of you is\n\t\t\tbest in deed: and He is the Exalted in Might Oft-Forgiving\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5556</sup> <sup class='fn'>5557</sup> <sup class='fn'>5558</sup>

He Who created the seven heavens one above another; no want of\n\t\t\tproportion wilt thou see in the Creation of (Allah) Most Gracious\n\t\t\tso turn thy vision again: Seest thou any flaw? <sup class='fn'>5559</sup>
Again turn thy vision a second time; (thy) vision will come back\n\t\t\tto thee dull and discomfited in a state worn out. <sup class='fn'>5560</sup>

And We have (from of old) adorned the lowest heaven with Lamps
			and We have made such (Lamps) (as) missiles to drive away the
			Evil Ones and have prepared for them the Penalty of the Blazing
			Fire. <sup class='fn'>5561</sup> <sup class='fn'>5562</sup>
For those who reject their Lord (and Cherisher) is the Penalty of\n\t\t\tHell: and evil is (such) destination. <sup class='fn'>5563</sup>
When they are cast therein they will hear the (terrible) drawing\n\t\t\tin of its breath even as it blazes forth. <sup class='fn'>5564</sup>
Almost bursting with fury: every time a Group is cast therein its\n\t\t\tKeepers will ask "Did no Warner come to you?" <sup class='fn'>5565</sup>

They will say: "Yes indeed: a Warner did come to us but we\n\t\t\trejected him and said `Allah never sent down any (Message): ye\n\t\t\tare in nothing but an egregious delusion!' " <sup class='fn'>5566</sup>
They will further say: "Had we but listened or used our\n\t\t\tintelligence we should not (now) be among the Companions of the\n\t\t\tBlazing Fire!" <sup class='fn'>5567</sup>
They will then confess their sins: but far will be (Forgiveness)\n\t\t\tfrom the Companions of the Blazing Fire! <sup class='fn'>5568</sup>
As for those who fear their Lord unseen for them is Forgiveness\n\t\t\tand a great Reward. <sup class='fn'>5569</sup>
And whether ye hide your word or publish it He certainly has\n\t\t\t(full) knowledge of the secrets of (all) hearts.
Should He not know He that created? And He is the One that\n\t\t\tunderstands the finest mysteries (and) is well-acquainted (with\n\t\t\tthem). <sup class='fn'>5570</sup>

It is He Who has made the earth manageable for you so traverse ye
			through its tracts and enjoy of the Sustenance which He
			furnishes: but unto Him is the Resurrection. <sup class='fn'>5571</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>5572</sup>
Do ye feel secure that He Who is in heaven will not cause you to\n\t\t\tbe swallowed up by the earth when it shakes (as in an\n\t\t\tearthquake)? <sup class='fn'>5573</sup>

Or do ye feel secure that He Who is in Heaven will not send\n\t\t\tagainst you a violent tornado (with showers of stones) so that ye\n\t\t\tshall know how (terrible) was My warning? <sup class='fn'>5574</sup>
But indeed men before them rejected (My warning): then how\n\t\t\t(terrible) was My rejection (of them)? <sup class='fn'>5575</sup>

Do they not observe the birds above them spreading their wings
			and folding them in? None can uphold them except (Allah) Most
			Gracious: truly it is He that watches over all things.
			<sup class='fn'>5576</sup> <sup class='fn'>5577</sup>
Nay who is there that can help you (even as) an army besides\n\t\t\t(Allah) Most Merciful? In nothing but delusion are the\n\t\t\tUnbelievers. <sup class='fn'>5578</sup>

Or who is there that can provide you with Sustenance if He were\n\t\t\tto withhold His provision? Nay they obstinately persist in\n\t\t\tinsolent impiety and flight (from the Truth). <sup class='fn'>5579</sup>
Is then one who walks headlong with his face grovelling better\n\t\t\tguided or one who walks evenly on a Straight Way? <sup class='fn'>5580</sup>\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5581</sup>

Say: "It is He Who has created you (and made you grow) and made
			for you the faculties of hearing seeing feeling and
			understanding: little thanks it is ye give." <sup class='fn'>5582</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>5583</sup>
Say: "It is He Who has multiplied you through the earth and to\n\t\t\tHim shall ye be gathered together." <sup class='fn'>5584</sup>
They ask: When will this promise be (fulfilled)? If ye are\n\t\t\ttelling the truth. <sup class='fn'>5585</sup>
Say: "As to the knowledge of the time it is with Allah alone: I\n\t\t\tam (sent) only to warn plainly in public." <sup class='fn'>5586</sup>

At length when they see it close at hand grieved will be the
			faces of the Unbelievers and it will be said (to them): "This is
			(the promise fulfilled) which ye were calling for!" <sup class='fn'>5587</sup>
			<sup class='fn'>5588</sup>
Say: "See ye? If Allah were to destroy me and those with me or if\n\t\t\tHe bestows His Mercy on us yet who can deliver the Unbelievers\n\t\t\tfrom a grievous Penalty?" <sup class='fn'>5589</sup>

Say: "He is (Allah) Most Gracious: we have believed in Him and on\n\t\t\tHim have we put our trust: so soon will ye know which (of us) it\n\t\t\tis that is in manifest error." <sup class='fn'>5590</sup>
Say: "See ye? If your stream be some morning lost (in the\n\t\t\tunderground earth) who then can supply you with clear-flowing\n\t\t\twater?" <sup class='fn'>5591</sup>
Nun.  By the Pen and by the (Record) which (men) write\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5592</sup> <sup class='fn'>5593</sup>
Thou art not by the grace of thy Lord mad or possessed.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5594</sup>
Nay verily for thee is a Reward unfailing: <sup class='fn'>5595</sup>
And thou (standest) on an exalted standard of character.
Soon wilt thou see and they will see <sup class='fn'>5596</sup>
Which of you is afflicted with madness.
Verily it is thy Lord that knoweth best which (among men) hath\n\t\t\tstrayed from His Path: and He knoweth best those who receive\n\t\t\t(True) Guidance. <sup class='fn'>5597</sup>
So hearken not to those who deny (the Truth). <sup class='fn'>5598</sup>
Their desire is that thou shouldst be pliant; so would thy be\n\t\t\tpliant.
Need not the type of despicable man ready with oaths.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5599</sup> <sup class='fn'>5600</sup>
A slanderer going about with calumnies.
(Habitually) hindering (all) good transgressing beyond bounds\n\t\t\tdeep in sin.
Violent (and cruel) with all that base-born <sup class='fn'>5601</sup>
Because he possesses wealth and (numerous) sons. <sup class='fn'>5602</sup>
When to him are rehearsed Our Signs "Tales of the Ancients" he\n\t\t\tcries. <sup class='fn'>5603</sup> <sup class='fn'>5604</sup>
Soon shall We brand (the beast) on the snout! <sup class='fn'>5605</sup>
Verily We have tried them as We tried the people of the Garden\n\t\t\twhen they resolved to gather the fruits of the (garden) in the\n\t\t\tmorning. <sup class='fn'>5606</sup>
But made no reservation ("If it be Allah's Will"). <sup class='fn'>5607</sup>
So there came on the (garden) a visitation  from thy Lord\n\t\t\t(which swept away) all around while they were asleep.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5608</sup>
So the (garden) became by the morning like a dark and desolate\n\t\t\tspot (whose fruit had been gathered).
As the morning broke they called out one to another
"Go ye to your tilth (betimes) in morning if ye would gather the\n\t\t\tfruits." <sup class='fn'>5609</sup>
So they departed conversing in secret low tones (saying)
"Let not a single indigent person break in upon you into the\n\t\t\t(garden) this day." <sup class='fn'>5610</sup>
And they opened the morning strong in an (unjust) resolve.
But when they saw the (garden) they said: "We have surely lost\n\t\t\tour way: <sup class='fn'>5611</sup>
"Indeed we are shut out (of the fruits of our labor)!"\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5612</sup>
Said one of them more just (than the rest): "Did I not say to you\n\t\t\t`Why not glorify (Allah)?' " <sup class='fn'>5613</sup>
They said: "Glory to our Lord! Verily we have been doing wrong!"
Then they turned one against another in reproach. <sup class='fn'>5614</sup>
They said: "Alas for us! We have indeed transgressed!
"It may be that our Lord will give us in exchange a better\n\t\t\t(garden) than this: for we do turn to Him (in repentance)!"\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>5615</sup>

Those in sin used to laugh at those who believed

And the Moon in her Fullness; <sup class='fn'>6046</sup>

By the promised Day (of Judgment); <sup class='fn'>6053</sup>
By one that witnesses and the subject of the witness\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>6054</sup>

And they witnessed (all) that they were doing against the\n\t\t\tBelievers.

Those who persecute (or draw into temptation) the Believers men

As for them they are but plotting a scheme <sup class='fn'>6077</sup>
And I am planning a scheme <sup class='fn'>6078</sup>

Who will enter the Great Fire <sup class='fn'>6089</sup>

Laboring (hard) weary <sup class='fn'>6098</sup>

Pleased with their Striving <sup class='fn'>6100</sup>
In a Garden on high <sup class='fn'>6101</sup>

By the Break of Day <sup class='fn'>6108</sup>
By the Nights twice five; <sup class='fn'>6109</sup>
By the Even and Odd (contrasted); <sup class='fn'>6110</sup>
And by the Night when it passeth away <sup class='fn'>6111</sup>

By the Day as it appears in glory;

By the Glorious Morning Light. <sup class='fn'>6175</sup>
And by the Night when it is still <sup class='fn'>6176</sup>

And removed from thee thy burden <sup class='fn'>6189</sup>

Verily with every difficulty there is relief.

And the Mount of Sinai <sup class='fn'>6196</sup>
And this City of security <sup class='fn'>6197</sup> <sup class='fn'>6198</sup>

Those who have faith and do righteous deeds they are the best of\n\t\t\tcreatures. <sup class='fn'>6232</sup>

Their reward is with Allah: Gardens of Eternity Beneath which
			rivers flow; They will dwell therein for ever; Allah well pleased
			with them and they with Him:  all this for such as fear their
			Lord and Cherisher. <sup class='fn'>6233</sup> <sup class='fn'>6234</sup>
When the Earth is shaken to her (utmost) convulsion <sup class='fn'>6235</sup>
And the Earth throws up her burden (from within) <sup class='fn'>6236</sup>
And man cries (distressed): `What is the matter with her?'\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>6237</sup>
On that Day will she declare her tidings:
For that thy Lord will have given her inspiration. <sup class='fn'>6238</sup>
On that Day will men proceed in companies sorted out to be shown\n\t\t\tthe Deeds that they (had done). <sup class='fn'>6239</sup>
Then shall anyone who has done an atom's weight of good see it!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>6240</sup>
And anyone who has done an atom's weight of evil shall see it.
By the (Steeds) that run with panting (breath) <sup class='fn'>6241</sup>
And strike sparks of Fire <sup class='fn'>6242</sup>
And push home the charge in the morning <sup class='fn'>6243</sup>
And raise the dust in clouds the while <sup class='fn'>6244</sup>
And penetrate forthwith into the midst (of the foe) en masse\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>6245</sup>
Truly Man is to his Lord ungrateful; <sup class='fn'>6246</sup>
And to that (fact) he bears witness (by his deeds); <sup class='fn'>6247</sup>
And violent is he in his love of wealth. <sup class='fn'>6248</sup>
Does he not know when that which is in the graves is Scattered\n\t\t\tabroad <sup class='fn'>6249</sup>
And that which is (locked up) in (human) breasts is made manifest
That their Lord had been well-acquainted with them (Even to) that\n\t\t\tDay? <sup class='fn'>6250</sup>
The (Day) of Noise and Clamor: <sup class='fn'>6251</sup>
What is the (Day) of Noise and Clamor?
And what will explain to thee what the (Day) of Noise and Clamor\n\t\t\tis?
(It is) a Day whereon Men will be like moths Scattered about\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>6252</sup>
And the mountains will be like carded wool. <sup class='fn'>6253</sup>
Then he whose balance (of good deeds) will be (found) heavy\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>6254</sup>
Will be in a life of good pleasure and satisfaction.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>6255</sup>
But he whose balance (of good deeds) will be (found) light
Will have his home in a (bottomless) pit. <sup class='fn'>6256</sup>
And what will explain to thee what this is?
(It is) a Fire Blazing fiercely!
The mutual rivalry for piling up (the good things of this world)\n\t\t\tdiverts you (from the more serious things) <sup class='fn'>6257</sup>
Until ye visit the graves. <sup class='fn'>6258</sup>
But nay ye soon shall know (the reality).
Again, ye soon shall know!
Nay were ye to know with certainty of mind (Ye would beware!)\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>6259</sup>
Ye shall certainly see Hell Fire! <sup class='fn'>6260</sup>
Again ye shall see it with certainty of sight!
Then shall ye be Questioned that Day about the joy (ye indulged\n\t\t\tin)! <sup class='fn'>6261</sup>
By (the Token of) time (through the Ages) <sup class='fn'>6262</sup>
Verily Man is in loss <sup class='fn'>6263</sup>
Except such as have Faith and do righteous deeds and (join\n\t\t\ttogether) in the mutual teaching of Truth and of Patience and\n\t\t\tConstancy. <sup class='fn'>6264</sup> <sup class='fn'>6265</sup>
Woe to every (kind of) scandal-monger and backbiter <sup class='fn'>6266</sup>
Who pileth up wealth and layeth it by
Thinking that his wealth would make him last for ever!
By no means! He will be sure to be thrown into that which breaks\n\t\t\tto pieces. <sup class='fn'>6267</sup>
And what will explain to thee That which Breaks to Pieces?
(It is) the Fire of (the Wrath of) Allah kindled (to a blaze)
The which doth mount (Right) to the Hearts: <sup class='fn'>6268</sup>
It shall be made into a vault over them
In columns outstretched. <sup class='fn'>6269</sup>
Seest thou not how thy Lord dealt with the Companions of the\n\t\t\tElephant? <sup class='fn'>6270</sup> <sup class='fn'>6271</sup>
Did He not make their treacherous plan go astray?
And He sent against them flights of Birds <sup class='fn'>6272</sup>
Striking them with stones of baked clay. <sup class='fn'>6273</sup>
Then did He make them like an empty field of stalks and straw (of\n\t\t\twhich the corn) has been eaten up. <sup class='fn'>6274</sup> <sup class='fn'>6275</sup>
For the covenants (of security and safeguard enjoyed) by the\n\t\t\tQuraish <sup class='fn'>6276</sup>
Their covenants (covering) journeys by winter and summer\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>6277</sup>
Let them adore the Lord of this House <sup class='fn'>6278</sup>
Who provides them with food against hunger and with security\n\t\t\tagainst fear (of danger). <sup class='fn'>6279</sup> <sup class='fn'>6280</sup>
Seest thou one who denies the Judgment (to come)? <sup class='fn'>6281</sup>
Then such is the (man) who repulses the orphan (with harshness)
And encourages not the feeding of the indigent. <sup class='fn'>6282</sup>
So woe to the worshippers
Who are neglectful of their Prayers <sup class='fn'>6283</sup>
Those who (want but) to be seen (of men) <sup class='fn'>6284</sup>
But refuse (to supply) (Even) neighborly needs. <sup class='fn'>6285</sup>
To thee have We granted the Fount (Of Abundance). <sup class='fn'>6286</sup>
Therefore to thy Lord turn in Prayer and Sacrifice. <sup class='fn'>6287</sup>
For he who hateth thee he will be cut off (from Future Hope).\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>6288</sup>
Say: O ye that reject Faith! <sup class='fn'>6289</sup>
I worship not that which ye worship
Nor will ye worship that which I worship. <sup class='fn'>6290</sup>
And I will not worship that which ye have been wont to worship
Nor will ye worship that which I worship.
To you be your Way and to me mine. <sup class='fn'>6291</sup>
When comes the Help of Allah and Victory
And thou dost see the People enter Allah's Religion in crowds\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>6292</sup>
Celebrate the Praises of thy Lord and pray for His Forgiveness:\n\t\t\tfor He is Oft-Returning (in Grace and Mercy). <sup class='fn'>6293</sup>
Perish the hands of the Father of Flame! Perish he! <sup class='fn'>6294</sup>
No profit to him from all his wealth and all his gains!
Burnt soon will he be in a Fire of blazing Flame!
His wife shall carry the (crackling) wood as fuel! <sup class='fn'>6295</sup>
A twisted rope of palm-leaf fibre round her (own) neck!
Say: He is Allah the One and Only; <sup class='fn'>6296</sup> <sup class='fn'>6297</sup>
Allah the Eternal Absolute; <sup class='fn'>6298</sup>
He begetteth not nor is He begotten; <sup class='fn'>6299</sup>
And there is none like unto Him. <sup class='fn'>6300</sup>
Say: I seek refuge with the Lord of the Dawn <sup class='fn'>6301</sup>\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>6302</sup>
From the mischief of created things; <sup class='fn'>6303</sup>
From the mischief of Darkness as it overspreads; <sup class='fn'>6304</sup>
From the mischief of those who practice Secret Arts;\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>6305</sup>
And from the mischief of the envious one as he practices envy.\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>6306</sup>
Say: I seek refuge with the Lord and Cherisher of Mankind\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>6307</sup> <sup class='fn'>6308</sup>
The King (or Ruler) of Mankind
The Allah (or Judge) of Mankind
From the mischief of the Whisperer (of Evil) who withdraws (after\n\t\t\this whisper) <sup class='fn'>6309</sup>
